name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A pleasant, hopeful experience that could even end up bringing a couple of tears to certain members of the audience (I was VERY close to crying at one point). Full review in Spanish.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris movingly weaves a tale about finding an outer beauty that reflects the purity of heart within. It’s as pleasant as you want a movie like this to be, yet it does so without simplification that patronizes the audience.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This is almost pure wish fulfilment fantasy, but it's delivered with confidence and style.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: ...a thoroughly agreeable endeavor that benefits from the superb efforts of Manville and her various costars...

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It takes a lot of sophistication to keep a film like this from becoming cloying. Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is the champagne of nicecore.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: ... Makes you feel at ease, like having a snack by the stove in a cozy room. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Anthony Fabian wagers the tone of the Paddington movies, with a Wes Anderson aesthetic and Mike Leigh's vindicating spirit. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A film in which Manville pulls out all her weapons as a professional actress,  shining well above the story she leads by herself to its happy ending. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: What takes it from a watch-on-a-plane movie to a must-see matinee is a galvanizing and endearing performance by Manville.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: There is much to be enjoyed, but this might ultimately prove too disposable for its own good. The film works best as an escapist fairytale and as such, it’s ravishing.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris substitutes the yearning for a man's love with a dress. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Such an endeavour won’t change the course of cinema, but, my word, will it make you feel special; and, right now, that’s more than enough of a reason to support this European excursion.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It's a familiar formula but that's part of the charm.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The film’s designers spent a lot of time exploring the Dior archives and it shows. It’s Mrs Harris’s story, but it’s also a fond tribute to a world that has changed beyond recognition.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris takes its audience on a whimsical journey from London to Paris imbued with charm, wit and a sprinkling of fairytale escapism, punctuated by some French revolutionary spirit.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: In this fable, Mrs. Harris is not only Cinderella, hoping to buy the dress that transforms her into a princess, but the Fairy Godmother as well...

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Paints a simple yet powerful world where good deeds are rewarded, and anyone can make their dreams come true...

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: As if she were Cinderella, Ada Harris will overcome a few unfortunate events in a story with bad people that don't end up being that evil, and good people that turn out to be really good people. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: There’s no quibble that the light, feel-good nostalgia trip has its charms, yet those charms are thinly spread over an overly generous running time, its slow direction stretching what should have been a sweet Eailing-style dramedy into a bit of a slog.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: … a gem that glitters like the trimmings on a gown.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This is a warm and witty crowd-pleasing delight from start to finish.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: To call this film 'feel good' is quite simply a disservice. Enjoy the upgrade to feel great and do yourself a favour. Plan a delicious evening at the pictures, dress up, have a glass of bubbly and let Mrs Harris steal your heart.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris, with the incomparable Lesley Manville in the leading role, is a frothy fantasy that is a bit silly, very feminine, and utterly delightful.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If you don’t like “Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris,” you are a grinch, a cowardly custard, a box of rocks with a shriveled heart and sweatpants where your brain should be. What a thing of beauty.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: There's a delightfully upbeat tone to this period drama, echoing a radiant performance by Lesley Manville.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: What’s so lovely is that Mrs. Harris Goes To Paris is a celebration of beauty and the importance of cherishing those special things in life that may seem silly to others but make us feel most like ourselves.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris, based on Paul Gallico’s 1958 novel, is preposterous.  But it’s as pretty as a pink cloud. The director, Anthony Fabian, knows that in these grim times, escapism is good box office.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville’s plucky heroine feels tailor-made for the grim back end of 2022.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville takes the lead in this charming post-war Cinderella story and perfectly portrays the loveable and disarmingly sweet Mrs Harris.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s unabashed froth, as substantial as a tulle skirt. And perhaps that’s exactly what we need right now.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville is wonderful in the role, an island of stillness and veracity in a sea of agreeable froth.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It is a half-risen souffle of a film. But its classy leading lady gives it substance.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: ... Against this backdrop of exploitation, decay and corruption, we’re asked to cheer for a brainwashed blue-collar cleaner who’s about to blow half a grand on a posh frock? The genius of the film, of course, is that we do.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville wraps both arms around this role -- and us -- to deliver the message that the only wealth that's really worth anything, in the long run, is kindness.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It is handsomely mounted, Manville mostly keeps the sentimentality under control, and if you are in the mood for something pleasantly untaxing you will be pleasantly untaxed.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Director Anthony Fabian has made a broad and cheery snowglobe of a film.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s a thoroughly pleasant if flimsy film... with a distinct perfume of nostalgia wafted towards us, say by the sight of Gitanes lit up on cross-channel flights.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Preposterous though it may be, this is a terrific family movie in a style audiences may not have seen since Mary Poppins.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris could never be mistaken for a Ken Loach polemic. But whilst showing us a lot of pretty frocks, it gets awfully close to giving the finger to feudalism.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It may sound dismissive to call a film ‘nice’, but that’s exactly what this is. It’s beautifully produced, entirely uncynical niceness. If you’re after just a lovely time, come on in and put your feet up.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Certainly, much of this is confection laced, disarmingly and sweetly so. But it is a confection we are fully invested in because our faith in Manville never wavers. We believe in her, and so believe in the film - its modesty, its kindness and warmth.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is only slightly more rooted in reality than, say, Jurassic World Dominion, but beneath the Cinderella sheen it does manage to make some salient points.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It is delightful. Unrealistic but delightful.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It benefits from the breathtaking couture of three-time Oscar-winning costume designer Jenny Beavan — dresses the movie treats as sacraments worthy of slowing down time — and for Lesley Manville’s performance in the lead.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is charming froth given weight by the delectable performance of British star Lesley Manville as the charwoman who blossoms in the City of Light.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville, with smiles and warmth, makes it work.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The main reason the film succeeds is Lesley Manville who is perfection in the role.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Delightful comedy about the many meanings of the clothes we choose to wear and what these choices say about our lives and values.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Like a Powerball ticket, "Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris" conjures “what could be,” not what is. And it’s entirely delightful.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a post-war Cinderella story, with a mature heroine who uses grit and tenacity instead of fairy godmothers to achieve her dreams and find romance along the way.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This movie practically dares you to scoff at it; it feels like a judge is watching you watch the movie, poised to find you guilty of cynicism if you flinch.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review:
What a delightful picture show!
You’ll be entranced before you know.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris could have been made fifty or sixty years ago (although its gorgeous cinematography and inclusive casting would have suffered). It’s the sort of feel-good movie that is all too rare these days.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s the type of cozy, uplifting film that can easily brighten someone’s day.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A nauseatingly time-warped film about how the right fancy dress can change your life.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: “Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris” is about more than just wanting a new dress; it’s about pursuing your dreams under impossible circumstances."

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: "Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris" is a delightful movie, with a heartwarming story ... This midcentury fairy tale reminds us beauty is important and kindness, honesty, and sacrifice for others are the keys to a meaningful life.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris isn’t as inspired as the dresses it showcases but it is a well-mounted argument for the importance of fashion.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville shines in this charming, fairy tale-infused movie that offers a lovely diversion. In an era of superhero movies, it's so refreshing to see an ordinary woman being the heroine of her own story.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Sometimes it’s good to just be whisked away to a magical world and spend two hours with delightful people having their dreams come true.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This 60-year-old story of pursuing a dream with resolute kindness could not feel more fresh in its knowing class clash. Lesley Manville is an absolute treasure, her command of comedic pathos supreme.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Simply delightful in every sense of the word.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Ada’s journey is relentlessly pleasant enough to thrill that twinkly great aunt that lives within us all.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Overall, a delightful two-hour respite from the summer heat, or any season.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A charming heroine, a delightful story, and all in all good solid entertainment.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville's the main reason to see this working class, Queen-For-A-Day, belle of the ball fantasy.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: An utter delight.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If this inspires a few eye rolls, it’s nothing compared to how many smiles it elicits.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville is simply wonderful in every moment.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It is nice to see a fairy tale for old people.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: ...this fairly conservative, simple story elevates to something joyful and celebratory even as it acknowledges the difficult journey to get there.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville is glorious in a performance where she hits it out of the park.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If viewers get stuck on the “this would never happen in real life” notion, they will miss the point of this charming tale.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A humble trip worth taking.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s a heartwarming tribute to dreamers.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: I can be hard-hearted when told a film is “enchanting” but left with a tear in my eye and a lump in my throat.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: As Manville knows what she’s doing, she manages to place herself right at home in the part of Ada Harris, a strong-willed woman who ideally brings her sense of politeness and curiosity to everyone she meets.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville creates such a lovely, relatable, and heartfelt character that the audience readily believes in her and her quest. Her determination is infectious. Her energy is boundless.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville... brings her own set of dynamics to the role and scores a huge personal triumph.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: "An old school whimsical film that will charm you in a way that you haven't been at the movies in a long time."

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville delivers an effervescent performance that reminds us of her formidable comedic, as well as dramatic range.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Its charm is abundant, bursting at its seams

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: With the beautiful production design and costumes this film is reminiscent of a picture straight out of the golden age of Tinseltown.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Touted as 'House of Gucci' for nice people, this adaptation of Paul Gallico's 1958 fantasy is elegant, endearing, escapist entertainment - an unexpected delight.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Few films from the past few years have given me as much continuous pleasure as Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville is a delight in the fairy tale for the working class that reminds us to keep dreaming. I got serious Garry Marshall vibes. His spirit is all over this film. Charming.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville is the main reason to see a really feel-good story that has been around for 65 years.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Anchored by a strong turn by Lesley Manville, Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a beguiling bonbon of a movie - a modest crowd pleaser with a heart a mile wide.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Fabian’s direction makes good use of Manville’s sparkling eyes and soft smile as the unassuming fish out of water and Mrs.Harris teaches the elite to be human which is luscious, refreshing fun.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris is cut from the same cloth as Longfellow Deeds and Jefferson Smith, innocent outsiders who cluelessly cut through the pretensions of the cynics they encounter.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This is a pleasant trip to Paris.  Huppert essentially plays Manville’s character in 'Phantom Thread', so enjoy the role reversal.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lighthearted and sweet, this movie could charm the pantsuit off of almost anybody.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris is darling and delightful, making for a perfect summer fit.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris stretches a bit to make high and low meet harmoniously, but it often manages the feat, thanks especially to Manville. As a force of British charm, you could imagine her Ada one day teaming up with Paddington.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s wispy fantasy, but lovable Manville and a winsome cast make it feel real. Need a mood boost right now? This is it.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: In nearly every way, Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is magical.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a frolicsome frock fantasy, full of joie de vivre and a certain I don’t know what.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s rare to find movies that value the mere idea of beauty, and this one—directed by Anthony Fabian—does so unapologetically.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Sometimes all you want is some whimsical feel-good comfort food. And sometimes all you need is an actress like Manville to give it some special flavor.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: I enjoyed every moment of this offering.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: No one does this sort of lighthearted frippery as well as the British.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: [Lesley Manville is] basically giving Paddington in a Phantom Thread setting.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris may be the feel-good movie of the summer. The casting of Manville, Bravo, Isaacs, Williams, Hubbert and even an enjoyable turn by Alba Baptista help tell an inspiring story.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Just like the title character, this breezy British comedy overflows with scrappy working-class charm.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: An engaging wisp of magic realism, featuring a London and Paris fit and stage-lit for a 1950s musical.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It's a charmingly chic fairytale giving me vibes ranging from Phantom Thread to Gigi to Mary Poppins. Yet, it's an inspiration tale with exquisite design providing the ultimate tribute to the Christian Dior brand

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This mid-century-set treat is as pretty and heartwarming as you can imagine.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a quiet delight, a perfect summer interlude that exudes beauty, optimism and charm in every scene. Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris feels like capturing joy in a bottle.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Through it all, Manville treads a delicate line perilously close to making Mrs. Harris cloying, but somehow never oversteps.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Fortunately, Manville ... is there to maintain the film’s humor, drive and dignity.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Longing for a sweet little surprise that transports you to a place of pure movie enchantment? Then check out the glorious Lesley Manville as a struggling London maid who travels to Paris to fulfill her Cinderella fantasy of owning a Dior gown.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris could be in the running for the title of Nicest Movie Ever Made.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Just like the costumes we see, the film paints its aesthetics with inviting colors. Yet, it understands that beneath the surface is where the soul truly lies.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s a featherweight tale that benefits from a great cast and stunning costuming.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: While Mrs. Harris may not always see herself that way, Manville shows us in every moment that the character’s discovery of her courage and value is as much a work of art as the meticulously constructed gowns of Dior.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A sweetly cheeky tale...a story of people with hidden hearts, and the woman who inspires them to bring those hearts into the sunlight.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Stories about outsiders taking on exclusive systems are nothing new, though the details of their struggle change with the retelling. “Struggle” is the key word here, however, as it seems distressingly missing from this serio-comic dramedy.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: So benign and enjoyable viewers may find themselves uttering one of its heroine's oft-used refrains, "Oh, that's lovely." And for the romantics — not the cynics — in the audience, there is absolutely nothing wrong with that.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The sumptuous production and Lesley Manville guides us through the defining beauty of Paris and fashion glamour. Ada Harris reminds us of the power of a singular goal, and how the world opens up when she never gives up on it. I dig Paris with Mrs. 'Arris!

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If everything else in "Mrs. Harris" is off the rack, she's [Lesley Manville] a hand-crafted designer dress.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville charms as the good-natured London heroine.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: I was charmed by this unapologetic fairy tale about a cleaning woman who dreams of wearing a beautiful ball gown designed by Christian Dior. Lesley Manville is a marvel, and this film is a lovely vehicle for her—the perfect embodiment of Ada Harris.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: This welcome confection will have you smiling, even shedding a tear or two along the way.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville makes the mediocre worth watching, just barely, elevating the lesser material by pouring herself into it fully.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The movie delivers its chuckles and elicits its sighs in a calibrated narrative arc that softens the hard edges of its late bloomer’s life.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If you’re allergic to this sort of thing it all sounds insufferable. But the film is very good at what it does -- gorgeous to look at and put together with manifest affection and care by director Anthony Fabian and crew.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville carries it all off effortlessly... She is playing a character who, without ever descending to easy sentiment, radiates goodness. At its best, that’s what this film does too.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris masterfully achieves every note essential in a captivating underdog story.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A delightful film that just oozes joy

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville works hard but the movie -- never credible to begin with -- becomes increasingly difficult to swallow as it labors to wrap things up.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville is an absolute delight here...

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: A sweet-natured, old-fashioned charmer that’s not only set in the fifties but could easily have been made then.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: There may not be a lighter movie at the theatres this summer. But Lesley Manville elevates this film about a woman determined to own Dior couture, in defiance of class.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If you want a cute, lighthearted, “gosh, golly gee” kind of movie with incredible fashions, then Mrs Harris Goes To Paris is one right up your alley.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville absolutely shines in a terrific vehicle for the underrated actress.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is predictable and overlong, but Leslie Manville brings the heart and soul.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Despite its gleeful showcasing of beautiful clothes and vibrant midcentury Parisian sights, the film is caught between its fantasies and its principles, landing somewhere more annoyingly clueless — and dull — than it ought to be.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: "Mrs. Harris" is the kind of pleasingly old-fashioned movie that could have come out in its late-'50s time period, starring Deborah Kerr or Jennifer Jones.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: “Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris” never devolves into a preachy treatise. Instead, it’s a soothing tonic, a nice little escape from the troubles of the world.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs Harris and her journey to Paris might not be one that stays with you for very long – one’s memory of the film might be as fleeting as her trip – but it’s so far the best escape many of us will have had this summer.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville makes sure that Mrs. Harris herself is never overbearing to watch, but the movie around her ultimately gets far too cutesy for its own good.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: MRS. HARRIS GOES TO PARIS isn’t just for those who appreciate splendid sets and costumes. It’s a story of hope, happiness, achievement --- and ultimately love.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The operative word to describe co-writer and director Anthony Fabian’s film is “charming”. It is essentially an enjoyable fantasy.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Gives us an everyday superhero to root for.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It's not the most rousing endeavor, but small creative goals help the film remain as charming as it possibly can.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Lesley Manville radiates British charm in a tale that’s both slow and rushed.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: As far as fashion flicks go, the House of Dior fares much better than the House of Gucci.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville in any incarnation is one of the great pleasures of screen storytelling, especially now. And even at its most patronizing, “Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris” provides a generous, gentle stage for her most endearing qualities to shine through.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s entirely inoffensive (not to mention a little boring) in its pursuit of a moment or two’s frothy confection.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a nourishing, if fleeting, summer holiday that can be enjoyed for far less than the cost of couture.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It’s a sometimes tedious but just as often delightful way to window shop.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Between the delightful Lesley Manville and top-notch dress designs from Jenny Beavan, there’s enough reason to go to a theater to watch Mrs. Harris go to Paris

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville’s made a couple of extreme character switches since she played the fierce guardian and businesswoman behind her brother's fashion house in 2017’s "Phantom Thread," but none so radical as this, her first turn as a fairy godmother...

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Manville enhances the screen alongside Jenny Beavan’s posh costume design. For a movie about the beauty of clothing, the outfits in “Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris” are worth the price of admission.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: It is perhaps the ultimate fantasy, that all good deeds go rewarded; making Mrs. Harris’s world punishing enough to drive suspense, but decent enough to work out, is a balancing act that director Fabian skillfully manages throughout the entire film.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If director Fabian’s touch is a little heavy and coy, the actors lighten it every preordained step of the way.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The best “feel good” movies do a little something to restore our faith in humanity, and this one does that, time and again.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If you’re anxious and world-weary and you want the next season of Emily in Paris to hurry up and arrive, this film may be just the ticket.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: You want to know something special about this movie, don’t you? Well, it’s Lesley Manville. The script can be nonstop lies, but she finds the truth in it.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Thanks to some slyly plush storytelling and even better performances from Lesley Manville and Isabelle Huppert, what could have sufficed as a sweet charmer delivers a whole lot more.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Despite a tendency to be cloying and cliché, the comedy/drama Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris has exuberant charm that's hard to resist. Lesley Manville shines in this fairytale-like story about a woman who believes it's never too late to chase a dream.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Anchored by Manville’s beautifully nuanced and sunny performance (and those of the supporting cast), assured direction by Fabian, and a gorgeous production design by Luciana Arrighi, Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a surprise and a pleasure.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Led by a great Lesley Manville, Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris﻿ is a delightfully wholesome film and the very definition of a "feel good" story.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: On the surface, Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is a film about Ada’s quest to buy the couture gown of her dreams, but much like Ada herself, there is more than meets the eye.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: An effervescent Lesley Manville buoys the film even during the most egregiously hokey moments in a film extolling the virtues of kindness, empathy, and the transformative power in the pursuit of happiness.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Director Anthony Fabian’s film is an unlikely but thorough crowd-pleasing charmer that offers a persuasive argument that maybe story isn’t everything – and that characterization, tone and unfailingly good humor can go a long way, too.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: But "Mrs. Harris Goes To Paris" is about more than just wanting a new frock; it's about learning to pursue your dreams even when they seem impossible and to appreciate beauty even when it seems out of reach.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Enchanting.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: If you want to feel good for two straight hours, Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris is the movie to see this summer.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: In the tradition of Britain’s class comedies, what makes 'Mrs. Harris Goes To Paris' comes down to the difference between, say, your average fashion designer and someone like Dior.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: [Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris] is given a sheen of topicality without ever exhibiting any willingness to actually get its hands dirty.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: Fabian’s film is charming enough, though his attempts at romance remain largely earthbound as he makes a clean break from the earlier TV version, offering a different interpretation of the character.

name: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
review: The movie is a story about fashion that feels triumphantly out of fashion with the overblown norms of today’s filmmaking. It wears its earnestness as well as its quiet confidence on its sleeve, and it’s a good look for the cinema.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The movie has a social commentary that’s not preachy, putting on display the cut-off predicament that ex-cons of all ages run into. Plaza just keeps getting better and better.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza’s tough but sympathetic performance keeps you hooked all the way.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: As neatly set-up as the world of the film is, it wouldn’t work half as well without Aubrey Plaza’s brilliantly specific lead performance, portraying Emily as an emotionally shut-down woman on the edge.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Well, what would you do?

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is great at portraying the side of L.A. that we all know and love from classic noir, but also contemporizing it.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza is just incredible in the lead performance. She's just a skinny little thing, but she really makes you believe that she can hold her ground with bigger, tougher guys. She also makes you believe that she has real steel inside her.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Using crippling student loan debt as a motivation for someone breaking bad as opposed to any sort of revenge plot is a genius move, and Ford loads the film with down-to-earth details that make Emily’s story feel so intrinsically rooted in the real world.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It's a late fest highlight, one of my faves. It remains hyper focused and never wanders, with a 96 minute runtime that is just right for this story...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza, gives a nervy, committed performance, transforming Emily from an embittered temp worker into a stone-cold thief. She is a boss for the entire film ultimately creating her journey on her terms

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It’s difficult to comprehend this is a debut feature from writer-director John Patton Ford. The filmmaking is so assured. The narrative is so tight. It feels like the work of a seasoned pro.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: There's a style reminiscent of the Safdie brothers (Uncut Gems) in Ford's film, but this writer/protagonist duo delivers a tour de force with its own signature and merits. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Emily the Criminal
review: This is not your usual indie fare; it’s a guileless indictment of the broken American dream and one of the best films of the year.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It’s a tight 96-minute runtime and it’s directed with quiet ferocity by John Patton Ford, who is making his feature directorial debut here. Based on this, he’s probably gonna get more jobs

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily is Plaza’s Michael Corleone, a character who erodes your sympathies so slowly that you almost don’t notice what’s becoming of her — or perhaps, what she always was.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: As a crime thriller, Emily the Criminal is well-written and absorbingly paced, but it’s Plaza’s fearless work that makes it memorable.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily The Criminal is a brilliant piece of art that’s particularly relevant to today’s world. It’s almost terrifyingly realistic and shows how far a person is capable of going when society turns its back on them.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza absolutely crushes it!

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A bit overt in its messaging, I liked the parallel dramatic arcs pitting the lead's personal and professional awakenings together for a tense climax.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: This is a down-to-earth, small-scale, tightly focused genre film. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily The Criminal isn’t in any way bad, it’s just that Plaza is way too good and nothing reaches her level.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Written and directed by John Patton Ford, the film showcases Aubrey’s versatility and screen presence. Rossi is cast well as co-star and sidekick. Cinematography by Jeff Bierman works well in evoking the moodiness of the film with cool tones.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is a decent thriller driven by an interesting character, but from the faltering pace to the predictable plot, the story overall fails to match the intensity of Plaza’s lead performance.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It's a bracing look at a society that makes it almost impossible for someone to escape their past. So even as it dips into several thriller cliches, it remains gripping.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A hugely assured debut for writer-director John Patton Ford.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Much of the film’s success comes down to Plaza, who has left that deadpan sphinxlike mode of hers some way back in the rear-view mirror.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The glower of actor Aubrey Plaza is a thing of great beauty and precision, as subtle as a stiletto secretly sheathed in a kicky pair of boots.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Debut writer/director John Patton Ford wrings plenty of queasy, claustrophobic tension out of this scenario and Plaza – clearly relishing the chance to play gritty after a career of kooks and weirdoes – is as good as she’s ever been.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: ...a wholeheartedly enthralling endeavor...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A dark exploration of the American Dream and the dangers that it holds

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Through the conventions of a tidy and efficient little thriller, Emily the Criminal paints a bleak picture of a generation that’s entering adulthood with few avenues to prosperity.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: "Emily" is apropos of the record numbers of low-wage employees currently voluntarily quitting jobs that can never pay the bills. Which is one of the planned steps towards a society's workers letting the state take care of them. An excellent example of it.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It’s like Robin Hood robbing the rich and giving to the poor; it has the allure of punk rock.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: If you like your crime thrillers slightly smoked with fraught anxiety, then you should be able to commune with this film at a satisfactory level.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza turns in a career-high as a low-grade gangster forced into the Los Angeles underworld to pay off her student loans. The tension is unyielding, the writing impeccable, and the cast first-rate especially Theo Rossi as Plaza’s mentor.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It’s strangely exhilarating to see a film imbued with such 1970s-style worker rage.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza is at her absolute best in this unapologetic look at repurposing talent for "unsavory" activities. The film highlights how broken the system is while not getting preachy.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: While another filmmaker might have seen Emily as a cautionary tale -- a working woman whose life affirms the immutable laws of class -- Ford sees a screwed-over millennial whose wrath and cunning have reached a boiling point.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza disappears into her role, resulting in a career-best performance and one of 2022’s most captivating screen characters.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: On the one hand, Emily’s relatability, and Aubrey Plaza’s performance, deliver an explosive story. Emily is a ticking time bomb. On the other hand, the implication of what the world is coming to if a white girl cannot succeed feels disingenuous.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza is the film's true heart and force.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Based on a great idea, and it executes that idea flawlessly.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Beyond eliciting an Oscar-worthy performance from the vastly underrated Aubrey Plaza, Ford delivers the perfect movie for an era in which millions of young people are dealing with the double whammy of student-loan debt and an exploitative gig economy.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey plaza is amazing… one of the best performances and best movies of the year.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily is a woman who's found no way to exert control over her life until she gets in touch with her inner badass.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza gives one of her best outings in this solid thriller that's tense, unpredictable and never dull. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is genuinely successful generally, both as a social commentary and an intense, lean-and-mean crime thriller.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza excels...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Equal parts empowering and bleak, there’s nothing criminal about taking the time to enjoy Aubrey Plaza’s stellar performance in this suspenseful thriller.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza bears the weight of inescapable debt and crushed hopes in Emily the Criminal, and she flexes on it.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal concocts a narrative that’s just as much character study and social commentary as it is a crime drama.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: As much as the film crackles as a Millennial revenge tale, Emily the Criminal simmers as both a character study and a trenchant indictment of the U.S. carceral system and structural poverty it abets.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A low-keyed drama that argues persuasively that when the system is rigged crime actually does pay.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Largely feels cut from the cloth of the neorealists...[a] compelling dramatization of the strain the American economy puts on the indebted class of gig workers, and the lengths people may find themselves going to in the face of dwindling options.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Dicey, daring and unpredictable and should cast a broader spotlight on both its star and its filmmaker.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza leaves behind her typecast to give us her best work yet as a woman running in desperation mode, simultaneously presenting vulnerability and strength, in an intense film about greed, love, and survival at all cost. Full review in Spanish

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Ford has plenty to say in his feature debut but Plaza helps him say it without losing sight of the human psychology and drama at the heart of his messaging.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily The Criminal takes a character and a situation many audience members will connect with and throws it away in favour of a generic indie crime finale. The set-up and the lead performance promise far more than the ending of this crime thriller...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: An incendiary lead performance from Aubrey Plaza elevates Emily the Criminal into an urgent meditation on our survival of the fittest economy.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily The Criminal is another masterful performance by Plaza, who has quietly become one of the best actors of her generation.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: But if Emily the Criminal isn't always successful as a genre exercise, it's thoroughly gripping as a portrait of a woman always operating in survival mode.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The first half generates some real fire before the final act decelerates into familiarity, but Aubrey Plaza maintains that blaze throughout and is a reason to follow all the way to the end.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: I can’t say enough about Aubrey Plaza’s performance. Not only does she keenly capture Emily’s vulnerability but also her toughness – both pivotal ingredients to this fascinating character.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The gritty look, the harsh critique of the punishing shallows of capitalism, and Plaza's incendiary yet dry righteousness: it's a dark parable of empowerment but it's also a bold, dark showcase for her gifts.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: ... It’s energizing to see something as keenly observed and uniquely competent as Emily the Criminal.  It’s a tense and engaging thriller that looks and feels distinctively different.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: As a social tract, Emily the Criminal is more impassioned than wise. As a thriller, it fares better -- in that case, no one’s asking for wisdom.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: How would Emily stop a dangerous man pursuing her in a car? What kind of attitude does she need to be intimidating? By pretending to be tough, Emily becomes tough, and through Plaza’s performance that transition is seamless.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is an intense experience and an introspective look at the way forgiveness is never given, no matter how much you repent.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza's Emily is a cagey, super badass and sexy character who keeps surprising the audience throughout the story. She is best doing a slow burn with the character, then pouncing with a wild veracity opposite to Emily's exterior. Soul Larceny!

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza's star is in ascent and this movie showcases her talent The only problem is the meandering story that never rises above mediocre.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The funny girl has grown up to become the woman in the little-seen "Black Bear" and "Best Sellers." Now, as a struggling artist-turned expert in credit card fraud, Plaza offers one of the year's most versatile performances in the role of her career.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: “Emily the Criminal” is a crackerjack crime thriller. It’s paced like something Mann might have scripted and shot with the energy of a Safdie picture.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Veneer of grittiness aside, Emily the Criminal is ultimately something of a fantasy, shrewdly targeted at a postgraduate workforce crushed by debt.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Surprisingly topical but not preachy, this movie makes its points while allowing for some interesting character moments.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza delivers a powerful performance. She transitions slowly over the course of the film, leaning in to own her presence, power, and sexuality as her time on screen mounts.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It's almost a modern Western... A sharp film and really well directed.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: What we get is this sort of pretty good Neo-Noir movie.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: What sets “Emily the Criminal” apart is that it presents its order of events as natural, cyclical and definitive, without foregoing character for fist-in-the-air histrionics.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza expands her horizons with this nifty noir. Theo Rossi is also memorable.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Filmmaker Ford’s Emily screenplay makes good use of the wickedness lurking just beneath the surface of Plaza’s arguably comedic bad-girl persona.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza is superb in the role, in part because she’s playing so well against her usual type.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: John Patton Ford's Emily the Criminal, from his own screenplay, offers up another great turn from Plaza, who has fully embraced her indie-goddess status, starring in (and producing) low-budget pictures with a great deal of panache.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: An extremely impressive piece of work.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: In her hands, Emily is defensive, cagey, and unafraid to be unlikeable. Plaza’s electric.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Well-executed and an interesting portrayal of a morally ambiguous woman facing test after test.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza gives a knockout performance as “Emily The Criminal” and makes this one well worth seeing.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal has an awfully cute title for a movie so bubbling over with rage.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A suspenseful, engrossing thriller about a woman finding her purpose in life, however dark and messed up that purpose may be.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza is such an explosive device, a coiled bundle of skepticism and rage, that she blasts her scenes into life. This is a fully-fleshed out character and a highlight of her career.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A fierce and focused performance from Aubrey Plaza is the main attraction of the disquieting drama, “Emily the Criminal.”

name: Emily the Criminal
review: At a tight 90 minutes, the movie ends up feeling like the rare genre film that actually earns more room to breathe. Still, for a criminal, 'Emily' is largely a success.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Whether it be in moments of quite contemplation or determined action, Plaza dominates the screen, driving the story forward with a passion that makes this much more than a throw-away genre exercise...One of the year's best films.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: File Emily the Criminal in the category of bad films that earn credit for reflecting the zeitgeist.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: “Emily the Criminal” may not be much of a role model, but its star is something else.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: There’s more than a kernel of truth in “Emily the Criminal” in nearly every interaction, and each rueful acknowledgment of American capitalism’s tough-luck-pal undertow.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: What “Emily the Criminal” really is is a character study; and this is where Plaza comes in. She’s the really good thing the movie has going for it.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Continuing her string of strong performances, Plaza brings mesmerizing layers to the role.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A spare but riveting thriller about the lengths an individual might go to to fight back against a fucked-up yet all-too-real system.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: An intense drama rife with social commentary about the fraying edges of today's world and the tiny push it takes to send someone over the line.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal features an intense heist, an unfortunately relatable tale of millennial desperation, and a crazy-good performance from the deadpan queen.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: As a desperate woman embracing her dark side, Plaza does richly layered work in this neo-noir thriller.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: One of the pleasures of Plaza’s performance is the way she shows us a person working out her fight-or-flight instincts in real time, and in ever more dangerous transactional situations.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is a type of morality tale where the morals get squishier the more the film goes along. You may not agree with everything Emily does, but thanks to a really good performance by Plaza, you’ll still be rooting for her.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A gritty and suspenseful LA noir that also serves to examine the structural issues that uphold wealth inequality in this country. But “Emily the Criminal” isn’t trying to be preachy or political; it’s just authentic, and urgent.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Essential to this is Plaza’s intense, subtle performance, one that should lay to rest any doubts that she can headline a drama.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: While turning to a life of crime to get out of debt isn’t the most original concept, Ford’s decision to keep his camera on Emily’s face for most of the film elevates the material, for Plaza’s performance is the draw here.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: More than being typical crime caper, Emily the Criminal is also a scathing portrayal of getting trapped in gig economy work and student loan debt. Aubrey Plaza gives an intense and memorable performance in this suspense-filled drama.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza gives a powerhouse performance in this action/thriller that exposes the society in which we all currently live: a place that does not offer forgiveness or rehabilitation.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: ...this inclusive hard-luck yarn will speak to many viewers who want to live their best lives — but know damn well they’re not financially capable of doing such a thing.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal functions as a thriller. At its heart, though, the film is a harsh study of a character brought to and then breaking her limits...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal works thanks to a thrilling central performance from Plaza

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza shines in this smart indie noir.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza shines, but tepid thriller slams capitalism in most Gen Z way possible.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Thanks to Plaza, “Emily the Criminal” is a fascinating character study. Like its main character, the movie is a mix of elements. The social commentary, crime drama, a hint of romance and character work, fit together like puzzle pieces .

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza does great, but a lack of tension and character development take away from the film. The idea is a good one, but the themes are barely touched on instead of fully explored.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Offers a crisp understanding of frustrations and anger tied to the loan business, providing a universal sense of stress, which makes for powerful cinema.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza continues her transformation from TV funnylady to indie drama queen anchoring this sharp crime story that's both anxiety-inducing and oddly redemptive.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: An appealing but insubstantial showcase for a fine cast.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The cinema's favorite "naughty girl" turns "badass woman" in this gritty and bitingly-topical thriller set in LA's thriving illegal underground economy.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A satisfying story of female empowerment of the criminal kind.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The dark, dry and daring talents of Aubrey Plaza continue to enchant.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It’s becoming obvious that Aubrey Plaza can do no wrong.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: For me, Aubrey Plaza is an acquired taste, but she and Theo Rossi are a dynamic duo of chemistry as their lives, in crime and out, intertwine. I really wanted them to be successful, even if it is a life of crime.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: a career best performance from Plaza… an unexpectedly gritty American crime thriller from a promising new American filmmaker.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The film may not suffer from didacticism, but it’s at its most volcanic when it promises to blossom into a study of a generation’s financial difficulties.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza in a stunning performance as a woman drowning in student debt who accepts an offer she can't refuse.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Even admirers of the always solid work from Aubrey Plaza will be stunned by her riveting, nuanced performance in this taut thriller/character study about a young woman who is trapped by her circumstances and turns to a life of crime.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Ford's script never deviates far from reality, which is why so many scenes will have you on the edge of your seat. Each time Emily is confronted with a job, you can't help but wonder if this one will be the one that will get her caught.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: This film belongs to Aubrey Plaza and it's her best work to date. Even if the film ends up going down fairly predictable territory in a way that's akin to the downfall of a protagonist in a Walter White-esque manner, it's still worth a look.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: John Patton Ford's debut feature is very astute about mixing character study, crime thriller, and critique of a "trickle-up" economic system that more and more Americans are finding is fundamentally gamed against them.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is a lean and efficient thriller that, even in the smallest moments, is an intriguing look at credit card scams and dummy purchasing with stolen identities.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: If you’re looking for a movie to kick back and enjoy, Emily the Criminal will keep you entertained. However, if you want little more than car chases and credit card fraud, the film has plenty of intrigue for viewers looking to scratch beyond the surface.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The whole movie is somewhere in-between a real genre movie, an indie character study and a social commentary. Its fine and certainly a decent one-time watch, but I was certainly missing more energy and depth.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The film is a cinematic expression of the hypocrisy of accountability and how it ties into opportunity. Emily the Criminal has a conscience, and it gives voice to those who are rarely heard.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plazas performance, along with Fords screenplay, shows the film to be one of the highlights of the 2022 Sundance Film Festival and is sure to find an audience once it finds a home.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: There's a lot to enjoy in Emily the Criminal. Plaza's performance and some of the nail-biting plans certainly make for a great moviegoing experience.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The crime thriller genre is so routine, what could make it less formulaic? How about a taut script and smart direction by John Patton Ford and a gutsy performance by Aubrey Plaza.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: With Aubrey Plaza in one of her best roles as a lead, the film evolves into a social commentary that may spark further debate. Also, keep in mindno unpaid internships!

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Though the second half falls more into straightforward crime thriller tropes, it remains consistently tense and entertaining thanks to two terrific performances from Plaza and Rossi and an ever-present looming air of financial burden on our characters

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Writer-director John Patton Ford does a wonderful job of showing how the mutual interest between Youcef and Emily slowly blossoms both professionally and personally.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Its a highly satisfying blend of a modern-day womans picture and a tidy, B-movie thriller. The damned dont cry, indeed.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: John Patton Fords debut as writer-director is simplistically crafted in both plotting and form, but Plazas committed performance carries us through the increasingly dire journey.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Anger is her fuel, self-preservation her only principle. I wouldn’t want to spend time with her in real life, but she was great to observe at a distance.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Shallow.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: This is the tightest, most satisfying little noir Ive seen in a good long time.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: ...a true criminal travels beyond sadness to find opportunity in pessimism, and that’s Emily’s journey in a nutshell...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The best thing about it is Plaza's ferocious performance but even though the film is more or less watchable, it is mostly because of her undeniable and innate presence and charisma than because of the material she is working with here.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza’s ongoing determination to bring out the authenticity of the story actually makes the film darker than it would be as a traditional thriller.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It's milder Uncut Gems blended with some dark commentary on student debt, and Aubrey Plaza is fantastic as an upstart crook who must hustle her way through petty crime in order to help pay off her debts.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: John Patton Ford wrote and directed the movie, which is an entertaining and sharp-edged look at the world in which so many millennials find themselves.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza knocks this one out of the cinematic park. Her Emily is no one's fool. And she's a survivor.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: On the surface, the film is a thriller about a millennial who hits her breaking point and turns to crime to pay off her student debt, but she turns the tables in black market capitalism's game of risk.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: An extremely effective first feature from John Patton Ford with a powerhouse performance from Aubrey Plaza at its core. Emily may make some unethical, dangerous decisions but the film never lets you forget what put her in that position to begin with.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: [Emily the Criminal] mistakes straightforwardness for sleekness, blandly shaped when not being energized by Plaza's superhuman effort.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza, who continues to prove herself as a force to be reckoned with, is excellent, which is why it's such a shame that the rest of the film fails to be more than just mediocre.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Refreshingly, writer-director John Patton Ford's script never seeks to excuse Emily her past misdeeds or sugarcoat her worst impulses. She's a messy, believable character and her journey into LA's crime underworld in no way feels far-fetched.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza delves even deeper into the darkness with writer-director John Patton Ford's fervently intense crime-thriller Emily the Criminal, proof that she deserves every and any role she wants.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: With her steely demeanor and large, intense eyes, Plaza is a force to be reckoned with a hidden brutality just waiting to be unleashed.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is less the morality story one might presume and, because of that, makes it memorable; decrying the subjugation of self to be a cog in a machine constantly trying to grind us all down.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza never strays from her character, making sure the audience is on the edge of their seats.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It could have so easily been a neo-noir thriller, and at times it toys with that, but there's a certain glee one has when watching the film as a whole, something that boils predominantly down to [Aubrey] Plaza.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: This is a side of Plaza we haven't seen before -- a tough vulnerability that really brings Emily to life.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Elevated by an incredible, layered performance, writer-director John Patton Ford's debut feature is a show-stopping, intense thriller with depth.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: More neorealist films should feel like heist movies. This mixes its social commentary with its genre conventions so well and at its core is the truly stellar performance from its lead.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza brings a transfixing ferocity Emily the Criminal that is hard to look away from

name: Emily the Criminal
review: If rooting for this fledgling gangster is a crime, I plead guilty.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A shrewd portrait of a young woman searching for meaning and finding it in an illicit situation.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza delivers a career-best performance in Emily the Criminal...

name: Emily the Criminal
review: "Emily the Criminal" runs a taunt 90-minutes as if it were a gritty, guerilla style B-action movie you'd rent at Blockbuster on VHS in the nineties. It knows what it is and doesn't try to be anything different. Strap in.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: [Aubrey Plaza] gives a force of nature performance in a film that sometimes feels a little too breezy.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: [It] isn’t quite as insightful as it seems to think it is but still stings on the strength of Plaza’s fearlessly charismatic negative energy and the script’s glib but inarguable critique of late-stage capitalism.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Plaza's standout performance as the cold-hearted eponymous character is among her best work.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza is outstanding in this pitch black noir.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Ford has crafted a sturdy little thriller, well-constructed and executed even if it might not be as notable as one might hope for, offering a compelling character study within the confines of its genre trappings.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Manages to work toward a satisfying, logical conclusion while offering a solid critique of the gig economy many Americans face in which fortune is merely a credit card swipe away.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Featuring one of Aubrey Plaza's best performances, Emily the Criminal is an excellent example of how to make an effective thriller on a smaller scale.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A scrappy pitch-black study of just how easy it is to step into the void.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: The superstar that is Aubrey Plaza shines in this new wave crime thriller. A hard-hitting and enthralling journey.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A lot of Ford’s debut is frustratingly thin, more concerned with giving Plaza plenty of opportunities to bore through the screen with her eyes in extreme close-up than in really breaking down her psychology and the perverse romance at its center.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Underlying the compelling crime story is a scathing indictment of the work culture that undervalues human beings.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It keeps you glued right from the start, rooting for the villain to create a system of her own.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It's an undeniably striking debut, slick and involving enough to have us curiously excited for whatever [Ford] decides to do next.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It has enough to say and Plaza is strong enough as Emily to carry the film past its more pedestrian elements.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is a refreshingly low-key, scrappy crime caper that thumbs its nose at late-stage capitalism and the American Dream, hammered home by top-notch work from Aubrey Plaza and Theo Rossi.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A grittier and more mature role for Plaza that offers many situations to show she can be quite a bad-ass when given the chance.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal finds Aubrey Plaza at her most intense. It's compelling to watch.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: "Emily the Criminal" is a smart and suspenseful crime drama that grounds its genre thrills in a scathing critique of the cruel inequities of the gig economy.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Aubrey Plaza Is Superb In This Gig Economy Crime Saga.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: While Emily the Criminal is a well-crafted film, what takes it to a new level is how Plaza brilliantly and deftly crafts a character who is completely accepting yet also completely defensive about the non-tenable situation society has forced her into.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: It works very well as a dramatic thriller, but it also paints a credible picture of a reality that, surely, many people live in the United States. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Emily the Criminal
review: Emily the Criminal is a nail-biter that makes the most of the tough side Aubrey Plaza has shown in even her most comic performances.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: But despite the fact that the camera rarely backs away from studying Plaza's wary eyes and tense mouth in close-up, this character piece feels as distanced from its taciturn subject as if it was merely monitoring her on security camera.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: A heart-pounding thriller with high stakes and edge of your seat intensity. Aubrey Plaza & Theo Rossi have fantastic chemistry, but it is Plaza that steals the show.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: As a showcase for Plaza's talents as an actor, the movie is almost perfect.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: John Patton Ford's debut taps into familiar territory with a strong pair of lead performances, but so lightly and blandly that he barely skims anything off the top.

name: Emily the Criminal
review: In Emily the Criminal, Plaza goes to her darkest territory to date, seamlessly blending the edges of an "unlikable" character with her own persona. She's got an edge, but dammit if you can't root for her.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: What “Free Chol Soo Lee” lacks in terms of earlier material, it more than compensates for in revealing this underseen historical movement.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Beyond the conscientious and dogmatic spirit, Free Chol Soo Lee is a sociopolitical documentary that digs into yesterday to find the footprints that still have an effect today. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: [Ha and Yi] instead tell their story with sober details, having amassed fascinating archival footage of the man, his family and the media storm that surrounded him.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The filmmakers never lose sight of the importance of the mass mobilization of ordinary Asian Americans. In the archived footage, the numbers of protestors increased over time, as well as their passion.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: In its clear-eyed empathy for the totality of life, “Free Chol Soo Lee” is only deepened by not ignoring what happens when the spotlight fades on a righted wrong...

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Thanks to co-directors Julie Ha and Eugene Yi, this lesson from history gets a timely if conventional retelling. Archive footage and talking heads help depict a complex and weirdly obscure saga that leaves a bitter aftertaste.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The film's reliance on second-hand material makes it rather impersonal, but it's still a potent tale.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: There’s an entire history of political representation to confront here, in other words, and even when Free Chol Soo Lee doesn’t seem to be taking this problem on in a direct way, the movie’s self-aware deviations from the norm are pronounced.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Given the rise of anti-Asian hate crimes and ongoing miscarriages of justice today, Free Chol Soo Lee sadly offers plenty of lessons the world has yet to learn from.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: [An] impressive and wrenchingly sad documentary...

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The taut film takes us through the story with great economy.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: As we examine the details of Lee’s case, its combination of poverty, social inequality, official indifference, casual racism and plain-old bad luck creates a whirlpool of misfortune that draws us in irresistibly.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Channeling the spirit of Sacramento Bee reporter K.W. Lee, who first led the charge for Chol Soo’s exoneration, Ha and Yi embrace detailed reportage, demonstrating the racially biased bunglings of police and judicial procedure.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The film captures the activist spirit of the 1970s-1980s and the many characters involved in Lee’s story, while refraining from any kind of hagiography of its central character.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Though operating well within the lines of contemporary true-crime, this focused documentary maintains a sense of disgust that many of its peers only tap intermittently.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: While this documentary traces a true story in a rather straightforward manner, the important subject matter makes it worth a look.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: What makes the film so engrossing is how much attention the film-makers give to Lee’s complicated life after prison...

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: A gripping, enraging and moving documentary.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Free Chol Soo Lee reminds us that when we sit on the sideline and do not actively fight against discrimination and the stereotyping of Asians, real people, such as Chol Soo Lee, suffer.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Chol Soo Lee’s complicated story deserves to be told; this film does a good job telling it.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: This is a worthwhile introduction to Soo Lee; even more importantly, it’s an urgent cautionary tale.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: With so much to cover,  Free Chol Soo Lee often feels like the tip of a much larger iceberg. Ha and Yi instead opt to focus their feature on its more uplifting elements, which makes for an understandable, if somewhat limiting choice for the feature.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: As much as it celebrates the exoneration of its subject, a Korean immigrant in California named Chol Soo Lee, this documentary... is concerned with how the consequences of the failure of justice rippled through the rest of his life.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The film sympathetically, but honestly, portrays Lee as a man encircled by his destiny practically determined by his social setting.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Filmmakers Ha and Yi have a lot of archival footage to work with, which they assemble quite masterfully to tell Lee’s story.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: It deliberately and pointedly asks far more questions than it can ever answer: questions it quietly implores the audience to take home; to debate; to take to the ballot box and the courtroom...

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The documentary details the plight of the Korean immigrant who, in 1973, was wrongfully convicted of murder in part because white tourists were unable to distinguish one Asian person’s features from another...

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Julie Ha and Eugene Yi's documentary is a work full of empathy and encouragement.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Free Chol Soo Lee tackles many subjects, the justice system, the Asian American community, the burden of representation, but the way that it puts Chol Soos story and his tragedies front and center is exceedingly effective.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: In just around 90 minutes, Free Chol Soo Lee brings to light the deep complexities of narrativizing Asian diaspora.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: A compelling and moving tribute to a man who was by no means a perfect person but nevertheless had a remarkable impact on breaking barriers.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Directors Julie Ha and Eugene Yi craft a powerful indictment of systemic racism and the criminal justice system, while providing Lee a chance to have agency and tell his story through his own words.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Yi and Ha's act of excavation, of linking Asian-American oppression and resistance to the modern day without ever explicitly bringing this decade into the conversation, is deeply moving.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: The film works because it finds the tricky balance between describing Lee's hard life and exploring how his prison experience inspired a movement that was bigger than he was - and how he struggled to live up to those expectations.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: A straightforward but engaging documentary by Julie Ha and Eugene Yi. But why is this story at all important? The answer: It preserves and narrates an important episode in the development of what can be called Asian American identity.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: It's both a galvanizing story of grassroots activism and a tragic example of what the U.S. prison system takes from those trapped within it.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Does what you need a documentary like this to do. It is fascinating and insightful

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Ha and Yi combine careful editing and sensitive direction to ultimately deliver a shocking and sobering insight into a normal guy, whose only 'crime' is looking different

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Free Chol Soo Lee is what documentary filmmaking should strive for as a medium built of humanity and empathy.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: It isn't just the prosecutors' case that is meticulously and convincingly picked apart in Julia Ha and Eugene Yi's engrossing documentary, but the entire American justice system as a whole.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: A loving depiction of a lonely and often misunderstood man.

name: Free Chol Soo Lee
review: Julie Ha and Eugene Yi's involving documentary covers a U.S. wrongful conviction case that ultimately helped improve cultural and judicial sensitivities.

name: Decision to Leave
review: Park Chan-wook gives us the most romantic movie of 2022, about insomniac homicide detective Jang Hae-jun (Park Hae-il) who becomes obsessed with caregiver and potential mariticide candidate Song Seo-rae (Tang Wei).

name: Decision to Leave
review: This stylish romantic melodrama doubles as a gripping murder mystery in which the procedural and emotional elements blend seamlessly.

name: Decision to Leave
review: It’s got everything one would want in a neo-noir… gloriously-shot, stylish, romantic, and mysterious, with a shocking finale I didn’t see coming. Certainly one of the best of 2022.

name: Decision to Leave
review: Park Chan-wook certifies with this splendid film an uncomfortable truth: the purest form of romance is the kind that guarantees the impossibility of consummating that love. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: A film that seems to be based more on concepts of romance than on American detective or noir cinema, and that has a structure that could tire some. Full review in Spanish.

name: Decision to Leave
review: The ending of this crazy star-crossed love story is even crazier than the rest of the plot, and that's very hard to do.

name: Decision to Leave
review: A dazzling neo-noir capable of moving with enormous virtuosity by a visual language that appeals to the 21st century, ruled by its pirouettes and digital layers, without losing classic noir tradition and its eternal stereotypes... [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: Yes, it's dense. Yes, you may feel empty after viewing. Yes, the characters could solve their problems simply by speaking two lines at the opportune moment. But cinema isn't logical. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: A glorious film that lies between the impetus of love and death, mystery and romance, that takes us by force from the precipice to the depths with a blow of dark and tragic rapturous lyricism, as beautiful as it is wounded. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: Decision to Leave is above all a film about language; between people and images. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: ... A suspense machine, a captivating thriller at the service of a doomed love obsession. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: Murder, perhaps suicide, upscale sushi, failing/failed relationships, love at first arrest, and crow’s feathers are all important elements in Chan-wook’s story of a weekend marriage detective’s quest to put the nasty amongst us away for good.

name: Decision to Leave
review: Park Chan-wook's most elegant and mature film to date, Decision to Leave reinvents noir and dresses it up with a romance that's both obsessive and moving. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Decision to Leave
review: I miss sick and twisted Park Chan-wook, but if being more restrained gets him wider acclaim and Oscar nominations, I hold no resentments.

name: Decision to Leave
review: Park Chan-wook is exploiting the two elements that middlebrow American audiences love—sex and plot trickery.

name: Decision to Leave
review: The way Chan-wook manipulates characters within space and time here is visually stunning, and when combined with one of the year's most perfectly matching musical scores it creates a deep emotional connection to the film's romantic duo.

name: Decision to Leave
review: How should I say this? Reminiscent of Hitchcock, the tone is seamless, the performances by Park Hae-il and Tang Wei are flawless, and the storytelling is addictively satisfying and engrossing.

name: Decision to Leave
review: This twisted romantic thriller from Park Chan-wook features a knockout performance by Tang Wei as a Chinese immigrant to Korea and Park Hae-il as the police detective who’s assigned to investigate the death of her husband.

name: Decision to Leave
review: A Hitchockian labyrinth that keeps you guessing until the end with its knotty, twisty narrative—pushing and pulling characters through relationships with each other and with the audience.

name: Decision to Leave
