review: X is a gory, funny, surprisingly restrained and yet still gleefully amoral film.

name: X
review: Ti West blends old school homage with modern horror thrills to craft a blackly comic and surprisingly poignant tale loaded with scares and gut-churning gore.

name: X
review: Its got a decent script, an energetic cast, and lots of style.

name: X
review: It's a love letter to the best of horror, and further, freedom of expression. There are moments of surprising, haunting beauty that add nothing to the plot, but everything to the experience. With X, West can be compared to Craven or even Carpenter.

name: X
review: A near-perfect film, cut off at the knees to make room for future sequels, but sequels that will surely flesh out the story.

name: X
review: A film that unabashedly combines fairly explicit sex scenes with an ultra gory slasher, and explores the relationship between sex and death.

name: X
review: Ti West’s X aims its slasher-movie homage straight at classic horror fanatics.

name: X
review: A meticulously-crafted ode to vintage horror.

name: X
review: This is really great, a throwback to those grindhouse films of the 1970s.

name: X
review: Falls off a bit once the killing starts, but Ti West has crafted an entertaining, humorous and sex-positive homage to '70s horror films that is just downright fun.

name: X
review: If you can get on its same wavelength — which admittedly takes the first ten or fifteen minutes — and understand what West is doing, then you’ll have a good time.

name: X
review: Whether you buy the premise or not, this is still one of the best horror films thats been made in a long time. The photography, editing and overall vibe harken to nostalgia movies like Boogie Nights and Dazed and Confused.

name: X
review: Ti West is becoming one of the only directors since John Landis that’s capable of crafting a true horror comedy.

name: X
review: Proudly brings us right into the heart of horror cinema at its most sordid... without sacrificing any of the intellectual density that "elevated horror" is so proud of.

name: X
review: A nasty-minded slasher with a wicked sense of humour and a taste for blood

name: X
review: ...an exceedingly (and sometimes excessively) deliberate horror film that benefits from its atmospheric sensibilities and roster of top-notch performances...

name: X
review: This is a compendium of horror films from the 70s and early 80s all rolled into one.

name: X
review: Whether you want to breathe along with it remains an open question. Know this, though, X may not transcend its horror  niche but it embraces it with unwavering commitment.

name: X
review: Xs gory violence matched with sexual imagery makes for a uniquely entertaining slasher, albeit one that you may not be in a rush to watch again due to how uncomfortable it is.

name: X
review: It’s an out-and-out slasher that embraces cliche as often as it desires to subvert it.

name: X
review: Goth, Ortega, and Snow all give endearing, dynamic performances.

name: X
review: X is preoccupied with voyeurism across different generations, bringing together two genres - horror and porn - associated not just with the MPAAs X rating, but also with the male gaze. That gaze will be subverted and skewered...

name: X
review: West’s trademark slow build-up gives us every chance to imagine our own version of the mayhem on the way... To hold our attention in the meantime, he has another trick up his sleeve: making his characters sufficiently interesting and likeable.

name: X
review: A fantastic slasher flick that works on multiple levels, but chiefly at its most important job: slicing and dicing in dizzying delight.

name: X
review: West's film is meta but not in the painful wink-wink, nudge-nudge jokiness of the Scream franchise. Instead, it's a more subtle way of referencing the horror genre through just the visual look of the location or the costumes or the framing.

name: X
review: A skillful, clever, not entirely satisfying homage to the heyday of both skin flicks and slasher cinema.

name: X
review: X is a horrifying and self-aware slasher that knows no film exists in a bubble. It embraces cinematic history, humps it, then slashes its throat.

name: X
review: The film proves once again if you do a good job mixing sex and violence, you captured Hollywood's winning formula combo

name: X
review: Creepy, hilarious, gross...X is a love letter to 70s horror classics but also something entirely fresh and original.

name: X
review: The characters (and the performances) are strong enough to make sure this avoids the usual pitfalls that come with making a film about film-making, giving the slaughter just enough of an emotional core to keep it from being a collection of flashy slashes

name: X
review: West just wants to punish everyone involved in gory ways played for laughs.

name: X
review: X paints the screen with a sensual bloodbath that serves up plenty of well-timed thrills with a harrowing message.

name: X
review: I expected many things from X, but I didn't expect it to make me cry.

name: X
review: West effectively rachets up the tension by delaying the requisite bloodletting, which is done with a relative sense of restraint.

name: X
review: West has made a rare horror tale that makes you listen, ponder and consider whats happening to its hapless victims, and why.

name: X
review: It's quite a while before the dictates of the genre kick in - and when they do it's with substantial force.

name: X
review: I had fun with this and easily could see myself watching it again

name: X
review: Director Ti West crafts a blood-soaked tribute to 1970's era slashers while inserting his own thoughtful meditations.

name: X
review: X has no interest in making any sweeping statement about gender, sexuality, or age. Instead, it strips slasher horror down to its core and reminds us of what it was about the genre that made us love it. It's funny, self-aware, and unashamedly gory.

name: X
review: An instant slasher classic.

name: X
review: A no holds barred, take no prisoners horror flick that possesses that magical ability to still genuinely (and delightfully) shock and astound you.

name: X
review: For all its lackadaisical, uncontemporary pace, and lack of most great horror’s gruelling intensity, X remains a satisfying, keenly thoughtful ride.

name: X
review: It's porny, and it's scary.

name: X
review: Between West’s screenplay and a universally strong cast, X is surprisingly affecting.

name: X
review: Ti West's "X" is one of the best slashers I've seen this year. It's not for the faint of heart. Its story shocks but also broadens the horizons and provokes. Worth revisiting, with a soundtrack jam-packed with bangers and performances out of this world.

name: X
review: X provides a map for how to do the classics right while still taking the formula somewhere original.

name: X
review: X is a whole-hearted homage to the 70s slasher movement. And unlike the majority of its kind, it actually manages to live up to its predecessors.

name: X
review: X by name, extreme by nature. Ti West's horror comeback doesn't pull any punches and it's full of sex, violence and plenty of great scares.

name: X
review: "Skewers the soured tropes and sex stereotypes of a certain slasher era..."

name: X
review: West’s taboo-trampling addition to the genre is really, really good… albeit in a way so nasty that I was regularly flinching in my seat.

name: X
review: If there is pleasure in pain, then X hits the spot.

name: X
review: I give West credit for having a vision and sticking to his own influences. He knows what he wants to do and how to execute it unapologetically.

name: X
review: Editing is great in this one, cutting back and forth from images representing religion, aging, sex & mental illness. Yes, there is plenty of nudity and quality kills, but also there is also an exacting eye toward the homage of "That 70s Feeling." Groovy!

name: X
review: Fans of arthouse horror have reason to rejoice. Prodigal son Ti West has returned ... to his roots, delivering a slow-burning, immensely gratifying bloodbath, mixing grindhouse aesthetic with an adult film edge that looks too good to be bad.

name: X
review: Ti West's slasher pastiche has a strong start but once the gruesome kills arrive and the ultimate secret is revealed, there isn't anything here that we haven't seen before.

name: X
review: ..a playful and idiosyncratic ode to both ends of the 70s sleaze cinema spectrum (hardcore porn and Wes Craven-esque slashers) alike.

name: X
review: Mia Goth is fantastic in this wildly entertaining slasher about repressed desires and their devastating consequences. Full Review in Spanish

name: X
review: X is a great example of how you can honor the genre classics while still very much doing your own thing.

name: X
review: Ripe with playful winks and nudges.

name: X
review: Perhaps the film’s efforts to say something about desire and old age are a touch graceless, but they have definite novelty value.

name: X
review: Enough of it works to be precisely a gory, howling entertainment for those who like their movies to come dipped in viscera. It also tries to be funny and sometimes succeeds.

name: X
review: Sweaty, sexy and extremely fun slasher.

name: X
review: Ti West returns to horror after a nine-year absence, only to unveil his magnum opus. X is an instant horror classic with standout performances by Mia Goth and Scott Mescudi. Sex, Gore, and Rock n Roll.  Now go watch Tobe Hooper's "Eaten Alive".

name: X
review:
It takes a slasher movie trope  you have sex, you die  and does its own thing with it. 
What its doing thematically is really cool.

name: X
review: More than just a stylish grindhouse throwback, this gorefest explores sex and violence in fresh ways. It takes into account the oft-ignored subject of aging bodies and balances things with moments of wry humor.

name: X
review: X is everything you want from a slasher, and one of the more fascinating horror films of the year, making it an instant classic.

name: X
review: Mixes camp and horror with a love story that is at once poignant and monstrous.

name: X
review: A bracing mix of old-school gore horror and modern irony. You'll laugh, then cringe, but never not be entertained.

name: X
review: Traipsing into danger is the essential playbook of horror, a path well-trodden. But the brutal, giddy-making X, written and directed by Ti West, makes that journey somehow feel both fresh and comfortingly familiar.

name: X
review: Sex and violence are delivered with a self-aware wink in this hugely entertaining comedy horror.

name: X
review: X is a mastery of the grotesque that even veteran horror film lovers will find hard to sit through at times. But if you can stomach both the best and worst of this snuff film orgy, then you're sure to enjoy yet another Ti West hall of famer.

name: X
review: Its a complete breath of fresh air to see a real movie, one that puts all its energy and creativity into just doing the thing.

name: X
review: Set in 1979, Ti West's creepy and compelling slasher film builds a case, to quote Billy Joel, that "the good ole days weren't always good."

name: X
review: A24 leaves behind the "elevated horror" and embraces the sleaze of 70s filmmaking. A gloriously disgusting and twisted ride that will keep you gripped till the very end.

name: X
review: West delivers in every facet, from the art dept, irresistible yet varied characters, and horror that boasts a strong sense of realism. And somehow, it's so fun to watch it all unfold.

name: X
review: A deliciously grisly entertainment existing on a level of craft well above most multiplex offerings, genre or otherwise.

name: X
review: A stylish and entertaining take on the slasher film, one set in the world of low-budget pornography set in 1979 Texas.

name: X
review: A wild party with a lot on its mind.

name: X
review: A wildly entertaining guilty pleasure, heavy on gore and creepiness, but low on surprises and plenty of telegraphing.

name: X
review: A bold, enthralling film that's sort of like Debbie Does Dallas-meets-The Texas Chain Saw Massacre with an arthouse twist and a heaping of dark humor.

name: X
review: My own heart still belongs to The Innkeepers, but X is a memorable return to form that shows hes far from done with the genre that birthed him.

name: X
review: A strange and wonderful return to form for the indie-horror phenom, an ode to the life-altering magic of cheap and dirty horror pictures. 13 years after his breakout hit in the genre, Ti West has added another great horror film to the canon.

name: X
review: Bloody. Brutal. Grungier than a big-city back alley and more guts-strewn than a slaughterhouse. This is how you like your slasher-flick horror, and trust us when we say Ti West has your back.

name: X
review: After such a strong start, X's back half is a one-note affair.

name: X
review: You'll laugh, you'll scream, and along the way, you meet some truly fascinating characters on both sides of the pointy object.

name: X
review: Like most of West’s films, X is not particularly ambitious in its psychology or storytelling. It’s his technique that makes his work feel like it has one foot in the arthouse...

name: X
review: To quote Chainsaw and Dave from the classic Summer School, "Two thumbs up. Make that four for gore." I had certain expectations going in and it exceeded all of them.

name: X
review: Exquisitely enjoyable thanks to some dynamic plot and stylistic decisions, with X Ti West puts the sexy and serious back into a long abused sub-genre.

name: X
review: It’s a simple conceit, but one West plays it out to its logical (and of course bloody) conclusion over the film’s hour and three quarters, with an almost languid pacing in keeping with the story’s pre-digital setting.

name: X
review: A disturbingly good time.

name: X
review: Horror movies often do this Trojan horse thing where they tell us something about society or about our inner selves. In X, there are no shortage of high-minded ideas to fish out of the entrails.

name: X
review: Theres a sense of what West was wanting to make interfering with what he was actually making, creating a mostly ineffective grindhouse exercise.

name: X
review: The real wonderment of the film, beyond the stellar performances, lie in the framing and editing.

name: X
review: There are certainly pleasures to be had here, as West lovingly re-creates the vibe of an era gone to homicidal seed, but I suspect it will play better on the festival circuit, then in the multiplex, where not everyone will be in on the joke.

name: X
review: "A deep-fried scummy Texas tale that summons up all of the grimy goopy 70s Tobe Hooper feels"

name: X
review: Fans of horror, 70s films, and 70s horror films have more than good enough reason to check out X for exactly whats being promised.

name: X
review: X rips at the jugular with exuberant joy. This is old-school exploitation horror that isnt afraid to offend and doesnt care if the rough edges get sanded down.

name: X
review: An over-the-top, blood-soaked, sex-filled, no-holds-barred amusement park ride

name: X
review: You can pull at any one of those threads of thematic oomph and get more from it, or you can leave them all in place and just let West's brutal little throwback horror journey wash over you ... when it comes to "X," you're in for one hell of a ride.

name: X
review: Proving that the coarsening of society can, for better or worse, be liberating, X uses the further coarsening of cinema to show us that it can also be a whole lotta fun.

name: X
review: Completely derivative X has no new ideas up its bloody sleeve. Mia Goth lacks presence in two roles.

name: X
review: X is expertly shot, and there is an atmosphere created that distinguishes this from anything else. Its an uncomfortable throwback slasher with attitude.

name: X
review: There is a sincerity to it all. (Director West) is playing things straight as he wants us to be gasping for air, not guffawing with laughter.

name: X
review: Decadent... what's happening isn't as significant as the why of it making viewers' skin crawl, confronting eventuality head-on... art house horror masquerading as low-budget slasher fare.

name: X
review: Nothing short of a masterpiece.

name: X
review: With wild abandon, X is a film that carves out a place amongst not just the best horror from A24, but of the glorious genre writ large. It is a meticulous and patient work that packs a wicked sense of humor that never lets go once it has you in its grasp.

name: X
review: An absolute blast that works as an authentic celebration of slasher films while being a period slasher itself.

name: X
review: For those who inherently love a fun slasher, this will deliver. However, X aims higher.

name: X
review: More than just a standard gore-fest, this humorous horror-com also gives an interesting take on sexuality and the fear of ageing.

name: X
review: Smart, well-paced, intentional, and fraught with fascinating themes and character arcs, X is a worthwhile slasher film that is aided by a great cast.

name: X
review: Straightforward in its approach and execution, X is weirdly charming because it imagines a different kind of slasher antagonist and explores how, despite significant limitations, they can still be creepy.

name: X
review: It’s deeply silly, but eminently watchable.

name: X
review: The rare recent horror movie that remembers the genre is at its best when its fun, depraved and undercover smart.

name: X
review: X is a horror film that doesn't break any new ground, but this 'slow burn' movie delivers some gruesome terror with touches of social satire that can bring some laughs.

name: X
review: A collection of promising scenes and details sorely lacking compelling connective tissue or much of a point.

name: X
review: ... the reason behind Howard and Pearls murderous actions is not fully explained, which made the film feel unfinished and lacking something story-wise.

name: X
review: A Texas Boogie Nights Massacre

name: X
review: X is a fun movie – a throwback to the Grindhouse pictures of the 1970s and the slasher genre of the late ‘70s and early ‘80s.

name: X
review: "X" pays off by showing what happens when characters are more than just meat for the grinder — or, for that matter, those doing the grinding.

name: X
review: X is a fun and solid horror film but its not as straightforward as it wants to be.

name: X
review: X is playing in many multiplexes, but it feels like it belongs in grungy theaters with sticky floors and flickering lobby lights, where you can better appreciate its disreputable thrills.

name: X
review: West sets out to make a bloody, heart pounding horror movie with X, and, for the most part, succeeds beautifully.

name: X
review: X is a horror film that starts as an art film that devolves into a nightmare you'll find yourself cheering for. It's great fun and worth a second and third watch.

name: X
review: By fusing two types of films that have long been bedfellows -- slashers and pornography -- X makes for a gripping shotgun marriage of genres.

name: X
review: BOOGIE NIGHTS meets THE TEXAS CHAINSAW MASSACRE in Ti Wests latest

name: X
review: While its gnarly payoffs eventually peter out, X is filled with fun and intense setups that harken back to classic slasher fare.

name: X
review: "X" peers into the kinky, kooky crevices of sex and violence.

name: X
review: This is an homage but also a strikingly original and cheerfully grotesque work, filled with dark humor, relatively complex subtext and gung-ho, all-in performances from the talented ensemble cast.

name: X
review: Outside of the self-aware games, the film is a tense and chilling piece of horror...

name: X
review: It would be a mistake to call “X” a misfire — in its artisanal, period textures and delight in old-school atmospherics, it’s too well made. But it’s better at teasing than following through.

name: X
review: Theres enough satire baked into the premise, plus an effort to ground both the characters and the killings, that the film manages to weave some genuine audience investment in with all the jump scares.

name: X
review: “X” is a clever and exuberant throwback to a less innocent time, when movies could be naughty, disreputable and idiosyncratic.

name: X
review: While X points most overtly to the slasher classic The Texas Chain Saw Massacre – along with sly references to everything from The Shining to Paul Schrader’s Hardcore – what West offers up is more winking tribute than carbon copy.

name: X
review: X is a throwback to the horror of Tobe Hooper and Wes Craven, but with a sensibility that simultaneously feels like a tribute and an update.

name: X
review: X bucks expectations for a 70s slasher.

name: X
review: The film’s most clever maneuver, however, is bringing all of its thematic threads to bear through its central villain...

name: X
review: X is a fitting tribute to the B-horror and slashers of yesteryear while providing a visceral examination of sexuality, youth, and the fear of aging. A triumphant victory for the horror genre, incorporating its themes with the guts and gore of horror past.

name: X
review: As good a representation of the horrors that lurk unseen as anything in recent years.

name: X
review: To anyone old enough to have lived through 1979 — and to harbor no nostalgia for the inartfulness of DIY porn and VHS slasher movies, “X” is less of a treat.

name: X
review: X is a barn burner of a movie; sexy, bloody, funny, poignant in a way, and non-stop fun. Dont miss out on seeing this one with a crowd, youll be glad you did.

name: X
review: Twisting horror archetypes into something unique but still quite gory and terrifying, Ti West continues to solidify his place as a true auteur in the genre realm.

name: X
review: The joy of X comes from the unexpected, which fits so wonderfully into the stuff youd definitely expect from the sexy tin this film is packaged in.

name: X
review: Wests latest exploits two familiar scenarios simultaneously while offering a rejoinder to the moralistic gender and sexual stereotypes that defined older horror scenarios.

name: X
review: While West isnt always operating on the same levels as his influences, his signature flair for tension through simmering slow-burn pacing remains unparalleled.

name: X
review: X is the great kind of horror that wont settle for the cliches or the narrative beats we have seen before. It's marking the spot for what great horror cinema can look like and its another Ti West banger.

name: X
review: Ti West is back with a violent vengeance, slicing and dicing his way through an exceptional original slasher that marks his best film yet.

name: X
review: Ti Wests 1979 set homage is simply the best of its kind since Rob Zombies The Devils Rejects.   X is the most fun Ive had at the movies so far this year.

name: X
review: X feels like something fresh and alive. West draws from the classics, sure, but it's evident he feels inspired by them rather than dependent on them.

name: X
review: This isn’t a reinvention of the wheel, but a reminder of why the wheel became the industry standard in the first place.

name: X
review: The expectations for West’s return to film were high, and luckily X brings this master of horror back with a bang.

name: X
review: This delightfully dark and surprisingly complex flick feels unbelievably fresh. Its influences inspire innovation rather than shackling X to the other derivative tropes we’ve come to expect from ’70s throwback horror.

name: X
review: Even when considering the brutality and carnality of it all, this is a slasher flick with a clever head on its shouldersbefore it gets chopped off.

name: X
review: X is a uniquely chilling slasher horror with pristine gore, a brilliant cast, loads of fun, and will make anyone scream out loud.

name: X
review: X is an early contender as one of the best horror movies of the year...a blood-soaked throwback with no shortage of fervor.

name: X
review: Ti West's X vividly portrays the DIY-ness of like-minded types shooting a porno and taking the enterprise as seriously as an art film, but once all hell breaks loose, its promise of a genre deconstruction all but evaporates.

name: X
review: Ti West intelligently repurposes slasher tropes into a thoughtfully sex-positive injection of bloodlust and plain old lust

name: X
review: X is a properly satisfying shocker.

name: X
review: A full-tilt genre experience that is as surprising as it is savage.

name: X
review: A blisteringly cool grindhouse flick that's as funny in the build-up with its movie-within-a-movie premise as it is wickedly violent in the payoff.

name: X
review: Director Ti West delivers a rollicking genre treat with blood, gore and brains.

name: X
review: If you are looking for a different type of hack and slash in the cinemas, you will want to peep your eyes on X.

name: X
review: Without a doubt, X is a triumph in every possible way: it defies expectations, its both thoughtful and thought-provoking in equal measure, and the way that West is able to effortlessly build tension and terror throughout is downright transcendent.

name: X
review: Ti West wears his influences on his sleeve, deliberately invoking the visual language of The Texas Chain Saw Massacre.

name: X
review: Ti West's X delivers big on slasher-style thrills, but also adds in a shockingly powerful examination of aging, the power of beauty, and what happens when one loses that power.

name: X
review: Ti West finds the sweet side of a Texas Porn Massacre.

name: X
review: Its a bit mind-boggling that West asked attendees at the SXSW Film Festival premiere to be circumspect regarding spoiling; he himself doles out foreshadowing and corny innuendos like candy on Halloween.

name: X
review: Whether you have a deep appreciation for exploitation cinema or love for slashers, X will equally turn you on and have your heart pounding at every turn.

name: X
review: An icky good time that's primarily a love letter to the filmmaking process.

name: X
review: X is scary, fun, bitter, and just as ridiculous as the real world.

name: X
review: Benefitting from West’s knack for capturing period vibes and from an unusually engaging cast, the pic is meatier than the average slasher film...

name: X
review: A narratively different beast that demonstrates why West should be given full reign to go full throttle on deranged, savage, and intense horror-comedies more often. Its a blast.

name: X
review: What X brings to the table along with its well-written characters, great kills, and patient rhythm of storytelling is a genuine meditation on sex, youth, and our collective human terror around aging.

name: X
review: A decade after his last horror film, Ti West returns to prove he's not only still got it, but his filmmaking has only gotten sharper over time with this viscerally violent exploration of our own mortal decay.

name: X
review: X is that uncommon fear film that's actually about sexuality, and not just the carnality going on in front of the camera wielded by its small troupe of amateur pornsters.

name: X
review: The folks within those frames actually seem like real people.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is practically bursting with testosterone. The story of Amleth (Alexander Skarsgård), a Viking Prince hellbent on revenge, Robert Eggers‘s third film is essentially a case study in the destructive nature of unyielding masculinity.

name: The Northman
review: Northman is one of Robert Egger best films. The scope, the scale, the atmospheric building of Norse mythology is groundbreaking. Along with some insanely well acted performances and beyond thrilling action and revenge based story. Must Watch Masterpiece!

name: The Northman
review: The Northman creates a unique saga that taps into something truly primal before one hell of an ending.

name: The Northman
review: An intoxicating and epic blend of violence, mysticism, and breathtaking visuals.

name: The Northman
review: Spectacle, pageantry and myth combine with blood, mud and abs for a dazzling, uproarious Viking spree in which Alexander Skarsgård seeks to avenge the murder of his father with the aid of Anya Taylor-Joy and Icelandic national treasure Björk.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman stands as a stark reminder that there is still a place in cinema for gorgeous, inspired odysseys, rife with literary allusions, deep-seated spiritual meanings, and an exploration of complex human emotions.

name: The Northman
review: This brutally violent, yet soaringly lyrical action epic is quite unlike anything captured on screen before.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an epic the likes of which we hardly see in Hollywood anymore, carefully curated by a master of the medium and packed with powerhouse performances.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers is still a major reason to stay interested in whatever movies are becoming.

name: The Northman
review: Not since Christopher Nolan’s Inception has a studio executive shown such balls of steel, or perhaps I should say boller av stal.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers embraces the filth, the mud, the moss, the viscera that were part and parcel of the day.

name: The Northman
review: [Eggers has] gone for broke with this epic arthouse blockbuster that mixes Hamlet and Gladiator through the lens of a hardcore metal album cover.

name: The Northman
review: It is disappointing that The Northman goes past what would have been a truly radical ending and extends itself for a zany climax that qualifies as Valhalla porn.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a brutal and violent film, felt in both its protagonist’s appetite for revenge and a world that seems to require suffering to continue turning.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman isn’t exactly a triumph, but with its many knockout moments, it represents a big step forward for the youngish director Robert Eggers, who for the first time has a big budget ($90 million) to work with.

name: The Northman
review: Hopefully it will be received by audiences for what I believe it is: a memorable, harrowing, cautionary nightmare.

name: The Northman
review: "The Northman" is winningly engaging at every turn and is best when it becomes an unabashed technical marvel. If it lacks the unpredictable looseness of “The Lighthouse” (Eggers’ best film) it offers clarity of vision with propulsive energy throughout.

name: The Northman
review: A breathtaking cinematic onslaught that savvily turns hellishness into movie heaven.

name: The Northman
review: A new oddity in which horror, revenge and Norse mythology go hand in hand in one of the most suggestive and visceral shows that we've been able to enjoy on the big screen in the last years.

name: The Northman
review: A ferocious revenge tale that's heavy on the blood and sweat but light on the tears.

name: The Northman
review: The most violent film I’ve ever seen to also feature a stellar fart joke.

name: The Northman
review: Gratuitously extenuating retina trips... A nightmare in its own right that portrays the tragedy and the end of a treacherous and ultra-masculinized world. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Beastly warriors, assassinated kings, and soothsaying seers look down upon a brutal landscape where the common person could be free one moment and conquered the next with little to say in how their fate will play out... it's best to be prepared for both.

name: The Northman
review: While The Northman isn't, in the end, as wholly perfect as Eggers debut The VVitch, he's still three-for-three and more ambitious each time he gets behind the camera.

name: The Northman
review: You can tell Eggers wanted a more elevated, visually-driven movie and I hope a director’s cut shows up someday.

name: The Northman
review: Made me watch The Princess Bride. It's not a coincidence. Like The Northman, it's about vengeance, duels, fights, colorful characters, a love story that destiny couldn't break... I go to bed thinking about it. Not The Northman. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Bobby Eggs might finally be starting to make movies that I can enjoy.

name: The Northman
review: Director and co-writer Robert Eggers is fascinated by the sounds and textures of the pagan and the primal.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an exceptionally crafted film with unconventional visuals and a filmmaking voice behind it that is powerfully unique.

name: The Northman
review: Blood runs, mud flies and bones crack — in crisp, percussive ways you’ve hopefully never heard in real life — throughout The Northman, a grand, gut-spilling Norse epic that feels at once earthily ancient and thrillingly modern.

name: The Northman
review: An authentic-looking and dream-filled world of a thousand years ago, sometimes beautiful and often brutal — but always fascinating.

name: The Northman
review: A savage and mesmerizing Viking saga like no other, Robert Eggers’ The Northman leaves your senses bludgeoned by the time the credits roll.

name: The Northman
review: A complete cinematic experience from the sound, score, acting, aesthetic, story, and directing is masterfully put together and executed.

name: The Northman
review: If you’re looking for a bold and nihilistic tale, you’ve come to – quite literally – the perfect place.

name: The Northman
review: It's brutal and violent, but there's something really beautiful about it.

name: The Northman
review: A magnificent Mise-en-scène, straddling the subtle and the brutally direct, in a narrative that fearlessly advances towards existential fatalism. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Nicole Kidman steals her scenes in this immaculately crafted tale of revenge. The action brings the heat, but the story may leave you cold.

name: The Northman
review: While the violence, blood, and mud won’t be for everyone, The Northman is a rewarding film for those who venture into its wilderness.

name: The Northman
review: A historical epic without the epic, a revenge plot with all the agency of revenge removed. What is left?  A two and a half hour plodding viking re-enactment.

name: The Northman
review: An all-too-rare modern example of an auteur-driven epic, The Northman demands to be seen on the biggest screen possible.

name: The Northman
review: This is not the sanitized, horned-helmet-wearing, Marvel comics Thor vision of Viking-hood. This is blood and mud and ice and pagan gods, and, reader, I am here for it.

name: The Northman
review: For all the nonsense The Northman trails in its wake, this is also a big, brawling and absolutely beautifully shot and scored film.

name: The Northman
review: There is no better word than “visceral”, in its broadest meaning, as a compact synthesis of everything that happens here. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Eggers builds it as a visceral sword-and-sandal epic that never loses its rhythm of action or sense of spectacularity in portraying barbaric times. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: In The Northman, Robert Eggers sheds the title of a horror director. He shows just how far his range can lead him, and it is exciting to see him lean into that.

name: The Northman
review: It’s not a bad movie in the least, it just feels like a lot of the Eggers special sauce got watered down, even if the brutality went way, way up.

name: The Northman
review: A Shakespearean nightmare centering on the obsession in which rage reigns supreme, but also its poetry... [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Eggers continues his seemingly meteoric ascent to world-class filmmaker status, expanding his toolkit to encompass a breathtakingly intense, attention-grabbing, single-take approach to scene and story creation unlike anything else.

name: The Northman
review: It’s a man’s man’s man’s man’s man’s world.

name: The Northman
review: A ferocious, epic tale that is beautifully brutal.

name: The Northman
review: With its naked sword fight on top of an exploding volcano, The Northman is rad...its blood-soaked tale of vengeance right in line with the great Icelandic sagas, an epic cinematic rendering of a story that has been told for at least a thousand years

name: The Northman
review: Visually it is darkly stunning, but storywise it is all over the place. Nicole Kidman is one film and Alexander Sharsgard is in another. Anna Taylor-Joy doesn't know where the heck she's supposed to be.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers' film didn't resonate with me after I left the theater. I never felt pulled into the orbit of Amleth's revenge close enough to really empathize with his plight. Gorgeously shot yet oddly hollow emotionally.

name: The Northman
review: I wanted to love Robert Eggers’s follow-up to The Witch and The Lighthouse, but maybe a big-budget Viking saga just isn’t the right fit for a wonderful weirdo like him?

name: The Northman
review:
An immersive event from its first seconds.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: This is a movie that doesn't shy away from emotions, it embraces them fully. The actors don't shy away from overacting, either, they revel in it, and this is both refreshing and entertaining.

name: The Northman
review: You genuinely feel how much his characters have faith in their gods and their folk tales as an extension of their everyday lives.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is brutal, bloody and violent, even a little gory at times. But its beautiful aesthetics displayed in every shot and every sequence place it above other movies with similar topics. [REVIEW IN SPANISH]

name: The Northman
review: Hyper-stylized… form triumphs over substance.

name: The Northman
review:
If we are fools in doubt, we can break the cycle of violence and revenge...or else leave behind a scorched Earth…where only losers can reside.
[Full Review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Epic, massive, and ostentatious. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Northman
review: Eggers' latest is wicked and delightfully weird without ever losing its grip on being a compelling character study engulfed in dazzling imagery. It’s his best film to date and the most confounding studio film of the year.

name: The Northman
review: ...an epically-misguided trainwreck that couldn’t possibly be less interesting or involving.

name: The Northman
review: What Eggers has done with this film is to develop an intense story of revenge, without hiding how barbaric and bloody and brutal life was at that time for these people. Full review in Spanish.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman falls short of being an epic film, but the mastery in composition of the film is noteworthy.

name: The Northman
review: Execution, performance, and art direction are all unparalleled, but the whole simply proves a solid familial melodrama in the end. They can’t all be "great."

name: The Northman
review: Eggers has embraced the wildness. creating a world of primal ritual where the spirit realm regularly interacts with the material one, and life is nasty, brutish, and short. Mercifully so.

name: The Northman
review: Predictable at every turn, but the operatic style of the effects leave you entranced - even chilled - for the entire film

name: The Northman
review: This is a film that gives what is wanted, without any regrets, through an environment that’s as angry as it is awesome.

name: The Northman
review: Drenched in testosterone, Northman is less concerned with reinventing the wheel with it's narrative built on the same mythology that inspired Hamlet, but rather with making you feel the visceral human anger and rage underpinning it's entire proceedings.

name: The Northman
review: A death-metal ode to honor, retribution and sacrifice that casts payback in a surprisingly, and thrillingly, positive light.

name: The Northman
review: It’s a good movie, yet also a little disappointing, because it’s not quite good enough to get away with being so little fun.

name: The Northman
review: he tale of Amleth (played wonderfully here by Alexander Skarsgård) could be called Shakespearian.

name: The Northman
review: If meant to be a provocative meditation on freewill and revenge, and a bloody, visceral, painstakingly-detailed spectacle  it maybe only delivers on the spectacle.

name: The Northman
review: A violent, visceral, and engrossing voyage.

name: The Northman
review: Exciting and sprawling, The Northman is almost a throwback to an earlier time of movie-making, with a story of redemption, presented in a fascinating and spellbinding way.

name: The Northman
review: A brutal, testosterone-fueled profusion of "Game of Thrones", 300, and Kill Bill

name: The Northman
review: Both beautiful and brutal, The Northman is a saga worth seeing.

name: The Northman
review: Skarsgård never once puffs his chest to assert his place as the hero, in complete alignment with Amleths sense of prophecy bestowed upon him at an early age.

name: The Northman
review: The storyline was simple yet effective. The landscape, the production values -- I was all in.

name: The Northman
review: Overall, despite the lavish treatment, the film is surprisingly dreary...

name: The Northman
review: It's the creative juices of Robert Eggers that gives The Northman its unique identity, from the impeccable detail and design to the wild flourishes and overindulgences.

name: The Northman
review: As we get to summer with a lot of polished blockbusters, this is something a bit grittier, and a bit more interesting.

name: The Northman
review: It's Hamlet with a lot more blood and a lot less clothes.

name: The Northman
review: Striking and compelling, for a film that toys with the concept of defying one's fate, the narrative does feel disappointingly stuck to a predetermined path, missing the surprises of Eggers' past films.

name: The Northman
review: What you’ll get is neither the bold weirdness of Eggers’s previous efforts in the critically-acclaimed margins nor a clean strike into the blockbuster mainstream.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is signature Eggers, with an almost maniacal dedication to period authenticity, big themes and some surrealist and supernatural touches.

name: The Northman
review: "The Northman" is a sweeping epic driven by blood and brutality, offering up a bleak and unrelenting take on the legend that inspired it. It might be great - hell, it almost certainly IS great - but sadly, it left me behind.

name: The Northman
review: This is teenager cinema par excellence, an opera of old-world mayhem fit for Beavis and Butthead.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers take a predictable revenge tale and makes it his own, especially early on. Definitely a slow-burn that builds effectively with assured, confident direction that also asks for patience. Visually, it's one of the best of the year.

name: The Northman
review: Its better than most of the current movies in its weight class but its less than that of which we know Eggers is capable.

name: The Northman
review: I would say it's one of my favorite movies of the year, but it's really one of my favorite experiences of the year.

name: The Northman
review: A rude, bloody, hyper-violent Viking saga like nothing you’ve ever seen.

name: The Northman
review: Through it all, Egger pulls excellent performances from his cast, maintains a steady forceful tone and drives the storylines to a cataclysmic ending. Try as you may, you can’t take your eyes off the screen.

name: The Northman
review: If anyone is victorious, it's the viewer of this immersive saga, who will emerge wobbly-legged, dazed and probably a little more appreciative of the relative tameness of modern life.

name: The Northman
review: Pure cinematic bliss. Great performances, a blood-soaked revenge story and Karin Blaschke' gorgeous shots - all amazing. Full review in Spanish

name: The Northman
review: To prepare for this role, Alexander Skarsgård has bulked up to superhero proportions. A mass of muscle with a weapon in each hand, hes a terrifying prospect.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers has a unique conception for the film, and he's guided his actors and technical team to bring it to the screen with extreme vividness.

name: The Northman
review: Will sure tickle those that have come to expect nothing less from a filmmaker unafraid to be bold and gorgeously weird.

name: The Northman
review: A sweeping tale of laser-focused retribution, woven into the alien tapestry of ancient Nordic myth.

name: The Northman
review: An incredibly well-made and well-acted film with some spectacular attention to detail, but the slight story and Skarsgard's stoic performance undermines Eggers' technical achievements.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers recreated, with obsessive accuracy, the world of the medievals in order to lower us into a myth that feels primordial and strange, as if it’s tapping into something in the back of our minds that we’ve always known but half forgotten.

name: The Northman
review: 'The Northman' may not be your kind of movie. Eggers does not seem to care whether or not the violence offends you. His purpose is to showcase a brutal time when life and death meant less than today.

name: The Northman
review: With his third feature film The Northman, Robert Eggers delivers brutal violence with gorgeous cinematography that entrances the viewer from beginning to end.

name: The Northman
review: A sublime technical feat with no emotional core. Eggers doesn't offer anything new or subversive to the Hamlet tale, including its discussion on masculinity. Skarsgård feels miscast (or perhaps Anleth is just boring?)

name: The Northman
review: It's all very bleak and cruel. And stylistically intoxicating.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers delivers exactly what youd expect from the filmmaker. However unlike his previous projects, THE NORTHMAN may be the most straightforward film, but it still veers into the weird realm.

name: The Northman
review: Where the movie goes south is in its narrative and characters. Beneath the twisting Scandinavian folklore is a simple and familiar revenge story that never gives us real reason to care.

name: The Northman
review: Its easy to get lost in time during those two hours.

name: The Northman
review: It certainly feels authentic -- there’s a sense of constant otherness to what we experience on the screen, yet with no sense of contrivance -- and that’s what matters. Everything feels strange, savage, implacably other.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a well-realized film full of action and an easy-to-understand story that might not be for everyone.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman isn’t exactly a triumph, but with its many knockout moments, it represents a big step forward for the youngish director Robert Eggers, who for the first time has a big budget to work with.

name: The Northman
review: The tamest Eggers film yet. Lacking in the depth department, but fantastic looking.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a sight to behold and the work of a director who has cemented his ability to transport audiences into worlds inhabited by the strange

name: The Northman
review: Eggers has quickly established himself as an auteur with a specific voice, and The Northman proves that having a bigger budget only enhances his strengths.

name: The Northman
review: It is a visually stunning, breathlessly violent, bone-crushingly metal take on Viking legend.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman doesnt offer anything new narratively, but it may be the most vicious movie to hit cinemas this year and its certainly one of the most beautifully shot.

name: The Northman
review: Iceland's hottest new club is "The Northman." Located at the Gates of Hel, this place has everything.

name: The Northman
review: You never would accuse Robert Eggers of being just another filmmaker.

name: The Northman
review: "When I was an hour into the film, I thought how Eggers could have just gone ahead and taken on Conan. But by the end, I was pulled into Eggers grander, more complex vision."

name: The Northman
review: Not unlike parts of Quentin Tarantino's "Inglourious Basterds," "Django Unchained," and the "Kill Bill" opus, the filmmakers build the tension with a nerve-rattling, deliberate pace and often make you think you're seeing something that is merely implied.

name: The Northman
review: Few mainstream films are allowed to be this bold, combining hallucinatory imagery with visceral action. Eggers tells a Nordic revenge story classic in its accessibility, but fueled with a style that refuses to water down the material.

name: The Northman
review: Genuinely amazing!

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is gripping cinema of the sort that we get too little of today, when too often a director’s vision is diluted by box office imperatives and the lure of four-quadrant appeal.

name: The Northman
review: Savage, supernatural and often silly, Robert Eggers' intense Nordic nightmare is filled with brawling, bloody brutality.

name: The Northman
review: A beautifully bloody empty shell.

name: The Northman
review: While other, nobler films often treat vengeance as something poisoned and futile, The Northman asks us: what if revenge was a satisfying, orgasmic triumph of sheer nirvana?

name: The Northman
review: Realism and mythology converge in this grandiose and brutal visual spectacle that explores a familiar territory in the revenge saga genre. Full Review in Spanish

name: The Northman
review: None of the players should be blamed for the uneven historical canvas or the unnecessary length of some scenes. Regardless, if anyone really is looking to be entertained by stories of this ilk, I suggest a 1958 spectacle simply called 'The Vikings.'

name: The Northman
review: This visually striking and brutally violent battle epic unspools a visceral exploration of primal instincts and toxic masculinity thats set in the 10th century but still resonates today.

name: The Northman
review: Visually, its absolutely stunning, but the sullen tone of "The Northman" makes it a bleak, one-note opus.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman" offers elaborately staged hatred and death. It was popular then; its popular now.

name: The Northman
review: "The Northman" follows the breadth of savagery in savage lands. There is no escaping the pall of terror it reveals. Eggers is a master at blending psychology and cinema. He plays mind games with his most assuredly cowering audience

name: The Northman
review: Visually gargantuan, thrumming with strange noise and even stranger visions, this is not even your grand-daddy's grand-daddy's Shakespeare - this is the bastard child of George Miller's Mad Max Fury Road and Darren Aronofsky's The Fountain

name: The Northman
review: Theres so much more below the surface that feels almost locked away behind a fortress of sparse dialogue and explanation. The Northman, sadly, isnt as inviting as it needs to be for viewers wanting to explore the world the film presents to them.

name: The Northman
review: It’s an impressive piece of time travel. Eggers succeeds in conjuring up a world governed exclusively by blood feuds and territorial imperatives. And Skarsgard, who helps initiate the production, makes a magnificently realised Amleth.

name: The Northman
review: Though the film narrowly avoids being a contrived blockbuster, it still is not refined enough to exhibit the kind of storytelling prowess that Eggers is capable of.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers has established himself as a master of mood and tone since he dragged us by our eyebrows with The VVitch. Here, he’s working with a much broader canvas and a sizable budget, and acquits himself astoundingly well.

name: The Northman
review: If you are fan of old-school epic tales of revenge, then The Northman is the movie for you. It’s a cinematic throwback that is a step forward for Eggers.

name: The Northman
review: At nearly two and a half hours, that may be a lot to ask for anyone hoping for a straightforward thriller, but for those willing to get invested, there’s significant treasure in store.

name: The Northman
review: Even though there's actually little going on here outside of a revenge plot, the movie has weight to it, something at stake. It feels like it was crafted by people with pride in their craft.

name: The Northman
review: That mix of detail-oriented realism and wild swings into mysticism and animalistic combat isn't just a budgetary flex; it lends The Northman a thematic gravity that keeps it from floating off into self-indulgent silliness.

name: The Northman
review: The Witch, The Lighthouse and The Northman all reflect their director’s penchant for exacting attention to detail and hard-earned madness.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a lot of things—bruising, rousing, and often entertaining—but it’s not particularly complex.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers delivers a bloody good Shakespearean revenge epic.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is not for the faint of heart. Its a haunting, bold, and brutal Viking epic.

name: The Northman
review: It holds our attention with unforgettable visuals and the sheer, raw audacity of its premise.

name: The Northman
review: Think you know what a Viking is? You have no idea.

name: The Northman
review: For all its physicality, The Northman (like Eggers’ other tales) hinges on emotion and superstition.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an epic saga of revenge...unflinchingly realistic, deliberately paced and leaves you with your breath taken and your mind expanded.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers makes "The Northman" as crafty as an art film, as brutal as a slasher flick - two-plus hours of arthouse savagery.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman might be Eggers at his most traditional, yet its his best feature, which is saying a lot because hes created nothing but bangers. It makes me wanna run to Iceland and grow a beard and abs.

name: The Northman
review: A bloody, muddy, beautiful and sometimes surreal vision of Norse myth.

name: The Northman
review: Represents a successful transition to the higher-budget echelon for its director

name: The Northman
review: The Northman has a limited payoff after two hours, and not even an unexpected finale saves it from averageness.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers exhumes the bones of a primal myth and arranges them in spectacular fashion, no doubt. But just as The Northman itself is interested in scrying meaning from old ways, you'll want to find something to take away here.

name: The Northman
review: An intense, brutal, and captivating two-plus hours of watching bad people pay for their past deeds. Yes, revenge is cold, but in "The Northman," it arrives in a top-notch artistic package.

name: The Northman
review: Worth the watch for the intense, authentic period setting and grittygorgeous depiction of a legendary revenge story. Though the film takes itself a bit too seriously. As is often the case, Anya Taylor-Joy is the best thing about it.

name: The Northman
review: Not all of The Northman works -- some of it’s muddled visually and linguistically, and at turns it gets a bit too feral for its own good -- but the immersion and mood makes for a mesmerizing and haunting odyssey.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman, whether you approach it as legitimate folklore or as a testosterone-fueled Saturday-afternoon lark, speaks to the 10-year-old boy in all of us, with a loud and mighty Viking burp.

name: The Northman
review: Fire and brimstone meet rot and decay, yet theres ambition afoot here. Eggers deserves a great deal of the credit for crafting another startling, big screen vision.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers’ miscast, moody, turn-of-the-10th-century action adventure seems late to the Norse feast despite, or perhaps because of, its overserious intentions.

name: The Northman
review: The film feels oddly flat, mitigated as it is by the cross purposes of its creator and the studio that backed it.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman envelopes its conventional swords-and-sandals plot with a vibe and aesthetic that is both unhinged and seductive.

name: The Northman
review: More than a little over the top, this piece of bloody eye candy from ancient Viking life is a tasty, visually intoxicating  guilty pleasure.

name: The Northman
review: “The Northman” is authentic atavistic cinema, a bulletin from the before times fashioned by one of the great natural filmmakers of the present.

name: The Northman
review: Its most notable quality is the way it refuses to bend its characters to the present, preferring instead to make them as alien in their perspective as possible.

name: The Northman
review: Forget fire and ice (though there is that, too); revel instead in arterial spray. What more could you ask for? Its AD 895, and times are tough.

name: The Northman
review: A sensory triumph more than it is an emotional one, this is nonetheless an enthralling endeavor, everything building to a crushing finale of senseless masculine bravado thats as gut-wrenchingly beautiful as it is tragically heartbreaking.

name: The Northman
review: Psychological probing is squashed, like many onscreen skulls. It all leads to a slog of a saga of slaughter.

name: The Northman
review: Lets get to why youre really here: Yes, Willem Dafoe does appear in both a Viking-era dog costume AND in his underpants AND as a disembodied head. Its all true.

name: The Northman
review: Its a rarity in todays IP-saturated cinematic climate that a director like Eggers is permitted to take this wild a swing, and even rarer that their major studio debut feels so of a piece with their earlier works.

name: The Northman
review: The emotional connection meanders, but the production and Skarsgard's physical performance fly sky-high.

name: The Northman
review: It offers us almost no quarter, and asks none of us. For that, it has to be respected. Not many big-budget period movies are this unwilling to throw a sop to modern attitudes.

name: The Northman
review: If youre looking for an unapologetically bloody and masculine movie with just a dash of eerie energy to it, youll probably dig The Northman.

name: The Northman
review: His attempt to juxtapose ambition with cinematic bloodlust is not always successful, but when it works, the savagery on display can be breathtaking.

name: The Northman
review: A payback tale for the ages.

name: The Northman
review: Working for the first time with a blockbuster-scaled budget, Eggers can give full range to his feverishly inventive imagination, and the result is often hypnotic...

name: The Northman
review: Instead of the roots of Shakespeare’s play, “The Northman” merely serves up its raw material both half-baked and overcooked.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers manages to infuse this straightforward tale with plenty of his unique sensibilities.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman goes beyond just being another story about Viking savagery and delivers a film that is steeped in lore, rituals, and prophecies. Its brutal yet beautiful with ferocious action sequences paired with stunning visuals.

name: The Northman
review: A brutal film made for adults that shows us the maturation of an important cinematic voice.

name: The Northman
review: For all its relentless fury and fire, "The Northman" has a remote iciness that hampers emotional investment in the Shakespearean heroes and villains. That said, its vast medieval-era storytelling is stunning in its vivid and realistic presentation.

name: The Northman
review: If you want to see a cinematic spectacle of Viking violence and warrior masculinity - this is going to be for you!

name: The Northman
review: Director Robert Eggers hot-stamps medieval suffering into a titanic work of art.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers serves up a Viking Hamlet. It wasn't as unhinged as we were hoping for, the plot is echoic, and many characters (particularly the female ones) lacked dimension. There's however justtt enough going for the film for it to have been watchable for us.

name: The Northman
review: Its a film that sears itself into the senses via nightmares glimpsed in the hellish half-light.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman misses the thematic depth of Eggers first two films, but the talent on display is unmistakable and cements Eggers as a force of nature as mercurial and frightening as Amleths rage.

name: The Northman
review: A tumultuous, graphically gorgeous entertainment for our time as well as an ineffably somber meditation on our species’ seemingly inexhaustible reservoir of savagery.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman makes you realize that, perhaps, an entire life grieving what you lost can truly stop you from what you can gain. diandrareviews

name: The Northman
review: Alexander Skarsgård slays as a prince dishing out ice-cold vengeance in the musclebound, medieval epic "The Northman."

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an intense, nail biter that is going to leave a lasting mark on the epic period drama. With gorgeous cinematography and phenomenal performances from Skarsgard, Taylor-Joy, and Kidman, this is a film you should see in theaters.

name: The Northman
review: We rarely get movies like this anymore, with an emerging auteur given the time and money to craft the big-budget film that he wants to make. The fact that The Northman is as good as it is almost feels like a bonus.

name: The Northman
review: Its certainly a spectacle, for all its slower moments, but a largely effective and successful spectacle: by the time the credits roll, its hard not to be utterly swept away by it.

name: The Northman
review: Quite possibly the first truly great movie of 2022. It might even be the first truly great movie we’ve gotten in a couple of years.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers indulges both the grand folklore of the Viking age and the commonplace reality that shaped it, successfully creating an odyssey that feels grounded in the actual demands of civilization.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers does not care if the moviegoing public comes away having learned about themselves or achieved some measure of catharsis. The film serves the internal needs of its protagonist, nothing more. The conceit is admirably single-minded.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman, Robert Eggers’ biggest and most expansive (and expensive) feature to date, is also his best so far.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers' commitment to verisimilitude means that he conveys every sweaty, grimy, bloody experience of the characters in vivid detail.

name: The Northman
review: A visually enthralling evocation of a distant world, blending history and myth in a composite awash in bloodshed and butchery yet strangely intoxicating even in its excesses...Yet dramatically it leaves something to be desired.

name: The Northman
review: Director/co-writer Robert Eggers has sought to make the definitive Viking movie, and while the film issues a guttural cry for theatrical viewing, it is built around such a basic revenge plot as to blunt those simple charms.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers presents misshapen children who grow to be fearsome beasts, these simple tales told through cruelty and magic that resonate regardless of the setting. Eggers is more comfortable shaping and molding folklore and mythologies with dark symbolism.

name: The Northman
review: For the first time, it feels like Eggers is relying on pagan pageant more than psychology to drive the movie, and the result is a seance that doesn’t quite spellbind, despite a sincere effort to.

name: The Northman
review: What’s perhaps most impressive about “The Northman” is that it hurtles through 136 minutes of musclebound, shaggy-maned mayhem without a whisper of camp or a wink of irony.

name: The Northman
review: "Northman" is relentlessly brutal, but the violence feels appropriate for a world in which there aren't any rules and where "social change" comes at the sharpened edge of an ax.

name: The Northman
review: There is swordplay, soap opera style revenge, surprising nudity, a howling ritual and a fight on an active volcano. But it can be viewed as a blood and guts old fashioned adventure through the filter of Robert Eggers. Why wasn't Nick Cage in this movie?!?

name: The Northman
review: A hell of a movie and youre unlikely to see utter weirdness on such a grand scale anywhere else.

name: The Northman
review: So many movies about Vikings never convince us that we’re watching anything but actors dressed like Vikings. This one’s chanting in Old Norse and Old Ukrainian makes the film far more persuasive.

name: The Northman
review: It's a brawny, lusty, bloody epic of big emotions and in-your-face intensity, a movie that happens TO you as you're watching it, both visually and aurally.

name: The Northman
review: Hypocrisy is by no means fatal, but despite a glorious climactic duel on a lava-drenched volcano, The Northman leaves weary familiarity in its wake.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an excellent, unflinching, and immersive vision from filmmaker Robert Eggers.

name: The Northman
review: "The Northman" feels like the culmination of Eggers' powers as a writer and director, taking his knack for creating moody atmosphere and his gift for words and staging them on an epic canvas.

name: The Northman
review: ...made with blistering cinematic vision.

name: The Northman
review: Visually stunning and painstakingly choreographed, The Northman perfectly measures up to its epic expectations.

name: The Northman
review: With his remarkable attention to folkloric detail, filmmaker Robert Eggers takes on Viking mythology in this bloodthirsty meditation on revenge.

name: The Northman
review: Once ... the underlying ideas about revenge come into sharper focus, the filmmakers don't develop those...

name: The Northman
review: If this is how we get our big screen Sword & Sorcery revival, with inward seeking filmmakers taking a stab at arguably the most externally pleasurable genre, sign me up.

name: The Northman
review: The mood, the detail and the look of this production is extraordinary. And the fiery showdown at the end is incomparable.

name: The Northman
review: A wild and trippy ride, big, mythic, violent, and wonderful. Eggers once again proves that hes not only a filmmaker with his own crazy and specific vision, but that he has the skills to pull it off.

name: The Northman
review: Its a familiar story of payback, violent, visceral and vengeance-filled, but Robert Eggers singular vision, and fondness for ancient symbolism and psychedelia, make it a unique experience.

name: The Northman
review: Hypnotic visuals with a bland story.

name: The Northman
review: As is the case with Eggers, expect a fair amount of the supernatural and surreal to seep in here and there, but not enough to outweigh the meticulously crafted period realism.

name: The Northman
review: A monumentally bonkers, blood-smeared battering ram of Old World barbarism.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers distinct vision will thrill some, offend others, but ultimately offer an experience you wont soon forget.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers' The Northman is an extraordinary feat of cinema – but it's also a bloody, mournful, violent tale of vengeance that is never simply academic, but visceral, sensual, emotional, and epic.

name: The Northman
review: As the central revenge plot proved too familiar even from this most distinctive of directors, I found myself only able to appreciate it in terms of its filmmaking craft.

name: The Northman
review: “The Northman” lavishly rewards fans of the swords-and-vandals genre, even if it leaves the rest of us in bludgeoned, bemused awe.

name: The Northman
review: “The Northman” fills out its widescreen canvas, carefully and meticulously.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an extravagant and unshackled cinematic experience with a vibe akin to a rock opera performed at the foot of an active volcano.

name: The Northman
review: a deft blend of arthouse flick and historical drama, dripping with atmosphere and anchored by strong performances and superb direction.

name: The Northman
review: It doesn't just cut to the bone, it tears apart flesh, splatters blood in our faces and spits in our eye.

name: The Northman
review: More of Olgas strong character & less of the bellicose brutality of the male ones wouldve helped Eggers in his critique of toxic masculinity. Instead, his savaging of machismo is dampened by all the savagery he insists on splattering across the screen.

name: The Northman
review: Sheer fun ride into darkness

name: The Northman
review: Eggers’s action sequences are swift and brutal, filled with the crunch of life extinguished and tossed into the bone pile of time. Skarsgård, hulking and seething, is a fine vessel for the film’s opulent menace.

name: The Northman
review: Still and all, theres something missing here. While we may understand everyones intention, theres no emotional connection with any of them.

name: The Northman
review: Another killer entry in the filmography of a storyteller who cannot be contained.

name: The Northman
review: “The Northman” is both a dazzling display of film craft and a sly retooling of genre, a movie that delights in fulfilling certain conventions while turning others on their artfully severed heads.

name: The Northman
review: Equal parts beautiful and desolate like a part of Icelands own volcanic countryside, iThe Northmani is auteur Robert Eggers most straightforward film, making up in style what it gives up in the complexity of his previous films.

name: The Northman
review: This movie is so visceral you can feel it reverberating inside your body, which is exactly what makes it so delightful.

name: The Northman
review: An achievement for the helmer, but he's easily distracted here, working tirelessly to manufacture an immersive viewing event, leaving dramatic power limited.

name: The Northman
review: As unusual and occasionally off-putting as The Lighthouse was, it was but a warning shot for the persistent madness of The Northman, a film designed to maintain a sense of uncanny threat in every frame.

name: The Northman
review: This is cinematic storytelling at its finest. Drawing from Norse and Icelandic myths, it's also unmistakably Shakespearean in theme. While it's magical, mystical and symbolic, it's not confusing. I admire and appreciate that.

name: The Northman
review: The secret to The Northman's success is simple: it delivers everything you could want from a Viking movie.

name: The Northman
review: Skarsgård has thrown himself into Eggers' latest with full force, and it shows: not only does he look incredible, but he's operating at the absolute peak of his abilities with a performance that will certainly be among the highlights of his career.

name: The Northman
review: Thanks to intensely committed performances, the keen lensing of cinematographer Jarin Blaschke and clear motivations that drive the plot along like a humming V8 engine, The Northman does revenge as well as anyone could.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a cinematic experience that could only come from Robert Eggers.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers has solidified his legacy as a wonderful director and there are no doubts, he will be making movies, possibly even Oscar worthy ones, for many years to come.

name: The Northman
review: An inert bore stricken by leaden direction by Robert Eggers who, despite an obviously huge budget, renders the film with absolutely no sense of adventure or excitement.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman doesn't so much adopt the plot of Hamlet as dig beneath it to unearth the ur-story that predates Shakespeare by centuries. So while the tale's broad strokes are familiar, its particulars can vary in intriguing ways.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman takes viewers on a magnificent adventure.

name: The Northman
review: A visually stunning, but vapid, tedious and exhausting video game.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers is a visual master.

name: The Northman
review: It is melodrama, and murder and mayhem and witchcraft; its everything Robert Eggers does best on the biggest scale, and its his best film yet.

name: The Northman
review: THE NORTHMAN is how epics should be done.

name: The Northman
review: Around the sturdy mythic pillars of regicide-slash-fratricide and seething vengeance, Eggers and Sjón have fashioned an almost-original creation, a mud-and-gore-slicked work of historical verisimilitude spiked with fly agaric and raging testosterone.

name: The Northman
review: 'The Northman' is a film that, in relation to subject matter, budget and lack of an IP, should not exist in 2022. Warts and all, it's a miracle of a movie.

name: The Northman
review: Once you settle in for the ride and commit yourself to whatever hellish vision Eggers cultivates, "The Northman" doesn't just subvert expectations, it obliterates them.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers doesnt compromise on the brutality and scale of his latest feature, creating a visually compelling and absorbing thriller. Combined with Skarsgårds powerful performance, The Northman cements a welcome return to the cinematic historical epic.

name: The Northman
review: Gritty, bloody, visceral and front-loaded with a need for vengeance, the latest work from writerdirector Robert Eggers (The Witch, The Lighthouse) is so immersive and authentic, you'll feel the muck between your toes and every blow across your body.

name: The Northman
review: A guttural, primal grunt of a movie that is all raging testosterone and incendiary machismo. And I loved nearly every minute of it.

name: The Northman
review: THE NORTHMAN is a wild ride. Its dark, violent, gory and very entertaining.

name: The Northman
review: At two hours and sixteen minutes, THE NORTHMAN moves quickly. I could not take my eyes off the screen.

name: The Northman
review: This is a ghastly, grisly, ultra violent film that is hard to watch, but also hard to look away from this visually striking take on ancient Viking lore.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is well-acted, directed, and undeniably thrilling.  Alexander Skarsgård cuts a swath of bloody vengeance in a ferocious Viking epic. The film vividly combines a Hamlet-esque narrative with Scandinavian history and mythology.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers has what you might call a singular vision. Here, hes made a film that feels like it was beamed directly from the long-dead skull of a Nordic bard.

name: The Northman
review: It might not be subtle, it might not even be particularly deep, but it sure is spectacular.

name: The Northman
review: Despite efforts from the Valkyries and Odin’s ravens, this Viking action art piece is fettered to the ground by the demands of the studio gods.

name: The Northman
review: Once again, I can’t quite see what all the excitement is about, as the American director combines a sub-Shakespearean tale of murder and revenge with Viking mythology, shamanistic ritual and a huge amount of bloody Dark Ages violence.

name: The Northman
review: '...a mighty, nasty-ass epic of treachery, pagan horror and bloody revenge...'

name: The Northman
review: 300 meets Midsommar, and probably the most realistic Viking movie to date. Part ancient myth, part Shakespeare, part History Channel. This might not be a "fun" movie but it's a visceral experience worthy of the big screen - and your time.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers' blistering epic 'The Northman' is a raw, bloody, and brutal Viking revenge saga that splatters blood and brilliance on every inch of its canvas.

name: The Northman
review: The Northmans unrelenting blood-soaked story plays out against a brooding, hostile landscape that Eggers makes full use of.

name: The Northman
review: It’s as ambitious as it is preposterous and, at times, ponderous – filled with garbled epithets about vengeance and fate that are whispered, muttered, or blood-curdlingly yelled.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman, with its vicious blend of blood and ice, feels like the crowning achievement for one of the most idiosyncratic and unique filmmakers working in Hollywood today.

name: The Northman
review: A testosterone burst that serves as a visceral and audiovisually stunning psychological study of the toxic macho hero figure... Full Review in Spanish

name: The Northman
review: Brutally violent but artistically stunning, The Northman brings harsh realism and dreamy mythology to this Viking story that inspired William Shakespeare's Hamlet ... The end result is an immersive cinematic experience that is both menacing and magical.

name: The Northman
review: It is two hours and fifteen minutes of violent, animalistic ritual, a testosterone-fueled orgy of masculinity, a film so dark, dirty, raw, and hardcore it makes The Revenant look like Jane Austen.

name: The Northman
review: Coming as a follow-up to The Witch and The Lighthouse, this 90 million effort packs all of that budget on screen while still holding onto the off-the-wall qualities that make Eggers a standout genre filmmaker.

name: The Northman
review: Director Robert Eggers' blood-soaked Viking epic is equal parts brutal and breathtaking, a truly immersive cinematic experience that makes the almost-140-minute runtime pass in the blink of an eye.

name: The Northman
review: It’s rather ripe for parodying, though you can’t deny the film’s power and scale as well as the beauty and strangeness of the landscape, in turn green and lush and black and icy.

name: The Northman
review: Although neither as moody nor wacky as his first two films, it’s another masterful achievement from one of the English language’s most exciting contemporary arthouse filmmakers.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is everything we expect from director Robert Eggers  dark, surreal, atmospheric with a poetic intimacy for character building.

name: The Northman
review: Metal as hell! An arthouse 'Conan the Barbarian' that makes 'Game of Thrones' look like 'Snow White'

name: The Northman
review: A cinematic wonder of Viking violence and old-school melodramatic barbarity, The Northman is an unrelenting and gruesome historic epic that showcases an absolutely berserk performance from Alexander Skarsgård.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is magical, mystical and relentlessly masculine, but also, in places, perhaps a little too much.

name: The Northman
review: For all its virtues The Northman is an unrelentingly bleak spectacle, nobody's idea of a fun night out.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers delivers a masterful film about the power of myths to inform our own lives.

name: The Northman
review: You can always count on things to get weird with Eggers, but that doesn’t necessarily mean they get interesting.

name: The Northman
review: “The Northman” is at once overwhelming and curiously uninvolving.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers needs to allow some moments of quiet so we can get to know the characters and feel invested in their journeys. This was too much of everything

name: The Northman
review: "Bloody but brilliant medieval vengeance tale."

name: The Northman
review: What’s so amazing and essential about The Northman is how populist and accessible it is to any viewer who buys a ticket while Eggers also retains so much of what makes him such a unique and interesting director.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers' take on the Vikings is something to behold and marvel at.

name: The Northman
