review: Eggers is a skilful and imaginative director, and his films achieve almost unbearable levels of intensity: The Northman is a brilliantly realised saga that burrows its way to the heart of the Viking sensibility.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is one of the most visceral cinematic experiences for some time. A bold, bloody & violent tale of vengeance & fate, its a captivating but trippy journey which wont work for everyone.

name: The Northman
review: Our adoration of The Northman has little to do with the level of violence on screen... and more to do with the craft, scope and skill that went into creating the first great blockbuster of the year.

name: The Northman
review: The stakes though inviting as they may seem are underwrought. And while that may be their very purpose on the page, in the film the absence of engaging reasons to stay invested undermines the entirety of the saga Eggers seeks to tell.

name: The Northman
review: One of the most breathtakingly nuts movies in recent years, a died-in-the-wool Viking revenge epic that feels every bit like a visionary has been given money to burn for the first time in his life, and is going to take full advantage of it.

name: The Northman
review: Never compromising his unique style, Eggers crafts a visceral Viking epic with The Northman. Eggerss spellbinding blend of blockbuster and art house gives us a haunting experience that will be celebrated amongst the upper echelon of cinema in 2022.

name: The Northman
review: Praise the Norse gods, for not only is The Northman an exhilarating revenge saga that outdoes most modern blockbusters when it comes to action sequence staging and immersive sound design, but Eggers’ penchant for the strange remains fully intact.

name: The Northman
review: The director of 'The Witch' made a Norwegian black metal Hamlet starring Alexander Skarsgard as an angry Viking. That's it, that's the review.

name: The Northman
review: The film's extreme violence, ambiguous moral stance and delve into supernatural folklore might alienate certain viewers, but this ranks alongside other great revenge epics such as Gladiator in terms of sheer excitement and spectacle.

name: The Northman
review: With viciousness relegated to its margins, it often feels neutered and bloodless, but still ends up on the right side of entertaining thanks to its pulsating music and measured performances.

name: The Northman
review: The beauty of this film isnt the story but the visual feast for the eyes, the direction, cinematography, editing and the world created by the co-writer and director, Robert Eggers.

name: The Northman
review: As I think about it, this Hamlet-clone needs something more, like a heart and soul. "The Northman" has neither. Brutal battles alone do not make an epic. It takes a good story, too.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers commitment to maintaining period accuracy and influences makes for a visual feast but binds it narratively. The mesmerizing style and mysticism ensure its deeply engrossing.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers treats the big screen reverently, like the last one he will ever get to make a film for.

name: The Northman
review: A simple story told with unrelenting force, The Northman soars thanks to its staggering visuals, thundering score and with iconic central performance.

name: The Northman
review: What Eggers has delivered is a relatively epic and unsurprisingly ambitious exercise thats loaded with some tremendous imagery, his trademark detail, and grisly violence, yet somehow feels unduly restrained.

name: The Northman
review: A revenge thriller with an elevated horror heart and an anthropologists eye for detail and ritual. But despite the layered imagination that went into recreating this ancient world, it is still the most conventional film yet from Eggers.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers’ immersive approach and stylistic flair creates one wild, applause-worthy combat scene after another, reminding viewers why he’s one of the most unique visual artists working today.

name: The Northman
review: For the most part it’s an enthralling immersion in a forbidding time and place, enhanced by an immoderately attractive cast and saddled only by a dramatic sameness that settles in after a while and gradually diminishes the film’s impact.

name: The Northman
review: while the films craft is exemplary and its drama brutal, "The Northman" is not as memorable a film as Eggers prior two.  This critic recalls Nicolas Winding Refn's 2009 "Valhalla Rising" more fondly.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman delivers a brutal and Shakespearean epic, continuing to prove Robert Eggers is one of the best directors in the business.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is the kind of movie that breaks down that revenge-driven narrative and weaves it into a story of a lost boy trying to find answers only to be confronted with a different reality than he wanted to believe.

name: The Northman
review: Its revenge-odyssey narrative operates along such a primal wavelength one could easily imagine Eggers discovering it inscribed on a cave wall.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman, is a grim masterwork of guttural vengeance.

name: The Northman
review: Never less than epic, never less than the new benchmark in Viking stories put on film.

name: The Northman
review: The most metal adaptation of 'Hamlet' you're ever likely to see.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is epic, hypnotising and compelling.

name: The Northman
review: Beneath the runes and visions, it's a tale as old as Game of Thrones, and as simple as a story told around a campfire: a ride of the Valkyries spelled out in gore and popcorn.

name: The Northman
review: This is intimate, culturally rich storytelling on a brutally epic scale.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers continues to cement himself among the greats with a fierce Viking tale of vengeance. It's a good mix of visual thunder and blood-soaked violence. Skarsgard's tank-like stature drives the narrative beautifully. Kidman surprises....big time.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is raw, savage and uncompromising. It's a ruthless revenge story set during the Viking Age, and Alexander Skarsgård is a beast of a man.

name: The Northman
review: A brutal revenge tale that straddles the line between arthouse and mainstream entertainment.

name: The Northman
review: You can almost taste the sweat and the salt and and the fire, grounding the experience in the tangible, but hovering just on the edge of every frame is the sense that there might be something greater at work.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman can’t help but feel like a wild stallion being reluctantly reined in. For all its screaming and grunting, the film is subdued; a retold revenge story with strong pillars but no inner life.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers' deep dive into VikingNorse culture and religion is fascinating. However, an unsatisfying and routine tale of murder and revenge that surprises no one is only saved by the Hannibal-esque moments of violence.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers's execution feels hollow, capturing the horror but undercutting the heart. So in the end, the blows  while intense and gory  don't hit as hard as I'd have hoped.

name: The Northman
review: A delightfully offbeat epic. No guts, no glory!

name: The Northman
review: A truly distinctive epic, blending brutal violence, powerhouse performances and otherworldly imagery into its volcanic rampage of revenge. Unmissable.

name: The Northman
review: The movie has much to recommend it — a powerful cast, certainly, and a different sort of performance from Nicole Kidman, among other things — but it’s a lot.

name: The Northman
review: Not a movie for those who dont consider themselves at least slightly adventurous and open-minded.

name: The Northman
review: A few centuries of exposure to the formal theatrical tragedies have prepared us for the storys inevitable narrative arcs. But the richness of Eggerss historical ventriloquism ensures there is never a dull moment.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is an exhilarating, unrelenting, authentically barbaric tale of rage and romance with the performance of a lifetime from Alexander Skarsgård

name: The Northman
review: Eggers stages much of it in painterly fashion, including a battle royale set in a flaming landscape that captures both the raw power of nature and the barbaric fury of the men fighting in its lap.

name: The Northman
review: A hulking, bloody Skarsgard makes quite an engrossing action hero. He performs some physical feats in single takes that either are impressively practiced or seamlessly enhanced with visual effects. That you can't tell which makes the action compelling.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers brand of psychological shock is bolder here than his prior works and potent in bursts, but barely works on boldness alone.

name: The Northman
review: Theres mild satisfaction to be found in some of the destructive confrontations, but plenty of dawdling via bewildering rites and rituals that eat up screentime, sapping opportunities for more thrilling Viking exploits.

name: The Northman
review: Genuinely thrilling from start to finish.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers blood-soaked Viking epic isnt just the film of the year so far  its a widescreen rallying cry for cinema in the age of streaming

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a brooding, fierce revenge flick and a bold, modern epic made by a unique visionary storyteller that simultaneously challenges and entertains.

name: The Northman
review: The best kind of multi-quadrant movie: Without abandoning his arthouse credentials, Eggers has made a rousingly rough, extreme action saga that has the potential of attracting the kind of viewers who might have found his previous work impenetrable.

name: The Northman
review: Rumours of recuts and difficult testing haven’t reduced its essence: like Skarsgård’s brawny frame, it stands more than tall enough at 137 minutes. It comes at you with whopping set-pieces and a ragged, reckless sense of structure.

name: The Northman
review: It feels compromised, but the great stuff outweighs the not-so-great stuff. To see or not to see? If that is the question, the answer is: see it.

name: The Northman
review: A one-note fiasco and a foam-flecked depiction of cartoon machismo from a gifted film-maker who should have known better.

name: The Northman
review: It’s ultimately rather dull and hardly any fun...

name: The Northman
review: An incredible achievement, amplifying a blood-soaked adventure epic in the haunting specters of witchcraft and folklore that will still challenge viewers without leaving them fully out in the cold.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a feast of visuals and balanced storytelling. It considers Norse storytelling and history that shows Eggers' prowess as both a director and a writer.

name: The Northman
review: Eggers fans, and the cinematically curious, who will come away dazed, and sometimes dazzled.

name: The Northman
review: With The Northman, we encounter the brilliant execution of a fairly demented vision. To see it is to think, simultaneously, “Wow” and “What were they thinking?!”

name: The Northman
review: All hail an egg-head whose non-macho masterpiece is hopefully about to set the world on fire.

name: The Northman
review: A work of bold imagination, not another offshoot of a familiar IP. That alone deserves respect.

name: The Northman
review: Uncompromisingly grim and savage.

name: The Northman
review: I call upon Odin: may The Northman make a billion dollars.

name: The Northman
review: In a movie era that’s been defined by compromise, The Northman rides into theaters with the fury of a valkyrie — it’s the rare studio epic that would sooner die than submit to modern precepts of how it should be told.

name: The Northman
review: Although the film ends up as a shallow rumination on revenge and single-minded dominance, it’s hard to beat as spectacle. In terms of making history exciting and engrossing, The Northman is about as titillating as gateway drugs get.

name: The Northman
review: The definitive Viking epic, The Northman is a brilliant melding of arthouse and blockbuster. A stone-cold masterpiece.

name: The Northman
review: With a strong sense of authenticity and purpose, The Northman is designed to unnerve and repel. In a wide release landscape of easy-to-please, vaporous entertainment, such feats should be celebrated.

name: The Northman
review: It’s entirely outrageous, with some epic visions of the flaring cosmos. I couldn’t look away.

name: The Northman
review: The Northman is a mystical waking nightmare of drama, adventure, and horror that combine into something truly dark, bewitching, and visceral.

name: The Northman
review: There are few filmmakers that can make the leap from smaller, insular stories into large-scale epics, but with The Northman, Eggers has proved that his style and substance can remain intact, regardless of the size of the story.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers manages to deliver a nightmarish epic of blood and busted skulls, fully making good on its premise, but stumbles when it attempts to deviate too far from its core concept.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers spins a brutal Viking epic with a dash of eerie Shakespearean tragedy.

name: The Northman
review: Performance, setting, look, and sound come together to create an engaging fantasy that will wow. With meticulously choreographed fight sequences and a distinct aesthetic, The Northman succeeds where other stories like 2007's Beowulf and 2006's 300 fail.

name: The Northman
review: The film has a lot going for it, fantastic battle scenes & mysticism that elevates the protagonist's journey, but it is lacking in overall character.

name: The Northman
review: Your jaw is so often left gaping in awe from its stunning cinematography and in terror from its ferocity to the point you might just resign yourself to keeping it open for the duration of the film.

name: The Northman
review: The powerful and moving new film by co-writer and director Robert Eggers is a story you've seen before, but you've never seen it like this.

name: The Northman
review: In making the violent Viking epic The Northman, Robert Eggers has found a way to craft a revenge tale that audiences will go for, while not compromising his style.

name: The Northman
review: A staggering feat of visceral filmmaking, The Northman, like Eggers' previous films, warrants profound analysis while still delivering a high-octane action odyssey.

name: The Northman
review: While the canvas of Robert Eggers latest is considerably broader than that of The Witch and the Lighthouse, it feels as if its psychological chaos hasn't expanded accordingly.

name: The Northman
review: Robert Eggers delivers big yet again. The entire ensemble sizzles in this ferocious revenge tale that envelopes you in the 10th Century and ensures you feel every ounce of the story's passion and aggression via the expertly crafted camerawork.

name: Prey
review: I loved Prey. I think it’s the best summer “blockbuster” of the year.

name: Prey
review: The new installment in the Predator franchise risked a lot by changing its name to Prey, but the stellar film wound up earning it wholeheartedly.

name: Prey
review: The Predator franchise has new life thanks to Prey. The film works on a multitude of levels as a perfect prequel, monster movie, sci-fi flick, a badass heroine story, and win for Native representation and portrayals.

name: Prey
review: With a stunning debut in the Hulu original film Prey, Amber Midthunder proved herself as a sci-fi/action star to watch.

name: Prey
review: Prey makes for a pragmatic prequel to Predator, but not a pulsating entry to reinvigorate the franchise.

name: Prey
review: Questions that Predator raised all those years ago — Who is the invader? Whose land is being invaded? — rebound with special resonance in Prey.

name: Prey
review: Prey critiques the assumption that survival requires dominance.

name: Prey
review: Prey reinvigorates and revitalizes the predator legacy, going back in time to show how the franchise still has a future.

name: Prey
review: This was a very solid new addition to a franchise that is been mediocre at best. Great leading performance by Ms. Midthunder.

name: Prey
review: It's a tight hour and a half that doesn't lag. Very solid performance and phenomenal action scenes. Love the focus on an authentic cast!

name: Prey
review: It's gritty and muddy yet still beautiful and invigorating, it's packed with seriously tense action, and it's all about using cunning tactics and the environment around you to outwit and outsmart a vicious Predator warrior...

name: Prey
review: Dan Trachtenberg didn’t need to prove anything after directing certified masterpiece 10 Cloverfield Lane as his first feature, but this is a quite good, generously gory Predator flick.

name: Prey
review: A prequel to the Predator franchise, this taut and thrilling is atmospheric and exceptionally well-told.

name: Prey
review: Amber Midthunder is the best thing to happen to this franchise since Topher Grace bought it in Predators, and while it's probably too much to hope for a follow-up, she and Trachtenberg have given us the best Predator since the original.

name: Prey
review: I’m not sure I can recommend Prey enough. It’s visually beautiful, full of layered stories and environments and it has a completely badass female lead that is even tougher than maybe even Dutch, himself.

name: Prey
review: “Prey” is one sci-fi opus worth tracking down.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a worthy sequel to McTiernan’s iconic original. Its innovative approach takes the concept in new directions and invigorates an aging franchise. Despite the many odds stacked against it, Prey is one of the most exciting films of the year.

name: Prey
review: What Trachtenberg gets wonderfully right here is not simply paying homage to the original and crafting a decent hunt/showdown, but laying ground for its own originality throughout the film.

name: Prey
review: A refreshing, lean and mean take on the Predator mythology.

name: Prey
review: A great movie? Absolutely not. But it won’t insult your intelligence nearly as much as so many movies being churned out for streaming platforms.

name: Prey
review: Prey just works. Cinematic scale, strong performances, beautiful attention to detail, top-notch action sequences... it’s a solid outing that deserves the largest screen possible.

name: Prey
review: An exciting Predator prequel that features a hugely compelling lead (and her dog!). One wishes there was a deeper exploration of Comanche culture, but the inclusion of both Indigenous characters and women is incredibly welcome

name: Prey
review: If you if you're into the Predator franchise,  you'll enjoy it. If you didn't like it since the first one, I think you should give this one a shot, and I think you'll enjoy it. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

name: Prey
review: Hallelujah, praise the Lord! At long last, somebody did something creative with the Predator series! It took only 35 years after the release of the original science-fiction thriller, which well deserved a sequel but not the three that it got.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a slower, more thoughtful but no less captivating film.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg brings the 'Predator' franchise back to basics in a fun and empowering outing that boasts an outstanding lead performance from Amber Midthunder.

name: Prey
review: Let's hope Prey starts a new wave of really great, back-to-basics Predator movies.

name: Prey
review: ... Nasty, brutish and short — like the best B-movies — but far from dumb.

name: Prey
review: Prey establishes its conflict with no fuss, gives us a hero straining against the role 18th-century Comanche culture dictates for her, and doesn’t skimp on the action.

name: Prey
review: With Prey, director Dan Trachtenberg very effectively regenerates a brand that had overstayed its welcome.

name: Prey
review: A sequel that actually lives up to the original.

name: Prey
review: The film is a ripper, both figuratively and literally.

name: Prey
review: It’s probable that no one expected Prey to be a monster hit, but the film stumbled upon a good meet and matchup, a cross-genre pollination that suddenly opened up entirely new narrative directions.

name: Prey
review: “Prey” takes no prisoners. One of this summer’s most exhilarating action movies, it both reinvents the “Predator” franchise and layers it with thematic depth, thanks to a taut, character-driven script and well-choreographed action sequences.

name: Prey
review: Although [Trachtenberg] doesn’t properly innovate in Prey, he also doesn’t complicate, embracing narrative straightforwardness and modernizing through spectacular imagery and effects.

name: Prey
review: The fact that this movie is centered around cultures foreign to most Americans, as well as being set in a time and environment alien to most of us, helps to set this movie apart from most other films in this genre.

name: Prey
review: This is a multifaceted experience ripe with the kind of blood-pumping adrenaline common in action movies of the VHS era, but elegiac compositions put it in league with today’s progressive arthouse trends.

name: Prey
review: A compact yet supremely satisfying action experience that caused me to go back and rewatch the original Predator, just to see if Prey had actually stolen its franchise crown.

name: Prey
review: The result is a thoroughly satisfying underdog story that taps into the pleasures of old-school action cinema.

name: Prey
review: Over 300 years ago in Comanche territory, largely by the light of fires and of the moon, when warriors are faced [an]  otherworldly, technologically advanced monster... Trachtenberg shows mastery of frame, pace and suspense, and the casting is superb,

name: Prey
review: Prey manages to tap into the classic setup of the original Predator without ever feeling like it's retreading familiar ground. The action is close-quarters and visceral while the setting and time period are a welcome change. Best since the original!

name: Prey
review: Prey succeeds on every level.

name: Prey
review: Director Dan Trachtenberg has made a juggernaut of a film without an ounce of fat.

name: Prey
review: Should have been released in theaters. Pure entertainment from beginning to end. THIS is the Predator movie we've wanted since the original. Love that it was so rooted in the hunt and what a predator's natural instinct is. Amber Midthunder is stellar.

name: Prey
review: It's a fascinating film.

name: Prey
review: It’s easily the best Predator movie since the original. By stripping the Predator’s story to the bone and adding the friction between Indigenous peoples and European colonizers, Dan Trachtenberg creates a taut story of hunter vs. hunter vs. hunter.

name: Prey
review: While “Prey” has an undeniably cool nostalgic kick, it also manages to put its own original spin on the franchise in large part thanks to its period, its setting, and one lights-out lead performance from Amber Midthunder.

name: Prey
review: Prey did something that I believed was impossible for this franchise. It gave a lot of heart, a passionate and powerful main character, beautiful cinematography, and most importantly, an amazingly strong and fresh take on the Predator story!

name: Prey
review: For my money it’s the best since the original.

name: Prey
review: The fight choreography is expertly staged and shot. No blurry camera pans and choppy editing that leaves you wondering what just happened. It’s top-notch, theater-quality action piped into your living room.

name: Prey
review: Prey evolves the female action hero by incorporating quieter strengths into her characterization.

name: Prey
review: Predator at its best, in an exceptional survival tale reflecting a people’s myths & legends seemingly confirmed by the arrival of the inexplicable. ... [A] deeper, definitive experience.

name: Prey
review: Prey is the best Predator movie after the original.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: Sometimes less is more and simple is safer, but when the execution is as good as it is with Prey, I’ll take that more often than not.

name: Prey
review: Never before has 'final girl' been foreshadowed quite so hard - but, all in all, despite a gathering pile of minor misgivings, the film works pretty well as a fairly straightforward, but reasonably paced film with lots of well-handled action sequences.

name: Prey
review: For the first time since the Reagan administration, the Predator series delivers.

name: Prey
review: Hollywood loves to crank out boring action movies. But Hulu’s Prey is anything but. It plays off of and reverses long-standing Hollywood tropes about Native Americans to craft an alien thriller that actually delivers.

name: Prey
review: A thrilling and suspenseful horror action-adventure. The filmmakers incorporate the Indigenous cultural aspect in a clever way that works for the story, featuring a phenomenal female protagonist who's a force to be reckoned with.

name: Prey
review: The rare franchise installment that finds a fresh, compelling spin on the material while also effectively drawing inspiration from the original without being suffocated by it.

name: Prey
review: Prey basks in a visual style that’s attractive but rarely expressive: a capable sort of commercial work.

name: Prey
review: The performances are unforced and natural; both Midthunder and Beavers exude screen charisma without making a big deal of it. Technically the film is quite beautiful, evoking the sort of pristine wilderness captured so hauntingly in The Revenant.

name: Prey
review: It’s the kind of franchise-furthering sequel that actively plays on your memories of the prior films without just defaulting to the hit parade.

name: Prey
review: [Prey is] my favorite Predator movie.

name: Prey
review: An impressive calling card for rising director Dan Trachtenberg... with a haunting, respectful recreation of Native American life in the sparsely settled interior of the raw continent.

name: Prey
review: Prey is the exhilarating back-to-basics action thriller that the franchise sorely needs.

name: Prey
review: Each step of the movie is telegraphed, masticated, and the predictable veiled as false classicism evoking films like The Naked Prey (1965), and it never quite defies the [franchise] mythology. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: Unlike so many other franchises, I now hope this one doesn’t go extinct anytime soon.

name: Prey
review: Thanks to the Indigenous context in 'Prey', the story develops overall themes of predator and prey dynamics from a new perspective, all the way through entire food chains.

name: Prey
review: The effort is appreciated, but for me there is only one 'Predator' movie. It premiered in 1987 and stars Arnold Schwarzenegger. This prequel is below, it does not even reach the heels. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: This film’s creative team had its heart in the right place and honours the people it portrays including the people whose location they borrowed.

name: Prey
review: Director Dan Trachtenberg makes the most of the wilderness setting and sharp young cast, and holding back on effects while skilfully cranking up suspense.

name: Prey
review: Prey turns the franchise on its head and delivers a surprisingly emotional and epic story.

name: Prey
review: Hulu’s clever prequel to Predator is so much more than IP exploitation—it’s bloodthirsty, self-assured, and crowd-pleasing

name: Prey
review: The perseverance of the human spirit is a universal story one could inject anywhere. Trachtenberg fully uses the 90+ minutes allotted to him to return the Predator franchise to stable ground.

name: Prey
review: This is a surprisingly good entry in the Predator franchise.

name: Prey
review: A marvelous and fun post-modern fable that uses the depraved invader as a metaphor for US history, while also reflecting on indigenous cultures and its women...

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg overuses computer-generated special effects to such a degree that virtually all of the action set-pieces are hopelessly drained of energy and excitement...

name: Prey
review: An absolute winner

name: Prey
review: It’s been a long time since I’ve seen a film as purely thrilling and completely satisfying as Prey.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg took an unprecedented risk and succeeded

name: Prey
review: The result is pretty fun, if also a tonal mishmash of goofiness and gorgeous landscapes.

name: Prey
review: Stands on its own as an efficient, expectedly gory thriller.

name: Prey
review: This is a fresh and exciting standalone film that entertains, educates, and fires the imagination and admiration for Midthunder’s dedication.

name: Prey
review: A perfect example of how new perspectives naturally enrich stories that have been retold, providing a shield against clichés to amplify results. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: Prey is a fantastic genre piece that is sure to satisfy fans of the Predator franchise as well as those who just want a grand survival story. Amber Midthunder is amazing as Naru.

name: Prey
review: A pointed counter to the muscular mayhem of 1987’s Predator...

name: Prey
review: A “Predator” story should have well-crafted and excitingly staged scenes of humans fighting an alien. This picture has plenty.

name: Prey
review: A film with lots of feminist Western and just a tad of sci-fi.

name: Prey
review: Loyal to the max to the original, this film successfully reboots the exhausted franchise precisely for going back to its basics yet using a protagonist diametrically different from the muscular soldier of yonder. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: I liked how everything just kind of came back full circle… I thought that was really, really, well done.

name: Prey
review: This was not about shock value at all, I thought it was tastefully done.

name: Prey
review: Surprisingly good.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: A good premise for a Predator movie if you think it's worthwhile making a Predator movie. It should be at least this good.

name: Prey
review: Don’t think too much about what is going on and have some fun with it. Don’t expect anything out of the norm and you’ll be, at the least, satisfied.

name: Prey
review: While it is certainly more coherent and enjoyable than Black’s 2018 The Predator, Prey is a middling, lightweight effort.

name: Prey
review: Perfectly fulfills what it promises. Incredible action, exciting sequences and guaranteed entertainment.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: Prey works because it speaks to Naru’s realistic “weaknesses” instead of imbuing her with less-than-believable strengths. She’s small, but she’s quick; she’s not strong, but she’s smart; nobody believes in her, and therefore they never see her coming.

name: Prey
review: Between the bad computer-generated animals and the fundamental misunderstanding of why these movies work, the first hour is kind of a mess. Luckily, things pick up in the back 40 minutes.

name: Prey
review: As a female empowerment, diversity conscious, low gun exposure monster movie, Prey proves that it’s not just beefy white guys who can tango with danger and outwit the devil.

name: Prey
review: Probably the best and certainly the most viscerally satisfying of all the extant Predator sequels.

name: Prey
review: A beautiful, bone-crushing piece of work that is not only the best Predator sequel, it's a fascinating example of how to reframe and continue a beloved franchise without resorting to mere fan service or naked nostalgia

name: Prey
review: In bobbling both the central character and the fray going on around her, Prey doesn’t take advantage of its many opportunities.

name: Prey
review: After years of disappointing and uneven franchise entries, it feels good to be excited about a Predator movie again.

name: Prey
review: Prey was never intended to be Shakespearean fare. What it sets out to accomplish, it does so masterfully, marking arguably the best entry in the series so far.

name: Prey
review: A prequel to the Predator series that stays true to the essence of the original – stylishly violent, stickily graphic, impossibly tense – while also working satisfyingly as a self-contained entity.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a glorious combination of fight, flight, and human survival, where the hunter becomes the hunted, and the monster known as the Predator ferociously gnashes his mandibles once again.

name: Prey
review: Amber Midthunder and the authentic Indigenous cast take the prequel to the next level delivering the best sci-fi film of the year.

name: Prey
review: It’s a terrific-looking picture I wish we’d been able to see the way it was intended, especially with a rowdy Friday night crowd.

name: Prey
review: 'Prey' pumps blood back into the Predator franchise with a riveting duel between the alien and a skilled Comanche huntress.

name: Prey
review: Provides the franchise a fresh start that could be the reboot it needed. If nothing else, you get to see the predator fight a bear.

name: Prey
review: 'Prey' is a fresh, original, and exciting entry into a franchise that was in desperate need of new life.

name: Prey
review: Pitting so-called primitive people armed with hatchets, knives and bows and arrows against an alien with advanced technology makes for exciting and edge-of-your-seat viewing.

name: Prey
review: Some up-to-the-neck moments are among a few reasons to recommend (this) wild and wooly 'Predator' franchise prequel set 300 years ago on and around a historically accurate Comanche settlement.

name: Prey
review: The best Predator film since Arnie ran to the chopper, Prey strips everything down to the bare essentials to deliver a thrilling story of survival.

name: Prey
review: …Amber Midthunder is the real star here, and if you don’t like that, get out of her way, because she’s absolutely taking no prisoners, and neither does this gory, violent, ingenious film…

name: Prey
review: Prey is the second-best Predator movie.

name: Prey
review: "Prey" stays precisely locked into the relentless gear and exciting pace this legendary movie monster threat has long deserved.

name: Prey
review: Prey is the first Predator sequel (well, prequel) that demands a rewatch, and the most inspired and thrilling the franchise has been since Arnold first trekked into that jungle in ‘87.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg pulls off a fresh new take on a dried-out franchise.

name: Prey
review: How can one teenage girl hope to take down this enormous, often invisible, ferocious, emotionally intelligent, extraterrestrial being with a wide array of weapons at its disposal? Let's just say Prey comes up with ingenious ways to even the odds.

name: Prey
review: You may think you don't need another Predator movie in your life, but you need this one -- it is awesome.

name: Prey
review: While it doesn’t break new ground, this action thriller goes back to the basics that made the original Predator work.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a small miracle of an accomplishment, and it made me wonder if there could be more stories of Predators visiting Earth at various points in history before the events of the original film.

name: Prey
review: This movie celebrates what made Predator great while making its own story.

name: Prey
review: Prey keeps its story simple, evokes its era well and teases out the cat-and-mouse survival dance superbly.

name: Prey
review: Not everything about Prey works... Fortunately, that doesn’t detract too much from the visceral and visually arresting action, which should keep you engrossed -- and on the edge of your seat.

name: Prey
review: 'Prey' works largely because of humans that we care about.

name: Prey
review: Prey brings the Predator franchise back to its roots...[It's] the best entry in the series since the O.G.

name: Prey
review: Prey returns the Predator franchise to what made it great to begin with, incorporating the classic tactics and weapons of its titular galactic hunter against an inspiring, game new quarry.

name: Prey
review: In its simplicity, PREY possesses a heart-pounding energy, intensity, and tension that recent installments lacked. Amber Midthunder's Naru will have you rooting for her all the way to the very end

name: Prey
review: Prey joins the elite class of sequels that are better than the original. The Dan Trachtenberg film delivers such a unique take and style that revives the franchise, and makes it the most clever film in the IP.

name: Prey
review: Prey plays the hits in a fresh way without having to rely on callbacks to the original by having actors shout, "Get the chopper!"

name: Prey
review: The action is propulsive, blood-soaked but inventive.

name: Prey
review: The Predator fights a bear. It is, therefore, a good movie.

name: Prey
review: Midthunder giving a muscular performance but can’t wrestle Prey away from the franchise, which makes the Comanche people feel like ornamental props in a better-than-average Predator movie rather than fully formed characters who own their narrative.

name: Prey
review: Prey is an average action movie, one that suffers from being part of a franchise that wouldn’t seem to have much of anything interesting left to give.

name: Prey
review: A survival thriller in more ways than one, Prey brings a female perspective to a famously masculine franchise.

name: Prey
review: What’s interesting about this “Predator” outing is that even though we know all the story beats, director Dan Trachtenberg (see “10 Cloverfield Lane”) makes them fresh.

name: Prey
review: A very necessary back to basics take on a franchise that had lost its way.

name: Prey
review: Is Prey 2: This Time, He’s Bringing His Friends too much to hope for?

name: Prey
review: Believe the hype... a perfect storm of sight, sound, and situation... pure spectacle both intended as and deserving of a wide theatrical release, (it) has instead been banished to streaming for the cinematic crime of being a mere merger asset.

name: Prey
review: The film moves at a brisk pace of 90 minutes. It’s fairly simple and straightforward without being overstuffed with mindless characters and melodrama. This is all about Naru knowing she can prove her worth.

name: Prey
review: Director Dan Trachtenberg ... delivers the year’s best action film. Midthunder’s compelling main character slogs and slings through her character arc, instead of parachuting in, already fashionably armed with a complete complement of kick-ass skills.

name: Prey
review: "Prey" is easily the best "Predator" since the 1987 original.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg does a decent job building up to an exciting finale, and headdresses off to his skilled cinematographer, Jeff Cutter, who worked with Trachtenberg on the latter's terrific debut feature, 2016's 10 Cloverfield Lane.

name: Prey
review: Older viewers may miss Arnie’s quips but it’s still the most effective Predator flick since that first one.

name: Prey
review: The best Predator sequel/prequel since the original. There are many gruesome deaths that will satisfy all fans! I only wish the character develop had the same energy.

name: Prey
review: Everything comes together in an exciting mix.

name: Prey
review: How did it take them 30 years to figure out THIS is what they should've been doing with these movies all along?

name: Prey
review: [Dan] Trachtenberg's virtuoso and dynamic camerawork deserves [mention] as well, where the action sequences evoke a sense of palpable tension.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg innately understands what made the first film such a classic and delivers a fresh but familiar take that completely revitalises this sagging franchise.

name: Prey
review: I had a blast with Prey, not only for the shock and awe of the action but by the central character’s engaging, captivating story.

name: Prey
review: Prey is going to go down as one of 2022’s most entertaining motion pictures.

name: Prey
review: After all the past failures, Prey might prove that the future of the Predator film franchise is in the past. More anthology-type stories that are loosely connected, standalone stories, such as Prey, might do the Predator series a world of good.

name: Prey
review: It's intrinsically familiar, which is both a strength of Trachtenberg's installment ... and an obvious weakness...

name: Prey
review: [Midthunder is] a dynamic presence on screen, which is great, as she’s in most of the movie and helps make the already strong story that much more compelling.

name: Prey
review: rey is everything fans could want from a Predator film. It recaptures the horror and brutality of being hunted by the strongest creature in the galaxy. Prey delivers a satisfying tale of survival that puts the franchise back at the top of the food chain.

name: Prey
review: It's not unlike the first Predator, as it happens, a movie that scared the piss out of me when I was 14 and has, in the 35 years since, become one of my go-to examples of a perfect machine of action, horror, comedy, and sociology. Prey may be another.

name: Prey
review: The FX and cinematography of the pristine New World impress as the film checks the boxes of the franchise as well as lending a voice to the Native American experience.

name: Prey
review: Action packed and expertly made, the Predator franchise hasn't been this good since 1987. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: No matter how smart Naru is, she's going to have a tough time beating the technologically advanced predator with a simple bow and arrow. It's an unfair fight, and it doesn't work. The film's setting ultimately proves to be its downfall.

name: Prey
review: Prey's stripped down narrative and classic thrills make it the rare reboot that works.

name: Prey
review: If you think about PREY too hard, it may just fall apart from a credibility standpoint. So, don’t. It’s worth the suspension of disbelief.

name: Prey
review: Once [director] Trachtenberg hits the accelerator, it doesn't stop until the brutal, bloody conclusion that had me gasping for the last 20 minutes. Full review in Spanish.

name: Prey
review: "Prey,” as these movies eventually do, gets appropriately blunt and bloody, though it trudges through tough narrative territory on the way to a bombastically fun showdown.

name: Prey
review: Director Dan Trachtenberg reinvents the Predator movie by stripping away the bombast and machismo, and doubling down on simple storytelling for a film that rivals the original.

name: Prey
review: Suspenseful and scary, it's a worthy complement to the Predator franchise.

name: Prey
review: Prey represents an odd if refreshingly spare addition to the franchise, giving a coming-of-age spin to a faceoff that can't help but feel like a serious mismatch.

name: Prey
review: This prequel manages to capture the spirit of that Schwarzenegger original while completely rejiggering and deepening the Most Dangerous Game notion at the center of it all. It instantly establishes itself as a series highlight.

name: Prey
review: Amber Midthunder makes a spectacular action hero in this compelling survival story that just happens to be a 'Predator' prequel.

name: Prey
review: While the picture is certainly one of the better installments in the franchise...and its unusual setting gives it added interest, its combination of two familiar scenarios...comes off feeling rather tired.

name: Prey
review: Consistent with both intense action and compelling drama, Prey is satisfying and exciting with Dan Trachtenberg proving his worth once again.

name: Prey
review: Prey focuses solely on being a solid thriller with little frills.

name: Prey
review: Prey offers one of the most intriguing, well-executed twists on the series’ mythology so far.

name: Prey
review: Its thrills aren’t solely reliant on what’s already familiar to audiences. It isn’t powered by nostalgia -- an exceedingly rare thing to see in mainstream cinema these days.

name: Prey
review: The third act is clever, some of the shots are cool, Midthunder & Beavers are excellent - but the movie's just not that good. Like Michael Myers, the Predator needs to change things up because they've just become too boring & repetitive several movies in.

name: Prey
review: The franchise’s latest stab at resuscitation... absolutely kills.

name: Prey
review: The real meat on “Prey’s” bones concerns who is the more fearsome predator: The alien beast or the French colonizers? That question gives this gory R-rated Western/horror mashup its brain, attitude, even its punch.

name: Prey
review: Under Trachttenberg's effective and accomplished direction, Aison's script balances its central David vs. Goliath concept with suspense and action sequences that pay homage to the 1987 movie starring Schwarzenegger. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: A scary and fun amusement park ride that also elicits a surprisingly tender emotional response.

name: Prey
review: Prey elicits another wonderfully gnarly genre exercise for the Predator franchise.

name: Prey
review: After four films attempting to recapture the original film's magic, Prey finds the path forward.

name: Prey
review: “Prey” is painstakingly attentive to the authenticity of its Indigenous setting. Similar attention to the script would not have gone amiss.

name: Prey
review: "Prey" doesn't push the "Predator" tale forward in any significant ways.

name: Prey
review: The long-running Predator franchise finally has an entry that can stand as an equal to the original film, precisely because it narrows its focus on the story elements that matter dramatically, instead of unnecessarily expanding the franchise’s mythology.

name: Prey
review: To call 'Prey' the best 'Predator' movie since the original is damning with faint praise. It's so much more. It is lean, sharp, and relentless.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a nimble beast, far nimbler than it could have been and while it’s not quite enough to make us crave more from a franchise that’s already given us too much, it’s enough to justify the journey way back.

name: Prey
review: Aside from some flat supporting characters and occasional stale dialogue, the saddest fact about Prey is its perfect big screen viewing that’s bypassing cinemas. But... Trachtenberg’s Predator is gnarly, commanding, and by far the scariest yet.

name: Prey
review: What is immediately evident is how effectively Prey recaptures the spirit of the first film. It stands proud as the best addition yet to the franchise’s original.

name: Prey
review: [Amber Midthunder] grows, to her own merit, into the best action heroine that Hollywood has given us in recent years. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: One of the most impressive things about Prey is how patient it is — especially for an action movie.

name: Prey
review: As a sci-fi, action, drama film, Prey has more style and depth than the original Predator movie but still manages to tie the two films together with common threads offering a plausibility that makes sense.

name: Prey
review: Midthunder is a compelling lead, but you don’t need Predator vision to see how warmed-over this franchise has become.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a stripped-down sci fi action movie with a strong hero and tension to spare. The story is a bare-bones tale of survival, but given an interesting and often gory twist.

name: Prey
review: Amber Midthunder gives a fierce, persuasive and winning performance as the fully-committed Naru, who is ready to prove herself a mighty hunter in defense of her people. And to make an uninvited and unwelcome guest bleed profusely until it dies.

name: Prey
review: The second half is easily the best we've seen from the Predator franchise since 1987.

name: Prey
review: Gone are the commandos who find themselves hunted for sport – Prey sees what happens when the hunt for sport interrupts the hunt for survival.

name: Prey
review: Nostalgia-driven or not, it’s frankly cool to see some of these brawls go down. Sure, the Predator will make quick work of other Comanche and colonizers looking for a fight, but what about seeing this alien take on a grizzly bear?

name: Prey
review: Prey was exactly the kind of reinvention the Predator franchise needed. It’s intense, suspenseful and filled with exciting action sequences.

name: Prey
review: You can holler aloud at the spectacular violence as Naru proves her gravitas and the series is rescued by filmmakers who have discerned its decades of latent potential.

name: Prey
review: Prey is exactly the jolt a dying franchise needs. The story is simple, and that's why it works so well. Amber Midthunder is up there with the greats in terms of feminine archetypes. And the dreaded space villain is deadlier and more menacing than ever.

name: Prey
review: Prey is an exhilarating film and a worthy prequel to the Predator franchise.

name: Prey
review: Prey proves to be an apropos title, as the film is cowed by John McTiernan’s original Predator.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg’s vision and confident display of the material revitalises the franchise with a palpable sense of fun and adventure. “If it bleeds, we can kill it”, and Predator is back with a vengeance.

name: Prey
review: The subpar script can't keep up with the talents of the director and actors. They can only elevate the material so much before it crumbles.

name: Prey
review: Prey is as violent, gory, and action-packed as you want a Predator flick to be.

name: Prey
review: The best Predator film since the 1987 original. Amber Midthunder kicks ass in this awesome, no-nonsense, hunter/prey thriller that injects new life to the iconic sci-fi franchise. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Prey
review: As fresh as “Prey” does feel in this new warpaint on the surface, the film does feature a lot of inherent, built-in franchise limitations.

name: Prey
review: Prey's Comanche heroine outsmarts her powerful adversary with cunning, courage, and rage. It's a solid sci-fi thriller that brings much needed creativity to a stale franchise.

name: Prey
review: Prey is easily the best Predator film since the 1987 original.

name: Prey
review: If the notion of yet another “Predator” movie is scarier to you than most of the movies have been, well, this one’s actually OK.

name: Prey
review: Prey is an awesome restart of the Predator franchise featuring a fantastic new heroine with a star-making performance.

name: Prey
review: To borrow a phrase from Mean Girls, the very entertaining Prey is the latest attempt from 20th Century Studios (formerly 20th Century Fox) to make “fetch” happen.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a solid-enough entry in the franchise, and a quality base hit for Hulu for August.

name: Prey
review: Not only is Prey an expertly crafted thriller, but the new Predator movie also heavily benefits from being a deeply personal character journey -- one powered by Comanche tradition just as much as it is by Predator-sparked thrills.

name: Prey
review: Simplicity is what enables Prey to succeed so magnificently, both as a long-overdue, worthy successor to Predator and as a rip-roaring stand-alone period action flick.

name: Prey
review: Prey arrives with a fresh spin on the franchise’s mythology that hopes to revitalize the series for good.

name: Prey
review: Amber Midthunder and Dakota Beavers create a great bond in Prey, set 300 years ago in Comanche territory. Beautiful cinematography, excellent choreography, The Best Predator Movie Ever.

name: Prey
review: So much of the film’s success can be laid at Midthunder’s feat, the 25-year-old Sioux actress easily proving herself an incredible action lead.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg has directed the hell out of one of the best monster movies in years, proving that there’s life in any horror franchise if you stick to what makes the central creature fascinating.

name: Prey
review: A worthy addition in the “Predator” canon that comes close to replicating the simplistic and primitive nature of John McTiernan’s 1987 classic. In other words, it kicks all sorts of ass.

name: Prey
review: It’s full of the Predator franchise’s trademark violence and tension, but it’s the ferocious, star-making turn from Amber Midthunder that stands as its greatest strength.

name: Prey
review: It's not an especially different take on the central human vs. hunter concept, but it's definitely an improvement over "The Predator."

name: Prey
review: Prey takes a knock, in my book, from going straight to streaming, but only because it’s so thunderously bloody and intense, scored by Sarah Schachner to sound exactly like the primal scream it should be.

name: Prey
review: The latest installment in a flagging franchise, Prey weaponizes its simple formula into a sleek, sci-fi action missile.

name: Prey
review: Every new installment of the Predator franchise has aimed to recapture that original film. But instead of coming up with new quotable lines and a new charming lead, Prey simply doesn’t have as much to offer.

name: Prey
review: No sane person could begrudge Midthunder, Beavers et al their moment. Even stuck on the small screen (which is such a waste), they’re a huge deal.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a technical marvel, a uniquely refreshing take on the Predator formula, and Amber Midthunder is up to the challenge, immediately cementing herself as a must-see action heroine. This is how a reboot is done exceedingly right

name: Prey
review: "Prey" is the kind of movie summers are made for, a thrilling ride you'll want to immediately start over and watch again.

name: Prey
review: The important thing is that the action sequences are staged with maximum skillfulness.

name: Prey
review: It's intimate and character-driven, with more than enough action to satisfy the most die-hard Predator fans out there. Heck, even if you've never watched a Predator movie, chances are you'll love Prey. It's just that good.

name: Prey
review: Nice B-movie, would like a bit more substance and subtext to it next time.

name: Prey
review: Though it isn’t original, since the 1987 film first introduced nearly all the same components of these now-classic movie monsters, this derivation is considerably faithful in tone and atmosphere and content.

name: Prey
review: There is enough right and apparently painstakingly accurate about Prey that hearing the characters speak an actual indigenous language would have taken it to a whole other level. But it follows a familiar bloody narrative for Predator fans.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a dull and lousy rehash and not a real origin story for The Predator franchise. This mindless horror flick clumsily panders to gender politics by having the theme that women are underestimated as hunters.

name: Prey
review: Finally, the excellent Predator film we’ve been praying for.

name: Prey
review: Predator hasn’t been this good since Arnold first yelled “Get to the choppa!!”

name: Prey
review: One of the year's greatest surprises, and most deserving of a big screen release...yet, it's going straight to Hulu.

name: Prey
review: Amber Midthunder ends up being (almost) as badass as Arnold Schwarzenegger in the original. [Full review in French]

name: Prey
review: A perfectly passable creature feature-meets-First-Americans entertainment, and I dare say any multiplex in North America would have loved to shown it.

name: Prey
review: A lean action thriller, ﻿Prey ﻿takes Predator back to its ultraviolent roots and proves itself as a worthy entry in the franchise's mythology.

name: Prey
review: With fantastic tension, brilliant fight choreography & a number of gnarly kills, Prey is the best Predator flick since the original, taking the franchise back-to-basics. Amber Midhunter is a real standout...

name: Prey
review: Prey is the first movie in this series to truly deliver since the original Predator. Dan Trachtenberg's second film, after 10 Cloverfield Lane, is another great franchise installment. Amber Midthunder gives a terrific, star-making performance.

name: Prey
review: The first sequel that got Predator totally right.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg remembers the most important rule: the Predator is just a character. The movie around it has to be a good one too.

name: Prey
review: Bolstered from the get go by Midthunder’s peerless delivery, the film feels like a true and conscious new departure away from the usual rehashing and repackaging of the same old ideas.

name: Prey
review: Gnarly, vicious and bloody entertaining, this might be the best Predator film there is. We finally have the Predator film we have been craving for and frankly, the one we deserve.

name: Prey
review: Solid prequel delivers something most blockbusters can't - efficiency.

name: Prey
review: As an alien-attack thriller, “Prey” is competent and well-paced, though with little in the way of surprise. But the journey of Naru lends it a semblance of emotional coherence that most of the “Predator” films have lacked.

name: Prey
review: PREY is easily the best Predators film since the original. Midthunder is great as the lead, Trachtenberg's directing makes Predator come alive again, & action/fights are the icing on the cake. Saddened it's not available on big screen for all to enjoy!

name: Prey
review: Midthunder brings a steely focus and intimidating physicality to all she does with the part. That’s really her doing most of the running, jumping, climbing, and rolling around in the muck. Midthunder is in it for a penny and every pound.

name: Prey
review: How can even the most skilled Comanche warriors battle a massive alien being with a full arsenal of advanced technology? Now that’s how you orient a prequel.

name: Prey
review: Where Prey stumbles the most is that the formula for the franchise is starting to feel stale. There may be more than one way to skin a cat, but there's apparently still only one way to tell a Predator story. The change is fresh characters and scenery.

name: Prey
review: Best post-Arnie Predator variant? Undoubtedly. Best Predator movie per se? Tough call, but trust this: Prey gets the job done.

name: Prey
review: Even those who have never seen a Predator film before should make sure to check out Prey.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a really fun movie with fantastic visuals, a great leading performance, an interesting and authentic setting, wildly entertaining fight scenes, excellent writing, and an obvious love for all things Predator.

name: Prey
review: Effortlessly the best Predator movie since the original, Prey proves that, against all expectation, there’s life in the franchise yet, not to mention a thrilling new lead in Amber Midthunder.

name: Prey
review: It’s a shame almost nobody will get to see [Prey] in a theater; it might be faint praise to call this good enough movie the best Predator sequel in over 30 years, but it’s almost perfect late summer entertainment in its utter satisfactory-ness.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a fantastic adventure movie, a fantastic Predator movie, and this should have been in theaters. If you decide to watch this, bring friends over – it’s that kind of movie.

name: Prey
review: Prey is an intense thriller that provides the best Predator-centric moments since the original. This film thrives due to its simplicity and commitment to providing fans with some brutal fight scenes.

name: Prey
review: Prey is exactly what fans want in a Predator film. It is all about the hunt -- and insanely brutal kills. With ties to the other movies, its one of the best!

name: Prey
review: A lean, mean, riveting back-to-nature horror film that flies through its thrilling 99 minutes.

name: Prey
review: If the ‘87 Predator works because it’s foremost a high-spirited, well-oiled killing machine, Prey does more to honor that legacy than any previous follow-up.

name: Prey
review: It's no hyperbole to say that this is a film that demands to be seen on as big a screen as possible, if only in order to thoroughly appreciate one of the best action movies of the year thus far, let alone one of the best Predator movies since the first.

name: Prey
review: Prey takes its cues from 1987’s Predator in terms of simplicity and bloody action-horror. Its cultural specificity and period setting lend a sweeping period epic feel and introduce emotional stakes through its memorable characters.

name: Prey
review: Trachtenberg and company have put together a crackerjack monster pic, full of clever new approaches to old material.

name: Prey
review: Prey is inarguably the best Predator since the original.

name: Prey
review: Prey is the best Predator installment since the original while simultaneously crafting an engaging narrative of its own.

name: Prey
review: We'd say it was the best Predator movie since the original, but that feels like damning it with faint praise. It's a terrific movie in its own right that revitalises the franchise by stripping it back to basics.

name: Prey
review: Prey delivers pure Predator pandemonium, and is the Predator franchise at its best. It's also a much-needed fresh start for the series that allows Amber Midthunder to shine in a role that promises to put her on the map.

name: Prey
review: Prey is a lean and mean new Predator encounter.

name: Prey
review: "Prey" is no masterpiece, but it's a solid moviegoing experience and an encouraging sign of life from a franchise that seemed dead in the water.

name: Prey
review: There are moments of beauty and quiet contemplation leading up to and amongst the carnage that elevates 'Prey' beyond schlocky sci-fi horror.

name: Prey
review: Prey is the best thing that’s been done for this franchise probably since Predator 2, and it’s a real shame that more people won’t have a chance to see this in a theater.

name: The Woman King
Rating: PG-13 (Partial Nudity|Brief Language|Sequences of Strong Violence|Some Disturbing Material|Thematic Content)

name: The Woman King
review: …goes all in as a popular entertainment, rolling back the male-dominance of the action genre and replacing it with something smart, dynamic and female driven…

name: The Woman King
review: As these women take their place in the kingdom of Dahomey and assert their power, The Woman King truly takes on new meaning, and finds relevance in the modern era.

name: The Woman King
review: The film is shot impeccably well, scored passionately, and gives the viewer something to savor as they leave the theater.

name: The Woman King
review: It's not a perfect film but acting-wise - this is a masterclass. Pacing was tight and effective despite lacking in some character development. This is a really good film.

name: The Woman King
review: The performances, action scenes and cinematography were fantastic. I think the representation of bad ass black women was incredible.

name: The Woman King
review: Pacing issues and historical inaccuracies aside, The Woman King has great action and moving characters brought to life by a fantastic ensemble cast.

name: The Woman King
review: A giddy mix of history and fantasy.

name: The Woman King
review: ...as a piece of entertainment, The Woman King works very well. The action is extremely well-staged and is visceral and brutal and endlessly fun.

name: The Woman King
review: A wildly watchable and compelling movie, one of 2022's best popcorn films.

name: The Woman King
review: Between the historical African ballad and the feminist epic, The Woman King advances unspectacularly academic, annoyingly predictable, and blatantly contrived.

name: The Woman King
review: Gina Prince-Bythewood’s film offers all the pleasures of an old-school epic but with a fresh take—the heroes in this film are Black women, led by Viola Davis in an inspiring performance as the military leader Nanisca.

name: The Woman King
review:
The Woman King is a powerful film with Viola Davis playing and incredible lead. 

The dedication and craft put into this film is evident with strong performances and thoughtful moments.

name: The Woman King
review: Gina Prince-Bythewood directs the best battle epic since “Braveheart” and “Gladiator." It's that good, applying a diverse cast to good old-fashioned spectacle storytelling. Is it revisionist history? Of course, but it's still the best movie of the year.

name: The Woman King
review: Gina Prince-Bythewood’s action flick stars a number of young actresses joining the ranks of Agojie, but Mbedu really kills it with plenty of stunts and an emotional tale of mothers and daughters.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is one of the best films of 2022! Viola Davis commands this film with her presence of power & emotional grace. Every other cast member are just as powerful & engaging. Amazing dedication to scripting, choreography, stunt work, & directing

name: The Woman King
review: Films often elect spectacle or substance. To its credit, The Woman King offers both in a rousing tale of women warriors while mounting a devastating historical and cultural critique.

name: The Woman King
review: A rousing saga.

name: The Woman King
review: Poignant, proud, and powerful. What is remarkable is that this story has never been told in such magnitude and is a feat worthy of all the history books.  The strength in combat matched the strength in will.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis has her second-best role to date (love Ma Rainey) as Nanisca, the kick-ass and fearless leader. Lashana Lynch kills (literally and figuratively) as Nanisca's loyal lieutenant.

name: The Woman King
review: I applaud the femme-focus of “The Woman King” and its depiction of strong-willed, strong-bodied women who earned their place of power.

name: The Woman King
review: But the main selling point of The Woman King is its performances, with Davis and John Boyega standing out as especially phenomenal in this film.

name: The Woman King
review: An epic story that gets lost in an uneven and bloated film encumbered by subplots that lead nowhere. Fortunately, the collection of misfires doesn't get in the way of enjoying this old-fashioned production... [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: The film is more notable for the story it tells rather than how it tells it, with numerous action and fight sequences that are as precise as they're devoid of personality... [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: 'The Woman King' artfully and seamlessly blends some familiar movie genres — following in the tradition of big-screen sagas like Gladiator, Braveheart, and Last of the Mohicans — with a fresh female perspective. And, Viola Davis rules!

name: The Woman King
review: It does not seek to question masculinity, but limits itself to replacing the Leonids on duty with hypermasculinized women.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: For all its formulaic plotting and pedestrian dialogue, The Woman King is fresh in every other way: Its visual palette, its setting and art direction, its voice and perspective. It’s as beautiful to look at as it is tonally fierce – as it is predictable

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood’s achievement is urgent, brilliant filmmaking and Davis’s performance is bound to become iconic.

name: The Woman King
review: “Inspired by real historical events” means in Hollywood-speak: “A grain of truth in a bed of fiction and fantasy”

name: The Woman King
review: Not that they have to here, but the phenomenal quartet that is Davis, Lynch, Mbedu and Atim could lift any material.

name: The Woman King
review: Just a good-old-fashioned swords-and-sandals epic told with a fresh, diverse spin. Viola Davis is a cannonball in this, which is the most interesting/best performance she’s given since Fences.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a genuine crowd-pleaser that delivers grand entertainment in terms of blockbuster scale, punchy set-pieces and a formidable cast. Highly recommended.

name: The Woman King
review: Set against a dark backstory, this exhilarating tale of Amazon women, brimming with female energy, has more going for it than most superhero flicks

name: The Woman King
review: In this sisterhood of soldiers there’s more empathy.  It’s not that they're weak, but that they understand the price of being strong.

name: The Woman King
review: A wholly exciting feature that overcomes any conventionality with its fierce female spirit, and that’s more than enough to warrant a passionate celebration.

name: The Woman King
review: The dialogue is generic -- the formal kind constructed to suit all periods -- but the actors give it all the authenticity it needs, clearly delighted by the ebullience of their characters.

name: The Woman King
review: A big, mean, pulpy movie that drags the old Hollywood historical epic out of the shadows and into the cultural moment.

name: The Woman King
review: Stories of heroism, loyalty, implacable enemies and epic battles-to-win-the-day are as old as Hollywood. The Woman King makes the genre fresh again. Go and see it on the biggest screen you can find.

name: The Woman King
review: A film you’re supposed to admire, never mind its obvious shortcomings...For all its claims of being an epic film, it's blighted by some pretty ordinary cinematography...The messy battle scenes look as though they were edited in a blender.

name: The Woman King
review: An exciting character-driven spectacle of historical conflict, political machinations and heroism.

name: The Woman King
review: Everything -- performances, costumes, score, swashbuckling choreography, courtly intrigue -- comes together, as Dana Stevens’ screenplay hits all the right notes.

name: The Woman King
review: Emotional and gripping

name: The Woman King
review: With great visuals and choreography making each battle a physically brutal dance, we get a sense of what these women are fighting for whether "each other" means the Agojie or Africa itself.

name: The Woman King
review: The cinematography is what makes the film a success. The direction, the acting, the action and the execution are all flawless, just like the women themselves.

name: The Woman King
review: It is a film designed to inspire audiences and elicit cheers and, by and large, it succeeds.

name: The Woman King
review: Technically, The Woman King is an accomplished historical epic that doesn’t stray too far from the formula. However, the real life grounding and the strength of the performances make it one of 2022’s most rewarding surprises.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King accomplishes a magnificent feat: delivering an epic, action-packed tale without sacrificing character development.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: Exhilarating, suspenseful and moving, The Woman King is an epic action film that celebrates the power of women.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King engagingly blends fiction and historical fact into a thematically rich deeply nuanced story of coming-of-age, finding your center, then choosing how you’ll stand your ground.

name: The Woman King
review: In the case of The Woman King, we have anti-history mobilized in the selfish interests of an upper-middle class milieu, rewriting the past for money and status.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King provides a template for how men can advocate for women.

name: The Woman King
review: In short, filmmaker Gina Prince-Bythewood and a stellar cast bring the legendary Agoji warrior women to life.

name: The Woman King
review: 2022 is proving to be the year of female-driven narratives...but The Woman King brings it to another level that celebrates Black women through its power, pride and poise to create one of the best films this year.

name: The Woman King
review: Every historical epic needs a central, larger-than-life character and star to match. As General Nanisca... Viola Davis delivers a groundbreaking performance proving that she has yet to reveal the full gamut of her acting capabilities.

name: The Woman King
review: Thankfully, all flimsiness in the screenplay is overcome by the director, Gina Prince-Bythewood, and her committed cast, who transform a familiar dramatic milieu (Mulan meets Gladiator meets Wonder Woman) into thrilling, amphetamine-rush cinema.

name: The Woman King
review: Yes, the Woman King could be filed under wish-fulfilment, but that’s true of so many action classics.

name: The Woman King
review: A great time at the movies. A rare cinematic event.

name: The Woman King
review: With its slickly orchestrated violence, epic battle scenes and achingly cool heroes, this rousing crowd-pleaser is also this year’s most thrilling action movie.

name: The Woman King
review: The appeal of this film, directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood, derives entirely from its reversal of gender assumptions.

name: The Woman King
review: The end result is a novel, representation-stretching enterprise that, paradoxically, plays like the “sort of film they don’t make any more”.

name: The Woman King
review: exemplary intersectional feminist call to arms for the African sisterhood to keep building on the achievements of their female ancestors & to keep fighting – & dancing – as they did, or might have done... with or without the approval of their patriarch

name: The Woman King
review: A breathless, thought-provoking and often brilliant movie that is determined to embolden end educate those watching it.

name: The Woman King
review: While the story sees the state draw back from involvement in the slave trade, questions of complicity still linger more than most popcorn movies would allow.

name: The Woman King
review: A first-rate epic combining commanding performances and storming action with a powerful story.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King isn’t intended to be any ordinary account of history. It is a vibrant, restorative celebration of Black womanhood in all its glory.

name: The Woman King
review: The film uses history as a jumping off point for myth-making and in the process delivers an all-out action spectacle, just from a perspective movies have tended to ignore.

name: The Woman King
review: This is a grand spectacle with vivid and theatrical performances.

name: The Woman King
review: Fierce, full of action and drama, "The Woman King" is yet another platform to showcase the amazing talent of Viola Davis.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is cinema at its finest. It speaks to a generation who understands the importance of representation and couples that enthusiasm as an unapologetic celebration of Black womanhood.

name: The Woman King
review: A thunderously cinematic good time: see it on the biggest screen you can find.

name: The Woman King
review: To get complex, scheming, heroic and strong black characters -- exhibiting much of what it means to be black on screen -- within the context of a historical movie is a treat.

name: The Woman King
review: The fight choreography is stunning, with Prince-Bythewood showcasing the abilities of her performers in shots that grab hold of your eyeballs and refuse to let go.

name: The Woman King
review: Unlike the all-too-common, typically lazy "girl power" tropes found in your average blockbuster, director Gina Prince-Bythewood not only respects her female characters, but also cares for them as complex and flawed people.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis introduced this film by calling it her magnum opus--and she was not kidding.  As the aging but brave warrior at the center of the film, she makes what should have been a mundane war movie something much more memorable

name: The Woman King
review: Predictable script hitting every conventional beat... It all plays out like a Disney movie made for kids, except with copious throat slitting – and even that is relatively tame in order to maintain the PG-13 rating

name: The Woman King
review: The battles are exciting yet human-scaled, unlike those in today's blockbusters; injuries feel real.

name: The Woman King
review: All in all, The Woman King is an exciting, action-packed, history-based melodrama with a new and unusual setting, gorgeous look and sound, and dynamic performances -- but with occasional jarring flaws in the script.

name: The Woman King
review: But The Woman King is at its most powerful when it focuses on the army of women who don’t have superpowers but rely on training, strategy and unity.

name: The Woman King
review: Echoes of Gladiator and Braveheart resonate here almost deliberately, The Woman King surrenders to narrative conventions and clichés, seeking the safest paths... [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: Phenomenal performances elevate a script that leaves much to be desired, falling back on its impressive action sequences to satisfy and entertain.

name: The Woman King
review: An action film of the times that doesn't quite serve the slightly touched upon themes -- machismo, slavery -- with a far-fetched romantic story...

name: The Woman King
review: It’s fast, and it’s loose, and it totally works.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood celebrates these women warriors through impressive fight scenes that are athletic but realistic, eschewing the sort of CGI overkill that has run rampant in recent action films.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a crowd pleaser at its core, intent on entertaining the audience as much as elevating a story that many in its audience may not know (though they’ll probably still need to do a bit of research).

name: The Woman King
review: A welcome rarity in an audiovisual industry that's clearly seeking to update their outlook and stories. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a rousing battle epic that wears its heart on its sleeve.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King has two unnecessary plot points that distract from the power of the story of the Agojie.

name: The Woman King
review: If you're someone who loves action movies that use "true events" as an entry to a deeper narrative about surviving trauma, defying misogyny and overcoming personal torment in the face, along with all the ass-kicking, then The Woman King is a masterpiece.

name: The Woman King
review: A wildly entertaining feminist historical action film that delivers audiences a different kind of onscreen hero.

name: The Woman King
review: Let's get the Viola Davis Cinematic Universe started ASAP, please.

name: The Woman King
review: The diffuse storytelling somewhat dilutes the film's themes but Viola Davis, a Terence Blanchard score and an inherently interesting milieu are all good reasons to see it.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s Ms. Davis’s weary but firm insistence on always doing the right thing that carries the movie. She is as much of an action star here as Harrison Ford or Sylvester Stallone ever was.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis is a force of nature and she proves it over and over  in this film.

name: The Woman King
review: Gina Prince-Bythewood films through the lens of Blackness, highlighting the beauty, strength, and fierceness of Black people, unlike most stories about the slave trade that wallow in Black trauma...

name: The Woman King
review: Come the end of year awards, don’t be surprised to see Davis and co on those podiums because The Woman King might very well be one of the best movies you’ll see this year.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King has the feel of a Game of Thrones episode edited for the Lifetime Channel.

name: The Woman King
