review: "The Woman King," another world premiere movie from Toronto, has Viola Davis portraying a real warrior and ruling her historically accurate, all-female army the same way she dominated the recent opening weekend of the film festival there.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s no surprise that Davis knocks it out of the park as the anchor of a strong film that deftly balances stellar action sequences with a strong emotional story.

name: The Woman King
review: Maybe Prince-Bythewood has tapped into something that the two lousy Wonder Woman movies missed, but whatever it is, it isn’t excitement. Her battle scenes are haphazard, with poor continuity.

name: The Woman King
review: As if we needed something else to confirm Viola Davis’ place in the shrine of truly remarkable actresses, along comes The Woman King, an elaborately choreographed historical epic in which she towers over nearly every aspect of the film’s production.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood has made some wonderful films, but The Woman King may be her very best.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King plays like old-fashioned, crowd-pleasing entertainment. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis and Thuso Mbedu give excellent performances, powering the emotional center of this story. The battle scenes are well choreographed by Filip Ciprian Florian of Monster Hunter.

name: The Woman King
review: The sheen of a lot of this invariably feels more Hollywoodesque than something truly Pan-African. “The Woman King” filters Africa through a very specific lens of Hollywood, but it’s personal and visceral enough that it's exuberance is irresistible.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood continues to show her mastery of the "women kicking ass" action thriller. Viola Davis rules but Lashana Lynch also deserves a shout out for her balance of comedy, drama, and badassery.

name: The Woman King
review: The kind of nuanced tapestry of the female experience that can only come from a movie centered around multiple women rather than just one.

name: The Woman King
review: The cast is uniformly strong and the action scenes make fine use of its sound and editing to mask its PG-13 trappings

name: The Woman King
review: There’s no doubt that Gina Prince-Bythewood’s historical epic derives its strength from the terrific cast.   Viola Davis is a tour de force but with so many good performances, this is an ensemble piece whose strength lies in numbers.

name: The Woman King
review: If you had any doubt that women over 55 can be fierce warriors, seeing Michelle Yeoh in Everything Everywhere All at Once and now Davis in The Woman King should disabuse you of that uncertainty.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King at once feels like a pleasantly nostalgic throwback to a bygone era where historical epics reigned supreme and a bold step in an exciting new direction.

name: The Woman King
review: This movie's true strength is in what says about the importance of female power today.

name: The Woman King
review: A huge spectacle... African in nature but universal in its depiction of greed, suppression and tyranny. A deft team of female artists have masterfully created a feminist allegory that will excite and inform movie lovers for years to come.

name: The Woman King
review: All you need to know about The Woman King: There’s Viola Davis, buff as an Olympian, a blood-stained panga machete slung over her shoulder, and an expression on her face that says, “Who’s next?”

name: The Woman King
review: One of the best films of the year and an exhilarating movie-going experience! The direction, acting and overall execution elevates this contained blockbuster to award-season frontrunner. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: A welcome widening of history...

name: The Woman King
review: There's a lot going on in here... you want more time in this world. It's not completely brisk, but it feels like there's something else missing.

name: The Woman King
review: t’s worth checking out for Davis’ performance alone, and the rest will hopefully garner enough attention to ensure it becomes the classic it deserves to be.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King weaves story into history and brings to life the oft-forgotten prowess of this strong, female troop ... Even the staunchest fan of that Mel Gibson Scot movie will warm up to the new warrior king in town.

name: The Woman King
review: Where “The Woman King” excels is in tackling sisterhood, submission and defiance, while putting on a display of brute, female force.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis and Thuso Mbedu are spectacular together, and the choreography showcased during some of these fights scenes is fantastic. This is an awe-inspiring experience that will have you on the edge of your seat.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is one of the year’s best films!

name: The Woman King
review: Led by beautiful performances, including award-worthy work from Viola Davis, The Woman King is a must-watch historical epic and needs to be experienced on the largest screen possible.

name: The Woman King
review: The visual richness brought forth by Gina Prince-Bythewood doesn't quite salvage the simpleness of the premise. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Woman King
review: "...many of these details that stick out like a sore thumb to me are things most audiences may be unaffected by. The Woman King does a good enough job at curating rousing moments that many will find it easy to forgive or overlook the film’s flaws."

name: The Woman King
review: The battle scenes are beautifully mounted and really compelling.

name: The Woman King
review: There is such muscularity, athleticism, and ballet [to the choreography]. It is just great.

name: The Woman King
review: I’ve truly never experienced anything like it, as it manages to be both intimate and epic while staging some of the finest action sequences you will see this year. I can easily see this one cracking my Top 10 of the year list.

name: The Woman King
review: With a swaggering walk and steely gaze, Davis mixes indomitable will and commitment to principle.

name: The Woman King
review: The results provide a thrilling blend of grand, old-school entertainment and impactful storytelling.

name: The Woman King
review: Directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood, who cannot be pigeonholed, the film is a throwback of sorts to the big, exciting, emotional warrior epics that used to be all too common at the multiplex, with the twist that it’s women not men driving the action.

name: The Woman King
review: A powerful film about sisterhood, family and unity that’s entertaining and educational.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is the rare Hollywood movie that’s honest about the trauma of sexual violence that isn’t simultaneously rife with violently depressing storytelling.

name: The Woman King
review: Thanks to Prince-Bythewood, Stevens, and some truly superb performances, I cared deeply about these fierce, courageous women. And when that’s the case, it’s a lot easier to look past the film's blemishes.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s a well-crafted big screen event movie that stands out from this year’s pack of blockbusters for its context, if not for its content. And, frankly, that’s more than enough.

name: The Woman King
review: A rousing motion picture filled with well-choreographed battle scenes effectively folded into stories of human interest.

name: The Woman King
review: Gina Prince-Bythewood is up to the challenge of delivering a visually resplendent, crowd-pleasing spectacle that’s easy to recommend and even easier to love.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King has some genuine conflict, emotional weight and characters that aren't just 1-dimensional "strong female leads".

name: The Woman King
review: It’s awe-inspiring to see these women, particularly women of colour, radiating so much power and conviction that it emanates from the screen and washes over the audience.

name: The Woman King
review: As Nanisca, (Viola) Davis would give Keanu Reeves’ John Wick pause. She is a battle-scarred, muscular, no-nonsense leader who does not mollycoddle her troops nor fear speaking truth to power. ...

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is tailored for entertaining audiences.

name: The Woman King
review: Director Gina Prince-Blythewood and her production team create a meticulously detailed West African world with a story that's dramatically propelled by Viola Davis' intense performance.

name: The Woman King
review: Davis brings a melancholy to her character that’s more complicated than the movie around her aims to be.

name: The Woman King
review: Seeing these women in front of and behind the camera seize this opportunity to tell a little-known history of deep heroics is beyond valuable.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King filled with my spirit and soul as Viola Davis lead an all-star cast of Black woman to a historic, ground breaking cinematic triumph of epic proportions. Not to mention it being done in tandem with Nicole Brown and Gina Prince-Blythewood!!!

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis' performance puts an ordinary war movie in a class by itself...

name: The Woman King
review: A good cast and well-choreographed action can’t save the unfocused script or the dreadful cinematography.

name: The Woman King
review: A triumph! An exhilarating, empowering and rousing epic adventure grounded in humanity.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s this combination of the softer quiet moments and the large-scale blockbuster action-type sequences that makes The Woman King a film that will sweep audiences of all kinds into its tale.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a barn burner if you’re just looking for an invigorating night at the movies. But Prince-Bythewood’s real triumph is in grounding that sterling entertainment in a challenging dramatic text.

name: The Woman King
review: The temptation is to say it’s a David Lean-style adventure. It’s really a full-metal Gina Prince-Bythewood movie. Maybe "the" Gina Prince-Bythewood movie, given the way she’s marshaled all of her talents here.

name: The Woman King
review: A fresh female perspective and a rich cultural texture boost this otherwise formulaic war epic, highlighted by a deeply felt portrayal from Viola Davis.

name: The Woman King
review: Every actor involved delivers career-best work, which makes the film’s aesthetic failings all the more disappointing.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King overcomes the perils of its overstuffed script with a collection of performances that elevate the whole.

name: The Woman King
review: At the center, the true general, Prince-Bythewood, marshals every aspect of “The Woman King” in concert, conducting action, thrills and emotion beautifully. It is a remarkable, powerful film, and not to be missed.

name: The Woman King
review: Like Black Panther before it, The Woman King immerses us in African culture; only this time, it shifts the focus to real-life women and proves, without the corny factor, that we have always been warriors.

name: The Woman King
review: In a sea of soulless blockbuster action movies, it’s nice to see one with equal grit and soul. This is a triumphant historical epic where the quieter moments are as memorable as the rousing battle scenes. Viola Davis' magnum opus indeed.

name: The Woman King
review: While the movie’s treatment is surprisingly conventional, the tale of women empowered to own their own bodies couldn’t be timelier.

name: The Woman King
review: With The Woman King, director Gina Prince-Bythewood explores a neglected corner of history and has a ball doing it. Thanks to her quick pacing and impeccable staging of battle sequences, her enthusiasm is contagious.

name: The Woman King
review: The movie is a rip-roaring riposte to the evils of colonialism, and it had the boisterous crowd at last week’s Toronto festival world premiere clapping and stomping in approval. And tears? There wasn’t a damp eye in the house.

name: The Woman King
review: It is “Gladiator” or “Braveheart” but with a better lead and improved action. It is, hilariously, also almost a direct mirror of the plot from “Top Gun: Maverick.” Yet, for some reason, big fans of that movie aren’t as vocal proponents of this one…

name: The Woman King
review: Movies are at their best when they make you feel something, and I had tears in my eyes throughout The Woman King. Viola Davis's layered performance of stoicism and fierceness is one of her best, but it's the incredible Lashana Lynch who steals the movie.

name: The Woman King
review: This is an action spectacle with a beating heart.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s only thanks to Davis' considerable efforts that The Woman King holds together.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis is the central figure, Lashana Lynch steals the show, and John Boyega struts in director Gina Prince-Bythewood’s homage to African resistance and ‘90s historical epics.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a must-watch. An epic blockbuster unlike any other before it. From its amazing framing and visuals to its tightly directed story, it’s a riveting experience from beginning to end. It’s visceral, raw and groundbreaking in a lot of ways.

name: The Woman King
review: An action-packed, exciting, and even emotionally gripping tale.

name: The Woman King
review: A fierce Viola Davis headlines this historical epic about women warriors in 1823 West Africa and reminds us how truly inspiring it is to see these brave sisters doing it for themselves.

name: The Woman King
review: Gina Prince-Bythewood’s take on the historic warrior women of Africa is a superhero epic but with living, breathing, relatable humans. Fight sequences are epic, the emotional framework deep, anchored by Viola Davis as power personified.

name: The Woman King
review: Middling historical epic anchored by dynamite performances.

name: The Woman King
review: Davis’ performance, and the ferocious fight scenes, make The Woman King worth watching.

name: The Woman King
review: Tells an obscure lesson in African history that needed to be told.

name: The Woman King
review: “The Woman King” lets its excellent cast weave between hubris, shakiness, and strength, achieving not just richer representation but more thrilling fight scenes, too.

name: The Woman King
review: “The Woman King” is a dynamic epic that lives up to its regal title.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a quintessential historical action epic.

name: The Woman King
review: The film is a historical action epic that, for all the novelty of its setting and subservience to contemporary attitudes, traffics in a lot of cliché narrative beats and ideologies.

name: The Woman King
review: This movie is the breathtaking, entertaining and wildly necessary new king of that genre.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is an enthralling film, mostly thanks to some dynamic sequences and winning performances.

name: The Woman King
review: Complications of history aside, The Woman King is Black Panther minus the vibranium and with more women warriors, an empowerment tale fueled by kickassery, with battle scenes, ear-splitting ululated war cries and sword fights.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King proves to be anger-inducing and surprisingly uplifting. Dealing with those two emotions in a film with such hefty subject matter might seem contradictory, but actually, in The Woman King, they belong together.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s hard to understate how crushingly mediocre The Woman King is even comparison to its mid-budget historical epic kin.

name: The Woman King
review: That women can be powerful isn’t news, and Ms. Prince-Bythewood is so focused on making her Amazons amazing that she forgets to make them interesting.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is radical, radiant, and riveting.

name: The Woman King
review: See it as many times as your budget will allow, The Woman King gives us new heroes to cheer for and enough action to fuel new dreams.

name: The Woman King
review: Although it had me wondering about the real history, why shouldn't the ladies facing colonialists get their turn for revisionism? The action is decent & it's is one of the sweat-iest in memory, like a gladiator film. Warriors are doing it for themselves!

name: The Woman King
review: It tells an important story. But it's like the live-action version of a Disney animated film that does not exist (yet). Screenplay is shallow and at times silly.

name: The Woman King
review: Rises to the challenge of using an old-fashioned template to deliver a floodtide of exhilarating new images.

name: The Woman King
review: Despite being wobbly at times, in the end, this "King" finds its footing.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis and the cast overpower the film’s shortcomings to deliver a crowd-pleasing, new type of historical war epic.

name: The Woman King
review: ‘The Woman King’ dares to ask the question, “What if we gave Viola Davis a big sword?” More movies should do this.

name: The Woman King
review: So long as you don’t take it as a history lesson, “The Woman King” works as a brawny Hollywood action epic of the old school, though one with a slant you won’t have seen before.

name: The Woman King
review: The film... retains Prince-Blythewood’s commitment to character and to Black love, both platonic and romantic. It is her Hollywood opus, complete with the thrilling action set-pieces and swelling score to prove it.

name: The Woman King
review: The kinetic action adventure “The Woman King” is a sweeping entertainment, but it’s also a story of unwavering resistance in front of and behind the camera.

name: The Woman King
review: Never underestimate the power of a woman…especially Viola Davis. Director Gina Prince-Bythewood makes her fierce starring in this brutal, heart-pounding action epic.

name: The Woman King
review: Somehow, the film manages to feel like a throwback to the action movies of old while featuring people who were seldom allowed to occupy prominent roles back then.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is an excellently crafted historical epic, brought together by powerful performances, dynamic directing, and beautiful cinematography.

name: The Woman King
review: There’s not a lot wrong with it. It looks beautiful, the costumes are gorgeous, the fight scenes are terrific, and there is a nice bit of gore.

name: The Woman King
review: The film insists that real empowerment can only exist in a world other than our own. That’s a strikingly radical message.

name: The Woman King
review: The Agojie are regular women — though they are highly skilled ones who have endured arduous training. Their bodies are covered in scars. They die, they kill, they ache, they mourn — but they also laugh, dance and love. Gina Prince-Bythewood shows it all.

name: The Woman King
review: THE WOMAN KING is a magnificent film --- so utterly beautiful and powerful.

name: The Woman King
review: THE WOMAN KING is as exciting as it gets and as poignant as it is violent.

name: The Woman King
review: There’s not just fighting, but also traditional dances, chanting and singing, celebrating and mourning. You will not find a more colorful representation of African life that has nothing to do with lynch porn. I cannot tell you how refreshing that is

name: The Woman King
review: The movie's existence is vital. Its execution, however, leaves a bit to be desired.

name: The Woman King
review: Could have used less of the turgid melodrama that clutters up so many other period pieces.

name: The Woman King
review: For me, bringing the story of Nanisca and the Agojie to modern younger audiences is just as much an achievement as creating such an emotionally powerful film.

name: The Woman King
review: What we really want to see is an athletic Viola Davis wielding a curved blade and vanquishing her foes. And when we see her in action, “The Woman King” is bloody marvelous!

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King”is a character driven epic, one that tempers the rousing action scenes with powerful interpersonal relationships to keep us engaged. It feels like an old-fashioned action movie, but with a fresh and fascinating update.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis owns “The Woman King,” a movie every bit as majestic and monumental as its title implies.

name: The Woman King
review: This is a film driven by what makes its characters and conflicts tick. It’s freely fictionalized, and some of it’s overpacked. But “The Woman King” feels human-made, not machine-learned.

name: The Woman King
review: While the film features many scenes of battleground melees with swords and axes swinging and connecting, the violence in this story resides more in the human heart than in any weapon.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis towers in a fierce and gut-wrenching portrayal of courage. The Woman King is literally unlike any film I have seen.  Davis and a sublime supporting cast grace a sweeping narrative that touches many difficult issues.

name: The Woman King
review: Offering complicated substance along with its spectacle, The Woman King is a thrilling film that will no doubt be a crowd-pleaser.

name: The Woman King
review: Equally a thrilling historical epic and an intimate character study, it's both familiar and fresh with a superb ensemble cast and stellar production values.

name: The Woman King
review: The epic story of African women warriors (aka Virgin Warriors) led by General Nanisca (the force known as Viola Davis) is Wonder Woman, Black Panther & The Ten Commandments rolled into a larger than life historical action drama.

name: The Woman King
review: Phenomenal, strong awards contender for sure. A complex film with both great action & compelling drama, it doesn't shy away from the horrors of slavery & Africa's part in those atrocities. Probably the role of Davis' career, surrounded by a stellar cast.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a winning combination of drama and thrilling action.

name: The Woman King
review: Surface-level feminist subtext gives [The Woman King] a pass to indulge the same conventional clichés as other films of its ilk...[but] the formulaic action and predictable storytelling beats...are now in service of a lot of Disney-fied girlboss energy.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is yet more proof that, given the opportunity, women can perform as well — if not better — than their male counterparts at stereotypically male pursuits.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s about mothers and daughters, about strength and power, and it is an absolute triumph. The Woman King stands above the rest.

name: The Woman King
review: This film has a fire in its belly. But more importantly, it also has a heart full of love: love of life, love of freedom, love of Black people and culture, and love for its ferocious, complicated, brave women.

name: The Woman King
review: Never underestimate the power of a woman, and that advice goes double when it comes to the powerhouse that is Viola Davis.

name: The Woman King
review: Whatever the occasional weaknesses of the script, "The Woman King" is never not engaging. The stakes are high and the villains clear, with enough dramatic subtlety to deepen the well of nuance.

name: The Woman King
review: An exciting filmic experience full of action, feeling and many scenes of the great Viola Davis proving that she can kick butt as well as she can kick hearts. Full review in Spanish.

name: The Woman King
review: Nobody will question the rousing cinematic throw-downs, but “The Woman King” offers little in the way of the honest and intimate character beats a movie like this needs in order to elevate it beyond the scope of the blunt and bloody action sequences.

name: The Woman King
review: A well-acted, superbly made historical action flick that could easily serve as an inspiration for many in the same way we’ve seen from other films like it.

name: The Woman King
review: A breathtaking, creative and powerful film.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is the rare action drama that delivers both the sizzle and the steak.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood is extremely focused on making a mostly overlooked tale of honor and dedication feel enormous and emotional.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King made me think of classic films like Spartacus and how they don’t make movies like this anymore. Then it also made me realize that they’ve never made movies like this for women of color, [. . .] a fresh take on a classic historical epic.

name: The Woman King
review: A spirited and often thrilling action epic elevated by the regal, rigorous commitment of star Viola Davis.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King might on occasion follow something of a formula, but it's used to great effect, with terrific action, great performances, and a hefty story told with a deft hand.

name: The Woman King
review: With its epic tale of the solidarity that grows between the Dahomey as they battle against enslavement and exploitation, The Woman King illustrates, with stunning grace, how sisterhood can be more than dangerous and powerful.

name: The Woman King
review: As The Woman King builds tension, it gains momentum while telling a unique story that is grand in scale, emotional at heart, and well executed.

name: The Woman King
review: Davis -- fierce and formidable, bruised and battle-scarred -- is a revelation...She proves that you don't have to look like Scarlett Johansson to be a female action hero.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood delivers the best film of her career thus far.

name: The Woman King
review: While the story feels familiar, the perspective from which it is told is entirely fresh, making for a rare character-driven action epic that’s exhilarating and wholly unique in today’s cinematic landscape.

name: The Woman King
review: It's frustratingly bloodless and narratively sanitized, but still with rousing, chest-beating action sequences and dynamite, powerful exchanges between Viola Davis and Thuso Mbedu

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a big, broad action epic that’s designed to be a crowd-pleaser.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis showcases why she is such a powerhouse actor, displaying both fierce strength and heartfelt softness. Lashana Lynch, Sheila Atim, and Thuso Mbedu are the standouts, bringing an energy to the narrative that makes this a must-see movie.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood offers audiences some interesting visuals and manages to make the fight scenes bloody and savage while not overselling the violence.

name: The Woman King
review: A bold film that defies stereotypes and cliches, circumventing the obvious and giving us surprises and plot twists. Flawed human heroes without supernatural gifts, fighting evil and their own shortcomings to achieve a common goal—what a concept!

name: The Woman King
review: On one level, this is just a rousing Saturday-matinee action-adventure; on another, it carries the weight of everything Davis has done... and every page of Black history – Black women’s history – that hasn’t been told on this scale and in this medium.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is seriously entertaining action and packs an emotional punch.

name: The Woman King
review: An African female warrior epic. Viola Davis handles an action hero role as deftly as she handles Oscar-nominated drama.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s stirring but slightly stodgy, designed to stand the test of time.

name: The Woman King
review: Prince-Bythewood's directing style encompasses the perfect balance of action and drama.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a sturdy, rousing piece of studio entertainment, that makes both the new feel old and the old feel new.

name: The Woman King
review: It’s an oft-told tale, yes, but here imparted with a fresh angle and a meaningful moral.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a film that has the confidence to be completely sincere in both the sharp moments of humor and the stunning battle sequences.

name: The Woman King
review: “The Woman King” marks a ceasefire between two long-warring foes: Action and acting.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King” is more than an action movie. It’s a film that depicts a side of African history that is rarely told and an opportunity for Black people to assert their humanity and regality.

name: The Woman King
review: Thrilling and enrapturing, emotionally beautiful and spiritual buoyant, The Woman King isn’t just an uplifting battle cry. It’s the movie Prince-Bythewood has been building toward throughout her entire career.

name: The Woman King
review: Viola Davis, who plays General Nanisca, called this film her magnum opus. And I would add that this indeed is the greatest performance of her career. Oscar voters everywhere should take note.

name: The Woman King
review: Consider the overall rating an average: The Woman King is an 8/10 for entertainment value, and 4/10 for how it deals with history.

name: The Woman King
review: Fierce, furious and feminine...an action picture that isn’t so much “released” as “unleashed." Talk about a movie of its moment.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King leans toward fantasy in its heroic moments, but is rooted in truth about war, brutality and freedom. It is a splashy popcorn movie with a social conscience.

name: The Woman King
review: Energetic performances and technical precision come together to glorious effect in Prince-Bythewood’s rousing action film. It’s a lush, prime piece of entertainment in many respects.

name: The Woman King
review: The film is bursting with remarkable elements: a vivid and fully realized setting, eye-popping battle sequences (pushing that PG-13 rating to wild ends), richly drawn characters, and wonderful performances from everyone.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King delves into untold history for an effective action epic.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is sometimes cluttered and uneven, but the movie's compelling performances, gripping action, and inspiring personal stories can keep most viewers interested. Viola Davis is the movie's title character and should have been in more scenes.

name: The Woman King
review: The Woman King is a fantastic film that not only shows exactly why Gina Prince-Blythewood should helm action and drama alike, but also that Viola can easily best any action star on the screen.

name: The Woman King
review: A rousing historical drama with great characters.

name: The Woman King
review: Extremely entertaining - Viola Davis totally reinvents herself in this one. A fascinating story beautifully brought to the screen.

name: Till
review: It’s a courageous movie that gathers strength as it ages, with the tone producing an eerily horror effect that doesn’t lift for most of the movie. Deadwyler stuns in a role that could have been chewed up. She digs in.

name: Till
review: A searing civil rights drama that is as beautiful as it is heartbreaking — and as difficult to watch at times as it feels necessary.

name: Till
review: Documents like this film contribute to the education about racism and its new forms. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Till
review: There is enough here in craft to emphasise Chukwu’s gifts. Even when the language of the film feels too knowing or on the nose, Till also feels actively engaged in thinking through dynamics of how history plays out on film.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler delivers an outstanding performance as Mamie, reflecting the character’s emotional journey.

name: Till
review: Till isn’t easy to watch, it’s not meant to be. But it is required viewing.

name: Till
review: [This] bold depiction of the events broils with a fury that lays to rest any concerns of a dull-but-worthy affair

name: Till
review: A sensational acting showcase for Deadwyler, as Mamie shifts from devastated mother to reluctant activist.

name: Till
review: It's a movie that makes you feel good when it should make you feel lousy.

name: Till
review: Till treats the spectacle of pain with respect, and makes the case for its power to build solidarity and enact change.

name: Till
review: It's an unusual historical drama that manages to be both deeply moving and hugely inspirational without ever giving into sentiment.

name: Till
review: …Danielle Deadwyler’s huge leading performance should ensure that Till has a permanent shelf-life as a record of the agony that racism can create…

name: Till
review: These and other events are capably captured in Chukwu’s compassionate biographical drama that, though not without its flaws, stays with you long after the credits roll.

name: Till
review: Chukwu prefers humans to saints and fluid film-making is her thing.

name: Till
review: Chinonye Chukwu, working with a talented and mostly flawless cast, has established the film’s venomously racist Jim Crow-era milieu so profoundly that the exchange bristles with shock and sickening dread.

name: Till
review: ‘He came home to me reeking of racial hatred,’ carries the click of a screenwriter’s keyboard, not the ring of authentic dialogue. Never mind. This is a powerful film...

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler’s performance puts you in the shoes of Mamie, before, during and after the lynching of her son by white supremacists and it’s a very moving place to be.

name: Till
review: Chukwu doesn’t compromise the narrative for sentimentality...Till is a brutally honest portrayal of American racism and the moving portrait of a woman whose pain drove her to help others.

name: Till
review: Chukwu asks us to look beyond individual legal outcomes and see the bigger picture – to take strength from tragedy and find hope even in despair.

name: Till
review: Against the distress, Chukwu and Deadwyler find purpose in Mamie’s transformation into a hugely influential civil rights activist. This is a woman’s account of striving for racial justice.

name: Till
review: Till is a tough watch but a strong reminder of the vital contribution black women played in the civil rights movement and in bringing the racist crimes to public awareness.

name: Till
review: Till honours something more important: the power of a picture that speaks the truth.

name: Till
review: A grim film but an important one.

name: Till
review: Till is a compelling, unflinching, poignant but insightful account .. Chukwu skilfully interweaves a delicate balance between the pain and anguish ... and the sentiments of familial joy ... powerful storytelling

name: Till
review: ... An absorbing, slow-burning study of a broken woman’s politicisation. She is superbly served by star Danielle Deadwyler, who transforms Till from a good film into a gripping one.

name: Till
review: Without downplaying the violence of the social system in which this story takes place, Chukwu also takes care to celebrate the love within the extended Till family and the beauty of the Southern landscape.

name: Till
review: Well worth your time, especially if this story is a blind spot.

name: Till
review: Till is a fierce portrait of courage and a sombre study of the human cost involved in resisting this kind of barbarity.

name: Till
review: There are none of the big set piece speeches traditionally associated with winning awards. Instead we are presented with something which feels much more raw and natural.

name: Till
review: A detailed portrait of a political awakening through pain, one built around Mamie’s realisation that the racism she’s internalised as an independent city dwelling woman who’s fled the South can’t be buried or ignored...

name: Till
review: It isn’t a comfortable watch. Nor should it be. By the end, you may feel ashamed of the colour of your own skin, but it’s an essential film, telling a story that continues to reverberate with both dignity and an insistence on being heard and seen.

name: Till
review: [Danielle] Deadwyler's pain is palpable.

name: Till
review: Chinonye Chukwu's film leads with good intentions and dives into the roots of a mother's pain in order to build a heartbreaking epic that has no intention of concealing its militant message. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Till
review: Is a very hard film to watch, but it has one of the Best Female performance of 2022 from Danielle Deadwyler! The storytelling, the history, the acting, cinematography, one of the best scores this year & such a powerful telling of the Mother of Emmett Till

name: Till
review: Till is a must see for many reasons, but it is Deadwyler’s quiet, controlled and luminous performance that balances the horror and magnitude of the story.

name: Till
review: Till only thrives as a dramatic experience when Deadwyler is activated and humanizing it (which is thankfully much of the picture).

name: Till
review: The Nigerian-born director is totally committed to her subject, but I’m convinced that the power of the film doesn’t totally match the power of the message.

name: Till
review: The screenplay, by Michael Reilly, Keith Beauchamp and Chinonye Chukwu is taut and powerful. Writer-Director Chinonye Chukwu keeps the story simple and direct, avoiding the kinds of clutter and side issues that sometimes creep into historical dramas.

name: Till
review: An emotional and harrowing experience, anchored by Deadwyler's incredible performance — quite a revelation. Full review in Spanish.

name: Till
review: Chukwu is intentionally centering the Black experience with every frame. We need only see the pain inflicted and the strength to endure it. Just like Mamie with her son's body, TILL ensures we cannot look away.

name: Till
review: Doubtlessly, this will be the first time many viewers learn anything about Emmett Till. But it’s better late than never when it comes to this accessible film.

name: Till
review: Till is truly a gigantic opportunity for any professional, and Deadwyler has embraced it tooth and nail. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Till
review: The historical drama rises to a greater height because of the spirited Oscar type of performance by Deadwyler.

name: Till
review:
It’s tough to watch, but a must-see. 
It’s cinematic history.

name: Till
review: Inspiring and touching story of a Black mother whose bearing witness catalyzed the civil rights movement.

name: Till
review: For Chukwu, Till is another victory, even if it can’t quite match Clemency in power.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler is the heart and soul of this remarkable film.

name: Till
review: It is an honest depiction of an American tragedy. It forces us to remember a time that many would prefer to forget.

name: Till
review: The filmmakers are incapable of calling on the strongest dramatic forms, of drawing on the noblest ideas—above all, they are not interested in making a universal appeal.

name: Till
review: A reminder about a ghastly part of American history.

name: Till
review: An emotionally relentless story about a mother’s strength in the aftermath of an unspeakable tragedy. It carries with it a message that continues to resonate to this day.

name: Till
review: Next to Cate Blanchett’s remarkable incarnation of an egomaniacal conductor in Tár, Deadwyler delivers the most essential and critical performance in a film this year.

name: Till
review: Till really belongs to actress Danielle Deadwyler.

name: Till
review: This is a difficult film to watch because you share in the grief of a mother and an entire group of people, but it is a necessary story that needs to be told.

name: Till
review: There’s no happy ending, but Till does end with a sense of hope. The murder of Emmett Till changed the way many Americans looked at race. At one point, Mamie asks God why this happened. By the end, we feel that through one boy’s death others might live.

name: Till
review: What is astounding about Chinonye Chukwu’s direction of Till is that so many different movie genres seem to be expertly woven together into one story.

name: Till
review: She's [Danielle Deadwyler] got something, and it's on full display in this film.

name: Till
review: A powerful and riveting bio-drama that brings a thoughtful approach to its subject matter with integrity and love.

name: Till
review: An impassioned melodrama on the surface, unafraid of facing tragedy head-on and allowing ample space for grief, anger, and fear, but which is also a wise movie about the complicatedly political world Mamie Till finds herself in.

name: Till
review: The film's feel and nobility is more through a filter of today than the actual 1950s, but it must be told, because the murderer motives still exist today. Passionate performances, especially from Danielle Deadwyler as Mamie Till-Mobley. Essential.

name: Till
review: There’s no denying the sense of loss and will that Deadwyler’s performance makes so vivid...

name: Till
review: Equally tough and restrained...

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler as Emmett Till's Mother in "Till" is a powerhouse performance for the ages. "Till" is engrossing, enraging, heart-wrenching and poignant. "Till" will stay with you forever.

name: Till
review: It may seem like a small thing, but scenes that allow Mamie to be in full focus have a much harder impact because of very deliberate camera choices.

name: Till
review: Till manages to avoid feeling overly reliant on the violence behind this brutal act. Instead, the focus is on the emotions that come from this tragedy, the fallout of this event, and the remarkable performance from Danielle Deadwyler.

name: Till
review: One of the most moving, and ultimately inspiring, movies about the Civil Rights Movement.

name: Till
review: Unquestionably memorable, Till breaks the traditional biopic mold through perspective and persistence by way of a mother’s journey.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler deserves an Oscar nomination, at the very least, for her portrayal of Mamie Till.

name: Till
review: The film is emotionally engaging as we watch Deadwyler masterfully go through several transformations in the film, from worrying parent to grieving mother to determined civil rights advocate.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler gives the breakout performance of the year as a Black activist mother who used the 1955 lynching of her son Emmett Till to galvanize the civil-rights movement. Chinonye Chukwu crafts this emotional powerhouse into essential viewing.

name: Till
review: "Till" spares us the visual horror of Emmett's murder, but the pain of his death is felt in every single frame and in the emotionally raw and revelatory performance of Danielle Deadwyler, whose name should be on every awards season ballot.

name: Till
review: While the dramatic pacing is conventional to a fault, “Till” is a wrenching portrait of grief as well as a sobering history lesson.

name: Till
review: Get ready to ugly cry ... 'Till' is a gut punch ... Deadwyler nails it every time.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler is impressive and her dedication and eloquence in this role does justice to Chukwu’s script and to the memory of Emmett Till.

name: Till
review: Till is a powerful movie. Its strength rises not just from the story of racism it tells, for the background story has been told often, and not just from its unique perspective, but also from its stunning presentation in film form.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler was new to me when I saw her in Till. Her performance as Emmett Till’s mother is everything for this conscientious-to-a-fault drama.

name: Till
review: Compelling and absolutely heartbreaking, with a terrific star-making turn for Danielle Deadwyler.

name: Till
review: What distinguishes Till from most other well-intentioned films telling similarly themed stories set during this tumultuous era of American history is the absence of white saviors.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler is hypnotic, a formidable presence as a woman who endures the unendurable and then alters history.

name: Till
review: The story of Till cannot be told without the incredible performance from Deadwyler. She delivers an instantly classic performance that hammers home the emotion. The raw vulnerability on display cannot be forgotten after you leave the theater.

name: Till
review: In creating this visceral picture, Deadwyler anchors moments of defiance and activism with scenes where the loss of her son is immeasurable. Those fluctuating qualities make it one of the best acting performances this year.

name: Till
review: It’s but one aspect of Deadwyler’s performance which is such that “powerful” is an insufficient term to describe it.

name: Till
review: An engrossing Civil Rights drama that could turn its little-known star into an Oscar winner.

name: Till
review: Ultimately and unfortunately, Till is a film that covers important events, but doesn’t quite feel like it adds enough to the story to be an important film.

name: Till
review: In the film’s most telling and effective scene, a distant still shot at night is accompanied by audio of muted blows and reactionary screams. This is (sadly) the high point of Chukwu’s cumulative narrative.

name: Till
review: Though not a wholly successful film, Till is worth the watch for  [Danielle] Deadwyler’s performance. She will likely be a factor in awards season.

name: Till
review: The story told in Till happened a long time ago, but the lessons to be learned from it still apply today. The fight for civil rights endures, and as long as there is racial injustice in the world, films like this will need to still be made.

name: Till
review: Please give Danielle Deadwyler the Oscar as soon as possible. Her performance brought out all of my emotions.

name: Till
review: “Till” is a quintessential Good For You movie, but it’s also a good movie, rich with detail and beautifully directed...

name: Till
review: Deadwyler delivers an incredible performance that will be talked about through Oscar season and beyond. It’s crafted of equal parts grief and resilience, so strong it might have been baked in a kiln.

name: Till
review: There are a lot of familiar faces in Till, but the film’s effectiveness depends on two factors: Deadwyler’s performance and Chukwu’s direction. The two go hand in glove.

name: Till
review: You have to witness Danielle Deadwyler's performance.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler is a dynamo in this career-defining and awards-beckoning role, as she evolves from a woman of caution into a fearless fighter for civil rights.

name: Till
review: As Emmett's mother, Danielle Deadwyler delivers a searing, heart wrenching performance sure to be in the running in awards season.

name: Till
review: Chukwu delivers a somewhat uneven film but one that comes through with its requisite powerful moments, thanks in no small part to the stirring performance of Danielle Deadwyler.

name: Till
review: As hard as "Till" may be to watch at times, it must be seen not only for the story it tells but to appreciate all that Deadwyler brings to the screen. She is a revelation.

name: Till
review: An unusually thoughtful movie about our willingness to look beyond what might be reasonably expected of us, even as “Till” unavoidably can’t help contradicting its own ideas.

name: Till
review: Till remembers a too-recent crime with elegance, respect, and unflinching honesty.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler delivers one of the best performances of the year.

name: Till
review: While more conscientious than inspired it carries immense power, both on its own terms and in the shattering performance of Danielle Deadwyler.

name: Till
review: Till is a movie I can see playing in schools for years to come

name: Till
review: “Till” feels slightly old fashioned, usually in a good way.

name: Till
review: While Till is conventional in its cinematic design and production, the intensely human performances carry it forward.

name: Till
review: ...it does something that few films are able to achieve: It inspires.

name: Till
review: The strength of this movie comes not only from the performances, but also in the patience of the storytelling, allowing the audience to be enveloped in the emotion, and forced to confront it before moving on in the narrative.

name: Till
review: Till” makes the dark side of American history personal, bringing home the wrenching pain of an infamous racist crime through the eyes of a mother.

name: Till
review: The movie walks the line between historical record and urgent cry for action, but does so in an elegant film anchored by a remarkable performance. As Mamie, Deadwyler is a mix of love, grief and fury in a performance that vibrates with authenticity.

name: Till
review: Sometimes the love between a mother and son is so strong it doesn’t die, even after death. That’s what audiences will see here. That’s what they will take away. A love and strength that endures.

name: Till
review: A film that offers a stinging historical reminder of America’s history of racial injustice at a time where some are seeking to prevent that history from being taught.

name: Till
review: Till favors convention, sticking to familiar beats even in a story that forced people to open their eyes.

name: Till
review: Mamie Till-Mobley is just one of countless Black mothers in America who have lost children to hate crimes. "Till" painfully reminds us that we're still waiting for justice in the majority of these cases.

name: Till
review: For the second film running, Chukwu has given a black actress one heck of a showcase.

name: Till
review: At the centre of it all is Deadwyler, who shoots straight from a rising star to a fully established one with her performance as Mamie.

name: Till
review: It's never easy to watch an upsetting story of painful loss, but Till handles the depiction of grief in an empathetic and authentic manner.

name: Till
review: The tragic story of Emmett Till and his mother’s fight for justice finally gets the cinematic treatment, featuring an incredibly powerful first act and a heart-breaking closing ten minutes.

name: Till
review: “Till” confirms Chukwu as an actor’s director and should establish Deadwyler as a major presence in movies.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler... instantly cements her status as one of the most exciting performers working today.

name: Till
review: What Danielle Deadwyler does as Mamie is nothing short of what should win the Oscar.

name: Till
review: Through Deadwyler’s powerful performance, viewers will feel the palpable fear of Black mothers knowing they can never fully protect their Black children in white America.

name: Till
review: While it eschews the familiar rhythms of the biopic, it’s never able to commit to being about Mamie’s journey as deeply as it would like to be.

name: Till
review: "Till" is a mother’s story through and through and rarely ever leaves the lead actress’s pendulum of steadiness and trembles.

name: Till
review: Till is an affirmation of just how much Emmett Till’s life mattered, and continues to matter long beyond his last breath.

name: Till
review: This film will put a knot in your stomach from the very beginning.

name: Till
review: A clear example of how films should represent stories this sensitive and important. Not with an intent to somehow trick audiences into thinking we've moved past all this.

name: Till
review: a true achievement of filmmaking to create an emotional, affecting portrait of a mother and an unlikely civil rights pioneer, and to pay loving tribute to the life and death of Emmett Till.

name: Till
review: Anchored by Danielle Deadwyler’s towering performance, it’s a wrenching portrayal of reluctant heroism under the most horrific of parental circumstances.

name: Till
review: A riveting and deeply felt performance by Danielle Deadwyler brings depth and conviction to a surface-level retelling that's most powerful in its quieter, more intimate and reflective moments.

name: Till
review: Chukwu, Beauchamp, and Deadwyler have created a sensitive and compelling look at a horrific moment in American history.

name: Till
review: The film feels overlong and the portrait of Mamie Till-Mobley strays into adulation, but go to see Danielle Deadwyler's powerful performance.

name: Till
review: It bridges the past and 2022, when the Emmett Till Antilynching Act defined lynching as a hate crime.

name: Till
review: Till is strong stuff, but it might have been even more moving and less medicinal in effect if its 130 minutes were a bit less narrowly focused.

name: Till
review: She’s an indelible force playing an indelible figure—a role and a person that Deadwyler doesn’t imitate, but rather embodies.

name: Till
review: As Mamie Till, the previously little-known actress Danielle Deadwyler gives an astonishing performance, shimmering first with tenderness and later with the kind of agony no mother should ever have to contemplate, much less bear.

name: Till
review: “Till” is a work of mighty cinematic portraiture, with a range of closeups of Mamie that infuse the film with an overwhelming combination of subjective depth and an outward sense of purpose.

name: Till
review: It’s that intriguing, thematically conflicting execution, along with Deadwyler’s warts-and-all performance, that keeps Till from sliding into relentless melodrama and eventually becoming an effective (and affecting) story of true, Black trauma.

name: Till
review: Mrs. Bradley is played with infinite grace and dignity by Danielle Deadwyler in a performance that is one of the most thrilling of the year.

name: Till
review: Quietly stunning scenes emerge throughout.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler... brings a haunted immediacy to Mamie even when the screenplay doesn't rise to meet her, grief and fury and fierce dignity passing across her face in annihilating waves.

name: Till
review: Chukwu revisits the past while doing something extremely difficult. She makes this grim American history insistently of the moment — and she does so by stripping the story down to its raw, harrowing emotional core.

name: Till
review: Chukwu has shown a great knack for collaboration with actors and drawing marvelous performances out of them (see Alfre Woodard and Aldis Hodge’s staggering work in Clemency). She evidences it again with Deadwyler in Till.

name: Till
review: The film's point isn't to recount the cold, hard facts of historical record. It's to bring us closer to [Mamie] Till-Mobley in these moments of uncertainty, agony, and strength...

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler makes powerful choices as Chicago’s Mamie Till-Mobley.

name: Till
review: Propelled by Deadwyler’s unforgettable portrayal, “Till” leaves us with a sense of an indictment still unanswered in 2022.

name: Till
review: It’s the specific way Chukwu maps out and steers us through the terrible events that gives “Till” its stark and sometimes revelatory power.

name: Till
review: This restrained biopic is one of the most thoughtful to come out of Hollywood in recent years.

name: Till
review: Till will go down as one of the most powerful and important films to hit the screen in 2022, Danielle Deadwyler is unforgettable, and the film has a voice that needs to be heard more.

name: Till
review: Tells an epic story in simple, unfussy strokes, an important film more concerned with building a feeling of dread than in dazzling us with fireworks.

name: Till
review: Till isn't always an easy film to watch, though in a world where we debate whether truths should be taught Till is a film that demands to be seen and it demands to be experienced.

name: Till
review: Till' is one of the best movies of 2022. It is ... a chronicle of mother love. It’s also a tribute to Mamie Till Mobley’s heart-wrenching step of sharing her personal grief, opening the eyes of the world to her senseless and devastating loss.

name: Till
review: Chinonye Chukwu's heartbreaking retelling of the foul murder of Emmett Till and his mother's courageous fight to not let it pass is among the year's best dramas.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler gives a career-making performance as Mamie, perfectly poised between grief and strength. The film, which is dedicated to Mamie, ultimately belongs to her.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler’s ‘a mother knows’ court testimony is the stuff Oscar clips derive from, a powerfully moving, emotional speech.

name: Till
review: Till is a reverent historical drama that falls into some of its genre's tropes, but it's the film's raw and gritty moments that make it a cut above the rest.

name: Till
review: Over-produced, by-the-numbers and heavy-handed, but genuinely heartfelt. It's elevated tremendously by Danielle Deadwyler's breakthrough, Oscar-worthy performance.

name: Till
review: Deadwyler, who might be unrecognizable to those who first saw her in last year’s The Harder they Fall, is the model of poise, and grace, and sadness, and righteous fury.

name: Till
review: The movie is so emotionally exhausting (there are times where Deadwyler herself seems understandably drained) that audiences may be cried out well before a final moment of tearjerking grace. It’s a weepie of righteous anger.

name: Till
review: Many of us know the story, but how you heed the warnings is to tell the entire scope of it. It’s those principles that bring this film’s relevancy into the social climate of today.

name: Till
review: With a stunningly raw performance from Danielle Deadwyler, Chinonye Chukwu’s Till lives in the body of a traditional biopic, but it turns real events into regretful, wistful memories, with a camera that refuses to look away from a mother’s pain.

name: Till
review: A revelatory, star-making layered, and potent turn from Danielle Deadwyler chronicles Mamie Till Mobley from grief to trailblazing civil rights activist

name: Till
review: Rising to challenge viewers’ qualms about the movie’s existence is Deadwyler, whose stirring performance may be reason enough to see the film.

name: Till
review: If nothing else, see it for Danielle Deadwyler’s incredible performance. She truly is unforgettable.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler takes all of that pressure, pain, and misery and transforms that into a powerful performance that anchors the entire film.

name: Till
review: The heartbreaking and inspiring drama Till admirably tells the true story of Mamie Till-Mobley and how she not only fought for justice for her murdered son, Emmett Till, but also how she was an often-overlooked pioneer in the U.S. civil rights movement.

name: Till
review: Till is a fairly standard historical biopic but a strong showcase for the talents of Danielle Deadwyler.

name: Till
review: It is hard to see Till as anything but one of the year's strongest films. A heartbreaking yet inspiring look at resilience and the real-life horrors of racism, Till is not an easy feature to digest but is one absolutely worthwhile.

name: Till
review: Not only effectively highlights racial history, but also the grief a mother feels after experiencing the loss of her child (who Danielle Deadwyler brings to life).

name: Till
review: It’s that kind of rich detail, regarding Deadwyler’s star-making performance and the deliberateness of the creative choices, that makes “Till” such an assured and daring, well-calibrated feature by Chukwu.

name: Till
review: Few performances stick with you the way Danielle Deadwyler’s does in “Till.” As Mamie Till-Mobley, the mother of Emmett Till, who was famously beaten so horribly while visiting cousins in Mississippi that he was near-unrecognizable, Deadwyler is a force.

name: Till
review: The film has a powerful weapon in its arsenal in Danielle Deadwyler’s transfixing performance as a broken woman who finds formidable strength within herself.

name: Till
review: In her terrific performance as the mother of Emmett Till, Danielle Deadwyler wrestles a ghastly American tragedy into a story of resilience crucial to the civil rights movement.

name: Till
review: Important history told seriously, real people rendered sensitively. There is a purpose in that.

name: Till
review: Till may be brutally devastating to watch but the film--powerful performances and all--is essential viewing.

name: Till
review: This magnificent performance elevates Deadwyler to the ranks of the great actors of our time.

name: Till
review: The film taps into to a deeper well of emotions than most biopics.

name: Till
review: Danielle Deadwyler is a force to be reckoned with as Mamie Till, capturing a mother’s anguish, pain, and bravery.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A joyous juxtaposition of quotidian, vérité-style dialogue and fancifully inventive visuals that hits a tragicomic sweet spot.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Charming animated tale of a bereft one-inch shell overdoes the sentiment.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell could so easily have been irritating, and does lapse into sentimentality at times, but it achieves remarkable depths of emotion, and has much to say about the meaning and importance of family.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: No emotion is forced, but, as we move towards a touching denouement, even Teflon psyches will find themselves opening up to the oddest of outsiders.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The film is deftly done, unexpectedly moving and with a dash of Tony-Hart-and-Morph energy balanced by Zen ruminations on the interconnectedness of all things.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: For the opening half hour or so, I feared this hand-crafted oddity could become insufferably twee. But after a while, I stopped admiring the animation and was completely taken in by the characters.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: …If you only see one film about a mollusc this year, Marcel The Shell With Shoes on is the only show in town when it comes to snail tales…

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The animation, by the New York-based Chiodo brothers, is both witty in its make-do-and-mend aesthetic (the sentient Shreddies are a hoot) and sometimes dazzlingly intuitive. You don’t question the truth of it for a moment...

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: ... if you had told me I’d be moved to tears by the musings of a one-inch talking shell, I would have been concerned. And yet, I was. Because sometimes the best things do come in small packages.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Ultimately, Marcel the Shell with Shoes On, hits home in its comical and tender handling of collective grief and hope; something we can all relate to in the aftermath of a global lockdown.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: How Marcel copes with this shell-cracking stress forms a beautiful final act that’s tender but never twee thanks to adept comic timing and playful use of scale.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Delicate, yet resonant.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: For a slight, ninety-minute stop-motion animated movie to grapple with something like grief, community, and family and to do it so well, to so keenly observe all of that, is something special.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: This feel-good animated gem is one of the most delightful, most creative surprises of the year, introducing audiences to an utterly charming title character — voiced to perfection by Jenny Slate — who, like the film itself, is impossible not to love.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It takes an effort of will to remember that Marcel doesn’t exist. He’s not big enough to hug … but I sort of felt like it.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Further proof that YouTube characters seldom translate into feature length efforts.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Funny, profound, weird, sad, and gorgeously constructed — Marcel is a true original, liable to melt even the most cynical heart.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel is cute, but it needs to be more. The effort is clearly there and Marcel is a kind film about universal themes.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: ... hilarious, sometimes dangerous, and always fascinating, a unique life outlook that doesn’t pull any punches... Rossellini’s tone and subtle digs as Connie is masterful voice work... it’s hard not to smile at the way a one-eyed shell sees the world.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The puppetry here is brilliantly done.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: More than anything, it’s a film about joy: joy in family, joy in friendship, and joy in the many wonders of life we often miss.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Sweet, endearing, happily silly, often hilarious and deeply insightful movie... an all-round gem.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: [The filmmakers] try to make everything so charming and adorable that, at times, this compulsion to ALWAYS be liked slightly works against the film. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Not really about the plot but just about being in the presence of the characters, in a filmmaking style that elicits a gentle and innocent response... Felt like I had a warm blanket around me. This is something the world needs right now.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The element of sorrow mixed in with all the whimsy feels genuine enough. And as a diversion for patient and soft-hearted children, and for adults willing to shelve their cynicism for 90 minutes,"Marcel" even at face value has a certain wispy charm.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: There's this ventriloquist dynamic between Marcel and Dean that is impossible to not sense. Everyone of us has been Marcel at one point of our lives, with a personality so big that it does not fit our tiny bodies. Beautiful film. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Its a film about a loss soul, finding  your place, it has darkness and deals with death and grief... I adored this.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel The Shell With Shoes On is so wholesome and pure with some truly laugh out loud moments of humor and sweetness.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: By focusing its gentle humour and storytelling pathos on that deceptively simple message - that just being “good” is enough in a huge and often meaningless existence - the Marcel movie stands far taller than its weeny protagonist.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Enlivened by its adorable repurposing of household objects – sliced bread is a mattress, stray lint is a pet dog, tennis balls are cars – the film is cute without ever being cutesy.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The movie offers 90 minutes of poignant whimsy, all of it inducing genuine laughter and tears. If it doesn’t move you, I fear nothing will.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The film is so wise and tender and emotionally touching that even when the story ended, I wanted more. There are no missteps here.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Adorable, affecting and amazingly inventive, "Marcel the Shell with Shoes On" is unlike any film I've seen this year.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Imaginative, charming and beyond adorable.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Looking for a school holiday cinematic hero? Meet Marcel the Shell with Shoes On (and yes the one-inch tall character’s description is all in that title).

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The hybrid live-action/animated film is still an integrated experience; a story told many times before, but here given fresh wings and a shell to work upon.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It's an utterly charming, (mostly) stop-motion adventure of the soul with genuine laugh-out-loud moments and heartwarming drama to keep us invested in moments big and small.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On gels on the big screen making for a surprisingly swell animated feature film.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Love Jenny Slate’s raspy voice that gives the animated character its soul. What Marcel lacks in body mass, he more than makes up for it in irresistible charm and spunk.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A charming, understated, idiosyncratic adventure for especially mature kids or especially winsome adults.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It's a whimsical, heartfelt look at community, friendship and longing. And sometimes, it's very, very funny.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel’s ability to express deep feelings is sure to melt the hearts of young and old folks alike.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It’s clever, it’s consistently funny and dances right on the edge of cutesy without falling in.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Perhaps guilty of being too melodramatic at times, with some plot looking for easy tears, but Slate's voice performance is so genuine that it ended up defeating my cynicism, helped by the organic chemistry between Marcel and Dan. Full review in Spanish

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Few films feature a character as wholesome as Marcel. What makes this film truly special, is it came at the perfect time. When society is collective feeling low admits a pandemic, Marcel The Shell with Shoes On leaves you feeling happier about life.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: I found Marcel's story poignant, heartwarming and uplifting. Other parts of it are bittersweet -- which is to say, it's just human.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On radiates feel-good sincerity where it counts most.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Hilarious and extremely sweet... a feel-good movie that’s not like anything you’ve seen before.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The seamless way Marcel’s world is integrated into the live action is what makes it so engaging and the themes of grief and resiliency so moving.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Proof that you can make a compelling movie about anything - a dog, a shell, a rock. All you have to do is write a story that people can relate to.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In these pandemic times, the film’s themes of finding connection and choosing adventure hit more like a much-needed panacea.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A cutesy animated film that plays like a short being overstretched

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Sincerity and craftsmanship of this form are uncommon, and Marcel will undoubtedly become a cult classic character and gem in A24’s crown for decades to come.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: There's really little to do with Marcel, except embrace and adore this former YouTube short sensation-turned sweet little feature.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On turns Marcel’s world-view into a grand philosophical statement without losing the heart and decency that made the shorts a viral sensation.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: (Jenny) Slate and (Dean) Fleischer-Camp have a deep, thorough understanding of this world, these inhabitants, and the correlation between what we hold inside and what we share outside.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: “Marcel the Shell” provides wisdom and comfort for viewers of every age as they manage life’s transitions. Slow down, observe, and appreciate, Marcel tells us. Wise words from a tiny mouth drawn on with a pencil.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In the end, this is a story about the need for connection, and it couldn’t come at a better time.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On” shows no matter how big or small you are, it doesn’t take much to make a difference. You just need to be yourself.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: a truly charming film that should win over even the world's biggest curmudgeons.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: 'Marcel the Shell' is a reminder that at times when you feel like life is a despair and there's nothing good coming around the corner, and you're trying to protect the little good that you have, there will be good around the corner again.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: If you are allergic to cuteness, then even the world’s best EpiPen won’t save you from Marcel the Shell with Shoes On.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Flat out marvelous. It’s hilarious, poignant, surprising, and life-affirming, to name but a few of my reactions. A simple, beautiful movie that you should make a point to see as soon as possible

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On” is a tender, sweet, and thought-provoking look at family, friendship, and life.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Funny, tender and whimsical, Marcel the Shell excels at tugging at heartstrings in just the right ways.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: This kid-friendly A24 movie is somehow whimsical, bittersweet, life-affirming and a little bit heartbreaking all at once. And that makes it the perfect movie for the moment.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In the end, the sentiment it so unabashedly proclaims trumps “Marcel’s” shortcomings.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On does an excellent job walking a tightrope of melancholy and perseverance with a smile on its face.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Like anything that's sweet, too much of Marcel can make you sick, and a 90-minute dose comes a bit too close for comfort.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: As much as this is a comedy, it’s an emotionally cathartic tearjerker about loss, change and maturity.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: If this sounds like a mixed bag review, have a raisin, because it is. There’s a lot I enjoyed. I was engaged by the story and a tiny bit frustrated by Marcel. I realize my tolerance for wee voices and a million questions is as shallow as sweat in a pore.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It’s a surprisingly touching and heartfelt movie that will appeal to older kids and adults.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On imagines an alternative world where characters and stories are born of sheer creativity and not recycled ideas based on selling children's toys.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: An adorable little film with big life-lessons.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It's safe to say you've never seen anything like Marcel the Shell with Shoes On before, but you'll be glad you did.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Camp and Slate have the experience of viral frame and the distance from that experience to offer perspectives like, “It’s an audience, it’s not a community.”

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: This movie feels like a warm hug in all the right ways. Truly uplifting, hilarious, compassionate.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: ‘Marcel’ could be described as a ‘Garfield’ and ‘Fantastic Mr. Fox’ combination that gently rolls around and splashes in pools of honey, marmalade, and frank, observational discourse, but the said explanation doesn’t do this endearing film justice.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel is the kind of film that I suspect Jim Henson would have loved: It's childlike, playful, hopeful and wise — and all of this without ever stooping to sentimentality.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: He’s a heartwarming and resonant character, and this is a delightful little film.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It’s a different kind of animated adventure, to be sure, impressively done via stop-motion.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Somewhere, I suppose, there's a critic working up a venomous pan of this animated feature, based on the viral 2010 online short and its sequels. But I'm not that critic.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The performance of Slate, the excellent animation, and the uncynical storytelling makes Marcel the Shell with Shoes On the perfect balm in a summer dominated by blockbusters.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Adorable and almost relentlessly heartwarming, Marcel the Shell With Shoes On is some thoughtful all-ages fare that’ll win over the kids and their parents.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Fleischer-Camp makes a smashing fiction-film directorial debut with Marcel the Shell With Shoes On, and Slate shows once again that she’s one of the funniest people around with her lead vocal performance, much of it improvised.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The movie’s cloying sentimentality is balanced by its imaginative vigor and its wry shell’s-eye view of humanity.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: ...offered with such a gentle, quiet spirit that the movie feels like a crucial oasis.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It’s intermittently poignant and poetic with its thoughts on aging, mortality, contentedness, love, and loss, but the humor, which ought to be its strongest component, isn’t kept up with enough consistency to make the entirety of the picture engaging.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The success of Marcel the Shell with Shoes On is due in large part to the balance the film strikes. It never gets too cute or too twee that the characters or story become cloying.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On is a pretty perfect and quirky mash-up of animation and live-action that continues A24’s run of exciting films in 2022.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Jenny Slate’s exquisite voicework guides us through one of the most wondrous, original examinations of loss and the place we want to be in this world. A film for all ages that deserves your attention and love.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: I liked this, but the film more of a kid’s territory, because of lessons of family and coming together blah blah blah ... no new territory here. The great Isabella Rossellini is the highlight, as her low key deliver is hilarious and somewhat haunting.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: When our beloved wise-cracking mollusk first went viral, we were at an internet crossroads. We clearly chose the wrong path. The glorious (devastating) new film shows us why.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Even at 89 minutes the movie’s overlong, but in its gentle humor and wistfulness for a world of reconnection, it’s a genuine tonic.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In the hands of Slate and her director and creative partner Dean Fleischer-Camp, it’s charming, laugh-out-loud funny, and surprisingly poignant.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: "Marcel" is a balm for troubled times, a creative look at life’s mundane details, and a touching meditation on grief and loss. You will laugh, you will cry and you’ll feel a little better afterward.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
