review: It may not be your children’s shiny new favorite for endless replay, but, when absorbed with receptiveness and appreciated for its singularity, the movie will become a charming and formative right of passage experience held dear and passed down for years.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: If you can get past the preciousness, the filmmakers have admirably integrated live action, stop-action animation and guided improv for a natural flow between the characters.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Placing Marcel deeper in the context of our contemporary landscape allows Slate and Fleischer Camp to explore, on a meta level, how the character has been received.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Endlessly charming and touching, Marcel the Shell with Shoes On is a celebration of the connections that make our lives memorable.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It’s best not to expect a life-changing experience from Marcel the Shell With Shoes On. But its tenderness, along with its best jokes, are most welcome right about now.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Dean Fleischer-Camp’s Marcel The Shell With Shoes On is a reminder that movies are magic.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: You can also sink into the quietude of the story, the moments where Marcel describes the comfortable feeling of being able to rest when there’s a party going on in your house, lulled by the noise of other voices.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: I felt silly crying at a movie about a twee shell, but it was too sweet not to.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On gives us a unique character, while the film thrives by encapsulating his lovely and loveable spirit.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Laugh out loud funny, sad in a gut punching kind of way, and overwhelmingly big-hearted. Marcel the Shell with Shoes On is a heartwarming delight.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It's the quiet and contemplative moments - where not much really happens but the possibilities seem endless - that stick with you.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On takes a silly premise, one that could sit on the shelf next to other kid’s talking-creatures movies, and elevates it with a sense of humanity and the transformational power of friendship.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: “Marcel” is sweet, it’s charming, it’s clever. It’s also about as long an 89 minutes as you’re likely to spend in a movie theater this summer. Shoes Marcel has. Narrative drive his namesake film does not.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: There’s a soothing joy to seeing Marcel plop around spilled honey or getting grossed out over an earthworm. He’s a real personality unaware of the surreal impossibility of his existence.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The ideal family film should be equally enjoyed by kids and adults, then handed down from one generation to the next... And this delightful heart-warmer belongs in that category.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: [Marcel the Shell with Shoes On] might sound unbearably twee, but there is real emotion and purpose pumped into the tiny picture -- it has a heart as big as its title character is small.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: For the most part, Fleischer-Camp rewards the commitment, although there are moments when the film feels like it’s reaching to earn its almost 90-minute running time.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In adorable and poignant fashion, we go on a journey with Marcel, in search of his family, but what we find is so much more. We find a great big expression of love through the life of a little shell.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On gives us the opportunity for a delicate, whimsical and poignant escape that will make you feel stronger, taller and better for it on the other side.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Prepare to fall in love with Marcel. Now, it may have taken me longer to fall for Marcel the Shell with Shoes On than many of my colleagues, but it happened, and it will for you as well. What a lovely film.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: "Marcel" is a wisp of a wistful film, whether it’s being existentially deep or essentially silly. Most of all, it just feels like a salve.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: How can a film so disarmingly simple inspire deep feelings about loss, connection, and the meaning of family? I’m not sure I have the answer, but at a time when so many of us are feeling disoriented—or disconnected—a movie like this is especially welcome

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A surprisingly adept and ultimately infectious jolt on endings, beginnings and friendship amplified by a depiction of hyper articulate behaviors used to circumvent melancholy and desolation.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On pulls off an impossible feat by being as funny and puzzlingly tender as its inspiration.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Sometimes you don’t realize how much you needed a particular movie until you’re watching it.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell just might be the sweetest movie ever made. It is a magical, inventive, and adorable tale about the love of family, importance of community, and the value of finding connections with people who might not look or act the same as us.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A witty and heartwarming fable about learning to leave our shells to find happiness in the people and the world around us. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: This unique and laboriously crafted piece of animation by Slate and Fleischer-Camp is well worth watching for the whole family. It’s an inch that fills the screen with a beguiling presentation.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It is so sweet, gentle, and wise. It's just pure joy.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: One of the sweetest, most endearing movies of the year.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On is one of the most emotionally effective films of the year, a sweet-natured and bittersweet ode to life and growing up.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Its quiet tenderness feels expansive... proof that good things really do come in small exoskeletons.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Lighthearted entertainment that aims to please. Peace & Love.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Like wisehearted early Pixar films (Up), Marcel the Shell With Shoes On is a treat for the whole family, and a welcome respite from cynicism, sentimentality and anything-for-a-buck-ism.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The ideal mood-boosting movie, one that earns the warm and fuzzy feeling it leaves you with via stellar writing, great performances, top notch craftsmanship, and what feels like a deep and very genuine desire to bring some happiness and hope to the world.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: If a heartfelt summer comedy feels like something that the doctor ordered, then a healthy dose of “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On” is just what you need.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On is the most unassuming and delicate of movies, but don’t be shocked if it leaves you in ruins.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Exploring themes of isolation and grief with surprising sophistication, the humorous and heartwarming film makes the most of its thumb-sized title character’s unique perspective on the world.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Gives the one-inch-tall shell the feature treatment by digging into what makes the character such an endearing delight

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Are you ready for a shell with a googly eye to make you cry? I wasn't.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: This unassuming animated gem about a shell (indelibly voiced by co-writer Jenny Slate) trying to find his family shames the bloat of big-studio cartoons by proving good things really do come in small packages. The result is unique and unforgettable.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: One can envision Marcel the Shell with Shoes On becoming an object of cult fascination for a new generation.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In some ways, Marcel is a soft satire of documentary filmmaking, particularly the often heralded "fly on the wall" approach where directors treat their distant subjects as just that.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Fleischer-Camp and Slate have made shrewd choices all around, starting with their commitment to stop-motion animation, seamlessly integrated here with live-action imagery, often in the same shot.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Yet [Marcel's] optimism and the whimsical film are infectious. They will wear down hardened cynics, although some viewers may need to have insulin on the ready.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Maybe quirky earnestness is back -- so long as it’s done with as much care and insight as this rather marvelous curio.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Rossellini effortlessly keeps [it] intact with intelligence, beautifully controlled phrasing and a soft, melodious warmth that feels like a tender caress.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: So heartwarming and wonderful.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On struck me as an animated film like no other I can recall.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It's the rare film that adults can enjoy whether they have kids in tow or not. And if they do, the post-film discussions could be fruitful and fascinating.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In an age of multiverses, it feels nothing short of miraculous to have a film that can find the marvels within miscellanea.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: one of the most profound and introspective films to come out of Covid isolation cinema

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel’s remembrance of Mrs. Kim alone is worth the price of admission, a single sentence that would have had me blowing milk out of my nose had I been drinking any at the time.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On could be considered a kids movie or an art-house indie. But its proper audience might be anyone who’s ever felt sanded down by life, and could use a roll in Marcel’s rover.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Creators Dean Fleischer-Camp and Jenny Slate run the gamut of emotions ranging from hysterical laughter, surprisingly poignant thematic moments, and heartbreaking devastation

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It’s a soothing balm unlike any other wholesome feature around.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It could have been an excessively cute film about tiny sea shells with human-like characteristics, but this unique movie is an offbeat charmer with an appealing mix of comedy and sentimentality about life and love.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: So how does this [short] get expanded into a feature-length film? Well, Fleischer-Camp and Slate cracked that code, leading to one of the more pleasant films this side of Paddington 2.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A heartwarming, funny and exuberant delight for everyone, young and old. It's destined to become a cult classic.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On is sure to make your soul smile with its original concept and simple execution.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On is a strikingly sentimental and welcomingly funny feature that somehow leaves its audience with feelings of nostalgia for the past and optimism for the future.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: What may seem initially like a one-joke movie blossoms into a garden of comical delights.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On will make your spirit soar and remind you to enjoy those you love, inhale a bit of fresh air, and respect the earth every second as though it were your very first time.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: In an era of continuous mind-numbing content, a movie like Marcel The Shell With Shoes On is all the more monumental - a memorable and moving experience that seeks not solely to offer entertainment but to enlighten you emotionally.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Twee can have a short shelf life, and once we’ve gotten the Youtube-length-joke the picture loses some of comical edge...But if this is film is Marcel's teeny, tiny curtain call as a cultural phenomenon, it’s a perfectly adorable one.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel the Shell With Shoes On is a film with massive ambitions and an even larger heart.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Dean Fleischer-Camp’s Marcel the Shell with Shoes On convincingly proves that bigger sometimes is better.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A lovely film that expertly blends stop-motion animation with real life and explores the connections we forge with others, whether friends or family.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: While simple, there is great depth to this uncomplicated story.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: An old-fashioned crowd-pleaser in shiny new packaging, the kind of film that cinephiles can ditch the sitter for and just experience with their kids.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: The conceit gives the movie major stakes, and the payoff is glorious (and also likely to lead to lots of tears).

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A thoughtful, inventive, and poignant family flick that made me shed many tears. This adorable mollusks journey to finding his happy place again is so sweet that I wanted to spend more time with him.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: A24's first family-friendly film is an adorable romp.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: It fills a movie about a talking seashell with such a realistically sad context and a tender, deep-seated sense of longing and pain that’s near impossible to shake while watching.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Jenny Slate voices your new favorite movie character in Marcel The Shell With Shoes On.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: What you'll scope out in this small marvel of a mockumentary is how Marcel copes with loss of family, loneliness and sudden media fame, and how he relates, on 60 Minutes, to Lesley Stahl. I can't wait to see it and him again.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: By the film's end, it feels like the cinematic equivalent of a hug.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: "Marcel the Shell" seamlessly marries big ideas with charm and humor (and inventive stop-motion work to boot).

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Pack a hankie. But don't miss this strange, special little film.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Many films claim to be an antidote to this moment in history, but Marcel's flick might be the first one I've seen in the past two years that actually fits that bill.

name: Marcel the Shell with Shoes On
review: Marcel The Shell With Shoes On manages to harness enough of what initially made this diminutive protagonist such an unexpected treat; in particular, Slate's endearing vocal performance.

name: Fire of Love
review: Sara Dosa's celebratory portrait expertly weaves together this archive, but is also filled with lovely cinematic touches of its own, from Miranda July's poetic narration to the quirky animated sequences.

name: Fire of Love
review: Sara Dosa’s documentary is a celebration of the lives and work of a married team of volcanologists, Katia and Maurice Krafft, who spend years filming and recording volcanic eruptions.

name: Fire of Love
review: So much of this doc involves the filmmakers trying to make sense of and figure out who they are only from whatever archival footage they can find. This is exceptional feat to begin with, sorting through all of it...

name: Fire of Love
review: It’s also a beautiful love story about two people who shared a passion for exploring and for each other.

name: Fire of Love
review: Watching this gave me the weird sensation that the world was a stage for White people and the local non-white people are just background players. The Kraffts died in Japan but no Japanese voices are heard and no Japanese volcanologist died.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is presented in such a way that it feels like an homage to French New Wave films both in its looser structure and in its editing choices.

name: Fire of Love
review: This movie serves as a fitting tribute to the lives, careers and legacy of the Kraffts, as well as their love for each other and their dedication to the study of volcanoes.

name: Fire of Love
review: An extremely existential and somewhat fitting statement on how the Kraffts lived, venturing towards the unknown rather than running from it, all experienced in the stunning documentary, Fire of Love.

name: Fire of Love
review: [Sara Dosa] doesn't break out of her role as a second-rate chronicler. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: Volcanoes are amazing and terrifying. This doc shows that, and the special kind of love it takes to make this your life’s passion with someone else.

name: Fire of Love
review: Straying from a purely scientific outlook, Fire of Love reaches an epic spiritual dimension that at times is reminiscent of the great Werner Herzog... [Full review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: ...demonstrates a brazen humility.

name: Fire of Love
review: Undoubtedly in my top ten films of the year, this is a sublime documentary.

name: Fire of Love
review: By telling one of the year’s most compelling love stories, director Sara Dosa’s Fire of Love expands upon the idea of spectacle by showing it as an igniter of passion.

name: Fire of Love
review: An astonishing, volcanic relationship...

name: Fire of Love
review: The futuristic outfits and the photography take us through Maurice's refined gaze, showing us the different types of volcanoes, their textures, their environments, and also Katia, and the love with which he observes her. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: What an existence Katia and Maurice shared — and what a stunningly compiled and edited tribute this is to them... and the fragility of life, love and, well, everything.

name: Fire of Love
review: Absolutely jaw-dropping. This is cinema.

name: Fire of Love
review: Results in a splendid revindication of the quality of amateur scientific cinema capturing nature in its spectacular zenith. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: Transcends the nature documentary. This is something else: way more artistic and interesting. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: The droning narration nearly killed the film for me but others might like it. The images are spectacular, sublime, astonishing and terrifying, and they raise meaty questions.

name: Fire of Love
review: The wonders of drone technology have taken much of the risk out of filming angry volcanoes and now produce incredible images not even the Kraffts could have envisioned, making the chances they took and the footage they shot all the more astounding.

name: Fire of Love
review: Also a film about love. About the love that burns like fire, of course, but also that other love that the cinema tells us less about . [Full review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: It's a little light on actual science, but Dosa goes big on the Nietzschean romance of the couple without ever penetrating the roots of their obsession; they have the glazed fixity of all true obsessives.

name: Fire of Love
review: A visually stunning, emotionally evocative documentary.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love reminds us that they are also art of the highest order, a demand on our minds and hearts to pay attention, maybe especially to that which we cannot easily understand.

name: Fire of Love
review: What emerges over the course of Fire of Love is a profound meditation on the miraculous melding of kindred spirits who ignited one another’s passion and balanced each other’s strengths.

name: Fire of Love
review: ...has that same sense of playfulness but also wants to explore [Katia and Maurice's] obsession, their willingness to face danger.

name: Fire of Love
review: This may be your closest experience of nature at its most majestic and devastatingly powerful.

name: Fire of Love
review: When it lets nature speak for itself, the results are endlessly gripping. The ferociousness of reality ultimately buoys the film when its central conceit of a love story for the ages struggles to be more than an intriguing set-up.

name: Fire of Love
review: Not just a movie, it’s an experience that instantly grabs your attention and won’t let go, taking us to the edge of nature’s fiercest force and its paradoxical function of creation through destruction.

name: Fire of Love
review: A movie about people who figuratively and literally burn for each other (you hear that, Bridgerton fans?), Fire of Love is a nonfiction rarity: a documentary that can also serve as one romantic-ass date movie.

name: Fire of Love
review: The uneasy psychological undertow mixed with the stunning volcano footage and archive clips makes this a journey into a rare form of grail-hunting madness.

name: Fire of Love
review: Much of the imagery is so astonishing that it leaves us gasping for breath. But it's the likeable couple at the centre that holds the interest.

name: Fire of Love
review: A bittersweet ode to two passionate minds, a spectacular showcase of footage from the natural wonders of the world and a life-affirming experience on striving for your dreams, Fire of Love is an emotionally stirring and whimsically presented documentary.

name: Fire of Love
review: It succeeds in highlighting this tenet of their work, making it a valuable introduction not just to their unique lives and groundbreaking studies, but also to their own singular artistry.

name: Fire of Love
review: Seeing the ash plume unfold in the shape of a mushroom cloud 40 kilometres high -- beautiful but deadly -- is awe inspiring. But Dosa undercuts the raw power of such glorious moments with hideous sentimentality.

name: Fire of Love
review: The delivery wavers, & at times it’s difficult to decide if these two are courageous or foolhardy, but even so, Fire of Love is a remarkable story. Most importantly, it highlights the bravery of those who help us understand the power of the natural world.

name: Fire of Love
review: A story of love and discovery told with curiosity and care, Dosa honours her unique subjects — lending tenderness and poetry to the archive footage.

name: Fire of Love
review: Gorgeously shot. A love story that works on multiple levels. Not sure if the narration was entirely necessary but that's a minor quibble when everything else is emotionally resonant and engaging throughout.

name: Fire of Love
review: The film’s approach skirts around the actual science of the Kraffts’ work, but it does explore the psychology of a shared passion...

name: Fire of Love
review: Sara Dosa’s documentary might not make you fully care for its doomed lovers, but she more than compensates for it by inserting some of the most astonishing volcano imagery every put on film.

name: Fire of Love
review: [Maurice and Katia Krafft] managed to shoot spectacular footage of lava flows and volcanic cores. That footage forms the basis of this remarkable documentary.

name: Fire of Love
review: Centering their grim fate allows a more complex reading of their lives and choices. Were they quasi-heroic explorers? Adrenaline junkies who loved silly hats? Reckless fame seekers? Hopeless romantics? Excessively French?

name: Fire of Love
review: [Sara Dosa] has crafted a sensitive narration, softly whispered by her fellow film-maker Miranda July, that dares to ask huge questions about love and relationships in the face of imminent death.

name: Fire of Love
review: Dosa grounds Fire of Love’s awesome Romantic portraiture in a narrative that is perhaps more mundane but no less gripping for it.

name: Fire of Love
review: It's possible to admire their ability to simplify, even as we instinctively recoil from the tremendous risks they took in the process.

name: Fire of Love
review: Celebrity volcanologists Katia and Maurice Krafft's... love couldn’t have been more Shakespearean.

name: Fire of Love
review: A story of romance, between two people, and between the couple and the beautiful and terrible power of nature.

name: Fire of Love
review: [A] fascinating documentary about the daring duo who transformed our knowledge of nature’s most destructive forces.

name: Fire of Love
review: Sara Dosa’s documentary about renowned French volcanologists Katia and Maurice Krafft has tons of eye-popping footage of flowing rivers of boiling lava and bellowing volcanos. It’s “wow” with a capital W.

name: Fire of Love
review: Because of the overwhelming grandeur and fearful splendor of the many volcanoes this couple visited and photographed, watching this film on the big screen is a must.

name: Fire of Love
review: A gripping documentary about a French couple united by their love of the world's most dangerous volcanoes and each other.

name: Fire of Love
review: Purely spectacular as it is, Fire of Love is also a riveting film about film: a salute to the power of the Kraffts’ canny, witty images.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love may not make profound sense of this demise, or probe into their relationship much at all, but as a broad-brush rendering of the Kraffts’ lifelong quest, it has a coffee-table allure that’s undeniably ravishing.

name: Fire of Love
review: A portrait of two people who were equally and obsessively single-minded in their life’s pursuit... that is the heart of Fire of Love.

name: Fire of Love
review: It’s content to nod and stare and keep an admiring distance. With lava flows and ash plumes, that’s an understandable response and works fine. With a pair of individuals as unusual as the Kraffts, it’s not and it doesn’t.

name: Fire of Love
review: A romance forged by and ultimately destroyed by passion, Dosa’s Fire of Love is one of those rare documentaries that arrives once or twice a decade to leave audiences awe-struck by its wonder and terrors. It is the Grizzly Man of volcanoes.

name: Fire of Love
review: You say you've been on some crazy dates? You may want to rethink that when you watch Fire of Love...

name: Fire of Love
review: ... The film has an elegiac quality, one that's beautifully and thrillingly reinforced by the majesty of everything they [Katia and Maurice Krafft] documented.

name: Fire of Love
review: ... This film looks for something romantic, celebrating or consecrating the myth of the Kraffts: they loved each other, they loved volcanoes and it all came together on that terrible day.

name: Fire of Love
review: A hypnotic and poetic documentary that explores the deepest mysteries of nature and love in Earth's most dangerous corners. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: Fire of Love
review: "...archival footage is exciting enough, but editors...make judicious use of split-screen, circular stencils and other visual effects, varying the rhythm just enough to make this world seem even more magical."

name: Fire of Love
review: Dosa’s film is a slick, moving and cutely Herzogian portrait of this loving, monomaniacal couple who straddled the line between the eccentric and the earnest.

name: Fire of Love
review: Dosa infuses her story with a dash of the mythic, honoring her subjects who came to see volcanoes in mythic terms despite being rigorous scientists.

name: Fire of Love
review: There’s something supernaturally hypnotic about watching lava flow, watching ash and flame explode from the surface of the Earth, watching two tiny little people with gigantic spirits reveling in the majesty of mother nature’s power.

name: Fire of Love
review: The images of walls of fire crashing down with the force of Niagara Falls or exploding into rocks underwater is reason enough to witness Fire Of Love.

name: Fire of Love
review: Not only did they throw themselves into their work, but they took copious photographs and movies of the volcanoes they studied, which makes Dosa’s film not just a poetic love story, but a feast for the senses.

name: Fire of Love
review: Werner Herzog got there first. And what is with Miranda July's weak narration? But this a unique love story with striking visuals.

name: Fire of Love
review: The volcanologists are fascinating but I never felt like I got to know the couple. I should have.

name: Fire of Love
review: The result is more than a mere nature documentary. It is one of the most moving and mesmerizing films of the year, a meditation on the wonders of nature and human curiosity.

name: Fire of Love
review: Director Sara Dosa finds poetry in the love affair between volcanologists  the Kraffts and their scientific obsession with volcanoes.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love brings us as close to the beauty and horror of these natural wonders as a film ever could.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is not just a nature documentary, it’s something more. It’s a character driven film with stirring images best seen on the big screen of a movie theatre, about the nature of passion.

name: Fire of Love
review: It’s a film begging for big-screen beholding.

name: Fire of Love
review: The filmmaker isn’t so much interested in telling us about the Kraffts or even about the little-understood science of volcanology, but in creating a low-key twee mood that edges past cute straight into grating.

name: Fire of Love
review: Maurice voices a fateful philosophy, one which would catch up to them on Japan’s Mount Unzen, an event when finally told comes across as anticlimactic due to July’s monotonous reading, an enervation Dosa’s selected footage mostly overcomes.

name: Fire of Love
review: Every year, there are at least one or two extraordinary don't-miss-it documentaries. Fire of Love certainly qualifies as an entry for 2022.

name: Fire of Love
review: ...with its endlessly entrancing footage of magma exploding and flowing against the shifting background of a wall of smoke, it’s a documentary about how the recorded image is so powerful, some have even died for it.

name: Fire of Love
review: Two French lovers swirl the world in search of fire and one day, die together in the gushing molten surge of a volcanic eruption. Goodnight folks, that’s the summary of tonight’s feature, Fire of Love.

name: Fire of Love
review: The way Dosa shapes the story, emphasizing the couple’s deep love for each other and their unconventional lives, is what makes “Fire of Love” ... one of the most moving and memorable films of 2022.

name: Fire of Love
review: This is one of the most endearing love stories we've seen in film in a long time.

name: Fire of Love
review: It is spectacular. You have to see it in a theater to experience the enormity of it.

name: Fire of Love
review: The film percolates with a love of movies, specifically the French New Wave; at its best moments it feels like Breathless, if Jean-Paul Belmondo’s character had been obsessed with volcanologists instead of Humphrey Bogart.

name: Fire of Love
review: A movie which captures the overlapping unpredictability and ineffable beauty of both volcanoes and human bonds, and the unknown length of fuse which each ultimately possess.

name: Fire of Love
review: A 90-minute documentary about lava? What is this, geology class? Not even close... Fire of Love is a cool, sensual and visceral experience that thrusts you into an inferno of romance.

name: Fire of Love
review: A delightful documentary, but also seemingly an origin story for Wes Anderson's entire aesthetic.

name: Fire of Love
review: ... incorporates an impressive collection of photographs and archival footage so vivid you can practically feel the heat.

name: Fire of Love
review: Filled with breathtaking footage and making use of skillful editing, tranquil, thoughtful music, and gorgeously poetic narration, this documentary merges science, nature, and romance.

name: Fire of Love
review: The film is one of the year’s few awe-inspiring documentaries -- a visually ravishing record, a bustling adventure, and an engrossing character study that begs to be remade, with actors, as a big-budget Hollywood narrative feature.

name: Fire of Love
review: A dazzling, seductive, nature-meets-romance documentary that cuts against the current grain for nonfiction films.

name: Fire of Love
review: A singular and sublime new documentary about the couple that risks the sentimental in order to realize the truly romantic.

name: Fire of Love
review: The doc is a capsule history lesson on an eons-old natural phenomenon. But it’s also the greatest lava-fueled love story ever told.

name: Fire of Love
review: It's hard to find someone to spend our lives with let alone one who shares the same passion. Armed with explosive materials accompanied by lyrical collages, Dosa accentuates the story of two lovers who shared the same passion and lived and died together.

name: Fire of Love
review: Dosa’s film is confident in its imprecision, comfortable riding various visual and philosophical waves to appealingly exploratory rather than conclusionary ends. And so it’s baffling ... that all this is guided by Miranda July’s unfortunate voiceover.

name: Fire of Love
review: [A] thrilling, moving documentary...

name: Fire of Love
review: Celebrates the transcendent beauty of a shared, lifelong odyssey, but as with the volcanic blasts, also mourns the devastation that is certain to come.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love works as an educational resource, too. Their partnership is the core, but the Kraffts were always about taking viewers into the earth and explaining how life springs forth from it. You can’t have a romance or the movies without it...

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love, excavates their unique story, and the jaw-dropping footage the Kraffts left behind, in a film exploding with awe for the mysterious alchemies of love and obsession.

name: Fire of Love
review: There’s a reason that volcanoes have, throughout human history, been worshiped and placated like gods. Maurice and Katia Krafft represent a secular, scientific variation on that old-time religion.

name: Fire of Love
review: A poem of matrimony and magma.

name: Fire of Love
review: A wholly satisfying, overwhelming documentary, as disarming as it is explosive. To know the Kraffts is to share their lava affair, and sharing their journey brings you face-to-face with alarming majesties.

name: Fire of Love
review: This film is for anyone buoyed by life’s big questions, yet driven by the magnetic pull of romance.

name: Fire of Love
review: The visually entrancing volcano documentary “Fire of Love” chronicles a magnificent obsession and might even make that obsession your own.

name: Fire of Love
review: The Kraffts' lives and work do mean something ... by the end of Fire of Love. The film itself, though, finds deeper meaning in the evidence of what they meant to each other...

name: Fire of Love
review: While [the Kraffts'] work therefore speaks for itself, Dosa's documentary brilliantly speaks for them.

name: Fire of Love
review: Katia and Maurice Krafft lived most fully on the lips of the volcanoes that finally gave them the kiss of death.

name: Fire of Love
review: The fact that the two preeminent volcanologists happen to be a loving couple only adds to this unique assemblage of materials.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love uses Dosa’s exquisite prose, the Kraffts' own footage, and Miranda July’s narration to bring their love to life on screen.

name: Fire of Love
review: FIRE OF LOVE essentially forces the viewer to look deeper, beyond volcanology, and simply admire the equal parts simplistic and complex process of the natural world. It captures how life can come and go as swiftly as a North Wind.

name: Fire of Love
review: You've never seen volcano footage quite like this - and you're unlikely to see it anywhere else. The spectacle is undoubtedly stupefying but it's the captivating chemistry between Katia and Maurice that will keep you riveted until the credits roll.

name: Fire of Love
review: A fascinating watch, not only due to its unrivalled archival footage which the doomed lovers (...) accumulated in their many years of cutting edge vulcanology – but because this is a film about the enduring unknowability of the origins of a passion.

name: Fire of Love
review: An engrossing and ultimately emotionally overwhelming portrait of these two remarkable people.

name: Fire of Love
review: National Geographic once again delivers a film worthy of being required high school curriculum. From plate tectonics to the parabolic paths of the fierce, red-hot lava, Fire of Love is a fascinating and illuminative documentary.

name: Fire of Love
review: The most spectacular, nail-biting imagery, however, does not alleviate an unstable narrative approach that fails to live up to the visual feast.

name: Fire of Love
review: Directed with care, curiosity, and insight by Sara Dosa.

name: Fire of Love
review: The viewer gets a sense of their marriage and soulfulness, and by the end, we appreciate their influence and feel their loss.

name: Fire of Love
review: With Fire of Love, director Sara Dosa relates the Kraffts’ lives and work in a dreamy, sometimes wistful manner.

name: Fire of Love
review: Katia and Maurice may have died over 30 years ago, but here they reign eternal.

name: Fire of Love
review: The Kraffts’ curious tale, framed as a winsomely eccentric scientific love story, still impresses as a unique matchup between human idiosyncrasy and awesome natural phenomena.

name: Fire of Love
review: Part love story, part ode to the wonders of volcanoes, and part testament to the power of film to change the world, Fire of Love... gets you in the feels on many different levels.

name: Fire of Love
review: The love story of married volcanologists Katia and Maurice Krafft and their shared passion for up-close and personal investigation of volcanoes informs Sara Dosa's FIRE OF LOVE, narrated by Miranda July.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is a swift-moving documentary about an inspiring couple who faced the thrills and risks of living life on the edge.

name: Fire of Love
review: The couple's documentation of volcanoes often veered into the poetic and impressionistic, stitched together by Dosa to reflect not only the marvels of volcanoes but the power of love. But not in a cheesy way!

name: Fire of Love
review: The film oscllates between the playfully on the nose and the existentially profound with the confidence of a volcano chaser surfing on a river of lava.

name: Fire of Love
review: Whether its seeing footage of the eruptions and lava flows to hearing the couple talk about how they first met and how they balance one another, Fire of Love is a fun, informative, and bittersweet story of passion.

name: Fire of Love
review: Repetitive footage of volcanic activity disrupts the history of the love story, which is the most interesting part of the narrative. The film's at its best when focusing on the shared obsession Maurice and Katia had with volcanoes -- and each other.

name: Fire of Love
review: To paraphrase an old Onion headline, 'Romance between volcanologists ends predictably.'

name: Fire of Love
review: To the Kraffts, volcanoes have unique personalities, and their stunning footage indeed brings these phenomena to life. ... FIRE OF LOVE conveys that sense of awe, both at these natural marvels and at how two people who adored them found each other.

name: Fire of Love
review: This not only paints a loving portrait for the two subjects of the feature but also gives the audience an experience to engage with and take away ideas and messages reflecting on their own lives.

name: Fire of Love
review: a truly extraordinary documentary

name: Fire of Love
review: Their passion for volcanoes, and the way they thought it might translate into helping mankind, helps us see who they really were, and the result, built largely from archival footage, is breathtaking.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is inspiring for anyone who has a passion, and Sara Dosas vision with the Krafft footage pulls together a charming and tragic story that is both an informative nature documentary and also playful and witty in the style of Wes Anderson.

name: Fire of Love
review: The force of nature comes to stunning, searing life thanks to the Kraffts' footage, whether it is rivers of magma or gouts of smoke, with the film building the case that they knew exactly the impact of what they were committing to camera would be.

name: Fire of Love
review: For a documentary that relies on archive footage but has little to account for its subjects personal lives, Fire of Love does a remarkable job of seeing the romance through their work.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is so visually stunning that you could turn the volume off completely and enjoy the film almost as much. But why would you want to miss this touching love story?

name: Fire of Love
review: In telling their devotion to one of the natural worlds most dangerous forces, Dosa crafts a documentary that would make Herzog proud.

name: Fire of Love
review: The footage, from the Krafft’s archives, is stunning. This truly is a remarkable film.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is a precious film that captures a lifes work that was always in service of never capturing the whole picture.

name: Fire of Love
review: “Love” celebrates love of cinema, nature, science and the rogue outsiders trying to better understand our world.

name: Fire of Love
review: "Fire of Love" is a riveting portrait of a charismatic couple who lived life on the edge.

name: Fire of Love
review: Featuring utterly stunning archival volcano footage and a love story that will warm your heart, 'Fire of Love' is an absolute gem.

name: Fire of Love
review: With its quirky New Wave-adjacent cadences, Sara Dosa's sizzling Fire of Love proves that no one can narrate a fiery romance better than Miranda July's airily ethereal voice.

name: Fire of Love
review: This has to be one of the most heartwarming movies about scientists ever made, especially as it always honors the red-hot nature in their shared passion.

name: Fire of Love
review: Dosa has pored through hundreds of hours of the Kraffts' footage, much of it astonishing in its beauty and danger level.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is amazing, a feat of feats. Powerful, all around.

name: Fire of Love
review: Its lingering power, however, is not just the spectacle but also the thrilling intimacy of its subjects, whose eccentric, danger-seeking romance feels drawn straight out of Hollywood myth.

name: Fire of Love
review: The dangerous nature of their work starts to creep into the narrative, and by the end, this adorable love story has become a meditation on humanity's smallness in the face of the Earth's tectonic plates.

name: Fire of Love
review: Commits to a mad embrace of destiny, with eye-searing archival footage and an appreciation of the ineffability of devotion.

name: Fire of Love
review: We can be thankful that today's documentarians are going through the archives of this rare subset of cinema and giving the footage new outlets for discovery.

name: Fire of Love
review: With each clip, we understand Katia and Maurice's yearning to embark on these great adventures despite the destruction that volcanoes can exact.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is a portrait of the magnificent and the elemental, and how both can be mysterious and magical. And it's a reminder of how, even in death, there's much to be learned about life.

name: Fire of Love
review: Gorgeous archival footage. My science nerd side was geeking out while my romantic side was fulfilled.

name: Fire of Love
review: The couple's footage of pulsing lava rivers and burning rock have a beauty that becomes mesmerizingly abstract.

name: Fire of Love
review: This film is about wonder, not balance, and it turns us delirious in the white heat of this pair's chaotic, unflinching passion.

name: Fire of Love
review: A beautiful and beguiling film. One which buys into and fully embraces their spirit of adventure.

name: Fire of Love
review: Magnificent documentary.

name: Fire of Love
review: A sweeping portrait of two people passionately in love with science, nature, and each other.

name: Fire of Love
review: If you see any documentary this year, make sure it's this one. Films like this should be celebrated and revered, so go out and see it, in fact, see it twice

name: Fire of Love
review: Director Sara Dosa has found a treasure trove of footage of the couple and the unbelievable volcanoes they chased

name: Fire of Love
review: ... allows the audience to experience both the awe and joy felt by its subjects as they dance on the edge of destruction, lava spewing liquidly, even puckishly, just beyond their silhouettes.

name: Fire of Love
review: The visually stunning but occasionally dull Fire of Love is best enjoyed by people who are inclined to like nature documentaries. This story about volcanologist spouses Katia Krafft and Maurice Krafft often takes a back seat to the volcano footage.

name: Fire of Love
review: Already an extremely French cocktail, Fire of Love gets a final dash of existentialism that makes it linger on the tongue: if Godard had a thing for science.

name: Fire of Love
review: There's tragic timeliness to Fire of Love, a documentary on two top volcanologists and their shared passion for their job and each other.

name: Fire of Love
review: "Fire of Love" is one for the ages, staking an early claim as one of the most exciting films of 2022.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is indeed a love story, a love shared between a couple, their own love to demonstrate the forces of nature ripping itself apart or crashing together.

name: Fire of Love
review: The fuel of "Fire of Love" is the volcanologist subject's magma-proof adoration for each other and what they've laid eyes on.

name: Fire of Love
review: It's a doomed love story on every level, a gorgeous collage of a film in which romance, scientific inquiry and death do a 93-minute dance.

name: Fire of Love
review: A spellbinding experience.

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love is a testament to the Kraffts, their love of each other, and their shared passion for volcanoes.

name: Fire of Love
review: We are treated to a beguiling recounting of love wrought from a mutual fascination and tenacity

name: Fire of Love
review: Fire of Love doesn't waste a second, perhaps showing how elusive matters of the heart are to articulate but recognizing the best way to explain is for the film to simply find its way into yours.

name: The Batman
Rating: PG-13 (Some Suggestive Material|Drug Content|Strong Disturbing Content|Strong Language|Strong Violent Content)

name: The Batman
review: They turned revealing an antagonist's presence to the audience without the victim's knowledge into a suspense-driven art. Here, Reeves taps directly into these tactics to phenomenal effect...

name: The Batman
review: This is the ultimate Batman movie.

name: The Batman
review: Batman's superpower has always been that he's the smartest guy in the room. ... His title as the Dark Knight Detective has never been showcased on film as well as it was in The Batman.

name: The Batman
review: It may take three hours for Bruce to learn this lesson, but it's an incredible three hours. It may be fun to watch Pattinson put on black make-up and strap into the Batsuit to fight some bad guys, but there's much more to this story than just that.

name: The Batman
review: THE BATMAN exceeds my expectations and passes the bar of a reboot. It justifies its own existence with great storytelling, insights into humanity and human society, and powerful performances.

name: The Batman
review: “The Batman” reaches for an ingenious and compelling new way to tell a story about the thin lines between corruption, greed and nobility — but ever so limply and always just out of its grasp.

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves’ The Batman brings us closest to the essence of the Batman character than any film adapted from the DC comics have since Tim Burton’s inaugural Batman in 1989.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is a brave, bold and brilliant new take on a familiar character and Reeves and Pattinson have done him proud.

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves’ The Batman is a brutal, uncompromising vision that leaves its indelible mark in comic book film history.

name: The Batman
review: The film casts long shadows with blacks and grays, but the consistent, bleeding flashes of red paint the most intense moments with jarring contrast.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is the only comic book adaptation since The Dark Knight to come close to recreating that cinematic achievement, brilliantly blending entertainment with artistry.

name: The Batman
review: Reeves, it should be noted, assembles a lot of other people’s ideas and themes into this mammoth package. The movie is a triumph of craft and design, but original it ain’t.

name: The Batman
review: Reeves’ vision is fresh and innovative, building a young (but not brand new) version of the Bat world that is satisfying as a single film, while planting the seeds for a juggernaut franchise.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman transcends an oversaturated genre and gives arguably the best portrayal of the caped crusader yet. Matt Reeves delivers a slow-burn detective noir with a terrifying villain and ever-rising tension. A rare film that I would call a masterpiece!

name: The Batman
review: Writer-director Matt Reeves knows how to write a blockbuster with brains, and he knows how to film one with visual flare.

name: The Batman
review: The way that everything is spliced and shaken together, and the mood — and it's definitely a mood — makes this weighty, heavy, sublimely shot, excellently cast, always-engaging blockbuster feel new, and all things Batman with it.

name: The Batman
review: THE BATMAN shows that even the best intentions may inspire mayhem, cause heck this is Gotham.

name: The Batman
review: And even though at times the movie seems a little too male-centric, in times when this is almost prohibited, it felt good to feel those testosterone punches in such a quality, entertaining film. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Batman
review: How many times can this story be told? Next time pray that the filmmakers aren’t this self-serious about their own vision and that the running time values your time outside of Gotham.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves is a director with a vision. I'm glad I enjoy that vision, because Batman needs to have good movies.

name: The Batman
review: It is a victory of story and a failure of plot.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: Do we actually need another brooding Bat-flick of this type? Not really -- a little of Vincent Price prancing around as Egghead would be a welcome sight right about now -- but given its assignment, it mostly gets the job done.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves' The Batman features skillful cinematography, an epic score, and a memorable turn or two from the cast, but it's all undone by a remarkably weak screenplay that ultimately turns the film into a repetitive, unengaging, and over-long slog.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman

review: ‘The Batman’ is a little long, but it’s an overall surprisingly fun and creepy comic book film that never takes itself too seriously. And Robert Pattinson makes one good emo Batman.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: The action scenes and special effects in The Batman are top-notch, but what makes it all worth watching (on top of your device's Pause button for bathroom breaks) is the strong supporting cast...

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: "The Batman" is an installment of an often-depicted superhero that manages to give a fresh take. Both atmosphere and plot are dark and heavy. This may not be the kind of movie for those who lean more towards the MarvelDisney fanfare.

name: The Batman
review: Overlong but quite strong as an origin story that works on an emotional level by the end. The cast handles this material well, making it more of a detective yarn with hints of commentary about privilege by the end that could've been fleshed out more.

name: The Batman
review: A fairly good mock up for a Batman film templated as a graphic novel. Its dark and seedy mood is new backdrop for the Batman films but in terms of showcasing what this cape crusader has to offer in story telling, there is nothing new here.

name: The Batman
review: Ugly beauty is the nature of The Batman.

name: The Batman
review: If it's neither fun nor searing, even those iconic pointy ears might struggle to hear the point.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman shows that Reeves interpretation is one that knows that Caped Crusader was always as famous for his brains as his brawn

name: The Batman
review: It appears that Warner Brothers holy union with HBO MAX has rubbed off on them. diandrareviews

name: The Batman
review: It remains an action thriller that, with detective intrigue and atmospheric styling, shows an unexplored side of the dark knight in a Gotham City that is always drenched in rain and corruption at night. Full review in Spanish

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: Thanks to Pattinson and Danos compelling performances, as well as Reevess ambitious direction, The Batman is an enthralling thriller and a welcome return for the Caped Crusader.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: I didn’t think I wanted another Batman movie. But it turns out that Matt Reeves’s The Batman -- starring Robert Pattinson, who played Edward Cullen in the Twilight films -- has the Batman we need.

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves and Robert Pattinson made it look easy to make a new great Batman movie. Greig Fraser, Colin Pharrell and Paul Dano steal the show. The best Gotham out there in a universe full of potential. Full review in Spanish

name: The Batman
review: Reeves takes inspiration from numerous comic storylines, mixing and matching to concoct an elaborate tapestry that overflows with iconic characters in differing stages of repute. While not as emotive as his Apes films, the blockbuster spectacle remain.

name: The Batman
review: Always great to see a director with a distinct vision amidst a pool of adaptations. Matt Reeves commits to it and offers a rumination closer to Munich than whacks and pows.

name: The Batman
review: It doesnt execute every second of its runtime perfectly, but its sense of ambition and drive buoy its entire epic narrative, giving us a reason to get excited about Batman at the movies once again.

name: The Batman
review: Strange, squalid and sinister, Matt Reeves' version is dark and deadly.

name: The Batman
review: "The Batman" offers several great action pieces, but the movie does begin to crumble under its own weight, both in terms of the near-three-hour runtime and its own self-importance.

name: The Batman
review: Perhaps the biggest indictment of Gotham City is that even the villains feel a burning need to fight crime and corruption. Sex and sleaze are everywhere, apart from the Batcave, which may as well be a monks cell.

name: The Batman
review: Although Matt Reeves does make attempts to inflect the tired subject matter with some virtuosity, the universe's over-familiarity and essential stodginess overrides any novelty, to my mind, at least.

name: The Batman
review: Star Pattinson is electric in the role of Batman, expressing so much with his intense silence and reactions to the chaos.

name: The Batman
review: There's a tactile stickiness to the world that clings to you and immerses you.

name: The Batman
review: It's quite possible "The Batman" might be too dark and disturbing for some viewers, but I thought it was pretty terrific.

name: The Batman
review: This new The Batman is a seductive, and gripping detective tale by way of super-heroism. If this is what blockbuster filmmaking in 2022 looks like, then were off to a great start.

name: The Batman
review: The film I imagine Ricky Fitts would grow up to make after the events of 'American Beauty.'

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves’ meandering faux-profound take on Batman spends its over-long runtime telling women to shut up and do as they’re told or face the consequences.

name: The Batman
review: 175 minutes, dark in form and brilliant in execution, that break any labels a preconceived ideas, making the concepto of "superhero movies" lose all its meaning despite the masks and capes showing on screen.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: ...an above-average comic-book adaptation...

name: The Batman
review: It verges on camp without committing to it, and it essays the operatic without being able to provide the emotional impetus required.

name: The Batman
review: Stylish and stark, packed with well-executed action and high-quality performances, The Batman is a welcome addition to the canon of the Caped Crusader. Heres hoping we get to see more of what Reeves, Pattinson and the rest have in mind.

name: The Batman
review: What this film does achieve, however, is telling a solid new Batman story, one with some pretty compelling twists and a strong point-of-view on who, exactly, the Caped Crusader is. By default, that makes it one of the better Batman movies ever made.

name: The Batman
review: As for special effects, they are very good, and Greig Fraser’s cinematography is epic.

name: The Batman
review: How you like this iteration of Batman may depend upon how you like your serial murderers served and if you like your casting on a binary of Black and White.

name: The Batman
review: The cast is fine, with Pattinson adding his own touch to a role now undertaken by six different actors in the past 30 years, seven if you go back to Adam West and the original television show of the 1960s.

name: The Batman
review: A beefy, stylised approach and committed performances make this take on the Dark Knight worth a look, even if the film fails to break out of the usual cliched lack of light and colour.

name: The Batman
review: This is everything I could have asked for in a Batman film. I loved the tone, easter eggs, and so much research that went into this. Bobby Patts brought something different to this character that really stood out. I really loved this film.

name: The Batman
review: This is at least in the top three Batman films of all time for me. It was a combination of all of the best elements of the Batman character and Gotham as a city. It blew me away. This was fantastic.

name: The Batman
review: The Dark Knight returns with a more hopeful take on vengeance

name: The Batman
review: This Batman is as dark, depressed and angry as many of those living in these dark, stressful times. Batman wants revenge, while the villain wants to expose government corruption. Thus, the normal superhero story formula is upended.

name: The Batman
review: The good guy/bad guy duality — opposite sides of the same coin — has been done to death in past Batman movies. In this one, suffice it to say, it’s taken to startling heights.

name: The Batman
review: "... a veritable breath of fresh air in an industry glutted with visually banal superhero films with plots that feel written by committee."

name: The Batman
review: In a film that’s more about the showing than the telling, Pattinson’s moody edginess fits right in.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is not only proof that a comic book movie can be sexy, but an indication that the long-gone genre that defined Hollywood in the 80s and the 90s is making a slow but sure comeback.

name: The Batman
review: An engaging crime thriller that stars an excellent Robert Pattinson as a brooding, vengeful Dark Knight who dives into the corrupt heart of Gotham City and emerges as a symbol of justice.

name: The Batman
review: The twists and turns, the grim Fincher feel, the growling bruised Batman and the sadistic Riddler, this big-screen blockbuster is heavy-duty and for Bat-fans with a big appetite.

name: The Batman
review: I love the way they made Gotham City look.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman sets the bar for the crowded superhero subgenre in a bold, refreshingly auteur-driven manner.

name: The Batman
review: Reeves self-possessed direction digs into the character with gravitas and precision, making for a reinvigorating return to basics.

name: The Batman
review: Yes, self-parodic travesties like 'The Batman' could be more original. But even a creative Batman story is still just another Batman story. Isn't it time to give the man a rest?

name: The Batman
review: So committed is this film to a reenvisioned Batman look, feel, and face that I never thought of the other films as I watched. It might be the best reboot Ive seen.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: Pattinson is more a presence than a character, and he fits in with the dark visuals and chilling elements of the story.

name: The Batman
review: If you strip down the characters iconography deep enough, you are left not with a film about capital-B Batman but rather just a sullen sociopath who dresses up like a bat to fight bad guys.

name: The Batman
review: You can call it brooding -- I call it irritating.

name: The Batman
review: This movie doesn't earn the three-hour running time... It's an okay Batman movie; it's just too long.

name: The Batman
review: Ultimately, this Batman accepts the thankless, death-defying role he’s stepped into, and the sacrifices that go with it. But that choice would be more compelling if it weren’t framed as a tacit acknowledgement of all the inevitable sequels to come...

name: The Batman
review: What I like best is that Matt Reeves has delivered something strikingly unique -- not only for a Batman movie but within the superhero genre as a whole. And while I wasn't initially sold on its length, the movie earns its three hour running time.

name: The Batman
review: Controversial opinion: a Batman movie should not be longer than 'The Godfather.'

name: The Batman
review: "The Batman" transcends the superhero genre, honoring the characters roots by becoming an homage to film noir and the hard-boiled detectives of the 1930s and 40s.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman isnt just one of the best Batman films, its also one of the best comic book films to date.

name: The Batman
review: It's early in the year, but Reeves' lumbering misfire is a strong contender for the great overreach of 2022. This is not my Batman.

name: The Batman
review: The city of Gotham just feels very grounded and dangerous.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is everything a superhero movie should be.

name: The Batman
review: It's the kind of fat, clumsy imposter that a real Batman movie would tie up and leave at the scene of a crime in order to limit the damage it might do to itself and others.

name: The Batman
review: The movie’s inability to imagine its superheroes and supervillains with any meaningful psychological identity is of a piece with the failure to imagine ordinary people with any degree of individuality.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is a triumph where we see the Bat find love, hope, and a sense of understanding that he is not alone in this world.

name: The Batman
review: It’s not too surprising that this is Reeves’s film, since the recent Planet of the Apes trilogy is among the most rich, complex, and well-crafted franchises in cinematic history.

name: The Batman
review: An emo-thriller take on the world of Gotham, The Batman explores the mysteries of the dark underbelly of the city with expert world-building and unexpected humor.

name: The Batman
review: On the whole, The Batman satisfies. It may continually remind you of other films, the aforementioned work by Mann, Fincher and Lumet, but at least this magpie director is pinching from the best.

name: The Batman
review: There's so much to love about Matt Reeves' The Batman: the characters, the cinematography, the stellar soundscape, the incredible world-building. The screenplay could have been a little tighter, though.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman may not knock The Dark Knight from its perch, but it is a fully imaginative reworking of the Detective Comics era, lifted by muscular performances.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: It left me curious as to what's to come next. It's got that power, speed and strength to it...

name: The Batman

name: The Batman

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: Theres a good two-hour film buried in this bladder-busting, three-hour mess.

name: The Batman
review: While it might not be the greatest Batman story ever told, its good to see someone attempting to try something a little different with the character and the genre  and that alone means The Batman has an excellent defence for its existence.

name: The Batman
review: The trend of turning Batman and everything around him increasingly darker, which began with Keatons Batman, has reached its logical culmination in The Batman. Robert Pattinson is absolutely tremendous, vanishing completely into the role.

name: The Batman
review: Stellar cinematography and production design stand out, fantastic visual effects and a strong score from composer Michael Giacchino likewise resonates.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is all the fun youve been hoping for. Choosing to be gritty and real just as Marvel zooms off into the Multiverse was a smart choice, and provides a crowd-pleasing first chapter to a new franchise.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: This is a goth Batman. He's also a furry. "Furries create their own animal character (a fursona) which functions as their avatar within furry communities." So, a goth furry, with Catwoman making up his furry community of two. It's fairly fun but too long.

name: The Batman
review: Despite the weight of its long-running time and some unwanted subplots, The Batman offers plenty to celebrate as one of the best versions of the character.

name: The Batman
review: A near operatic morality play that isn't afraid to question its hero or show his weaknesses.

name: The Batman
review: Pattinson is one of the premier weirdos of his generation, yet The Batman restrains him and his co-stars into generic crime drama roles.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: The Batman may be overstuffed, but the strong cast and impeccable direction make the film an impressive love letter to the DC hero.

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves' oh-so-serious Batman presents a fresh, complex and inventively retooled entry in a long and crowded superhero franchise mostly dominated by supervillains far more interesting than its titular hero.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman ultimately feels like a competent adaptation of the source material refined and emboldened in the image David Finchers Zodiac. Reeves has a knack for memorable shots and incorporates interesting visual perspectives into his Batman

name: The Batman
review: Reeves has made the first Batman movie that has the feel of the best Batman comics.

name: The Batman
review: (Matt Reeves) transcends the clichés with a masterful, often tense and noir-as-night twist on the mythology that ranks with Christopher Nolan’s The Dark Knight as the best of all the Batman movies.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is more Blade Runner than Batman Begins, but this is damn good, consistently surprising filmmaking, and it all works.

name: The Batman
review: It’s a hellish fusion of ideas and genres, built on the foundations of some of the best comic book stories but still wholly its own creation, brimming with emotion and angst and tragedy -- and yet, this is not a film to be endured. It’s to be enjoyed.

name: The Batman
review: Despite its flaws, Matt Reeves has marshalled one of the smartest and most mature comic book adaptations in memory. The film is strongest in its first half but the double act between Wright and Pattinson sustains throughout.

name: The Batman
review: Superhero reboots have become tellingly frequent, as if being jolted back to life by increasingly desperate electro-shocks. For all the consummate care expended on The Batman’s beautiful surface, its substance subsides through familiarity.

name: The Batman
review: In addition to Pattinson, Wright, and Farrell (whose Penguin series cant arrive soon enough), nearly everyone else in the impressive cast likewise brings their A game.

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves gets caught between not being fun enough while also refusing to lean fully into the darkness offered by his premise, creating something that's undeniably watchable but also very serious and safe.

name: The Batman
review: The underlying plot becomes off-puttingly complicated, the tone remains annoying one-note, and one crucial climactic scene goes on so long you think it’s never going to end.

name: The Batman
review: Even without the overdone backstory, Pattinson's Batman is a fully realized, deeply-moving character who is immensely interesting to watch.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is inarguably the darkest cinematic vision of the Caped Crusader  and one that prods at the foundations of heroism.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is a terrific individual dissertation in the legacy of the Dark Knight. Brooding, brilliant, and breathtaking, The Batman hits that elusive sweet spot between a made-for-the-masses popcorn flick and a deeply complex political thriller.

name: The Batman
review: A smart, thrilling, engaging, and entertaining ride through a Gotham City that I hope to see revisited many more times.

name: The Batman
review: As expected of a director of Reeves calibre, The Batman is an exceptionally well-made film on a technical level, but in its critical final act, it loses sight of its procedural tone and instead gets distracted by the need to check numerous other boxes.

name: The Batman
review: While it doesn't redefine the Caped Crusader, Reeves and Pattinson provide a solid outing into Gotham. The film could probably be about an hour shorter and have shaved a plot line or two, but it's bound to make some Bat-fans very happy.

name: The Batman
review: ...deserves credit for shining the spotlight on the underbelly of Gotham, but the storytelling in The Batman is like Bugs Bunny meaning to have taken that left turn at Albuquerque; a meandering foray down a dark rabbit hole that isnt entirely necessary.

name: The Batman
review: Stylish and well-cast, but monotonous and with an overlong running time and not enough suspense or thrills.

name: The Batman
review: No snark, no spandex pantomime spectacle. Just noir mystery, Pattinsons sad recluse a detective in a cesspit of corruption. Relentlessly grim, all darkness and despair, not escapist but of our time.

name: The Batman
review: If the film falls short of greatness, because Reeves didnt know when to cut and run, it is, in its final extended form, a superior comic book adaptation and brooding thriller in its own right.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is the triumph we hoped for, and the film DC have desperately been in need of for a long time.

name: The Batman
review: A gritty and dark noir crime thriller that plays like David Fincher's "Seven." Pattinson, Kravitz, and Wright are the dynamic trio in Matt Reeves's definitive Batman film.

name: The Batman
review: In The Batman, Pattinson is one of the best portrayals of Batman on screen.

name: The Batman
review: "The Batman" is a crime film, influenced by film noir and police procedurals. It feels unique, and it manages to differentiate itself from the comic book movies that are usually released in theatres every month. Full review in Spanish.

name: The Batman
review: Except for a new cauldron of actors, this lengthy and exceptionally grim load of PG-13 (huh?) cinema gives the franchise that keeps trying to reinvent the wheel little to distinguish itself from the previous rest.

name: The Batman
review: As a standalone police procedural, it works quite well, but as a franchise reboot it’s not enough of a reset.

name: The Batman
review: You could say every era gets the Batman it deserves. Reeves has made an absorbing entertainment where its rainy streets and perturbed faces speak to our intensely uncertain days.

name: The Batman
review: Previous Batman movies have had noir elements. The Batman feels more like film noir with Batman elements.

name: The Batman
review: Has very few identifiable "flaws"; it's more that at a certain point, it's hard not to feel ground into submission.

name: The Batman

name: The Batman
review: In The Batman, Pattinson and Reeves create a superhero spectacle for audiences that goes above and beyond the norm. In lieu of a fatigued origin story, we get an evolution.

name: The Batman
review:
In the end, this may be the best Batman movie.

But it also may be the least entertaining Batman movie.

name: The Batman
review: Robert Pattinson and Matt Reeves return the caped crusader to his roots as an obsessive detective with this complex, intriguing reboot.

name: The Batman
review: When it comes to elevated powers, The Batman has a rare one: it is not a super hero movie.

name: The Batman
review: Director/co-writer Matt Reeves doesn’t present anything especially revolutionary in his approach here, but he incorporates some notable stylistic influences and places an emphasis on detective work.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is a product of this time and place, in other words. A shame that this time and place are so stupid.

name: The Batman
review: There's more to The Batman than its style, but I should say something about the film's prop and tech design, which is so good and fun.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman lives and dies on its characterizations. They’re pretty good.

name: The Batman
review: Gotham City’s favorite vigilante has long been known as “the World’s Greatest Detective.” Matt Reeves is the first director to truly realize that on screen.

name: The Batman
review: Lensed by two-time Oscar nominee Greig Fraser, Gotham has never looked so gritty, moody and beautiful... Michael Giacchino's haunting score is fantastic, orchestrating each scene with a balance of intensity and intimacy.

name: The Batman
review: Listen, The Batman is a solid outing for DC. But, by focusing on the early, comic-book detective iteration of Batman, it sacrifices some of the potential fun of the character.

name: The Batman
review: I really, really enjoyed this movie and... I definitely wanted to see it

name: The Batman
review: At its best, The Batman drips with shuddering dread. Too bad the movie concludes with a half-hearted attempt at a hopeful resolve, a letdown after so much dark commitment.

name: The Batman
review: Matt Reeves delivers a near-perfect film that’s only occasionally limited by its excesses.

name: The Batman
review: An emotional, noir, David Fincher-esque take on the iconic character.

name: The Batman
review: This film is on the level of Nolan’s masterful trilogy and transcends the comic book genre in a rather impressive fashion.

name: The Batman
review: For fans of the grittier DC movie entries, The Batman may be too sardonic. For those of us who missed freaky Batman, however, it’s an interesting turn, even if it’s not exactly a delight.

name: The Batman
review: Coming exactly 100 years after F. W. Murnau’s still-disturbing Nosferatu, The Batman doesn’t earn being called artistic decadence. Its depiction of social horror isn’t fully imagined; it never gets to the core of spiritual repulsion that Murnau touched

name: The Batman
review: Owing to the first-rate cinematography, and for Pattinson's brooding and emotionally bruised superhero, The Batman isn't the drudge it otherwise might have been.

name: The Batman
review: What Reeves has done here should be taken as a remarkable accomplishment. In an era of studio properties, especially superhero movies, aiming for the safest possible outcome, The Batman is a legitimately out-there film.

name: The Batman
review: The film gets off to a slow and slightly tedious start, taking far too long to get going... However, once the investigation into these murders deepens, the pace picks up and the film gets really fun.

name: The Batman
review: It’s not the grand synthesis Reeves may have hoped for, nor can all the villains put together live up to Heath Ledger’s Joker. But if you’re after a full meal of a movie, you shouldn’t leave feeling hungry.

name: The Batman
review: Weve seen him campy, broody, neon-splashed, comic book-styled, grittily realistic and whatever it was Zack Snyder was attempting, but this is a whole other Batman, altogether.

name: The Batman
review: The result is unexpectedly welcome, a comic book movie that feels buoyed by a mixture of humility and fidelity to its cartoon origins, and which stumbles only when it grasps at being more.

name: The Batman
review: Somehow, through dark magic and incredible craftsmanship, The Batman has managed to bring some truly fresh and invigorating elements to the franchise that are sorely needed.

name: The Batman
review: Reeves delivers clearer action sequences than any previous Batman director. Even better is the way the Riddler is revealed as a mirror image of the superhero who busts Bruce on his privilege.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman has some stylish trappings and some interesting ideas. But under the mask, weve seen it all before.

name: The Batman
review: Absolutely everything that writer/director Matt Reeves and cowriter Peter Craig put in the script works. But to be clear, thats works in the sense of how I kept my Mitsubishi Galant working until it caught fire in a parking lot.

name: The Batman
review: The Batman is exactly the gritty crime thriller it was selling in the trailer, but it is not the deep, dark detective story come to smash your notions of what a superhero movie can be.

name: The Batman
review: Created alongside Dune cinematographer Greig Fraser, this may be the best-looking Gotham City flick of all time.

name: The Batman
review: However bleak and disturbing the movie might be, The Batman's grittiness is in service of an unexpectedly optimistic message, and Reeves brings some much-needed glimmers of hope to this otherwise gloomy picture.

name: The Batman
review: My quibbles with the runtime aside, I think audiences going in expecting a more grownup mystery drama than a tentpole action movie will love The Batman.

name: The Batman
review: A bold vision of the character that reboots the franchise in an exciting new way.

name: The Batman
review: Knowing what kind of Batman this is (and, crucially, isn’t) is key to getting the most from this long, dark story.

name: The Batman
