review: Vital emphasis was on men making the decisions for woman in 1963 & now, a patriarchy that had/has no empathy or desire to protect women's health. Vartolomei bravely creates a woman that represents & experiences. A must see for all, but especially for men.

name: Happening
review: Diwan lets the cold hard facts trickle in as weeks are marked off at the bottom of the screen.

name: Happening
review: The film embodies the essence of why cinema is such a powerful artistic medium, and it will hopefully continue to garner the attention it rightfully deserves.

name: Happening
review: This movie manages to erase the dividing line between itself and the audience, offering us the chance to experience this for ourselves. To describe it, words arent enough.

name: Happening
review: Diwan's creative choices make for an extremely effective film, allowing viewers to empathize with Ann's fear, suffering, and despair on a deeper level. Its a gut-wrenching experience, no matter your life experience, age or gender.

name: Happening
review: Those scenes are sure to get under the skin and stick with you, but what resonates longest is the reality of how little things have changed.

name: Happening
review: Diwan’s stylistic restraint perfectly frames the urgency of Vartolomei’s performance...

name: Happening
review: Watching the efforts she is forced to endure is powerful, horrifying and anger-inducing and Diwan presents it all in unflinching detail that should resonate even more strongly now that abortion rights are facing their greatest threat in decades.

name: Happening
review: An exceptionally well-crafted and acted feature.

name: Happening
review: “Happening” is body horror in every sense, but the true revulsion lies in how easily it all could’ve been avoided.

name: Happening
review: An unflinching and harrowing portrait of what occurs when you remove a woman's right to choose, 'Happening' pulses with urgent resonance.

name: Happening
review: The director presents a sensitive, almost urgent look at the realities of a world that gets aggressively unfair when a person isn't allowed to take control over their own bodies.

name: Happening
review: I wish every single person who considers themselves on the fence about abortion could see this movie.

name: Happening
review: As an unempathetic milieu lumps shame upon Anne, Vartolomei's performance remains upright and taut. She handles this character with restrained, jaw-clenching tenacity as a constant sense of urgency is drawn out to devastating degree.

name: Happening
review: One part autobiographical exorcism, two parts social warning, and a double-serving of real-world body horror, "Happening" combines just a handful of elements into a potent force.

name: Happening
review: All this makes for an undeniably physical experience ... And it's hard to deny that Diwan gets the effects she wants.

name: Happening
review: With clear-eyed poise, the director Audrey Diwan captures the wrenching loneliness that can come with terminating an unwanted pregnancy -- and how judgment of such a choice can be even more crushing than the possibility of breaking an unjust law.

name: Happening
review: Diwan's camera stays focused on the most harrowing moments of Anne's experience, which makes Happening a difficult but often remarkable watch.

name: Happening
review: Diwan handles the reality of abortion with unforgettable plotting and imagery.

name: Happening
review: Clear eyed Vartolomei's performance is something of a miracle here as a young woman with her whole promising future tittering on the cliff because of the legality of a simple medical procedure to her body, her own body(!)

name: Happening
review: Guided by truthful direction and a phenomenal lead performance, Happening is a full-on heart-in-your-throat cautionary tale, a stark portrait of compassion being overpowered by law, forcing people to fend for themselves.

name: Happening
review: Happening is an authentic and earnest work, and though it declines to polemicize, it is inarguably pro-choice.

name: Happening
review: The period detail and feel of Audrey Diwan's is impressive, as is the way she steadily charts Anne's struggle.

name: Happening
review: This period drama manages the difficult task of speaking to our current moment without being didactic or preachy.

name: Happening
review: Given many of the disturbing setbacks on abortion rights, education and treatment throughout the country, Audrey Diwan's Happening is another stark reminder of the dangers of leaving women hung out to dry when the decision is upon them.

name: Happening
review: Though not an entertaining film, it's a timely one.

name: Happening
review: 'L'événément' is a film treated in a rather classic way but which remains very effective.

name: Happening
review: Diwan takes a sensitive subject with life-altering consequences, then personalizes and humanizes the circumstances.

name: Happening
review: To its credit it doesn't feel like a polemic but is merely matter-of-fact about the insanity and ignorance that springs from invasive laws around women's bodies.

name: Happening
review: Diwan approaches her material in a familiar social-realist vein and films everything in a boxy aspect ratio that heightens the sense of intimacy.

name: Happening
review: Diwan concentrates on what happened, rather than creating a morality around it.

name: Happening
review: Audrey Diwan's sophomore feature Happening is a shattering abortion drama that managed to make you feel everything -- and I mean everything -- its protagonist feels in her extraordinary circumstances.

name: Happening
review: Anamaria Vartolomei's eyes entrap. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Happening
review: This is a slice of clear-eyed French social-realism that will be meaningful to anyone who cares about personal freedoms.

name: Happening
review: It's hard to think of a film more necessary in the current moment.

name: Happening
review: It's a serious, gripping and finally honourable film.

name: Happening
review: Softly poised but packing a wallop, French writer-director Audrey Diwan's sophomore film announces her as a major talent.

name: Happening
review: Diwan's second film is both timely and important. But that doesn't make its final fifteen minutes any easier to watch.

name: Turning Red
review: A Pixar film with an energized spirit, along with a gentle and patient heart.

name: Turning Red
review: With winning characters and an engaging storyline, Turning Red is a humorous look at the awkwardness of growing up and figuring out how to break away and hold on at the same time.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red celebrates femininity, friendship, and family, in addition to being really funny.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar movies are often in the hunt for end-of-the-year awards, and “Turning Red” looks like a good bet this awards season.

name: Turning Red
review: "Turning Red rejects this progression of events as a birthright, and allows Meilin the agency to choose her own path and lean into the difference that makes her special. It’s a truly stunning execution of a much-needed message."

name: Turning Red
review: Whether you zero in on generations of female empowerment and healing, or the lush tail of a gigantic furry beast, there is something for everyone in Turning Red.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red finds Pixar surveying some of its most mature subject matter yet - strengthened by cultural specificity - while simultaneously retaining the studio’s signature heart and humor.

name: Turning Red
review: a funny, compassionate and intelligent animated coming-of-age film with art that communicates the beauty of Chinese culture… addresses the myriad, complex, feelings and sensations of puberty and adolescence with honesty and sensitivity to nuance

name: Turning Red
review: Director Domee Shi, who won an Academy Award® for her Pixar short film Bao, makes her feature film directing debut with a story that is both extremely personal and thematically universal.

name: Turning Red
review: Disney/Pixar are taking a big leap with this film - they've mined the Grimm fairy tales and harvested their own back catalogue - but they're hopefully finding that investing in filmmakers and their own personal experiences pays equal dividends.

name: Turning Red
review: Whilst Luca took obvious notes from the Studio Ghibli playbook, Turning Red is more like if The Farewell was also a shojo anime, but it’s an absolutely joyous, relatable, and heartfelt experience.

name: Turning Red
review: 'Turning Red' is the first Pixar feature solely directed by a woman. Domee Shi's exuberant film tells girls (and boys) that it’s okay to change, to feel strong emotions, to take the time to become your true self — even if the process is a little messy.

name: Turning Red
review: To quote boy band sensation, 4*Town, there really is “Nobody Like U” when it comes to Turning Red.

name: Turning Red
review: There’s something powerful that the film that’s going to stand as the future of Pixar is made by a team of amazingly creative women.

name: Turning Red
review: Don't mistake all that gloss, those earworm tunes and that endearing red panda for fluff, though: Turning Red has sweetness, soul and smarts, and it's another of Pixar's gems.

name: Turning Red
review: Red turns everything into a monumental power struggle that vindicates the right to dissent (adolescent or not) ... in these cancel culture times where people avoid uncomfortable conversations as they would landmines. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Turning Red
review: Minor Pixar, but by no means unsatisfactory. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Turning Red
review: The film is a bold step forward for Pixar, not just in how it tackles more mature subject matter, or how it champions underrepresented communities in a way that puts creativity front and center.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red may not be the strongest of Pixar's lineup, but it's an insightful and sentimental story of a young girl's reluctant journey through the monster that is puberty. It's also a blast of energy, full of joy, honesty, and plenty of hormones.

name: Turning Red
review:
Touching and entertaining, yet comforting for the young ones who have felt weird, insecure or embarrassed about their bodies.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Turning Red
review:
A brilliant film with a powerful, heartfelt, feminist spirit that becomes a song of absolute rebellion. 
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Turning Red
review: An exciting, fun, and chaotically adolescent film. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red manages to take a viewer into these deep waters without losing the playfulness and silly humor that make it a top-notch family movie.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a great lesson in respect, understanding and embracing labels of all kinds, while touting a very catchable soundtrack.  I need that 4 Town concert in my life like yesterday!

name: Turning Red
review: It's definitely an admirable film. It proves that, hopefully, Pixar is going in a different direction where they finally realize that they're okay. They're well-established. Let's experiment a little. You don't have to play it safe anymore.

name: Turning Red
review: The film succeeds in conveying the emotional turbulence of adolescence and the burden women face once they realize theyre gonna bleed every month, but ultimately its a turn-off due to the mom character who is so over-the-top protective.

name: Turning Red
review: Love and wholeheartedly support the normalization of puberty specifically menstrual cycles. Beautiful depiction of family, friendship and the differences between generational viewpoints. Its catchy songs will stay with you.

name: Turning Red
review: This is a movie for anyone who has experienced the turmoil Mei experiences, which is to say just about everyone.

name: Turning Red
review: The personalities pop, and brainy Meis girl squad is a vivid portrait of intense and moody tweens...The creators added distinct little extras, such as A+ student Mei twirling her pencil like a gunslinger and all the roofs are shaped like panda ears.

name: Turning Red
review: Shi redirects the specific in Turning Red into the universal effectively, raising it above racial and cultural boundaries.

name: Turning Red
review: Writers Domee Shi and Julia Cho, weave a beautifully textured screenplay that captures the challenges of coming-of-age.

name: Turning Red
review: A heartwarming and groundbreaking entry into Disney-Pixar’s catalogue, thanks to its thoughtful, honest — and funny — depictions of puberty, menstruation, adolescent rebellion, and life as a 13-year-old girl.

name: Turning Red
review: I enjoyed a lot of it, I was annoyed by some of it, and I came away from it thinking it was a B- Pixar film.

name: Turning Red
review: I think it chickens out a little bit from telling [a story about puberty] to tell a more universal one... All of that is kind of fun, but slight.

name: Turning Red
review: I liked the film, I didn't love it... Parts of this film are a case where more is less.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a fun film for tweens and a therapy session for adults.

name: Turning Red
review: And as Pixar never fails to do, the story mainlines straight into the heart and the humanity of the characters and by extension, the audience -- in all our marvellous, rebellious, complicated glory.

name: Turning Red
review: With Turning Red, Pixar abandons decades of nuanced storytelling and warms over Disneys clichéd advice to follow your heart.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red illustrates the counterintuitive truism that becoming a parent actually seems to make people forget what it was like to be a child.

name: Turning Red
review: Despite its specificity, this is a movie that should be enjoyable for most everyone.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is clearly a labor of love -- a beautifully animated film that evokes an intense sense of time and place.

name: Turning Red
review: A big warm hug of a film that deserves to be cherished and celebrated, and Domee Shi is quickly establishing herself as one of the most unique and exciting voices working in animation today.

name: Turning Red
review: In Turning Red, the next generation is personified by girls from traditionally marginalized groups. And it isn't daunting at all. It's affirming, and I suggest you tune in.

name: Turning Red
review: A wonder in the way 13-year-old girls can be: monstrous one moment, heart-melting the next.

name: Turning Red
review: The expressiveness of anime works well to reflect the intensity of Mei Lees evolving feelings and paints her world with the vibrance it deserves.

name: Turning Red
review: For all of its merits, the film ultimately advocates a wrongheaded central message under the guise of empowerment: embrace who you are, even your reckless vices and dangerous impulses, and dont let anyone stop you.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar has created its best film in recent years from an unbeatable mix of high-voltage comedy and their usual heart that doesn't put the message above a unique experience. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Turning Red
review: Just like how Mei turned into a giant fluffy red panda, while not everything about the movie is perfect, it did manage to take its changes and turn them into something thats so much fun.

name: Turning Red
review: 'Turning Red' is panda-monium with humor and heart.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar's bravest movie yet.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar's latest is a tender, colorful and funny tale about adolescence, family and cultural identity. Full Review in Spanish

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar's latest takes the ever-popular "I Was A Teenage Werewolf" monster-puberty allegory and ramps up the awkward adorability for an infectiously sweet, surprisingly thoughtful and energetically funny coming of age comedy

name: Turning Red
review: It mixes messages about self-realisation and the discovery of one's identity, with the normalisation of adolescent femininity, and a very funny fantasy story. Full review in Spanish.

name: Turning Red
review: It's a zippy film, faster and funnier than many Pixar offerings. It's also unabashedly girl-centric, even talking about puberty in a wonderfully honest, messy way.

name: Turning Red
review: Another exceptional coming-of-age tale from a studio that excels at them...a wonderful work of representational art, one that offers people who might not otherwise see such things a chance to witness themselves both on the screen and in the credits.

name: Turning Red
review: Like the best Pixars, you don’t need to have a kid to see it. It’s excellent entertainment for grown-up people, too.

name: Turning Red
review: Like some of its characters, its a little different, and a little strange, and that should be celebrated.

name: Turning Red
review: A unique and entertaining effort that continues the studios recent hot streak.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar has devised some inventive ideas, but who would ever imagine a story about 13-year-old girl's puberty and periods? But that’s what director-cowriter Domee Shi has done and done well.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red hits its key points about coming of age with authenticity and without apology.

name: Turning Red
review: Highly recommended.

name: Turning Red
review: If you are of the more specific audience that Turning Red aims to talk to, then it will feel entirely personal.  If not, theres still no reason that such a beautifully realised film cant be appreciated on its other merits.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red will make some folks uncomfortable with its themes and its turned-up-to-11 energy, but its a worthwhile addition to the Pixar canon and a good treat for anyone who is still young at heart.

name: Turning Red
review: The animation is a tad too ordinary by Pixar’s standards, but, hey, the jokes work, and an enthusiastic voice cast bring their A-game.

name: Turning Red
review: The studio arguably hasn't produced anything this affecting since the overlooked Brave.

name: Turning Red
review: I suspect tweens and teens are not the real targets anyway. The film often seems squarely, deliberately, aimed at their parents instead, offering them a gentle (if busy) reminder that they were young once too.

name: Turning Red
review: It’s a cute-as-a-button story about the power of relationships, found family, and finding yourself that feels like the warm embrace of a hot water bottle gingerly placed over your cramps.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a potent reminder of the power of animation and Pixar’s undisputed knack for storytelling that packs an emotional punch.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red stands apart from the Pixar pack for being unafraid to show puberty in all its uncomfortable glory, while being funny, charming and pleasantly poignant at the same time.

name: Turning Red
review: Once again, Pixar crafts an entertaining, comical adventure about deeper emotions, this time exploring a perky young teen's sense of self-identity.

name: Turning Red
review: Disney-Pixar packs a whole lot into this second-tier Pixar move that, to me, stands right up there with the best of Pixar over the decades	.

name: Turning Red
review: A nuanced and compassionate exploration of how to reconcile differences, embrace change no matter how painful, and learn the value of seeing family members as human beings rather than extensions of yourself.

name: Turning Red
review: Director Domee Shi crafts a charming coming-of-age story for Pixar.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red doesn't transcend being a kids film, but for a kids film it is fine

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar’s new film is charming, nostalgic, and, with Chinese-Canadian lead character Mei, a watershed moment for representation.

name: Turning Red
review: An homage to all things to all things adolescent girlhood, from the crew of close friends who come to mean more to you than your own family to the cult-like obsession with boybands to that unforgettable moment when your first period arrives.

name: Turning Red
review: As a Pixar fanatic, Turning Red is a welcome return to form after the unfocused Onward, but only time and rewatches will tell if it belongs in the storied animation studios upper echelon.

name: Turning Red
review: This is a story we haven't seen before from Pixar, universally relatable, but also universally ignored in films geared towards younger audiences ... Director Domee Shi finds a cute, fluffy way to break the taboo of puberty.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is another fun and interesting entry in the Pixar filmography. It may not be as broadly appealing as some of their earlier fare, but its great to see the studio expanding its profile to tell different types of stories.

name: Turning Red
review: Yes, there’s formula at work here. But who doesn’t enjoy an exquisitely manipulated cry?

name: Turning Red
review: one of the years most heartfelt stories.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a deeply personal & relatable story that is bursting with creativity, nostalgia & joy. It is one of the most ambitious Pixar films.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is easily one of Pixar's best, most brilliant efforts in years. Sure, it's fun, funny, and tender, but what really carries it to greatness is its ability to put us back in touch with our youth and give ourselves a bit more grace.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is an utterly charming film and an impressive debut feature for Domee Shi.

name: Turning Red
review: Shi and company draw an agreeable and emotionally sincere descent into the adolescent experience.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red, like most Pixar films, has an uncanny way of drilling down into a plangent set of adult emotions while remaining nothing less than a fizzing, sherbet-filled entertainment for children.

name: Turning Red
review: A kinetic and funny adventure that is more entertaining than transformative.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is easily the funniest Pixar production since Inside Out -- and only a little less insightful, without the full-of-itself attitude of Soul.

name: Turning Red
review: This is a smart, entertaining movie for two acts and a perfectly OK one for the third.

name: Turning Red
review: he frantic pacing (Shi lists Edgar Wright among her influences) and blink-and-miss-it background humour makes it a joy to watch.

name: Turning Red
review: It’s long been a Hollywood truism that centering women in coming-of-age stories guarantees that men will not watch them. Turning Red is a film that says fluff to all that.

name: Turning Red
review: This weird premise is fast & funny, & if youre into adolescent symbolism it has higher transitional girl-to-woman aspirations, but something seems missing through reliance on big set pieces & bizarre comic uses of the panda. Good that's it's streaming.

name: Turning Red
review: All the identities and metaphorical puberty struggle comes to a head in a hilarious climax, one where metaphor and culture clashes coalesce in a way that illuminates each conflict and maintains the gleeful exaggeration of a cartoon.

name: Turning Red
review: After a string of efficient but forgettable Pixar sequels, writer-director Domee Shi has unleashed the studio's inner weirdo.

name: Turning Red
review: This is a coming-of-age sensation where the supernatural and the mundane happily walk hand in hand, with each eye-popping surprise grounded in lifelike normality.

name: Turning Red
review: For an animated film, Turning Red has so many teaching and discussion points that it seems poised to be an enduring favorite for many years to come.

name: Turning Red
review: A fun, lively, joyous movie about embracing ones own uniqueness + body positivity, plus a huge win for Asian representation! Just because the movie is set within a specific ethnic culture, it doesn't mean the film is limited in scope.

name: Turning Red
review: Like Pixar's best films, it uses a simple concept as a springboard for complex emotions and visual delights.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a fizzing, squealing adolescent explosion of a movie that nails a fundamental truth about growing up.

name: Turning Red
review: This is a delightful fable about discovering yourself, while warning the parents that being loving can also mean knowing when to back off.

name: Turning Red
review: I found that Shi took a potentially on-paper solid idea and squandered it into semi-plodding and, at times, derivative plot

name: Turning Red
review: One of the most thematically and stylistically daring films Pixar has ever produced, featuring an outstanding cast and some beautiful animation that pushes the studio to a new level.

name: Turning Red
review: Theres a special kind of joy that comes from watching a film thats completely confident in its eccentricities. One made by a filmmaker who ... seemingly got the chance to execute their vision uncompromised.

name: Turning Red
review: As always, Pixar animation keeps us nicely intrigued, mostly with images and neighorborhoods from Canada's largest city precisely captured throughout.

name: Turning Red
review: ...a bright, breezy, original movie, but a shame that this wont be pitched to the adult audience who enjoyed Up or Inside Out...

name: Turning Red
review: As metaphors for puberty go, "your emotions go wild and turn you into a wild animal who snaps and snarls at your parents" is hardly a subtle one, but puberty itself isn't subtle.

name: Turning Red
review: The result is a heartwarming treat for the whole family that I so wish could play in the theater, because Turning Red is a total blast.

name: Turning Red
review: Anyone who has gone through puberty will find something to relate to in Turning Red.

name: Turning Red
review: The problems are mostly with the script, which often requires Meilin to be almost irritatingly obnoxious...

name: Turning Red
review: It is funnier, cleverer and more honest than you might expect.

name: Turning Red
review: For an update of Teen Wolf, it's perfectly great.

name: Turning Red
review: Though it retains the familiar magic of the legendary studio, ‘Turning Red’ stands out as a bold—and long overdue—landmark in representation

name: Turning Red
review: It's a wonderful allegory that proves universal to anyone who has ever had to battle against culture, tradition, and guardians too entrenched in their own regrets and guilt to get out of their own way.

name: Turning Red
review: A bright, fantastical comic romp that deftly blends heart, humor and artistry to deliver a universally relevant message about remaining true to yourself -- even amid the sometimes-overwhelming craziness of puberty.

name: Turning Red
review: An absolute joy to watch. It’s an empowering tale of young girl power that is a wonderfully vibrant ode to those awkward pre-teen years.

name: Turning Red
review: I think the panda might be a metaphor?

name: Turning Red
review: If the perfect is the enemy of the good, it’s banished joyously in Turning Red.

name: Turning Red
review: A hilarious and energetic coming-of-age comedy which is refreshingly open about puberty, novel territory for Disney.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is much like its pint-sized protagonist and goes proudly, loudly smaller, while still having the confidence and the smarts to poof at will into a bright red metaphor for the elation and confusion of coming-of-age.

name: Turning Red
review: A charming film that will win friends and trigger worthwhile conversations. The right sort of feel-good.

name: Turning Red
review: With heart, humor, and a deep understanding of the Chinese experience, Turning Red is deeply personal and that’s what makes it great.

name: Turning Red
review: Certain themes and characterizations aren’t as tightly executed as they are in other Pixar films... But the lush animation and moving ode to teenage friendship will most likely obscure those enough to make for an entertaining 100 minutes.

name: Turning Red
review: If Pixar is smart, it'll do everything it can to keep director Domee Shi happy, on its payroll and churning out premium content. She's wildly talented.

name: Turning Red
review: A bright but not light animated adventure that's entertaining yet challenging, approaching the turbulent years of adolescence from a unique standpoint.

name: Turning Red
review: Those who are quick to dismiss Turning Red might want to loosen up.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar's delightful look at trials and tribulations of teen girlhood in Toronto Chinatown.

name: Turning Red
review: Move over, 4Town. There is a new kid on the animated block; thy name is Girlz II Women.

name: Turning Red
review: Above all, the film is for girls Meilin’s age... Turning Red, the first Pixar film with an all-female creative leadership team, wants them to feel both entertained and seen.

name: Turning Red
review: Teenage coming-of-age stories do not come much sweeter, or honour girlhood more, than this animated feature from Pixar.

name: Turning Red
review: Even though Turning Red doesn’t reach the heights of some of Pixar’s best films, it’s still a pleasant enough way to spend an hour and 40 minutes.

name: Turning Red
review: Give Chiang and Oh credit for bringing out the emotional complexities.

name: Turning Red
review: A rare Pixar misfire.  I found the characters more annoying than charming, the message and metaphor confused, and the attempts at edgy humor off-putting.

name: Turning Red
review: Silly and playful, embracing the weird and never shying away. With a unique style, great performances, and a touching story - Disney-Pixar has done it again.

name: Turning Red
review: It damn well deserved a theatrical release, and its existence now feels like a Disney Trojan horse, but 'Seeing Red' is yet more evidence that the so-called Pixar Slump was nothing more than a media-created myth.

name: Turning Red
review: Buried within the finely tuned protocols of the pedestrian three-act screenplay  are some pretty deep thoughts.

name: Turning Red
review: Switching up the familiar parental overbearing or understanding roles can have humanizing implications for both fathers and mothers. Moms, like dads, are only human, and dads are, in a different sense, no less human than moms.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is emblematic of the animation studio at its best, full of emotional intelligence and creative innovation, as likely to please children as it is adults.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a heartwarming comedy filled with relatable characters. In dialing into a specific experience, it gives the story a unique and fresh feeling even while treading what would otherwise be familiar territory.

name: Turning Red
review: There are decent amounts of humor, some action, and plenty of heart-tugging moments. All of which means "Turning Red" is a delight to behold.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red nevertheless works well as a delightful coming-of-age story.

name: Turning Red
review: Ending with a bombastic fantasy battle, Turning Red is a sincere coming of age film that doesnt flinch at the cringey parts of adolescence.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar has parked any prudishness to create this bold, hilarious and strangely beautiful take on a 13-year-old girl’s trip into the land of no return — adulthood.

name: Turning Red
review: Anyone with a soul will warm to Mei, a raunchy little rebel whose lust for life turns the term “red-blooded” on its head.

name: Turning Red
review: Domee Shi, the first woman to direct a Pixar film, does a lovely job, keeping the story buoyantly witty and never allowing it to be overwhelmed by the rather obvious metaphor about bodies changing in adolescence.

name: Turning Red
review: The plotting, dialogue, and characters aren’t quite up to the studio’s standards. That’s more tribute to Pixar, and what we’ve come to expect from it, than criticism of “Turning Red.”

name: Turning Red
review: We’ve all been there even if our teenage turmoil didn’t result in pandadom.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar tackles the topic of female puberty in this animated funhouse ride about a 13-year girl from Torontos Chinatown who turns into a giant red panda in this wise and wonderful  metaphor for the roller coaster of messy adolescence.

name: Turning Red
review: The message about learning to love the beast within is tenderly handled, with delightful cultural details relating to rituals and cuisine combining winningly with universally relatable themes.

name: Turning Red
review: Through its fearless depiction of puberty as something worthy of such a big  and beautiful  platform, Turning Red is special.

name: Turning Red
review: If only real-life teenage awkwardness was as neat and efficient as this.

name: Turning Red
review: Although not without its minor shortcomings, I was won over by Turning Red's enthusiasm and earnest nature.

name: Turning Red
review: The filmmakers are sincere and straightforward in addressing the challenges and consequences of hitting puberty.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red succeeds on its most fundamental level. Its entertaining.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a potent and infectious film that addresses situations rarely discussed in movies, especially those aimed at younger audiences.

name: Turning Red
review: Writer-director Domee Shi's giddy animated debut feature offers a sweet and upbeat look at coming of age in an undisguised Toronto.

name: Turning Red
review: Shi turns a Chinese Canadian girl's discovering she can turn into a giant red panda into a touching tale about legacy, friendship, and learning to love everything that makes you, you with charm, wit and a heavy dose of middle-school earnestness.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a charming coming-of-age story with lovely pops of imagination and a refreshing lack of queasiness when it comes to its themes of puberty and adolescent sexuality.

name: Turning Red
review: Delightful, funny, unapologetically girl-centered, and a surprisingly touching allegory for adolescence, this is Pixar's most teen-friendly film.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is sensitive and insightful about identity and maturity, but it's also a ton of fun to watch.

name: Turning Red
review: While Turning Red is ambitious, like many of Pixar best films, unlike them it winds up overstuffed and undercooked.

name: Turning Red
review:
Meilin is a girl who has not fully become who she is, who feels the immense burden of her family and what's expected of her...who is trying to figure out her life with a little help from her friends.  

If that isn't relatable, then what is?

name: Turning Red
review: Aside from being an entertaining, nostalgia tinted coming-of-age tale (Tamagotchis, flip phones and boybands!) Shi's feature debut is an important and uniquely fresh take on navigating adolescence, identity & changing mother-daughter relationships

name: Turning Red
review: This would have made for a great family night at the movie theater  especially if you could drag the sulky adolescent in your house along with you.

name: Turning Red
review: As youd expect from Pixar, the film has all the studios typical artistry and cleverness, yet this one comes with big twists that often qualify as outright shocks.

name: Turning Red
review: "Turning Red" isn't a breakthrough the way that "Inside Out" was, but it has a solid emotional core and a mature, confident approach to personal subject matter. It's a touching tribute to everyone's inner teen.

name: Turning Red
review: A must see! It succeeds because Shi is willing to mine the depths of her own experiences. It manages to weave together so many complicated themes in a brilliant way. The strength and clarity of the protagonist allows for all of the dimensions to shine.

name: Turning Red
review: [A] gently upbeat tale of self-acceptance...

name: Turning Red
review: One of the studio’s finest releases in years.

name: Turning Red
review: Its more touching and more nuanced than you might expect from a film about a teenager who changes into a panda, but Turning Red is that movie. It is unafraid to be silly, serious and heartfelt, often at the same time.

name: Turning Red
review: The character writing and design are where “Turning Red,” directed by Domee Shi, most succeeds.

name: Turning Red
review: Richly layered, thematically bold...

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red stands proudly as one of Pixar's most diverse movies to date and thanks to Shi and its cast, it offers buckets of charm and beautiful visuals wrapped in a heartfelt and entertaining coming-of-age story.

name: Turning Red
review: Fun, weird and quite funny, Turning Red is one of Pixar's most different films in recent memory. A clever, edgy coming-of-age story that explores parenting, puberty and boy-band crushes. Full review in Spanish

name: Turning Red
review: Its about our bodies changing, friendships, the relationships between children and their parents, and a girl who finds out one day she can turn into a giant red panda. Turning Red is one big fluffy delight.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is relatable to anyone who's gone through adolescence and you completely feel rooted in Mei's world.

name: Turning Red
review: The movie can be on-the-nose about its themes and outlandish in its execution. Nevertheless, you have to respect the audacity of Shi, a filmmaker unafraid to write an unoriginal flavor for Pixar.

name: Turning Red
review: Overlook Turning Red at your peril. It’s the best thing Pixar’s produced in recent memory and perhaps the studio’s most emotionally nuanced and thematically clever film since Inside Out.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red captures that vintage Pixar vibe while telling a story that feels unique to the companys legendary canon.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red flickers with a bright feminine spirit, one that feels new, crimson-deep, and unapologetically rebellious.

name: Turning Red
review: the best Pixar movie in over a decade...Sandra Oh's Ming is perhaps Pixar's most entertaining vocal performance since Ellen DeGeneress Dory

name: Turning Red
review: Shi and co-writer Julia Cho recognize puberty's expansive affect, how that period in our lives inform the way we understand identity and negotiate the tension between friends and family, cultural tradition and whats trending.

name: Turning Red
review: It wont make you feel deep, existential sadness the way Pixar is knownor memedfor, but is there such a thing as deep, existential laughter? If so, heres that.

name: Turning Red
review: We’ve all got an inner beast, Shi reminds us, and taming it isn’t too hard — as long as you have friends (and boy bands) on your side.

name: Turning Red
review: The blast of creativity that Pixar needs and that everyone can love.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Reds a lot of fun to watch; its got humour, heart and the amazing vocals of Jordan Fisher  it just feels like a product of another time.

name: Turning Red
review: Feels like a B-team Pixar effort that will be quickly relegated to the bottom of your app queue.

name: Turning Red
review: “Turning Red” is pure Pixar in its imaginative clash of genres and impulses. Yet it’s something new, too, its own cultural- and gender-specific creation. I’m eager to see what Shi does next, metaphorically and every other way.

name: Turning Red
review: Has a lot of laughs, gorgeous animation, and an outstanding voice cast, but as the best Pixar films do, it finds a way to address specific feelings and human events in a way no other production team even attempts to do anymore.

name: Turning Red
review: Utterly charming and insightful

name: Turning Red
review: While Turning Red does not feel as impactful as other Pixar films, it delivers a good coming-of-age story about the difficulties of adolescence. Rosalie Chiang is fantastic as Mei Lee, and the dynamic displayed with her mother is a fun one.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is fun, wholesome, and adorably cute. It wraps you in an emotional blanket of warmth, although there's no need to worry about turning into a giant red panda yourself.

name: Turning Red
review: Domee Shi's feature debut is a lively and wise adventure with kindness to spare.

name: Turning Red
review: This is the 25th Pixar film to date and they always excel at finding a clever way of teaching kids about personal growth, emotions, and growing up.

name: Turning Red
review: The best thing about Turning Red is how it broadens the horizons of the 36-year-old animation powerhouse with a refreshing vantage point and some new moves... [But] it isn’t easy -- or maybe even possible -- to do puberty justice with a PG rating.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a delightful and heartwarming film.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red delivers an exquisitely animated story that's moving as well as funny -- welcome evidence that creatively speaking, at least, Pixar hasn't lost its golden touch.

name: Turning Red
review: Before Pixar returns to the Toy Story franchise with Lightyear, Turning Red represents a reminder as to the wonderful originality they are capable of when not designing films to sell toys.

name: Turning Red
review: The uncontrollable messiness of puberty is presented with understanding, compassion, and a lot of humor  both the good humor of empathy and the downright hilarity that Mother Nature provides so we dont all perish of humiliation during those years.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is straightforward and it captures very specific family pressures passed down from moms to their daughters perfectly.

name: Turning Red
review: Part funny-cute fantasy adventure, part thoughtful coming-of-age allegory, Turning Red is easy to relate to even if youre not a teenage girl because it taps into the array of emotions we all experience as we awkwardly try to find our place in the world.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a messy and authentic story that doesnt hesitate to break cycles (or talk about them) and tropes. Lets hear it for the girls.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixars Turning Red is a sweet little movie that works as a wonderful analogy for growing up.

name: Turning Red
review: Full of fun, humor, and heart, Turning Red is a coming-of-age comedy that's as exhilarating as it is groundbreaking family entertainment.

name: Turning Red
review: Domee Shi might be the future of Pixar. Turning Red is like nothing else the studio has done before, and it's all the better for it.

name: Turning Red
review: Chiang gives Mei a cheery attitude that jumps out of the speakers and draws the viewer in.

name: Turning Red
review: A film unlike anything Pixar has done before. A beautiful ode to growing up and finding yourself... a universal story we can all relate to in our own special, and messy ways - and it's a great monster-comedy for the kids. Yet another Pixar winner!

name: Turning Red
review: A vibrant—and sometimes unabashedly wacky—coming-of-age tale...

name: Turning Red
review: A daring, distinctive and downright delightful debut from Domee Shi, and a welcome change of pace from Pixar. Turning Red is, appropriately, its own beast — and one that’s easy to love.

name: Turning Red
review: We all need a little reassurance once in a while to stay true to ourselves, and Turning Red is speaking directly to generations of Asian women in the diaspora when they need to hear this the most.

name: Turning Red
review: That the studio gave a first-time director the freedom to explore these potentially sensitive themes, and to do so in a tone that is boisterous and playful rather than handwringing or self-serious, is a promising sign for Pixar’s future.

name: Turning Red
review: The lack of depth is a sign of Domee Shi struggling to make the big jump from short films to feature-length projects. It's also a blow to Pixar, for Shi is the lone female highlight among its next generation of in-house filmmakers.

name: Turning Red
review: iTurning Red/i is resoundingly funny, wonderfully expressed, and cleverly constructed.

name: Turning Red
review: A perfectly fine little film with engaging characters, parent-appealing cultural throwbacks, and the familiar message to embracing yourself.

name: Turning Red
review: Modest and funny, "Turning Red" builds to a moving ending that speaks to the eternal tension between demanding mothers and the daughters who seek their approval.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is Pixars funniest and most imaginative film in years. It captures the wild energy of adolescence, uses pop stars as a timeless window into puberty, and tells a tale of friendship and family in the most delightfully kid-friendly way.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a bold, consistently hilarious romp that sees Mei learning and figuring out what she wants to do with certain changes and who she is becoming

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red can at times get too one-note and formulaic in its themes of identity and self-discovery, but the movie has enough offbeat charm to make it a memorable coming-of-age story.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar's latest animated feature Turning Red brings literal magic to a teenage coming-of-age story, breathing new life into a familiar premise.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red's Toronto is culturally diverse, its approach as realistic as it is diverting, its emotional integrity sturdy yet malleable.

name: Turning Red
review: It is a coming-of-age love letter blending timely themes about growth, friendship, family, and embracing one's true self, with of course, 2000's boy bands.

name: Turning Red
review: A very funny movie that will reward repeat viewings. It's a beautiful, satisfying experience.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red, an inventive and delightful new comedy debuting on Disney Plus, is classic Pixar, making a bouncy comedy out of an adorable fantasy laden with allegorical implications.

name: Turning Red
review: "Turning Red" isn't afraid to give children the confidence to let their inner beast out of the cage every once in a while and be themselves.

name: Turning Red
review: Canadian-Chinese animator Domee Shis boldest move is tackling female puberty in such a candid, empathetic way.

name: Turning Red
review: Teen Wolf for girls and pandas.

name: Turning Red
review: An exceptional puberty comedy by way of Sanrio-branded Kafka, Turning Reds truthful transformations are strikingly charming, surprisingly complex and satisfyingly heartfelt.

name: Turning Red
review: With a bright visual style and specific, evocative storytelling, Turning Red is an incredibly special addition to the Pixar canon, and one of its best films.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red takes a transformational moment for girls into a hilarious and brilliantly creative exploration of adolescence. The film uses a family's greatest secret as an ingenious allegory for reaching puberty. Pixar continues to be groundbreaking.

name: Turning Red
review: A film thats trying too hard, has an extremely irritating lead character, and features a very lazy metaphor for puberty and womanhood.

name: Turning Red
review: “Turning Red” succeeds in hitting all the right emotional notes — and its real magic lies in its unabashed celebration of the joyful chaos of girlhood within a proud Asian immigrant family.

name: Turning Red
review: Its a beautifully animated feature with a unique target demographic and a solid story, but due to a misguided release strategy, it never quite gets the opportunity to feel eventful.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a charming, thoughtful, loving, funny, girl power animated movie that speaks without shame to the challenges of going to bed a little girl one day and waking up the next to the literal burden of being a woman.

name: Turning Red
review: "Turning Red" allows young characters with literal and figurative inner beasts true beauty amid all of their messy exterior and interior traits.

name: Turning Red
review: An entertaining, sweet, and resonant film. This is what embracing all cultural perspectives is about, because you can find universal understanding.

name: Turning Red
review: A confectionary celebration of middle schoollayered with enough puberty, generational trauma, repression, sisterhood, and boy bands to bring out the beast in any girl...Shi has a way of imbuing metaphor and allusion into explorations of family dynamics!

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is the first Disney movie for a young audience in quite some time that feels like it's speaking directly to them, instead of about them. The result is not so much a moral lesson as a map of how to accept yourself the way that you are.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red unspools a fresh, funny, and family-centric new mythology destined to become iconic.

name: Turning Red
review: The entire movie is another Pixar punch to the gut in a way that I think younger audiences will really relate to and older audiences will just cry over.

name: Turning Red
review: This movie is delightful and fun! You’re in for a great time. The art style read to me as a possible homage to Studio Ghibli, and Mei’s transformation into an incredibly cute giant red panda felt like a nod to the iconic fluffy Totoro.

name: Turning Red
review: Domee Shi has a very strong & unique creative voice, which means this movie is the same! Unlike anything Disney or Pixar has done before. Mei and her friends are a delight! But parents take note: frank discussions about puberty make this PG-13.

name: Turning Red
review: Despite the action and many of the spot-on depictions of adolescent awkwardness, the film is missing what the studio is best known for: heart and pathos.

name: Turning Red
review: Even though the connection between Turning Red and other intimate non-franchise Pixar films is palpable  it reminded me of Inside Out (2015) but also Soul (2020)  the fact that theres a woman at the helm really shows this time.

name: Turning Red
review: An intergenerational family drama, a search for self, and a big, bouncy comedy sure to entertain. Pixar on its B+-game.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is yet another Pixar homerun that truly captures what it feels like to be a thirteen-year-old girl while also remaining empathetic to overprotective parents and not leaning into teen girl cliches.

name: Turning Red
review: It isnt so much a bad movie as a tentative one. It came to life with grand intentions, some cute characters, a ready-made toy tie-in and a hint of controversy.

name: Turning Red
review: What if Pixar made Teen Wolf for younger girls? Turning Red is the result, another solid success story for the company.

name: Turning Red
review: I admire what director Domee Shi was going for with Turning Red but the script lets down that ambitious premise making for more of a mess than a masterpiece.

name: Turning Red
review: Tremendously heartwarming and wildly funny, it's a nuanced take on both the chaos of puberty and the weight of familial expectation. One of Pixar's most daring films thus far.

name: Turning Red
review: 2000s teen girl nostalgia, adorable red pandas, and an overall fun vibe come together in TURNING RED.

name: Turning Red
review: The films central metaphor might sporadically stretch a bit far, but it never quite gets to the breaking point, allowing for an empathetic understanding of how family history can simultaneously prop you up and weigh you down.

name: Turning Red
review: It all works beautifully. And the animation is brilliant.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar's Turning Red provides another well-animated coming-of-age story, with plenty of specificity, and a giant red panda.

name: Turning Red
review: Perhaps the best take on adolescence since Bo Burnham's "Eighth Grade."

name: Turning Red
review: Its messier, hornier, and more frantic. And like the big red panda version of Mei, its more lovable because of its faults.

name: Turning Red
review: It's an animated feature bursting with life. Turning Red explores important messaging on puberty, sexual repression, and culture clashes along with Pixar's infectious spin.

name: Turning Red
review: The crown jewel of Pixar’s people-turn-into-creatures oeuvre.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is Pixar's loosest, funkiest film to date.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixar continues to crush it with Turning Red...

name: Turning Red
review: Shi's bright and fluffy coming-of-age caper is an often hilarious and commendably frank appreciation of the awkwardness of adolescence.

name: Turning Red
review: The journey is slick and diverting, and at times incisive, but Turning Red is yet another Pixar film that coasts rather than glides. Hopefully its next offering can turn into something more.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is a sweet and relatable story about what it means to grow up, but not apart.

name: Turning Red
review: It’s hard to know what’s more impressive about the latest Pixar film: its boundless artistry, ingenuity and loopy comic verve, or the mere fact that the studio got away with making it.

name: Turning Red
review: Not only reminds you of Pixar’s strength in general, but how animated films can deliver layered, tricky, emotionally resonant stories with a powerful, punchy pop.

name: Turning Red
review: Director Domee Shi, who brought a dumpling to life in her Oscar-winning short, Bao, graduates to features with flying colors — literally — in this charmer from Pixar.

name: Turning Red
review: In the tricky world of tween-dom, it captures something sweetly universal: Growing up is messy, no matter how you bear it.

name: Turning Red
review: “Turning Red” is a delight and, I suspect, an endlessly replayable one, though in its eagerness to clean up its own impressively messy emotions in the final stretch, it falls short of the catharsis it’s aiming for.

name: Turning Red
review: A heartwarming coming of age story that is jam packed with extremely cringey, yet relatable, moments. Mothers and daughters will likely relate more than others, but still a great family friendly film in which Pixar pushes the envelope a bit.

name: Turning Red
review: Irresistibly cute and thoroughly unashamed of its own silliness, “Turning Red” may be second-tier Pixar, but the emotions run every bit as deep as in the studio’s best.

name: Turning Red
review: Shi crafts a heartwarming, empowering and fun narrative about female puberty and a changing mother/daughter relationship.

name: Turning Red
review: "Turning Red" is another Pixar homerun, a low-stakes adventure turned high-stakes thanks to its heightened emotions and envelope-pushing animation style.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red is filled with fantastic ideas, on the narrative and on the aesthetic side. But 'Inside Out' took more risks and the bigger the risk, the bigger the reward. Full review in Spanish

name: Turning Red
review: The end result is a tale as lovely in construction as it is narratively in execution, each working together in an exploration of agency and individuality as they brush against familial tradition.

name: Turning Red
review: TURNING RED excels in capturing the normal and at the same time wild life of a young girl in a super fresh, genuine and positive way. And the quality of animation is just astounding!

name: Turning Red
review: The film continues the Disney umbrellas penchant for globe-trotting and/or diversity-sourcing, though in a similarly token and facile fashion.

name: Turning Red
review: Feels so natural as an extension of the filmmakers own interests without a ton of modern animated tropes shoehorned into the simple story merely to appeal only to the kiddies.

name: Turning Red
review: Pixars best movie since Inside Out.

name: Turning Red
review: With Pixars latest film, Turning Redand last years LucaPixar seems ready to shift away from the tears, but rather, show that they can have an impactful, moving story without the moments of deep sorrow.

name: Turning Red
review: After a first hour that may well hit Zoomers and their millennial parents in the feels, Turning Red gradually runs out of steam.

name: Turning Red
review: Hilarious, awkward, over-the-top anime meets Pixar's emotionally raw, vulnerable storytelling. It's never felt so good to see my Asian teen self become the hero, and learn to forgive her too.

name: Turning Red
review: Turning Red argues that even the most cringeworthy mum is doing her best and, in return, parents need to let their teenagers find their own path. A worthy message, with or without pandas.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
Rating: PG (Dark Thematic Material|Brief Smoking|Peril|Some Rude Humor|Violence)

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With sensitivity and heart, it explores grief, war, and the question of what it truly means to be human.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Sel Toro’s film does, indeed, get a lot of things right. It’s got a nice sense of humor, for example. It is ambitious. It has heart. Where it falters, however, is in its near-total absence of charm.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Is there anything he cannot do? Del Toro’s love and care for his films, including his move to the animated medium with co-director Mark Gustafson, is a masterpiece with his own take on the famous Italian story.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: “Pinocchio” is one of the best films released in 2022. A beautiful depiction of love, war, life, death, purpose and self-assurance. All told through the mind of one of the masters of storytelling.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: All around, Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio comes down as one of the best of 2022.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Despite brilliantly and lovingly crafted visuals, the irresistible strangeness of the original tale is lost in an allegory of political thuggery

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A far cry from Disney's sanitized 1940 'Pinocchio' and the many versions that have followed, Guillermo del Toro's deeply sad, emotional interpretation is more politically focused than the familiar fable.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Not all of the songs work, but del Toro lavishes this story with his signature blend of the weird and wonderful. It's immersive, it's dark, and it's visually excellent.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro takes an almost over-familiar story, places it in a different world and gives it a whole new style of magic, one that can’t help but give you a lump in the throat. This is how it’s done. And you won’t see anything else like it.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A director like Guillermo del Toro, who sees the outcasts and the lonely as heroes, could never create a Pinocchio that defended “perfection” as a reasonable or even desirable goal. [Full review in Portuguese]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: While the reinterpreted story elements are a bit out there... one can’t deny the heart and soul that went into the production. The fascist setting ultimately distracts from the life lesson being taught... holy crap, when did the whale become a kaiju?!

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillmermo's approach to this classic story is mesmerizing! Easily the best anime film this year and the raw emotion of it all. So much life, tragedy, emotional, and it feels so personal. Oscar worthy film... ABSOLUTE MUST WATCH!

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: In straying far from Carlo Collodi’s 1883 novel, Guillermo del Toro has cobbled a much darker, more relevant boy of pine.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A sensitively made autumnal stop-motion film sonata.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: You've probably never seen a Pinocchio who dances for Mussolini, but Guillermo del Toro's dark, stirring, yet life-affirming take on the classic tale of the puppet who becomes a real boy has more in common with Pan's Labyrinth and The Shape of Water...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Another success in the inimitable storyteller’s wildly inventive canon of filmmaking.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The musical aspect didn’t match the technically stunning visuals, but this fable comes with enough humor, poetry, and grimness to justify the director’s childhood obsession.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: a stop-motion animated masterpiece, rich with emotion, texture, and detail both on the surface and within the story itself.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: We need another Pinocchio the way we need another King Arthur or Robin Hood, but Del Toro crafts something often beautiful that merges a fresh take on mortality with many of the elements we are comfortably numb towards.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This one is as advertised: A retelling of a fairly inert fable infused with all the good, bad, and gothically macabre of GDT, intended for kids but not really. Is that what somebody out there was looking to watch?

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: I thought it was incredible. It's a visually beautiful film, with complex themes, interesting characters, [and] a strong family dynamic that isn't always warm and fuzzy, but it's real.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Themes of empathy, fascism, dealing with death, and learning to re-live run deep within this masterpiece. And for all the complexities, the film is just plain enjoyable.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: If you’re going to do this story again, you might as well do it in a way that audiences can carry something different from the experience. Del Toro’s passion for this project shows with no strings attached.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro pulls at our heartstrings to tell a grandiose but deeply personal story. It is one of 2022's very best films.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's re-interpretation of the classic tale is a beautifully crafted and effective anti-war fable with a potent message of acceptance. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The stop-motion technology, though, is wondrously done... Much expertise went into making this film. But if I recommended it as fun for all the family, I'd expect my nose to sprout by another inch or two. This is a Pinocchio strictly for grown-ups.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is handsome and well-crafted. But the film’s intertwining of traditional Catholicism, Fascism, and dysfunctional families with gooey sentimentality makes a stew of ingredients that don’t go well together.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Overall, there is a lot intermingled – from magic realism to dark fantasy to satire. At first glance it would seem that ‘Pinocchio’ is not really kid’s film, but the film works on many levels.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: ... Defies the absurd notion that animation is exclusively for children and as such, inferior to bone and flesh fiction. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio is a fascinating film that offers substance for audiences of all ages. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Irreverent. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: As beautiful as del Toro’s Pinocchio is in design and conceit—the curved ridges on Geppetto’s beard alone are a wonder—the film never quite gains the intended emotional power.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro's re-imagining of the Pinocchio story is not for the youngest kids, but anyone interested in what happens when a brilliant filmmaker takes on classic material will find a lot to admire.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Although the world del Toro creates is gorgeous, the story is so confused between the original tale, a fascist political angle and oddly used Christian imagery that it's too frightening for children and too muddled and boring for adults.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro also does an excellent job of updating the source material to his style, setting the story in Italy under the rule of fascist Benito Mussolini.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s a testament to Guillermo del Toro’s vision for making it feel like I’m watching something new and fresh despite the many Pinocchio iterations that have come before.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: …this Pinocchio is too worldly for kids, yet doesn’t have enough dramatic heft for an adult audience…

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This is instantly a darker take on the popular fairy tale, though that is exactly to be expected with del Toro at the helm.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro‘s Pinocchio is amongst his finer recent films as well as one of the more standout adaptations of the classic fairy tale. It’s a must-see for this holiday season.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro's dark vision strings Pinocchio along with enchanting fantasy, haunting intelligence.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo Del Toro's Pinocchio is a masterpiece -- a bittersweet and perfectly human story elevated by stunning stop-motion animation.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: On his way to this profoundly poignant ending, Del Toro wanders along some deeply weird detours. But at a time when so many family movies feel as if they’ve been written by committee, this story is something rare...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio gives lessons in mortality from death creatures possibly more unsettling than those in Hellboy II and Pan’s Labyrinth.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Kids might quake a bit more in del Toro's version, but cinema fans find visual splendors from a master of the macabre.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This is a memorable re-telling that both moves the story in new directions while honoring what made it so beloved in the first place.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: If you appreciate stop-motion animation, you'll no doubt be enthralled by Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio, an animated work co-directed by del Toro and Mark Gustafson.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With every character, the animators clearly took care to master the expressiveness of the eyes, the natural flow of movement. The visual details overwhelm the movie’s flaws.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With the help of writer Patrick McHale, Guillermo del Toro has gently spun the beloved classic tale of a wooden boy and his quest for humanity to revolve around themes and ideas that del Toro has long been obsessed with.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The adult and somber themes of “Guillermo Del Toro’s Pinocchio” may be off-putting. It is aimed more for adults than children.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s been a long time since animated movies had the nerve to go to very dark places, and the celebrated master of macabre shows just what can be done with the medium.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Might be a bit dark for younger kids. But what else would you expect from Del Toro who leaves his creative fingerprints all over this project and the stop-motion-animation puppets that he and his team have brought to life?

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Given the choice between this and Disney’s recent live-action remake of its 1940 classic, del Toro’s film is less cynical, more inspired, and infinitely more memorable.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The darker impulses and political subplots may make the film less interesting to family audiences and more attractive to animation fans looking for more nuanced and complex animated adventures.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio has been a bucket list project of del Toro's for a long time, and you can tell he's poured his heart and soul into the project.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It is a lively adventure, thanks to the antics of insect narrator Sebastian Cricket (Ewan McGregor). And amid the darkness is great tenderness. Pinocchio learns bittersweet lessons on mortality and morality, while Geppetto comes to love him for who he is.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro is a master storyteller who completely changes how we’ve ever perceived this story. By tackling very deep ideas about what makes us human, whether or not Pinocchio is a real boy is no longer relevant.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It's a nice twist on the part of del Toro, one that breathes new life into a wooden corpse.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An original, unforgettable, enchanted nightmare.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A spellbinding, innovative, and original take on a story so many will think they know inside and out… but they don’t.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Far too often adaptations, especially those of fairytales and children's stories, feel the need to burden the audience with more of everything.  Instead, 'Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio' sculpts what's there into something fresh and original.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Against so many earlier versions, del Toro faces an uphill battle, not only to make his adaptation stand apart from the rest but make the worn-out material feel vibrant again [...] the film is at least successful in the former category

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: del Toro doesn’t care. He pushes the political pedal all the way through the floorboards and stubbornly remains true to his roots...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The drama is rich but del Toro is still making a lively adventure full of great sights.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The artistry of the detailed animation is gorgeous, especially on a big screen, and there's an undercurrent of emotion that's both thrilling and moving.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is a magical journey I did not want to end. A sublime and visually engrossing masterwork by one of our great directors. A meditative deconstruction of one's mortality, love, and innocence.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: I dare anyone to sit through this and not be touched by the unbridled love for life exuded by this unruly puppet and find revered awe for the talents of all who brought this beautifully dark ensemble to life.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro has embraced the poetry in craftsmanship and ushered in the most beautiful stop-motion animation film in years.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s an intriguing but ultimately muddled departure, grounding a story associated with fantasy in grim historical reality.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: I can make a compelling case that this is the best version of Pinocchio to-date, and that includes the Disney classic.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro has crafted a darker yet equally more emotional version of Pinocchio. It is exquisitely animated with rich textures, gorgeous lighting, and mostly welcome character reinventions. It is absolutely a contender for this year's best animated film.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: There are parts that can be shortened to make it a tighter story and maintain the tension that took a while to build up in the first place, but it remains entertaining nonetheless.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Despite its debatable first thirty minutes, the film takes flight and reaches a few dazzling moments. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An authentic milestone in animation.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With beautiful music, fantastic performances, and a marvelous script, Guillermo Del Toro’s Pinocchio is an instant classic.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An absolute technical, formal, artistic and narrative delicacy capable of astonish, draw smiles and break hearts.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Cool to look at and miserable to watch.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Every ingenious image is a gift.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Its themes are universal, even as it tells a story that feels wonderfully singular in its look and method of delivery.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: For fans of the director and his unique style, it’s a never dull retelling of a story you thought you already knew.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It is a tad bit too long but the haunting yet incredibly beautiful animation were awe-inspiring. Really enjoyed this dark take on a classic tale.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: While I thoroughly enjoyed the animation, I did think the movie was 10-15 minutes too long. The story was trying to do a bunch of things at once, which made it feel bloated at times.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: GUILLERMO DEL TORO'S PINOCCHIO is a stop-motion musical marvel and one of the best movies of the year. It is a cinematic feat that is not just for children, it is for everyone.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It is not only the best animated film of the year but certainly one of the year’s very finest.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The animation is painstakingly created, the stop-motion figures are incredibly detailed, and the story carries a surprising amount of weight for this oft-told story.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Audiences have never seen the likes of Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio and might never see something like this ever again.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro puts his personal stamp with exquisite cinematography capturing intricate stop-action in his dark, musical reimagining of the classic tale.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Real-world fascism and dark fantasy melded better in more grounded Del Toro masterworks, but there's a kitchen-sink approach with themes and presentation here that will, understandably, leave some viewers cold.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Unlike Matteo Garrone’s sublime 2019 fantasy, a version that managed to be faithful, wildly imaginative and all-ages in appeal, this brooding musical veers wildly between primary school scatology, repeated journeys to the underworld and darkest history.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: . . . del Toro and co-writer Patrick McHale smartly pack their adventure with emotional family messages and a few more of a decidedly political nature. Truth be told, their latest "Pinocchio" just might be 2022's best animated film. Why would I lie?

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: "By mixing a specific kind of magical realism with a very recognizable historical backdrop, del Toro gives his Pinocchio a kind of immediacy that’s as attractive as it is subtly terrifying."

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This film is a masterpiece, with fabulous original songs & scenic wonder in every frame of its emotional and stunning tale of adventure. We learn along with Pinocchio that time & mortality are fleeting, & to appreciate them is to value your own existence.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An enchanting feast for all... a “Pinocchio” that’s a copy of nothing—neither the original nor any previous version of it—but a brilliant, highly personal reimagining of its themes [in] gorgeous stop-motion animation.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: While it’s overlong and sometimes off-putting, “Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio” shows that new twists can still be added to old wooden tales.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: These puppets appear to have moved through centuries of history in this fully realized world before the audience arrives at the story and the setting.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: I value the risks "Pinocchio" took, and they all paid off... The craftsmanship that goes into each and every character model -- from Geppetto to the background villagers -- is beyond inspiring

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Artistically brilliant design and relevant messaging make this new take on a classic story fresh and topical.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With melodies both merry and melancholy (and usually delightfully bizarre), "Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio" transports us to a space of both wonder and horror, as befits a work from this Mexican auteur.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Bleak as winter, impressively made, Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is the latest of a rash of adaptations of Carlo Collodi’s classic children’s novel and is, without a doubt, the darkest.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is clearly not aimed solely at kids, but rather is banking on the fact that adults, too, will be drawn to the striking visuals and mature themes at play.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro finds in this oft-told tale both the heart that has allowed it to endure for so long and an idiosyncratic connection that makes his version feel new.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Roughly two-thirds in, the movie begins to feel a bit cluttered and unwieldy. But it’s a pure vision nonetheless—del Toro’s fingerprints are clearly visible in this painstakingly carved creation.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Blending incredible stop-motion animation and top-notch voice work with a surprising spin on a tried-and-true tale, Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is a winner.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Easily one of the best animated films of the year, and one of the most assured, endearing works of del Toro’s filmography.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Part of the ingenuity of the script is that each interaction with Pinocchio opens up an emotional wound in the characters that surround him. Some get to heal them, while others are consumed by them. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is the greatest adaptation of the Carlo Collodi story since the Walt Disney version.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s a del Toro movie all the way, giddy with moviemaking rapture and dark with undercurrents of fantasy and dreaming.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Through his [Pinocchio] rawness and insatiable curiosity, comes the promise of a fascinating and unconventional journey, one of exploring the vicissitudes of the human world. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It's a handsomely crafted, stop-motion animated take on Carlo Collodi's 19th-century picaresque, marking a distinct, ostensibly dark departure from the Disney version that has long dominated the public imagination.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Stunning animation and very good voice work, particularly from Gregory Mann as Pinocchio. But this is VERY similar to Pan's Labyrinth, so much so that it detracts from the film. However, that said, it's still worth watching for animation and film fans.
