name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio serves as a conclusion to a spiritually connected trilogy that del Toro began with The Devil’s Backbone and continued with Pan’s Labyrinth. The tone is symmetrical with the material, which has for so long been misclassified as a kids’ fable.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is a beautiful, layered, stop-motion masterpiece. The film is filled with incredible performances and imbued with the director’s signature style in a retelling that is both poignant and heartwarming.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Adding layers of sociopolitical allegory without sacrificing its kid-friendly charms, this adventure uses dazzling stop-motion animation to supplement its fresh narrative approach to the iconic tale of childhood innocence.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: "Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio,” is a gorgeously rendered, visually meticulous and narratively dense production that uses the magic of stop-motion animation to bring a new sense of life to this oft-told tale.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The tactile presentation is nothing short of awe-inspiring as the 15 year journey to bring this animated adventure comes to a bittersweet end. Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio embraces the beauty of life’s complicated imperfections, no strings attached.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: I don’t typically advise listening to crickets, but believe Sebastian J., because the story of Pinocchio has never been told quite like this.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The best animated film Netflix has ever made, and the best animated film of 2022.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: ...a remarkable achievement that will fill you with warmth and light.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Leave it to del Toro to transform a kids’ fairy tale into a funny, sad, and resourceful rumination on obedience, the messiness of immortality, and the world’s true monsters - fascists and others who exploit the innocent.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A tale of fathers and sons, spirits, and the underworld – coalescing in a time of social and political upheaval. That’s a lot to take in, and yet it all works in captivating fashion.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An intriguingly weird and spooky version of the story. Also a truly terrific feat of design and animation,

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is impressive and the animation is a work of art. A masterful rendition of a classic story.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: To survive is therefore the burden, but one you must shoulder with strength to honor those who've been lost. If that's not a worthwhile lesson, I don't know what is.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It is the first time del Toro has made anything resembling a family-friendly film that is made to be devoured by youngsters. ... Sumptuously realized. It's a very dark vision, best seen through adult eyes first, even though it's rated PG.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The most satisfying-looking film adaptation and it’s also the scariest, finds evil lurking but promises that love will prevail, no matter how painful the journey. Funny moment – hearing for the first time in a children’s film “Bugger off”.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s an ultimately affirming, if constantly emotional, story of love. It just walks a very bizarre path.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The most essential adaptation of Carlo Collodi’s novel since Walt Disney’s 1940 cartoon masterpiece, with a practically perfect mix of tragedy, comedy, adventure, parental worries, societal expectations, childhood precociousness and antiwar leanings.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An odd film, though it feels personal throughout, which is much more than you can say about a lot of other versions of the same story.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This animated adventure of the mischievous wooden marionette is dark, bleak, and still beautifully hopeful.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: There are some wonderful surreal creatures, a smattering of songs and moments of heartbreaking poignancy.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s visually top-notch.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Easily my favorite animated work of the year (and there were some strong contenders in 2022), and I hope del Toro continues to spearhead and direct new animated works going forward.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: [W]hen del Toro and his artistic collaborators focus on the core of this tale and their existential twist on it, the film makes this story feel new again...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This film is a love letter to healing and processing grief. The titular title may be the doll but the film is centered on Geppetto utilizing Pinocchio as his vehicle.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Harkens back to the good old days of tough-love family flicks with a lot of tears and huge emotional payoffs.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio’s spirited disobedience suddenly becomes a form of heroic resistance, rather than something to be squashed out of him.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The pleasantly odd-and-quirky fare we’ve come to expect from del Toro.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: These exquisite handmade characters feel fragile, easily broken, and the imperfections are part of their charm, part of their nature.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The del Toro version of this tale has just the sort of thing that the Zemeckis film lacks: purpose, both in its storytelling and its animation style.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo Del Toro’s Pinocchio is by far the superior version of the story to come out in 2022, returning the heart to the tale that is so clearly needed.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio rewards rewatches and further thought, and will likely take some time to tease out fully from its deceptively simple narrative.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: As a streaming option, Pinocchio wins points for being just different enough compared to typical family-friendly fare.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: While some of Pinocchio’s new ideas don’t entirely work, it’s the dedication to more fully exploring these characters and their origins as people and not as assistants in Pinocchio’s story that makes this the best adaptation since Disney’s 1940 version.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Rich in detail and imagination, the film’s style mixes and matches dreams with nightmares to create a palette that paints the fanciful and the earthbound in equal measure.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: ... a classic child’s tale that isn’t afraid to bear its teeth toward the follies of humanity in its quest to open and uplift hearts.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An absolutely magical, soul-nourishing film.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: As del Toro has already said several times, animation is not a genre; it's an art form, a way of making movies. And that philosophy is evident in every frame of "Pinocchio", a film made with love, dedication and lots of patience. Full review in Spanish.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: As weird as the story is, it’s been made all the stranger by the decision to turn it into a metaphor about fascism, a conceit that is as politically incoherent as it is unfortunately timed.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Thankfully, that visual splendor still makes for an enthralling experience. Del Toro's Pinocchio remains among the absolute best animated works you’d be fortunate enough to see this year or any other.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio casts an enchanting spell.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Fraught with danger and lilting with poignant melancholy... an exercise in exploring the seams between life’s pleasures and its terrible pains, a film that turns toward our grim era and wrestles some measure of hope and kindness out of it.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: If the art of making movies resembles magic, this is one of its greatest incantations.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Quirky but gentle, it concludes on a profoundly emotional note that will leave even the most stone-hearted viewer holding back tears.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It might seem to be a predictable move for director Guillermo del Toro to at last produce his 14-year fairy tale passion project. Less predictable is just how fearless and refreshing the project has turned out to be.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: As strange and macabre as it is heartfelt.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is a stop-motion achievement that sneaks up on you.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro gives the fable a boldly creative, explosively imaginative retooling of magical enchantment, grotesque beauty, mythological mysticism, sweeping human emotion and existential wonder.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Not merely a cosmetically distinct adaptation of its well-known source material, it puts forth a set of values that go far beyond platitudes and ponders the responsibilities of making and being a person.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Like Zemeckis’ version, this is a Pinocchio that wants to affirm that flawed people are fine just as they are; unlike him, del Toro can pull that off without betraying the aspirational nature of the story.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: But while there is plenty to laugh at in this adaptation of a fantasy classic, what the writers have also delivered is poignancy...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is a stellar example of how to do a highly creative movie remake that maintains the spirit of the original while making imaginative revisions. It's destined to be a classic in stop-motion animation.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A film that’s bizarre, beautiful, really smart and full of heart.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The best version of this story ever told.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This Pinocchio puzzles the existential question of what it means to be alive. The focus gives the old story an unusual, rich, autumnal slant.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It's a gorgeous movie, with dizzying designs that eventually lure us away from the old familiar cartoon images and into its cruel, but hopeful world.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Surreal, tinged with sadness, bittersweet, beautiful: that's the film that del Toro has chiseled.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This isn’t your father’s “Pinocchio,” but rather a “Pinocchio” that foregrounds the bonds between fathers and sons, tightening them with tragedy.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The most amazing change to the old story is the effective case the film makes for love conquering all: mortality, repressive society, one’s own limiting judgments.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s taken 140 years and about 20 screen incarnations, but del Toro has finally gotten Pinocchio’s secret sauce just right.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Though the rounded beauty of Disney’s draftsmanship—remember the cathedral-like cavern of the whale’s interior—can never be erased, the angularity of this latest attempt has a piercing punch of its own.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's animated masterpiece is visually resplendent but much more than a technical marvel. Dark, haunting, soulful as well as comical, thanks to Ewan McGregor's amusing take as Pinocchio's friend and guide.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The film refuses to sanitize life's most daunting aspects in favor of vapid distraction.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Animation is clearly cinema, and this film is further proof of that.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: There have been many versions of Collodi’s tale, but none have the thematic richness of del Toro’s work.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: I’ve seen many takes on “Pinocchio” over the years, but this is the first version to feature a cameo by Mussolini.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This third screen adaptation of Carlo Collodi’s beloved 1883 novel in three years might just be the one that endures.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The voice cast was well-chosen, and they don’t disappoint. Gregory Mann was a great discovery for Pinocchio. His exuberance conveys Pinocchio’s essential innocence, and he sings beautifully.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Some may find it long at almost two hours. That will depend on whether del Toro’s imagination has done its work. I found it spellbinding.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Maybe they shouldn't have done it as a musical, but other than that I think it is a fabulous film.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It's the integrity of that vision and the power that it gives it that eclipses pretty much any other American animated film we've gotten this year.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro transforms the morality-packed sinister and macabre original tale into an ultimate reflection of the ephemeral, and therefore, the value of life. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is one of the most visionary films I have ever seen. The whole movie is a feast for the senses. It is both wildly inventive and deeply affective.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It's hard not to want to repeatedly hit pause to soak in the vivid detail of the puppets and their settings, and to wonder at how it's all created.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Whatever I was expecting or wanted this remake of a well-worn story to be, this was better. I can’t say it’s an uplifting Christmas film for the whole family, but it’s certainly a beautiful one.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A bewitching animated masterwork that’s one of the best movies of 2022.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio was a refreshing departure from the predictable Disney-esque film. An overwhelming full sensory experience

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Like Geppetto, Del Toro and his team have masterfully brought to life inanimate objects, so much so that we forget we're seeing plastic figures. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Tender and macabre, happy and sad, sensible and challenging; a vigorous fairytale seasoned with humor and musical numbers, perhaps not always opportune, but always effective... [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: What does it mean to be a real boy? Perhaps the answer doesn’t lie in flesh and bone.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The vigor of its images is undeniable and, like its protagonist, the film remains a small and strange creature worthy of love and wonder. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro interlaces darkness with the utmost tenderness, without fear of being maudlin... [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro in pure form. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Though the child who sees the film will need some grit, the movie also zips and thrills, the stop-motion wonderfully inventive.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: There is a heart underneath all the darkness. Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio has a very heartfelt and bittersweet ending.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio brought tears and joy to my soul. It’s a moving story that balances humor, heart, and music.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Netflix must have called in the Blue Fairy because what better investment could they have made than giving Oscar-winning director Guillermo del Toro the funding needed to finally realize one of his dream projects?

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Clearly the year's best Pinocchio, a low bar; it is moreover one of the year's best films generally.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Not only is Del Toro’s Pinocchio a visual masterpiece, but it's also a masterclass in storytelling and narrative allegory. It is steeped in its own lore, and brimming with the vibrancy of life that emerges through the somber and dreary aesthetics.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Despite its very distinctive look and the rich darkness of its bittersweet story, this is very much in the tradition of Grimms' Fairy Tales and other similar edgy fairy tale stories. It is a tale about morality, and the nature of existence.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The animation is stunning, the story is drastically different from what we know, and the way this is handled will bring a smile to so many faces. It is easily the best animated movie of the year.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It has a fresh energy all its own while still maintaining the emotional weight that made Collodi's tale so impactful. It's an incredible achievement from its exquisite stop-motion animation to its thoroughly affecting storytelling.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro magically crafts what should be considered the definitive version of this tale, because even the changes from the novel manages to elevate the story. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio is a stop motion delight ... a dark fairy tale filled with emotion ... a surprisingly moving, powerfully heartfelt tale which easily flits between the profound and the glib

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This year we saw Robert Zemeckis’ live-action take on Pinocchio with Tom Hanks as the avuncular Geppetto. That Disney reboot of the 1940 animated classic was a bit wooden and too by the numbers; here del Toro mixes it up.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It certainly has its moments of poignancy and sadness and McGregor’s droll tones as the longsuffering cricket provide some grace notes of fun.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This retelling of Carlo Collodi’s novel about a wooden puppet who comes to life and dreams of becoming a real boy looks outstanding. The movie’s animation artistry is superb. It’s one of my favorite movies of the year.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With the brilliant mind of Guillermo del Toro behind it, anything that is classic can be made anew, and this Pinocchio is a gorgeous masterpiece.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The storytelling... is unashamedly old-fashioned, and forays into the political and the macabre are all carefully tailored to younger viewers.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: ...a remarkable achievement, but then again this movie is jampacked full of them...one of the year's very best films...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s perspective runs through every frame of this unique retelling, which isn’t afraid to tackle troubling themes. A sincere, soulful exploration of what it means to be human.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: You’ve never seen a Pinocchio like this one, a funny, touching and vital masterpiece from del Toro that uses stop-motion animation to create a world of beauty and terror to get lost in. The Oscar for best animated feature belongs right here.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: del Toro, del Toro, del Toro, this is what I’ve been missing, a take on a classic that refuels it with wonder. This Pinocchio invites us to explore the meaning of and our love for this property with excitement for the first time or all over again.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio works better when viewed as an artistic vision rather than as a traditional movie.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Del Toro saddles up with stop-motion animation legend Mark Gustafson to present some of the year’s most stunning visuals but also goes a step further by adding some weighty thoughts on war, death, and family to the beloved Carlo Collodi fairy tale.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This is rich with macabre imagination and tiptoes between dreaminess and nightmarishness.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The simple fact is that Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is too adult for children and too childish for adults.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: With an authentic dream team, the film is a unique experience that deserves to be enjoyed in the biggest screen available. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Rich in detail and often darker in tone, del Toro's Pinocchio breathes new life into a fantasy story done to death. However, the awe-inspiring animation can't smooth out an, at times, inconsistent handling of the film's subject matter.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Ultimately, this “Pinocchio” is a reflection on loss, on fear, on how things end, told with wistful resignation.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro sprinkles his signature dark whimsy on a fairytale classic with stunning puppetry and catchy original songs. Filled with heart, humor, and historical grounding, it’s a phenomenal feat of animated cinema.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: As with his best work, del Toro does an excellent job combining emotional vulnerability with a love of the freaky and uncanny, a balancing act that here gives the film a strikingly dark sense of humor.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The ending feels like a weird compromise between morbidity and sentimentality, while the stabs at humor continually fall flat. Despite all these apparent minuses, del Toro’s film is lively and entertaining. Still, it feels like a conceptual near-miss...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro Pinocchio delivers a masterfully distinct version of the classic tale, which comes just shy of perfection due to a few dangling threads.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is movie magic for the soul. A masterful, dark retelling of the classic tale, brimming with passion and love. Del Toro is at the top of his game, delivering amazing craftsmanship and unique vision. {Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: An eccentric and worthy entry into Guillermo del Toro’s already diverse filmography.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Visually, Pinocchio is among the year’s finest. The use of lighting is simply gorgeous and the script allows for the characters to feel more multi-dimensional.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is an equally heartwarming and devastating feature that takes the established Pinocchio story and evolves it into a meaningful examination of both life and death

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Everything about the film is so tenderly del Toro, whose work mingles wonder with melancholy, historical insight with childlike playfulness as no other’s does.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio captures the complexity of the world and the humans in it, and how we can survive after it all too.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is a wonder and a joy. This is one time when the director’s name as part of the title is a necessity. Accept no wooden imitations!

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The craftsmanship and exquisite detail that went into each frame of this animated picture is marvelous!

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s the rare movie that might accurately be described as more imaginative than good — but the occasional bit of inspiration like the tree-branch proboscis encourages the viewer to hang on.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Pinocchio thrives on a storytelling imagination that thinks outside the box.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: ...a strangely beautiful creep show.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A radical, raucous and resplendent reimagining of the classic tale, which develops Del Toro’s fascination with the intersection of human weakness and political will. This adaptation is enlivened by enjoyable eccentricities and endlessly engaging ideas.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Good lessons for tough times...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The new stop-motion animation version is a decidedly dark reimagining of the classical tale that gradually worms its way into your heart.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Yes, the film may be upsetting to some younger children, but it does make a kind of grown-up sense: Be good. Think of others before yourself. And no one lives forever.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Nothing less than the work of an auteur working with the best available talent to turn his decades-long dream of making a stop-motion adaptation of Pinocchio.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: While a lesser movie would have been crushed by the weight of these themes, Pinocchio manages to carry them all with relative ease.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The filmmakers have also decided to make this a musical which, while not a problem in and of itself, becomes one when the songs are as exceedingly bland as those written by Alexandre Desplat with lyrics by the screenwriters and Roeban Katz.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A fresh exciting new take on a classic story coming from a master storyteller like del Toro

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Thanks to richly detailed woodcarvings that form the basis for the stop-motion animation, Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is a wonder to behold.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s refreshing to see a young audience being handled sans kid gloves, while the adults in the room are brought on a similar emotional journey without the need for the winking humor that often gets them through the door and into this world.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: When you leave Guillermo del Toro to his devices without strings attached, you get unforgettably enchanting works such as this

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It’s one of the greatest animated films of the millennium. Del Toro taking on stop-motion is an unbelievable development for animation. He thrives in ways even for him that are pretty surprising.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The movie bites off way too much. It lumbers inelegantly between confrontations with grief and fascism.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Charmingly voice-acted, gorgeously animated with stop-motion, and featuring a score and songs that will put a smile on your face; this rendition of Pinocchio is a refreshing take on the classic tale.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The patron saint of monsters and misfits teams with award-winning, stop-motion legend Mark Gustafson to helm a deeply enchanting journey full of heart, breathtaking craftsmanship, and poignant themes set against a backdrop of Fascism.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Dark, mordant, with a definite horror movie vibe, it is what you might expect from del Toro, who gave us Pan’s Labyrinth – essentially a dark fairy-tale wrapped in real-world fascism, as is this, though it's aimed at a younger audience.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: More of a Frankenstein-ed fairy tale than some irreverent answer to the Mouse House’s 1940 hand-drawn classic. That’s a good thing. Sometimes an odd, awkward thing, and at times a naggingly modern thing, but mostly a good thing.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is a rare piece of cinematic magic that we only get to see by a master of the craft that is at the top of their game.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's "Pinocchio" is a soulful, whimsical, dark and heartbreakingly exquisite take on the classic tale.  "Pinocchio" is a magical masterpiece.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Without condescension in substance or form, Del Toro's Pinocchio touches upon the theme of rebellion against authority, perfectly aligning with his other work [Pan's Labyrinth and The Devil's Backbone]. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio is a deeply personal and utterly tender journey about making the most of what you have and who you have it with.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A mature, heartbreaking, beautiful take on the classic fairy tale. Going back to the roots of the Carlo Collodi novel opens up new themes.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo Del Toro’s Pinocchio is a lived-in stop-motion fable that breathes new life into rotten wood, meditating on all that’s unique about the finite amount of time we’re given. A truly magnificent creation.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A decades-long passion project results in a classic tale given new life with exquisite craftsmanship and a poignant story of rebellion.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Once again Guillermo del Toro has delivered a provocative, exquisitely crafted and timeless piece of filmmaking, that compellingly speaks to modern fears and anxieties.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The film is marked by wild flashes of invention, all born of painstaking craft and devotion.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: The beautifully whimsical and incredibly intricate animation stands out among the best of 2022 and it is gorgeous on the big screen.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: This is a magical masterwork of the highest order.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Driven by its more mature approach and dazzling animation, del Toro’s Pinocchio is very close to making a claim as the definitive take on the story – but sadly loses itself a little on the way.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A prickly, bracingly macabre spin on the much-adapted tale.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Might be the finest Pinocchio to have ever graced our screens, largely because it refuses to stay reverential to the material even if it is inherently inspired by and indebted to it.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro’s vision isn’t compromised by the so-called limits of animation, in fact, his film only further proves the ever-reaching power of the animation medium as a whole.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A lovingly-crafted and brilliantly told twist on a classic tale, this is del Toro at the top of his game. Equal parts charming and creepy, and masterfully put together.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: From its earliest moments, it's evident that this "Pinocchio" is a del Toro production, tonally sitting close to the fantasy of "Pan's Labyrinth" but with the horror and gore obviously scaled back for the kids.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: It is what it is, and that’s perfectly imperfect.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Unfolding over a faintly indulgent but never dull two hours, this is a rare children’s entertainment that isn’t afraid to perplex kids as much as it enchants them...

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio brings weirdness, darkness, and joyfulness to Carlo Collodi's tale of the little wooden puppet.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: A soulful stop-motion masterpiece.

name: Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio
review: If Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio is not ultimately a transcendent version of the story, it is an admirable one.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Family is complicated, messy, difficult to understand, and what matters most in this fantastic multiverse psychedelic drama that at this point needs little introduction...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: [Gives] us dildo fights, raccoon chefs, hot-dog hands, and muscular pinky fingers. In one of the film's best action scenes, [we have] a fanny pack. [Elsewhere,] two rocks with googly eyes share their deepest fears and comfort each other.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A wonderfully weird, exhilaratingly all-over-the-place absurdist comedy, led by great performances and a screenplay that is as funny as it is moving.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film with just as many lives as we see Yeoh’s Evelyn Quan Wang wade through.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A fun, frantic but unexpectedly emotional watch.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is a marvelous achievement in filmmaking. The Daniels have created one of the best films of the year, and it is sure to inspire the next generation of filmmakers.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle delivered the performance of the year in Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's Everything Everywhere All At Once...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Visually restless, thematically redundant and the rare movie to be both overwhelming and underwhelming. After only a little while, you’ll desperately long to be simply whelmed.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once takes the poignant themes of parental disappointment and life regrets and is able to successfully wrap them up in an absurd and entertaining 2+ hours of craziness.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Lots of movies and shows entered the multiverse this year, but there was nothing remotely like this one

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Rarely has a film’s title reflected its contents so well. While may not include everything all at once, it does boasts a range of genre approaches stacked on top of one another and blended into a variety of combinations.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A true genre-bending wonder with phenomenal performances from the entire cast, stunning visuals, and powerful themes, the hype behind Everything Everywhere All At Once is real!

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I hope this movie exists in every alternate universe.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An exhausting, confusing, hilariously funny, pleasing assault on the ears and eyes from directors Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Never has a film lived up to its title more than this, the most bonkers movie you’ll ever see, equal parts exhilarating and exhausting. I remain leary of the multiverse trend of chaotic storytelling. It shouldn't be repeated. Let “EEAAO” exist on its own.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ...mixes science fiction, martial arts, comedy, fantasy, parody, animation, social realism, and probably a few more styles I’ve left out.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is one of the best films this year. From the editing, set design, world building, pacing/transitions, amazing student choreography and some of the best performances this year from Yeoh, Quan, & Hsu. A NEAR PERFECT FILM!

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Undoubtedly the most creatively chaotic experience I’ve ever seen or likely will ever see.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's the most original film of the year

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE is one of the best films of the year. It’s a brave cinematic mirror of all the banal but critical things that make us and our lives important in an indifferent universe.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Stephanie Hsu threw down one of the best performances of 2022, hands down.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Delightfully bonkers on the surface, this inventive extravaganza from the directing team called Daniels (Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert) has a deep layer of family feeling and a well-earned emotional pull at the end.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The most brilliantly bananas movie of 2022 absolutely lives up to its title. Michelle Yeoh kicks all types of butt as a time-travelling laundromat manager in a multiverse of madness.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s an apt title—Everything Everywhere All At Once really does have everything...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: (The Daniels) Kwan and Scheinert make everything seem possible.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The explosion of creative storytelling along with stellar performances by the gifted ensemble led by the incandescent Michelle Yeoh, make for a dense work that should be revisited to continue to peel away the legion of layers that can be found...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is everything you want from a movie and so much more.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: …and in the multiverse Michelle Yeoh is everything!

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The directing duo, Daniels, turned down a Marvel offer to make their delightful new movie. We couldn't be happier.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I can't promise everyone will like it, because it is so weird. But it's so unique I feel like everybody should give it a shot.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I've always been a fan of Michelle Yeoh and this was a fantastic showcase of her skills. I really liked this movie and was thoroughly entertained. The only negative is that visually it can be VERY overwhelming.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I greatly enjoyed this and look forward to seeing it multiple times to continue dissecting the visuals and themes. All of the actors brought their A-game and I hope this gets numerous accolades this awards season.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It is unafraid of being cheesy and silly, leaning into the full potential of its marvelous vulgarity cut with a prevailing sweetness that resonates in a triumphant final act.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels, through their quirky, revolutionary and thoroughly entertaining film, offer a winning perspective to our troubles: It all matters exactly because we’re small and stupid.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A peerless ode to love, life and everything in between.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: One of the most profound and moving sci-fi films I’ve ever seen, as well as being mental and a lot of fun.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is the reason I still go to the movies! We've got a good one here folks.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The performances are in perfect sync with the Daniels’ giddiness. Michelle Yeoh, at the front and centre of possibly the most memorable role of her career, is the anchor of a film that rarely stops once it gets going.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is an exhilarating ride and an ample showcase of rising and unrealised talent that embodies the beauty of the human spirit through the prism of the preternatural. It is one of the best films of 2022.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh pulls off what is arguably the best performance of her storied screen career.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once takes a creative look at familiar topics by way of the multiverse concept.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Exhilarating, funny and moving, their film is also messy, overstuffed and a trifle exhausting.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Some of it is legitimately moving, and gets at the specific pains of an Asian-American family in a more lateral and artistic way than it might have with a more conventional narrative.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review:
Everything Everywhere All at Once is simply one of the best films of the year. Cinematically brilliant, full of nuanced performances and with incredible themes throughout. 

A24 continues to showcase why it stands as one of the best film studios.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Whether it’s the draining exposition of the first half or the smothering non-stop ridiculousness of the second half, the film never finds a good balance.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s absurd and wild and wonderful, and will probably make you cry.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ...the undisciplined product of a pair of spitballing concept artists, who too often find themselves pitching out of hiccups in characterization and allegory and embracing the shiny allure of the new whenever nuance become too much to bear...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's smart, idiotic, serious, hilarious, sentimental, routinary, fantastic, complex, simple, easy, hard; it's done it. It's everything. At once. Everywhere. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Hyper-innovative thrill-ride... draws elements of science fiction, martial arts, family values and that ever-expanding storytelling device known as the multiverse, and then throws the whole lot in a blender.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s up there with Mad Max: Fury Road, Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse and The Matrix, in that it’s a movie that fully embraces the spectacle and artistry of cinema whilst never forgetting about what really matters: story, character, and theme.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A bit overrated but worth seeing for the great Michelle Yeoh in a very trendy, nth-degree multi-verse, live-action cartoon concept film. (Lionsgate 4K blu-ray).

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Collaborating with a small team of visual effects artists working in practical media, [Daniels] have achieved a joyous spectacle as exhausting as it is constantly surprising. ... For all of its imagination, this movie's finale feels overlong and preachy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This is a film about finding love and connection when you’ve been ground down. Even the bizarre hot dog-handed world gets to have its own deep moments that will likely make you cry.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The sort of movie Michelle Yeoh deserves.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Outrageous, confusing, or confounding? Everything Everywhere All at Once stands out as one of the most original movies to come along in years.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once can be compared to many, many things, but one of the most complimentary things I can say about any movie is that this one felt like a live-action Don Hertzfeldt film.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A phantasmagorical time-shifting multiverse explosion of kung-fu sci-fi. Chaos reigns supreme, with the screen ablaze with every trick in a director’s arsenal, like an immersive demo of sensory overload.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's a whirl, a swirl, a trip, a blast and a juggle as well and, in this universe, the Daniels wouldn't have it any other way.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This is the true virtue that catapults this film into an instant classic: It finds beauty in the ordinary. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: After maybe, 10-15 minutes of normal stuff -- taxes, laundry, family tensions -- this movie takes off into some of the most imaginative and just plain what-tha’-??????? territory you’ve ever seen.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Not the perfect movie they've been hyping about, but a visually stunning feature with Michelle Yeoh and Ke Huy Quan at the top of their game. An interesting story about embracing the uncertainty of our own destiny. Twenty minutes too long IMO.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ...in Everything Everywhere All at Once, we enter the universes, the many branches of the central character, Evelyn Wang...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It makes good use of the idea of a multiverse, showing us the different possibilities of its protagonists, and confidently developing a narrative centred on the relationship between a mother and daughter, and a wife and husband. Full review in Spanish.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I can't find anything out of the ordinary, except a boredom that is as infinite as the universe. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Here's what's truly bold about Everything Everywhere All at Once: it doesn't try to be all things to all people. It's a keeper, in any universe.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review:
The colorful thriller, Everything Everywhere All At Once, is a movie to watch when nothing in the world makes sense anymore because it reminds you of what it is to be human.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review:
Utilizes science fiction as a vehicle to approach its philosophical questions...or something more intimate like new ways to solve problems or accompany your family on the path that each one chooses.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Almost, almost multiplies exponentially. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: There are moments when the title seems too literal. Exhaustion creeps in. But successive second winds follow.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Places the adventure in introspective terrain, almost metaphysical. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Exercise patience and a willingness to meet Daniels on their own lunatic turf...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Hot dog fingers. A raccoon chef. Kung fu. What's not to love here?

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An inordinate, overwhelming, frantic experience that is sometimes inconsequential and others irritating. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh's hilarious, mind-bending, existential crisis is exactly what we need. The Daniels knocked it out of the park with this unruly sci-fi adventure worth its runtime.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A strange and delirious gem... [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A film with multiple layers that converge throughout an extraordinary story. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Some of the story’s unlikeliest beats are also its most intimate, allowing Yeoh the opportunity for some incredibly nuanced emotional work.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: One of the best films of the year. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Matrix, thought thrown inside a blender of slapstick and surrealism, tenderness and stupefaction. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Within ten minutes, the Daniels make a clear point: no one else in the world could have directed this movie. As they continue to innovate and break the rules of filmmaking, the Daniels have the opportunity to become one of our most unique filmmaking duos.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The film has been billed as a science-fiction comedy, but it doesn’t really belong to either genre, despite the abundance of fantasy and the fact that it’s often very funny.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It has been a long time since I’ve seen a movie that both transported me so fully out of my mundane life and made me want to hug my kids and call my mom and appreciate my spouse’s penchant for corny jokes -- in this life, or in any others.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's excessive, gratuitous, and puzzle-like film owes a lot to the Pythons, at least to one of them: Terry Gilliam. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A historic cinematic event. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review:
The purest absurdity and chaos embraced between eschatological sequences, martial arts fights and pure emotion in a film that truly is everything.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: One of the wittiest films I have seen in a long time, it tops the scale of absurdities with panache and leaves audiences wanting more.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Outrageous fun, even if you might not be entirely sure what the rules of the multiverse are.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ...the movie, beyond a certain point, adopts an often unreasonably frenetic feel that becomes more and more difficult to stomach...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A totally unpredictable surreal journey of pop existentialism and kung-fu, frenetic and unexpected: an instant classic. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An artesanal blockbuster that can supercharge the senses, minds and hearts of all your versions, everywhere.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels fall into the trap of thinking that reacting to a thing is the same as engaging with it, or truly working to interpret it. And it is that sentiment that guides the emotions of the film which often feel too superficial to cohere.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels and their wow of a star Michelle Yeoh turn this visionary absurdist comedy into a volcano of creative ideas in full eruption. It’s like nothing you’ve ever seen.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Yeoh brings heart and pathos to a character that might have been two-dimensional in the hands of a less intelligent actress.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The fact that it delivers that message in a story that puts Asian and queer characters front-and-center is just another great reason to call this disarmingly oddball movie the brightest gem of the season.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: While this is one of the most intensely action-packed movies in recent memory, it's also sharply moving. And even beautiful.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Carrying an essential message for today’s cynical, busted up world, it’s uplifting, occasionally heartbreaking, everything, everywhere, all at once.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It may overwhelm lovers of the mainstream, but its peculiarity is also what makes it special.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: No doubt I thoroughly enjoyed it in another universe.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The result may be a tad overlong and convolutedly overstuffed, but it made me laugh, cry and think...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels had a goal: reintroduce Yeoh, who is so gifted with nuance that this role hits like a ton of bricks, and give movie audiences something they don't usually get. A genre-less, time-hopping adventure film that manages to thrill and make one laugh.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Those who do enjoy its delightfully unhinged cinematic style, its unabashed love of pop culture references, and its wild, multi-layered bacchanalian wonder, will likely proclaim this one of the best movies of the year.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Filled with zany invention, but also a pile-up of puerile jokes and laboured attempts to be profound.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: More Yeoh is more Yeoh. There may be some awful universe where she isn't one of the most capable, likeable frontwomen in film, but, thankfully, it's not this one.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Balancing its serious side with silliness and sincerity, queer-positive Everything Everywhere All At Once speaks to a communal determination to press forward, even when it seems the whole world is pressing back.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Rich performances collide with big ideas, wrapped in a nuanced understanding of how we treat each other. And there are butt jokes. So many wonderful, dumb butt jokes. What more could you ask for?

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Less devoted cinema-goers should be aware that while the movie is technically extremely impressive, often very funny and occasionally quite touching, it’s also an exhausting and overwhelming experience

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: …Everything Everywhere All At Once may rework familiar themes and characters, but you can’t say you’ve seen it all before…

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Although infinitely more engaging than Daniels’ intensely irritating debut, Swiss Army Man, the quirk factor remains dialled up to 11 throughout. Nevertheless, it’s fun...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I’ve rarely felt more impaled on the fence by a film, because, exactly as promised, it’s everything at once – good and not good; fresh yet still a formula; cramped, strenuous, full to the brim.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: While not entirely without fault, you would be pressed to find a film as brilliantly chaotic or as original as Kwan and Scheinert’s film.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Bonkers. Chaotic. Wild. A cinematic maverick. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a rare treat.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The directors behind the farting corpse film are now back with a trippy, wonderful and utterly compelling story of a woman drawn into the multiverse.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is the definition of a masterpiece and one everyone should watch as soon as they can as it’s the kind of movie that reignites your passion for cinema.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Hsu and Yeoh’s scenes together switch effortlessly between comically violent and deeply emotional as they eventually discover connection in the strangest of places and in the most surprising forms.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's a mother-daughter story. It's a story about acceptance and rejection. It's a story about intergenerational trauma. It's a metaphysical treatise on nihilism. It's a comedy. It's a romance. It's a sci-fi action movie. It's a kung fu movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The acting in this movie is superb and it looks great with its dazzling visuals, great stunts and elaborate sets. This is one of those films that really stands out from the crowd, and it will probably end up on a lot of top 10 lists for 2022.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Come for the wild ideas, stay for the warm wisdom in the Daniels’ heartfelt carnival of chaos. Yeoh aces every curveball.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I wish I liked it more.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Easily one of the best comedies of the year.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A great deal of energy and talent has been expended here on the idealisation of the family unit, and the quest for a United States that never existed.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A pure firework display of technical bravado, wild invention, emotional storytelling, comedic genius, action mastery and outstanding performances, Everything Everywhere All At Once is everything cinema was invented for.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh gives the best performance of her career in this visually stunning, uproariously entertaining, completely unique slice of sci-fi/fantasy from cinematic madmen Daniels.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s time to accept this fact: this is Michelle Yeoh’s world, and we’re just living in it. This is the film of the year!

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An all-encompassing, therapeutic Asian American film for us who build our identities around and seek to heal from cinema.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's a movie that's filled with the infinite possibilities of the multiverse, but ends up deciding that no, actually this universe is the one we've got – and that's all right with us.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Visually dazzling, hilarious and surprisingly touching, it is a sublime masterpiece.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If Charlie Kaufman had reinvented A Christmas Carol, it would look something like this. We can accept the film's absurdities because the storytelling is sharp, innovative and resolute and because the message squeezes through the noise of the absurd.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Every scene of the movie is rife with infinite possibility, and even if a given scene may play in a way that makes familiar, narrative, structural sense, there's still a hint, that anything, anything at all, could be coming next.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: There's a lot to enjoy .... And yet I found myself resisting the greeting-card conclusions.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: More or less a microcosm of your average day online—scrolling through feeds of random information, seeing context-less fragments of people’s lives, and generally feeling overwhelmed by the limitless drama unfolding at any given time, all over the world.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels accurately capture the organic changes in language and accent that divulge a character’s underlying traits.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels juggle silly gags and weird visuals like cackling Dadaists.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The most movie to ever movie. An ambitious, bonkers and yet ultimately touching film that reminds you revel in your humanity; all told through the constantly inventive storytelling that never feels confusing despite the endless absurdity.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Somewhere in the multiverse, "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is the biggest movie of the year, perhaps of all time, and it is beloved both critically and commercially, bringing about a new age of cinema that saves the theatrical exhibition industry...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Refreshingly vibrant and unique, a true force of film making.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The best movie I've seen so far in 2022; I highly doubt I'll see anything better, more original or creative, intensely funny and exciting, Highly recommended! Full review in Spanish.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels have achieved a rare feat of imaginative tenderness in their way of representing ordinary people getting beaten down by the cruel pressures of the world -- and still finding ways to get back up again.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I laughed. I wept. I cheered and I sobbed. As accurate as the film's title might be, it even more accurately describes the breadth of my feelings after experiencing it.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Every version of me within the vast multiverse of existence loves this film. Exciting, hilarious and heartfelt, it's an achievement of the highest order. The universe needs this films. Full review in Spanish

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Never have I seen a film with such scope and ambition succeed so imarveliously. ... The above rave notwithstanding, no film is perfector so Ive been told. ... Having authored the film to end all films, what the hell will Daniels follow it with?

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Yeoh and Curtis are sensational, as is the supporting cast, including Hsu, Quan, Hong, and even Jenny Slate (as a disgruntled customer). One can only imagine how the Daniels will ever be able to top this film.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Real life adulting is the ultimate foe to be vanquished in this deliriously haywire fantasy, a cinematic tab of acid buried in a metaphysical fable.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Its a rich, wonderful, audacious project that will energize audiences like a cool breeze on a hot summer day

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The heart of the story is the American dream scenario being questioned, only to find that family and sacrifice are worth the fight.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A towering achievement led by Michelle Yeoh's performance. Multiple universes collide in this hilarious and extremely touching story about embracing the ups and downs and the inherent chaos of life. Full Review in Spanish

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I laughed throughout at the madness. If you are up for something weird give it a shot.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a masterfully edited and downright wacky viewing experience.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels also manage to create believable people to put in these outrageous circumstances, so the film gets by on more than simply shock value.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: There’s lots to recommend about Everything Everywhere All at Once, but the film’s frenetic busy-ness wore me down.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Sometimes you get it and sometimes you don't, and I just didn't get this movie. Love Michelle Yeoh but she led me down the rabbit hole with this one.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Best to know as little as possible, don't try to understand too much, just be ready for a wild ride. Just like real life.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once may find itself flirting with the potential for a happy ending, but it aspires and succeeds in ensuring the journey is paved in authentic and universal suffering.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels construct a vision of equally bold and affectionate ideals.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Its a wholly original movie at a time when originality is in short supply.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Just surrender yourself to this bonkers but brilliant film thats a demented fusion of Yeohs high-kicking origins and the multiversal madness currently unfolding in the Marvel movies.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: For a lot people in the Year of Our Ongoing Pandemic 2022, the expression "living your worst you" is really going to resonate.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I want to remember the feeling this movie gave me as I left the theater. It inspires me to be kinder and better in all of my relationships.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is as absurd as it is profound, deeply moving and wholly original. The films final act is contemplative and heart-bursting with substance, and will monopolize your mind long after it ends.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Brace yourself for a cinematic sugar rush so intent on swooping you into its alt-headspace so viscerally and with such speed the makers didnt even have time to put commas in the title. A singularly zany, off-the-wall, over-the-top, crazy sci-fi comedy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: So moving, so funny, so emotional, so inventive, so crazy, so all-encompassing in its strangeness and heart that verbal descriptions are insufficient.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An astonishing achievement that tells the simplest of stories in the most elaborate of ways. Outlandishly absurd yet deceptively powerful, it's truly unlike anything you've ever seen

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ... builds its mythology upon itself in the best possible and most entertaining ways... a multiversal sci-fi and fantasy kaleidoscope of a film grounded in a bitter reality daring to ask what version of oneself is considered "best."

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Packed with wall-to-wall creativity. I feel bad for anyone who has to get up to use the restroom during this picture, because if you miss even a single minute of it, you miss a lot.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: “Everything” is an absolute joy -- a film I look forward to revisiting multiple times.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If you're familiar with A24, you're probably going to like this movie. It certainly is something interesting to watch.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Not the indie superhero movie some have been promising, but still a very moving film & serious awards contender. Yeoh gives a career best performance while Quan aka Indiana Jones' Short Round makes a triumphant return to acting. Sloppy but strong.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: When it was over, all I felt was a faint sense of wonder. It seemed an exhausting way to put across a very familiar idea.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: "The most unusual film youll likely see this year. Its absurd, laugh-out-loud funny, and sneakily touching, an everything bagel of emotion that more than lives up to its title."

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere is a truly whacky epic... And yet it’s also, somehow, a story about the illusion of agency and reality itself.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If you're looking for a very unique moviegoing experience, you'd be hard-pressed to find one this unique and enjoyable.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I respect the integrity of it, and [it's] an imaginative story, and something original and fresh, but I was struggling to keep up.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This film is as touching as it is absurd, and I wish it upon everyone.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Approach this wondrous concoction with an open mind, and an expectation of giddy insanity and I promise you won't be disappointed.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Its an oftentimes absurd movie, but one with plenty of heart as well.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: For all its abstraction and shenanigans, The Daniels made a movie that is purposefully accessible. Thats kind of the point. We are all in this nightmarish nonsense together.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The movies bright shining light is its cast.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Pure movie magic.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once will leave you breathless, confused, entertained, amazed, touched and maybe even a bit enlightened. But one thing is clear: Michelle Yeoh is a force to be reckoned with.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Whichever way you dice it, there's nothing else quite like it in mainstream American cinema at the multiplex.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In a world full of remakes, reboots and sequels a truly original film has become like the sasquatch of cinema, a mythical creature long thought to be lost forever. Finding Everything Everywhere All at Once feels just like that - mythical and just magical.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: [A] ridiculously entertaining, huge-hearted action-fantasy-comedy, a joyous ode to the multifaced wonder of life itself.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Witty, wacky and unpredictable to the end.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is an absolute blast and an unforgettably daft, moving and deceptively insightful ride.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once captures the majesty and originality of cinema while bestowing a multiverse of madness that offers an existential character study examining human desires, relationships, familial lineage, and life's choices.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The sheer fact this isnt going to a streaming service is another miracle in of itself, furthering the films emotional hold on an audience who appreciate all facets of the medium that is genuine, passionate filmmaking.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels have crafted a tour de force of pop surrealism on a budget that wouldnt cover Avengers: Endgames catering bill.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In many ways a homage to the inimitable grace and talent of its star Michelle Yeoh, the film takes gleeful joy in the experiential potential of limitless cinematic shape-shifting.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The juggling act that Everything Everywhere All at Once pulls off between high concept outrageousness and real and recognisable moments of human failings  often within the one scene  is truly remarkable.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s a peculiar taste that might even split the opinions of diehard sci-fi/act/com fans.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s gross and absurd, smart and silly, heart-breaking and heart-warming -- it’s everything in juxtaposition, seamlessly working together at the same time.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's a superlative tribute to the human spirit. A complex, eye-boggling, mind-blowing masterpiece.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Disarms the audience with zany humor, then hits them with philosophy about the human condition.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: To my surprise, among oodles of unhinged sequences, I ended up enjoying this chaotic and far-fetched movie, which also happens to be conceptual and deliciously satiric.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ...this is the movie you've been waiting for, while asking, "Why don't they make good, original, non-Marvel movies anymore?" It's here, and now it's up to you to see what all the fuss is about.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Fragmented and frenetic....It's like watching a deftly structured 'Sliding Doors' concept become an action--packed, cacophonous 'Cloud Atlas.'

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: There are movies that make you believe in movies. Everything Everywhere All at Once is absolutely one of them, an original vision in a Hollywood increasingly prone to repetition and redundancy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels have some crazy stuff running their imaginative minds, but knowing how to pair the insanity with heart is what sets them apart.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In a movie about the infinite, the heart lies in the intimate. But inside these personal stories, you have comedy, horror, drama, sci-fi, mystery, martial arts. Every kind of movie really is inside this movie, all at once.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Just when you cannot see yourself comprehending worlds with hot dog-length fingers or the silliness of sticky googly eyes, the brimming humanity underneath bubbles through with geysers of cathartic empathy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If it sounds like a fever dream, it plays like one, too, but at its heart, Everything Everywhere All At Once is a heartfelt story about forgiveness and family, featuring a bravura performance from Michelle Yeoh.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere is a pleasant and intentionally ungainly production that corkscrews gleefully with ever-increasing power.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels created something incredibly magical and mind-blowing, the actors delivered fully to every scene, and the entire cast really put together a brilliant work of art.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Offers a devil-may-care approach and a deliciously wicked sense of humor, a top-flight performance from Michelle Yeoh, and an emotionally true central theme...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The kind of imaginative, uncompromising effort that can get people excited about movies. While the net effect can be an almost overwhelming exercise to absorb, "Everything Everywhere" deserves to be seen some time, and somewhere.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Evelyns road to discovery is a mind-tripping journey accentuated by hilarious situations and weird encounters with people she seems to know  yet actually doesnt.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is an absolute marvel of visual storytelling, a mind-blowing cacophony of the absurd in the greatest possible sense, wrapped up in more heart than one movie should be allowed to contain.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Despite its lofty ambitions, this is a work of emotional sincerity -- colossal sincerity.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Visually and narratively inventive, yet grounded by powerful performances and surprisingly relatable conflicts.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This subversive, genre-bending mayhem remains emotionally grounded beneath its high-minded silliness.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Yeoh imbues Evelyn with moving shades of melancholy, regret, resolve and growing curiosity. She’s the kind of woman the world (and Hollywood) routinely overlooks, but Yeoh makes her embrace of lead-character energy positively gripping.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Embraces chaos and defies categorization with frantic, eclectic, pure cinematic anarchy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Just go see it. Buy the ticket. Take the ride.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once presents the idea that there is an infinite number of alternative universes out there, each with its own Michelle Yeoh. This is still not enough Michelle Yeoh.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Were only a quarter of the way through 2022, but I am already fairly confident in saying that Everything Everywhere All at Once is the best film of the year. Not only that, its one of my favorite films of all time.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels combine their influences into a particular blend of batshit insanity the likes of which few would dare attempt, and even fewer would be able to pull off successfully. Bold, innovative films of this ilk have grown increasingly scarce.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A crowd-pleasing, genre-bending adventure that's funny, dizzying, and infinitely memorable, this movie is also a lot.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The two things you need to know about EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE are that: a) its not boring and b) its a wonderful showcase for Michelle Yeoh. Indeed, if its a must see for anyone its for fans of the actress.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Amid all the puerile gags about tax receipts and hot dogs, the Daniels are urging us to connect with the people in this world, and the hijinks somehow make their message strangely moving. It is a unique achievement.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere is fringey and wayward, too often frenetic only for craziness’ sake. But Yeoh anchors it.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once will be absolutely adored by some moviegoers from its very first moments. It’s a film made to be loved—and, given the sheer eye-popping technical wizardry at play throughout, nearly impossible to hate.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If youre excited to see a film that is theater-worthy but exhausted by the run-of-the-mill tentpole options out there, Everything Everywhere All at Once was tailor-made for you.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A triumphant magnum-opus mind-bender of lo-fi sci-fi rooted in relatable ennui, as endlessly inventive for its high bar of engaging, enveloping drama as for its ever-lowered, always-cleared limbo bar of oddball multiversal storytelling.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is a dizzying collage of sci-fi, action, comedy and drama that's also the most amazing thing I've seen in ages.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: At the heart of the insanity lurks a spot-on depiction of a midlife crisis, and Michelle Yeohs depiction of that crisis is revelatory.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I was more enamored by Michelle Yeoh than the movie itself, but I applaud the originality of the Daniels' vision and filmmaking style. Its rare these days to see something that's unlike anything youve seen before, and that alone is quite a feat.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: "Everything Everywhere" shows what's possible with the right injection of ingenuity, vision and freedom of thought. It's the everything bagel of movies.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If Everything Everywhere All at Once's virtues only amounted to Yeoh's great work, it would still be a fantastic movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This film defies genre and your expectations.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I dont know how to review it. But I know that you should see it.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels' return is all at once hilarious, thrilling and heartfelt, and everything we've come to expect from the phenomenal Michelle Yeoh.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A bonkers and bizarrely wonderful genre mashup, “Everything Everywhere All at Once” is finally the multiverse movie that we can all relate to.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A gob-smacking gauntlet of action-packed, gonzo sci-fi fantasy about the loopy connectedness of all things.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
