review: A beautiful exploration of life and what we have to offer as people and what people have to offer us in return. I can't recommend this movie enough!

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: "Everything Everywhere All at Once" delivers what will surely become a multi-generational movie thatll never stop offering surprises or nuances with each viewing.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is a spectacular vision of the infinite, and a very heartfelt examination of a family coming to grips with itself.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels have made a movie designed to blast audiences in the face with creativity.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels feature is a work that seems alive with possibility, a sensation so rare in modern genre filmmaking that its practically nausea-inducing to have it pumped into your brainstem at 24 fps.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Yeoh is magnificent.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's often great, never less than fun, and who can say no to a never-better Michelle Yeoh? The mix of all kinds of styles, genres, and techniques makes for one zany and colorful comedy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This multi-layered, thrill packed action, sci-fi  comedy, would be a fantastic experience if the script wasnt such a hot mess.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The best film of 2022 so far has such imagination and energy even though it can be dizzying and confusing. Thankfully it has a strong motherdaughter central relationship that becomes quite moving and profound. Astonishing in nearly every way.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A thought-provoking genre-bending film that will stay with you long after. I will never see sausages, ratatouille, and Jaime Lee Curtis the same ever again.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Under all this insanity, the film focuses on the characters. It's still a story about family.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Bonkers and over-the-top films don't usually come with heartwarming messages, but this does just that. This is the cinematic experience audiences have been craving.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In this anything-goes environment, the shifts don’t feel like tonal contradictions. They just feel like an acknowledgment that life is simultaneously painful and absurd, and that the tension between the two helps define the sensation of being human.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The endgame isn’t quite up to the movie’s game. But the game is onto something.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This is a film that clearly needs to be seen multiple times to truly appreciate it, but it's not tough to love and admire after just one viewing.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This sci-fi mashup has a message: Life might be fleeting, unremarkable, and inconsequential, but we should cherish it anyway.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Whens the last time you went to the movies, and ended up contemplating your very existence? The movie delivers this existentialism, and the clownish absurdity of the family's fate ... it is adventurous, bizarre and just plain fun. Hail to THE DANIELS.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Entirely too much of a movie about how the world can feel like entirely too much. Especially these days. I loved it.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A stunning achievement in the management of insane imagery, clashing tones, and wild plot escalations that defy description, but which drive home an extremely effective and emotional story.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This film blends countless genres, storytelling techniques, and styles of humor together to create a unique experience. The level of detail is just ridiculous, and the journey is unlike any other.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once feels like a reimaging of The Matrix as directed by Michel Gondry. That pretty much encapsulates everything that’s right, wrong and way too long in this wildly ambitious movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything is spectacularly creative, Everywhere you look, happening All at Once, begging to be revisited again and again.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Inventiveness and sheer buoyancy, which “Everything” has in abundance, will take a movie a long way.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is weird in the best of ways, emotional, smart, and ready to take viewers on a ride they wont soon forget.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: By shrewdly grounding the insanity in their characters, no matter how bizarre they may seem, the Daniels find actual emotional resonance that usually eludes this increasingly popular multiverse premise.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh gives the performance of a lifetime. This whole movie feels like a tribute to her and a celebration of her career.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once has all the spastic energy, phallocentric humour and visual wit directors the Daniels brought to the Turn Down For What video.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Kon's work always spoke of the culture around us, of the terrors and anxieties we face every day while wrapping those stories in fantastical worlds where anything is possible.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once doesnt make the argument that love will solve everything. Its too smart for that. Love is complicated, messy, entangled with our traditions, environments, and lived experiences.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: When I say Everything Everywhere All At Once is a surrealist journey into an existential crisis and the various shades of motherhood, what I mean is . . . exactly that...I kinda loved it.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A dazzlingly kaleidoscopic adventure that is genuinely thrilling and often hilarious, with sensational martial arts fights in an always-astounding array of settings, with a roller coaster of surprising twists and turns that hold up on repeated viewings.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A MOVIE movie with a genuine beginning, middle and end in the Age of Content, its something to see, I tell you what.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It sets out to break your brain, finds an assortment of ways to break your heart ... and somehow pieces both together again with such skill of craft and narrative that it almost feels like a bit of a miracle.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: You can say a lot of things about Everything Everywhere All At Once but you cant say youve ever seen anything quite like it before.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: There's filmmaking joy, impishness, and deep concern for relationship challenges included here, but moviemaking discipline isn't really a Daniels things.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everywhere Everything All At Once is everything; heartbreaking, heartwarming, absolutely insane, completely logical, and despite it being early in the year, without a doubt it's going to be one of the best movies of 2022.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Multiverses may be all the rage right now, but the new sci-fi film from Daniels reckons with the consequences in a way that most blockbusters don’t.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels’ Everything Everywhere All at Once is a deliriously over-the-top, multiverse-hopping action movie that unrepentantly pushes itself to the limit.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This movie suffers from Terry Gilliam-itus, in that it suffers from too many ideas.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The whole thing can also be exasperating. ... Nevertheless, the craft on display is outstanding.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The world of the film is wild, but Yeoh acts as its core, a gravitational force that keeps even the butt-plug battle anchored in the truth of that journey. What a movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: With its insanely paced storyline through the multiverse and down-to-earth message anchored by the fabulous Michelle Yeoh, Everything Everywhere All at Once is the movie we need now.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It’s hard to know what to make of “Everything Everywhere All at Once.” It’s a tour de force — but of what? It’s exhausting. It’s funny. It’s confusing.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Buried beneath the cacophony of its sci-fi silliness Everything Everywhere All at Once has a message about ignoring lifes distractions in favor of what is truly important.  It succeeds as well as it does because it rests on Yeohs classy shoulders

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: As endearing as it is hysterical and startling, as touching as it is absolutely wild.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A cathartic story for anyone who has sought acceptance from family, Everything Everywhere tells the story of a family on the brink who discovers how to heal and come back together wrapped in the glittery, technicolored paper of a sci-fi superhero movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: ...more audaciously expansive than even its title suggests.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I suspect you could watch “Everything Everywhere All At Once” multiple times and have a different experience every time; it seems like a movie that would always have another angle to reveal.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An explosion of creative weirdness that is equal parts exhilarating and overwhelming.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It overthrows any standard expectations with a sublimely messy assemblage of brain-scrambling science fiction, kung fu action, absurdist jokes, movie references, and end-of-everything stakes that miraculously feels grounded.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: What a movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: You will be mentally exhausted and fatigued at the end, but it’s well worth the journey.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is a strange and inventive concoction. Its filled with martial arts, impressively choreographed fight sequences, humor, and a loving tribute to family.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Amid all the razor-thin editing, constantly shifting film stocks and styles, and purposefully opaque worldbuilding lies a curiously personal, universal story about the overwhelming noise of the world, and how impossible it is to deal with it.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis are splendid in this rare, one-of-a-kind movie that asks what the meaning of life is and then successfully answers. A brilliantly inventive breath of fresh air amidst Hollywood staleness.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: What keeps Everything Everywhere All at Once from falling into a black hole of sprawling thought is its wonderful central performances, and the emotional through line that Yeoh and Quan follow amid all the chaos.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Somewhere up there on the screen, there's a movie. Maybe dozens of them. If this sounds like your cup of chaos, have fun. As for me,  I guess I still prefer my movies one at a time.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Anything goes here. The filmmaking is both disciplined and unruly. For viewers not familiar with the directors' films (Swiss Army Man, The Death of Dick Long), they may need more than one energy drink to keep up.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Delivers nuanced performances, frenetic direction, and an unwavering devotion to optimistic storytelling.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: When you pay attention as closely as you can, you will be in for this fast-paced ride that offers an utterly fantastic, memorable experience sure to be one hell of a ride no matter which universe you find yourself in.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once may be a kaleidoscopic fantasy battle across space, time, genres, and emotions, but it’s an incredibly moving family drama first.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Its at once an emotionally affecting family story, a visually stunning marvel, a sidesplittingly hilarious comedy, and the best martial arts movie in recent memory.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The film has everything we love about chopsocky, the Stephen Chow-brand of mo lei tau comedy, and Wong Kar-wai's doomed romances.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: If I'd attempted to take notes on this movie my papers would have descended into squiggles and cross-hatch; it's not so much a movie on first view as it is an experience. This thing happens to you.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A much more adventurous adventure in conceptual and stylistic terms...

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh, 59, and Jamie Lee Curtis, 63, make beautiful movies together -- and I hope to see them joined in everything from Westerns to crime thrillers.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Exhausting, exhilarating, gratifying -- it's like trying to drink the totality of the last 40 years of pop culture through a firehose.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is unabashedly bizarre and hilarious, finding wonderful avenues of odd, but it also manages to be a fascinating philosophical work contemplating the meaning of being an imperceptible dot in the spectrum of infinity.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Theres a real determination and intention to every chaotic choice, a method to this madness that ultimately makes Everything Everywhere All At Once one of the most ambitious and ballsy films in recent yearsmaybe even ever.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This film is probably the best American multiverse movie we'll see and certainly the best and only one featuring Asian and Asian American talent ever produced to date.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once changes the game for what cinematic multiverses can be, with thrilling action, excellent performances, and a world of possibilities.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Given the movie's crazed pace, which is exhausting over the course of more than two hours, its unexpected tenderness comes as a surprise.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's not just destined to be one of the best films of the year, but also a classic comedy, sure to be treasured for decades to come.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: While a lot of its digressions may be far enough afield to scare some off, those who stick with it will find another wholly unique spectacle from Daniels that reminds us of the limitless possibilities of cinema.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Over its nearly two-and-a-half-hour running time, the movie's ambitions double, and double again, as though its a petri dish teeming with Mr. Kwan and Mr. Scheinert's wildest ideas.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A story about family wrapped in a brilliant maximalist casing. Michelle Yeoh gives us everything we ever wanted from her and things we didn't even know we could want from her. Laughter, tears, and ultimately catharsis make this a dazzling film journey.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: With its bland and faux-universal life lessons that cheaply ethicalize expensive sensationalism, the film comes off as a sickly cynical feature-length directorial pitch reel for a Marvel movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In the end, its many swirling parts unite around a remarkably coherent purpose: to provide a rare and dazzling showcase for a megawatt performer who scowls, gasps, punches, kicks, leaps, flips, soars and finally transcends.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Next to grander and glossier metaverses, and more tidily sensible movies, Everything Everywhere stands as an antidote to algorithm. It’s a preposterous and tasteless ode to the messy, nonsensical struggle and bliss of being human.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Written and directed by the duo, Everything Everywhere All at Once isn’t just about one thing or even one woman. It’s universal -- and, by extension, multiversal -- and every audience member can find something to relate to throughout the film.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A film that wrestles with the pressure of living your best life and finds hope in the idea of living your worst one, even if you have to jump through multiverses to realize it. In that way, the Daniels have crafted a film as weird and messy as life itself

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Instant contender for one of the best (and certainly most original) films of the year.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is just an electrifying experience thats a collective burst of creative energy.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A raucously madcap stroke of heartwarmingly lunatic genius anchored by a magnetic ensemble and exceptional work from Michelle Yeoh. Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert lean into their every outlandish impulse with endless sincerity and pathos

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Imagine The Matrix, but with jokes about sentient raccoons, to get a sense of the goings-on in this blend of comedy, science fiction and action.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Yes, the movie is a metaphysical multiverse galaxy-brain head trip, but deep down — and also right on the surface — it’s a bittersweet domestic drama, a marital comedy, a story of immigrant striving and a hurt-filled ballad of mother-daughter love.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Daniels latest doesn't aim to map out the multiverse so much as spin and pin you to its walls, Gravitron-style, with the centrifugal force of their hyperactively outré imaginations.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is an otherwise hysterical sci-fi action adventure but reduces a character to an antisemitic stereotype.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The frenetic, genre-blurring Everything Everywhere All at Once sometimes tries too hard to be eccentric, but this highly innovative film stands out for refusing to play it safe. Get ready for a bumpy and bizarre ride.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A24's Everything Everywhere All At Once is one of the best sci-fi films ever made, filled with fantastic action set-pieces and loads of heart.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels have once again concocted something refreshingly glorious with their rare ability to address the Sisyphean onslaught of human existence and subsequent lurking despair while also poking fun at the absurdity of their creation and human nature.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The film works magic by embracing excess, finding a kind of harmony and possibility within it, and reminding us of the beauty and lunacy of the human experience along the way.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Simply put, it’s brilliant, and I’m dying to see it again.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: This whirling cinematic dervish does a little bit of everything all at once -- not always satisfyingly but never with any hesitation.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once is one of the most inventive films I have seen in some time. The way it can balance characters, story, and out-of-this-world concepts is impressive, to say the least.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I loved this so much its almost guaranteed a place in my Top 10 at the end of the year. To be able to accomplish that, the movie would need to balance all that mind-blowing craziness with a very large amount of heart, and it does just that.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Admiring the chutzpah of The Daniels doesnt necessarily translate into actual enjoyment of the film, which is a high-concept project with plenty of flair, but a crucial lack of finesse in storytelling.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: You wont see another movie again quite like Everything Everywhere All At Once. Im confident in promising you that much.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is an astounding film that showcases the magnificent talents of the venerable Michelle Yeoh. The frenetic sci-fi action-comedy will have you laughing out loud.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: After 20 minutes, you truly cannot predict where this movie is going, but by an hour in, you can follow Evelyn trying to explain it to her family.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: However dazzling the vortexes this film shoots us through at supersonic speed may be, they still deposit us somewhere we’ve been before.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: An extraordinary movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Wildly entertaining, audacious and funny.  An action adventure with a heart, mind and soul. Michelle Yeoh is mesmerizing. It's destined to become a cult classic.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Builds with stream-of-consciousness logic into a running joke, and then, even more surprisingly, into something profound.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Its hard to make a movie about the multiverse. Its even harder to make a movie about the meaning of life. The Daniels somewhat miraculously accomplish both.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The most stunning and brilliant film so far this year.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything, Everywhere All at Once is sensational. It's a riotous good time packed with big laughs, non-stop action, and plenty of heart.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All At Once sticks every single landing it tries to make and offers up a unique and emotional take on the multiverse.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The creators of Swiss Army Man are back with another blast of creativity, wit, and heart.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once has the potential to be a generation-defining film, the sort of picture that shows why movies matter and how movies can move us.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Part martial-arts thriller, part heartfelt family drama, and part searing indictment of the banal subjugation of the IRS,.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once is a brilliant exploration of generational trauma and feelings of hopelessness. The film presents a lot of big ideas, but it all works.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: We all have wondered what would have happened if I , Evelyn just had the opportunity to experience it, realize her mistakes, and embrace a change of heart.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A thoughtful family drama detonated into brain-melting, action sci-fi absurdity.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A chaotic full-tilt multiverse of hot dog hands and flying Pomeranians rooted (just barely) in a superhuman performance by Michelle Yeoh.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Overstuffed, inventive and chaotic comedysci-fi action-adventure movie.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere is a giant tangled yarn ball of a movie, and if it doesn’t work for you, that feeling will last for a very, very long time. If it does work, though, it might be one of the most charmingly ridiculous movies you see this year.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: With incredible performances by Michelle Yeoh and the entire cast, the whirlwind journey the film takes you on is ultimately a little too rough of a ride.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A rapid-fire existential science-fictionactioncomedy extravaganza that manages to walk a number of extremely fine tonal lines with the grace of a master gymnast.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: The Daniels have funneled an energy some may have found occasionally obnoxious in their debut feature Swiss Army Man into a frenetic race against time with little restraint but plenty precision.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Together, this cast was electric and gave us something that will stick with us for years to come.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Your mind is going to need its best pair of running shoes to keep up with this one. A hilarious and tender WTF kaleidoscope from the Daniels.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Truly, Everything Everywhere all at Once does one thing. Exactly what the title promises.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It shouldnt have taken Hollywood this long for her to give Michelle Yeoh top billing.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Michelle Yeoh steadfastly leads us through ever-increasing insanity as The Daniels amp up their absurdity to deftly deliver a delightful action comedy ripe with deeper undertones.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In this love letter to genre cinema, Michelle Yeoh gives a virtuoso performance.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Theres never been a movie quite like Everything Everywhere All at Once. And there may never be movie quite like it again.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: It's impossible to describe. It's unlike anything you've ever seen. It's the best American movie in years, and certainly the best movie to hit theaters since the pandemic began.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: In a career filled with fantastic performances, Yeoh delivers her best work yet, giving each iteration of Evelyn just enough agency and nuance for each to stand out

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A magical triumph of cinematic storytelling. It's just a delight from beginning to end.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: I cant imagine Ill see a film this year at SXSW, or all year long, that speaks more directly to my cinematic sensibilities (sci-fi kung fu that makes me weep?!) or inspires more reflection... than Everything Everywhere All At Once.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: "A certifiably manic sci-fi-fantasy epic that somehow manages to make room for some potent ruminations on possibility, deliriously imagined set pieces and one incredible Pixar-related gag that takes on a multiverse of its own."

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A madcap, prismatic martial arts sci-fi family movie that refracts the entire scope of cinema and reality through the plight of a Chinese-American laundry mat owner. Quite simply one of the most original films ever made.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: And in Everything Everywhere All At Once, a dizzying and aching bit of popcorn entertainment, in fact, Yeoh has never been better.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere is the type of film that comes around only once in a blue moon. It's so brimming with invention and ideaswhere even vignettes that last less than a minute could be whole filmsthat its dazzling to behold.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Everything Everywhere All at Once can occasionally feel relentless, but the directors do pause for the emotional beats that give the chaos weight. The noise is part of the experience, but the sheer creativity is the reward.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Nothing if not true to its title, this frenetically plotted serve of stoner heaven is insanely imaginative and often a lot of fun.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: “Everything Everywhere All at Once” is about finding something to hold onto in the midst of oblivion, and it isn’t afraid to make itself the ultimate example of how that might work.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: There are enough ideas in “Everything Everywhere All at Once” to fuel a dozen movies, or else a full-blown TV series, but the Daniels have shoehorned it all into a bombastic, emotionally draining 139 minutes.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: Though it spans countless genres, mediums, and references dozens of films from 2001: A Space Oddessy to Ratatouille to Kill Bill to In the Mood For Love it feels like a movie like Everything Everywhere All At Once has never been done before.

name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
review: A maximalist promise deliriously realized, this epic adventure swirls sci-fi, metaphysics, martial arts, slapstick, star power, and pop culture shout-outs.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
Rating: R (Language Throughout|Brief Graphic Nudity|Some Violent Content)

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Capturing unstable humanity, along with black comedy and the brevity of life changing our decisions daily, within a motion picture isn’t easy work, but McDonagh strikes a nice balance of moods and tones.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: 115 minutes that, more than a movie, shape a state of mind. One that, little by little, gets under your skin by force of sadness, a shady sense of humor and that kind of existentialism capable of breaking the spirit of the most optimistic human being.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh paints a devastating portrait of men in general. The stupid in-fighting, the self-sabotage, and the endless quarrelling — instead of spending their lives doing something valuable for themselves and those around them.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The film has its charm because the director imprints valuable doses of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The most amazing thing about it is the fact it explores such huge ideas as the meaning of life, while simultaneously looking at the micro-aggressions of two stupid men with no capacity to deal with their own emotions.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Writer-director Martin McDonagh’s brilliantly crafted film offers a master’s class in pacing, with each successive scene building on the previous one until it has grown from a small, sweet Irish tale into a pitch-black, gut-punch of a tragicomedy.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonough cultivates within his dark comedic mind an original Irish fable rooted in James Joyce and W.B. Yeats.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Witty dialogue tempers the cynical take on the human condition in The Banshees of Inisherin, which promises more black comedy from filmmaker Martin McDonagh.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The film's decision to loop in the actual events of the Irish Civil War to parallel Pádraic and Colm’s feud feels a bit clumsy.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Realism coexists with artifice. It's a heartbreaking world, but hilarious. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A memorable and audacious tale of self-destruction and how disturbing human relationships can be. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: In a state of utter solitude, depression, and coldness, the real search is for a feeling, any feeling, in whatever form it comes. It isn't hard to understand these two protagonists... [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ... A unique story about a wounded friendship and the disastrous consequences of an absurd disagreement. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh's humor resides in the wounds of his characters, who, suffering from inflamed emotional wounds, know how to aim precisely at the weak spots of those they want to hurt. [Full review in Portuguese]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ... A tedious nonsense.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is not the kind of comedy that will make you smile, but rather one where laughter quickly turns into tears at the absurd fragility of human relationships.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: There is no other choice but to surrender. And laugh. If only for the sake of not despairing. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ... An everyday pursuit that doesn't fail to be the eternal quest to comprehend the meaning of our existence. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ... The rawness with which McDonagh delivers his reflection on the cycle of life makes The Banshees of Inisherin an ingenious and melancholic parable about disenchantment.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: As with all good movies, this one has various layers. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh is, for my money, the best writer in the business. Farrell and Gleeson are the perfect vessels for his unique brand of dark, heartbreaking, hilarity. A near perfect movie.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: An agonizingly slow watch, but it’s worth your patience mainly for the acting...

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The scenes with his pet donkey Jenny alone will stop you in the tracks.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: a film that is grounded in profoundly powerful performances, and a script so clever and funny that I laughed out loud time and again, all the while fascinated, horrified, and deeply moved.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It offers the best catalog possible from its director's virtues. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The tonal bait and switch from dark comedy to introspective, sensitive drama is what makes The Banshees of Inisherin among the year's best.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Simply watching Farrell's eyebrows as Pádraic faces his changing circumstances is entertaining, emotional and evocative; the depths and shades he can relay with a twitch, many actors can't muster with their entire bodies.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s sparkling dialogue, with pathos and comedy infused into every line, is delightful as always. Farrell, Gleeson, Keoghan and Condon make the poetry feel like natural speech.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review:
Confucius comes into play. "If you seek revenge dig two graves, one for yourself."
Hala-feckin-luya.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ...a stark reminder of how ego, pride, and an incessant need for control can consume anyone.  A film powerfully written and brilliantly constructed by Martin McDonagh.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin gathers human pain through its characters who, little by little, cease to be as they increasingly see themselves as trapped souls in grief... [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson have a great onscreen friction.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Insensitively dark, peculiarly humorous and wildly depressing, The Banshees of Inisherin touches the puerile, the hilarious and the creepy.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gleeson is terrific, as usual, but Farrell shows extraordinary range and depth.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell is in top form… lingers behind the eyes with a healthy dose of personal reflection… gets the point across while rubber-stamping the conclusion with ambiguity, a single shortfall in a sometimes-amusing tragedy-in-the-making.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A too dark comedy for my taste. Acting is great all round but the story is muddled.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is just another feather in McDonagh’s cap and it might be the film that finally wins him the full roster of accolades he deserves.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: I learned so much Irish slang against my will, but it was worth it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees is a darkly funny and provoking tale that is certainly one of the best movies of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A movie that bleeds with authenticity for its locations and local culture. And bleeds for other reasons.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review:
The Banshees Of Inisherin is dark, tragic, and somehow humorous in an overall somber undertone that gives audiences multiple layers to dissect. 

Colin Farrell’s range as an actor is incredible.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A beautifully bizarre tale of wistfulness that actually caused me to laugh out loud from its tragicomic tone. It certainly won’t be for everyone (I can’t quite put my finger on why…), but if you don’t absolutely hate it, you just might love it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: There’s a tried and tested formula from McDonagh’s back catalogue at work, that starts somewhere in blackly comic absurdity before the humour starts to drain away like let blood until all that is left is bleakness.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh expertly threads humour and pathos like a master weaver who knows exactly when to change colours.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: What begins as a story of provincial buffoonery gradually reveals itself as an allegory of Irish history and character. I don’t know why allegories are all the rage in movies nowadays, but this one is especially poignant.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh narrowly missed making a masterpiece here, but these performances are not to be missed.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Colin Farrell, who has so many different films on this year’s resume, shows he’s more than just a name on a poster. “Banshees” could be the film that puts him in the upper ranks of all actors.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: [Martin] McDonagh's reflection on mortality and human connection is equal parts humorous, heartbreaking and strange. It's the best film of 2022.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is enchanting, poignant, and relentlessly entertaining while leaving one with the inspiration to redefine what constitutes a real friendship and those are are simply associates for a season, reason or a lifetime.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh has it all, a great script, amazing cinematography, an astonishing score, & some of the best ensemble performances this year! Farrell & Gleeson are off the charts with their roles but everyone one around them makes this such a rich grounded story

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: There are so many layers here... but rather weirdly I didn't feel the same deep connection with this story and its band of characters as I had with Billboards. Farrell and Gleeson though? I could sit in a cinema with them for days.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ... A film that knows well to avoid metaphors and fables, despite alluding to certain characteristic elements or fantastical creatures. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees is a darkly funny look at mid-life crisis, mortality and our need to remain vital throughout our lives.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The director doesn’t do much to relieve misery or our current existential crisis. That’s why The Banshees of Inisherin feels like both an X-ray of contemporary malaise and a betrayal of Irish romance.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: When a friendship goes bad, both sides are victims in playwright Martin McDonagh's dazzling mosaic of betrayal.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Dominating the film, Farrell is completely, unglamourously plugged in, as a paradigmatic lost man suddenly knee-deep in collapse and strangeness, and pushed into being a hapless persecutor, not a victim.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: What ultimately pushes it for me from good to great is that sensational undercurrent of the uncanny: the strange behaviour, the sudden punctums of violence, along with the constant growing threat of it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The suffocating nature of a small community is on full display here, with petty grievances and barely-concealed sins all around. And yet it's also an extremely funny film, long past the point where you'd expect the laughs to fade

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is not just a beautifully written screenplay. This deeply affecting, warmly humorous, beautifully acted and handsomely photographed (by Ben Davis) film is a major work and top of my list for the best film of 2022.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Beautifully written and superbly directed by Martin McDonagh with a keen understanding of the ways some people need conversation and attention and others don’t want it, the movie develops moods and insights that are both curious and sly.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: As a comedy duo, Farrell and Gleeson are money in the bank, just as they were in McDonagh’s first feature In Bruges. As a pairing of actor and filmmaker, Farrell and McDonagh are no less in sync.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees is elevated by a darkly funny scenario that is skilfully realised and used to explore rich, psychological themes.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A magnificent film telling a great, compelling story.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: One of the most fulfilling films I’ve seen this year. McDonagh has delivered an utter delight.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This comic fable has a center as cold and bitter as a lifetime of disappointment, and the irony at its core rings true.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Mixing black comedy with drama, and themes related to loneliness and male anger, the films develops a very human story, starring characters who cannot stop thinking about their own mortality, and the way they are perceived. Full review in Spanish.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s sad, it’s sardonic, it’s insightful on the subject of toxic masculinity and how it causes and is caused by the soul-death of depression.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s a hallmark of McDonagh’s skill that, for all the film’s mirth, nobody actually tells a joke or deliberately tries to be funny. The humour is all character-based as the film explores the nuances that has soured the relationship between these two men.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It offers a hilarious and poignant reflection on friendship, loneliness, and man's ambition to transcend and leave a legacy. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Evocative cinematography and a gorgeous score make this a spellbinding men-gone-wrong fable.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh has brilliantly constructed a quaint little universe far removed from modern civilization that will make you stop and admire its eccentricities.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Taken all together, McDonagh and co. have crafted an exceptional film, one that's strange, quirky, and maybe even a little unsettling to some, but also one that easily stands as one of the very best of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Funny, but too many jokes don’t land. Compelling and unpredictable, yet even major escalation between the former friends maintains impact that feels minor when expanded beyond them.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Amid war civil and interpersonal, there is no warning for when our time has come; sometimes all we can do is hope for the best and make our best guess at what to do. It’s a somber notion; one that permeates the film and the audience upon completion.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A haunting tale of friendship and heartbreak.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson, who exhibited tremendous chemistry from In Bruges, are superb again, mining dramatic riches... all without unbalancing the film's rich comedic instincts.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This is a complex, rich and nuanced work, funny as hell and devastatingly bleak. Colin Farrell delivers his best work. Brendan Gleeson, Kerry Condon and Barry Koenig are beyond excellent, etching memorable, instantly classic portrayals.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A story of alienation and mortality, this meditative and dark dramedy delivers sensational performances, high emotion, and one of the year’s best films - if not the best.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson deliver memorable performances in Martin McDonagh's caustic, stifling, sorrowful tragiccomedy.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Bristling with dark comedic tension, McDonagh’s foreboding script chafes with colloquialisms as escalation ensues.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Shocking, heartrending, but also guaranteed to make you laugh out loud.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The plot, like the fable that it is, forces the public to question themselves, to wonder about the preferred path without offering a concrete answer in this regard. Perhaps there is no way to escape the trivial.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is also the funniest movie I've seen in years, its dialogue like steel flechettes packed into a pipe with gunpowder and misanthropy...

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: In lesser hands, a film like The Banshees of Inisherin would not reach those high dark comedy notes, but thanks to the cast and crew, the movie ranks as a classic in the genre.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A highly satisfying, macabre drama - and perhaps McDonagh's most mature film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Writer/director Martin McDonagh does a brilliant job of fluidly transitioning between emotional beats.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh takes something as universal as a dissolving friendship and gives it his unique spin to it with The Banshees of Inisherin. It’s a striking view of one person’s decision on how he wants to spend what precious time he has left.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: While dreaming of being Samuel Beckett and Flannery O’Connor both at once, [McDonagh] lacks the skill, balance, and basic command of craft in his own medium to nip at the heels of either.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is an engaging film that works as a solid drama or dark comedy-drama, depending on your humor, that you should go and see.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gives the impression of understanding every element of these characters and their staid, insular culture of about two dozen human souls at a molecular level.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The film toggles masterfully between comedy and tragedy; realism and fable. It manages to be both of the moment and completely timeless.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: At least one of the characters in this story, perhaps more, desperately needs psychiatric care. This is a unique movie that is not for all tastes. Writer and director Martin McDonagh successfully navigates a fine line between farce and pathos.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Colin Farrell plumbs emotional and comedic depths in Martin McDonagh’s witty and wistful period drama.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Beautifully shot & superbly acted but the film emanates such bleakness that’s hard to shake. Ultimately I come away not being as enamored with it as I thought I would. It’s a film I appreciate, even admire, but not love.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The ultimate body count is minimal. Unusual for a McDonagh flick, but each death, be it man or beast, is profound and affecting.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: In Bruges’s director Martin McDonagh reunites with Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson for a story of an Irish friendship gone sour. And it’s easily the best new movie I’ve seen in forever.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This startlingly original comic drama begins with a rainbow arching over emerald-green hills, as if daring you to think about quaint Irish clichés.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: I was delighted by every frame - a magical film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: There is a lot of meaning when you dive deep into McDonagh's script, but even on the surface, "The Banshees of Inisherin" is a crowd-pleasing dramedy.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Darkly comic and sure to inspire some involuntary guffaws even as you wince.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A perfect scriptwriting work and one of the most exquisite movies of 2022. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Underneath all the black comedy is a sense of deep sadness that these friends now have to share the island without talking to each other. It’s this that gives The Banshees of Inisherin its painful gravity.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Another classic from Martin McDonagh.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Colin Farrell has a drunken monologue in this about the utter futility of prioritizing meaningless achievements over the people you love and the virtues we survive by, and it broke my heart so much that it still hasn’t healed.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin strips all romance and romanticism from its time, place, and characters. It’s pure isolation and the anxiety of platonic loss. Anxieties, by the way, that few films tend to spend so much time addressing.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A sudden unfriending ignites a civil war between old buddies in the sublime 'The Banshees of Inisherin.'

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: I'd almost call this a horror film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s a visually bleak and melancholy work that also manages to find many ways to accentuate the beauty of the place and people, but it’s also a story about desperation and pain. It’s so many wonderful things, making it one of the finest films of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A visceral, raw, and potent story that will inspire us to rethink friendships, war, and peace. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: While the film goes in some extremely dark directions, it's also frequently very funny, although it did leave me a bit cold.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A satisfyingly odd Gallic fable, combining whimsy with bitter truths about human frailty.  Its combination of humor and gruesomeness is typical of McDonagh, and shows him at the peak of his wonderfully idiosyncratic game.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: If we must laugh to keep from crying, then The Banshees of Inisherin insists we do both, often at the same time.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: One of the most purely emotional stories of the year, The Banshees of Inisherin features some of McDonagh’s best work to date.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The wonderful thing about The Banshees of Inisherin is that you have no idea where it’s headed, even in its darkest moments.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A darkly humorous, poignant look at a bond between two men that transforms due to a series of rash acts undertaken by both.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is one of the warmest, funniest, and most disturbing films of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: All four in the movie's main acting quartet should be in line for awards-season mention, and a win or two would not be a surprise. They're all that watchable -- and eminently deserving.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Dark, absurd, and often hilarious, this examination of friendship against the backdrop of beauty and violence is a brilliant film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The result is a sharply funny, heartfelt and blunt film -- notice I said heartfelt and not heartwarming. McDonagh’s latest won’t leave you feeling happy, but it will put you in a curious, introspective state.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It is a wailing warning about how any of us may react when faced with the dull, stupid absurdity of our lives and the increasingly shrinking certainty of a collective future.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A tragic, heartwarming look at the pillars of friendship and one of the years best.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh might well have set himself up with a considerably complex challenge, but -- as one critic who was decidedly not a fan of "Billboards" -- I'd have to say, in this case, he's more than met his mark.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is a great big Irish onion, with layers upon layers about what it means to be alive, and how our friendships in life can change no matter how old we are.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: With The Banshees of Inisherin, McDonagh has crafted a work that manages to be his most focused while also soaring as his most emotionally expansive. It is not just his best film to date, but one of the best of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A mesmerizing tale told well, with excellent performances all around. Expect lots of award love to come this film's way once that season begins.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Pain, grief, disorientation, and a dash of violence are soulfully plotted together by McDonagh, with his vision so wonderfully conveyed through the expressive chemistry of Farrell and Gleeson.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Pairs a crisp dramatic clarity and whistling-past-the-graveyard comedic tone with an underlying melancholy, the latter being a somewhat newer development in McDonagh’s work.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It is no coincidence the fourth feature written and directed by Martin McDonagh is also his best. His first three films were not set in Ireland, except for a brief prologue in In Bruges, and by returning to his native soil, McDonagh is on firmer ground.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Key to this folksy yarn’s success is how grounded everybody and everything is in this odd enclave, and the lived-in performances add to the rich details that McDonagh has included.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Canny and darker than Guinness stout, “The Banshees of Inisherin” is willfully off-putting and as arresting as a car wreck.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It's a gut punch of a comic-drama that keeps finding new ways to land hard-hitting body blows, and it's easily one of the year's very best films.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The movie is not for the faint of heart, so be forewarned. But for those who stick with it, the rewards are profound.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Writer McDonagh’s ear for pitch perfect dialogue (there’s a lot to quote here) kept me thoroughly amused through even some dark humorous patches. The Banshees of Inisherin is a moral fable with heart and a message.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: On the surface is a quirky account of two stubborn Irishmen with nothing better to occupy their time than drinking or fiddling. But there’s subtle work beneath McDonagh’s premise that makes this his most ponderous film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Equal parts funny and forlorn, with a smattering of the violence that always been a sort of Emerald Isle background noise

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Condon and Keoghan give “Banshees” extra personality and verve, while Farrell and Gleeson are the two halves of its beating heart.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It's interesting in that people do change, & want something different, and what happens when there are no opportunities to get away from the person that represents this situation, & how the beauty of the Emerald Isle scenery seems to mock what's going on.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This is where horror and hilarity start to mix.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin could very well be the best movie ever made about how social media has warped our lives.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Brought to life with exemplary performances and sharp screenwriting, keeping the bleak tone of the endeavor approachable in a way that’s pure McDonagh.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: In classic Irish fashion, The Banshees of Inisherin is outwardly warm and inviting, yet harbors a decidedly prickly core.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The central disagreement in The Banshees of Inisherin may be inexplicable, but the film itself is fun to watch from beginning to end, even when it gets depressing. Ireland and the Irish film community have rarely been as well represented as they are here.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh is a master world builder. Whether you want to live in those worlds for two hours of your only life is purely a matter of individual taste.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Existential dread picks up a brogue and a fiddle full of longing at JJ Devine’s Public House on an island off the West coast of Ireland in 1923.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The humor is laugh-out-loud funny followed by gut-punch sadness, creating a captivating emotional ride.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleason both deserve Oscar Nominations and Searchlight Pictures obviously set the release date for the movie to be considered in multiple categories.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell, Gleeson and Condon combine for a sublime look at isolation, friendship.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: More than an expression of Irish parochialism, this quasi-folk tale shows how tragic results can spring from something that borders on the trivial...

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Like the miniature donkey he dotes on, Padraic is a creature of very elemental needs and immense loyalty, whose braying when denied that basic fodder can break your heart.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The real treat is the verbal jousting from McDonagh’s screenplay. What will bring you in is the sharp humor that’s a trademark in his work. What will keep you watching is his outstanding characterization.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonaugh remains one of the most audaciously original filmmakers and his reunion with Farrell and Gleeson cuts into the enigmas of blood feuds through a series of confrontations that are alternately some of the funniest and saddest of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh, Farrell, and Gleeson deliver something special, The Banshees of Inisherin unquestionably one of the year’s best films.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s a hoot and a half up until the last half hour when the comedy turns to tragedy, but make no mistake this is one of the year’s best films. It’s clever, challenging, symbolic, and impeccably acted by its stellar cast.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s deep without putting on airs, moving without reaching for sentiment, and intimate without becoming insular. It’s good, is what I’m saying.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh has a few blind spots, but for the most part, The Banshees of Inisherin is a masterfully riveting exploration on life and love.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Viewers won’t be able to take their eyes off the screen when the pair perform scenes together, which is a testament to their talent and the quality of the script.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: With an uproarious sense of humor and tender sequences of heartbreak, and brimming with some of the year’s finest performances, it’s a formidable effort told with great care, and easily one of the most gratifying films of 2022.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gleeson and Farrell fall short of the acrid chemistry of their performances in McDonagh’s In Bruges. Their characters are in a similar situation -- adrift and idle in an isolated, picturesque locale. But there is no urgency in their circumstances.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Titanic performances (by Brendan Gleeson and Colin Farrell), a superb script by director Martin McDonagh and the living, breathing beauty of the island contribute to the film’s Shakespearean qualities

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Audiences are going to love Martin McDonagh’s The Banshees of Inisherin -- right up to the point where they start to hate it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: [Gleeson and Farrell give] great performance that rise above the film’s material and lift the film to the heights of Davis’ lofty lens looking down on an island of lonely people.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ... A reminder that some of the very best stories are about ordinary folk living ordinary lives with all the humour and drama and tragedy that comes with just being alive.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gleeson and Farrell revive their mesmerizing interplay, surrounded by breathtaking Irish scenery and a brilliant ensemble cast.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The master of the pitch-black comedy, writer/director Martin McDonagh balances his newest, The Banshees of Inisherin, on a knife edge between hilarity and despair. And the thing about humour on a knife edge is that it’s sharp, but it stings.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: You can see the relish that actors have when the material challenges and elevates them; it’s as though they’re so sunk into this world they never want to leave it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees’ dramatic resonance is a result of how deftly McDonagh delivers his characters’ virtues and vices. What’s hilarious and tragic is that both are so modest compared to the amount of anguish they cause.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: “The Banshees of Inisherin” is a movie for people who have no interest in superheroes or car chases, but want to be both challenged and entertained.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A firebranded and fiendish entertainment whose absurdly simple setup – the sudden breakup of two lifelong chums, played by two actors at the top of their game – attempts to show how tragedy is in the eye of the beholder.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: I think what's quite clever about the structure of the film is that McDonagh flips your allegiances [in a way that's very finely balanced.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: [The] whole affair rests on the shoulders of Farrell and Gleeson, and they carry it well.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Colin Farrell is a revelation in this. I think it's probably his best performance ever.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The word "tragicomic" was coined for performances, and movies, like these.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh has a knack for creating characters whose outward behaviour is bold, outrageous, or off-putting, wrapped in stories that are dark and walk a line between mordant comedy and tragedy. Fans of great performances should have this film on their radar.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell is the “star” of “The Banshees of Inisherin” but the ensemble cast, on all levels, is what makes the movie village a living and breathing place.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: “Banshees” is like a short story trying to be a novel. The extra pages get filled with the postcard views.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh has crafted a bona fide story about the end of a friendship and in doing so created an entertaining and heartfelt film laden with meaning and purpose.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: I would venture The Banshees of Inisherin is McDonagh’s best work

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s official - writer/director Martin McDonagh ("In Bruges") produces his best work when he casts Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson…captures the soul of literary Ireland with its reflection of historical sweep in the psychology of everyday men.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: "Banshees" is a mature work, one where McDonagh realizes that a microcosm can say more than an entire war.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson are the perfect pair to give these characters the balance of humor and heartbreak.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is kind of a wonder.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is worth it for the inventive use of colloquial Irish swearing. Come for the cussing, but stay for the performances and the devastation that comes when a friendship ends, and there is no one to share a pint with at the local pub.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Certainly one of Farrell’s finest performances and like the film itself, his loneliness sticks in your craw like an oft-recited Irish limerick.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Writer-director Martin McDonagh has an uncanny ability to sharply capture connections in small communities while echoing larger themes. So this often absurdly funny film brings continually surprising textures and impacts.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s visually stunning and consistently witty while being unafraid to ask serious questions about life as it is, and should be, lived. It is proper art.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: For better or worse, "The Banshees of Inisherin" is an unrelenting emotional tussle of stubbornness among men. Your tolerance level for such behavior will undoubtedly mix feelings and inform your experience.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Although McDonagh has made nothing but films about explosive interpersonal conflicts that turn into raging emotional infernos, The Banshees of Inisherin is more like slowly moving molten metal that’s scorching everything it touches.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Writer-director Martin McDonagh’s soulful masterpiece offers a a windswept elegy on a camaraderie that has reached its inexplicable expiration, as well as melancholic rumination on mortality.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Being drawn out to the point of potential self-bodily harm, one may not go in thinking it’s a comedy. And yet, that’s what writer/director Martin McDonagh has delivered, a terrific black comedy featuring stellar performances all around.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The result is McDonagh’s most fully realized work since his breakthrough play, “The Beauty Queen of Leenane,” a generation ago.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Ultimately this is a movie about the two men, and there’s just not much there — not enough to justify a feature film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A hauntingly sad, compellingly strange film about friendship and toxic masculinity.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Inisherin is the kind of postcard-pretty Irish town that only really exists in the imagination of filmmakers like Martin McDonagh... [It's] more of an idea of Ireland than a representation.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s tale is both a tiny story of two men, and a larger allegory of what happens when a small disagreement spins out of control.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It's visually stunning, well written and the acting is top-notch. But without context, the plot falls flat, leaving behind an unsettling and bizarre film.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: With its striking balance of dark comedy, rich performances, and layered characters, The Banshees of Inisherin is McDonagh at his best, weaving a complex world that captures the full spectrum of human emotions.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Marvelous performances from Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It's certainly well-written and the two lead actors are fabulous. The whole cast is really good. But it is quite the downer.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: While we’ve been taking Gleeson’s off-kilter charisma for granted since 1998’s The General, the performance that leaves scars is Farrell’s. It’s tough to think of a portrayal that finds so many emotional shades and levels of depth in incomprehension.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Friend against friend, brother against brother, love lost and grudges cracking the fabric of society; it’s all contained in this little fable.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gleeson and Farrell make the film a delight.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees Of Inisherin is as dark as a pint at the island’s local. It’s savagely funny and achingly sad and something of a gem.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s strength is the slow burn; he brings a lot of seemingly unrelated elements together in a way that knocks you from your seat. There’s also a topicality to the psychological turmoil unfolding. For a film set a century ago, it feels incredibly now

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Swings between the hilarious, the horrifying and the heartbreaking in magnificent fashion.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Elegiac, humorous, and tragic, all at the same time.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Funny, heart-breaking, and painfully real, "The Banshees of Inisherin" offers an emotional depth that has become all too rare in modern cinema.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The film may be a solemn one, but there are plenty of beautiful truths that McDonagh and his cast and crew uncover on the fictional island of Inisherin.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson, paired so wonderfully in McDonagh’s 2008 In Bruges, interact with each other expertly here. Watching them act together is like hearing a pair of master musicians perform a duet.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The most well-crafted, all-around accomplished entry to the awards season so far. Despite the dreariness of the islanders’ lives and the violence embedded into the plot, it is never less than exuberant.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A superb dark comedy that wickedly explores friendship, legacy and the duality of kindness. The McDonagh, Farrell and Gleeson trio strikes gold again. [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Featuring incredible performances all around but especially from Farrell, and some of the best writing you’re going to see this year, it’s not one to miss

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: What seems like a very simple premise becomes a labyrinth of emotions and a treatise on human relations in the masterful hands and words of McDonagh...in this contained, beautiful and heartbreakingly existential tale of innocence lost.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin offers a bittersweet exploration of the heartbreak, loneliness, hope, and bizarre unpredictability of life with two estranged friends in a rural Irish town. Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson give magnetic performances.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Loved everything this movie explored, from the fallout of Colm's decision to what that does to the person who it directly affects as well as those who’re indirectly affected. Fantastic performance by Farrell and Gleeson.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Beautifully shot and directed, The Banshees of Inisherin combines a quirky sense of humor with a bleak story in a fascinating way. The ending may not satisfy everyone, but the journey is compelling and heartfelt.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This contemplative character study is a deliberately paced yet quietly perceptive examination of the fragile and sometimes fickle nature of friendships.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This is the Gleeson and Farrell show. The former has never been better; the latter delivers a compelling, often devastating turn of such startling conviction and control that we wonder if he might consider preparing an acceptance speech for [the] Oscars.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s screenplay is superb, playful and bleakly witty on the surface, but hiding troughs of existential disillusionment and despair.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Every scene is staged with an eye toward emotional repression, and an ear toward rhythmic dialogue and its subtext about death and what lies beyond — the exact same driving forces that made In Bruges so captivating.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin proves that breakups aren’t meant to be easy. It’s also McDonagh's greatest triumph yet.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A surprising step-up from a cadre of talent already operating at a masterful level.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A typically well written and acted McDonagh effort, but perhaps the writer-director gets tripped up by his trademark, and arguably gratuitous, gothic touch this time.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin seems superficially like an uncomplicated film, but it’s anything but.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: In a way, the irresistible dialogue is the main character. See it and you’ll speak Irish for a week.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It's built on the back of one of the best screenplays of the year -- one that ushers us down a dark and twisted path, yet has us laughing every step of the way.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This story of male friendship, from Martin McDonagh, is rare.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees Of Inisherin is just about a perfect example of cinematic storytelling, mostly because the narrative is driven entirely by the three sacred C-words: character, character and character.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: I consider Banshees nothing short of a marvel.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Deceptively simple, McDonagh's film unfurls beautifully to reveal a pitch black tragicomedy, a deliciously entertaining and terrible tale.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin’s greatest gift to its audience is its refusal to turn its eccentric, intimate story into an allegory for anything other than what it is: the sad tale of an abruptly interrupted friendship in a beautiful, isolated place.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A superb, consistently funny character study that delves into the striking, far-reaching impact of a sudden ostracization.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It's equally funny and heartbreaking, because it is both absurdly and achingly honest.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Wounded but funny, quiet but resonant and resistant to anything like a Hollywood formula, The Banshees of Inisherin is a strangely profound little comedy. It’s one of the few true originals among movies this year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin, the last in a trilogy of plays by McDonagh set in the islands, is a work of great purity, beautifully made.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gleason and Farrell, re-teamed with “In Bruges” writer/director McDonogh, give performances of deep complexity and authenticity. We can see them each, in his own way, struggling with thoughts and emotions they find difficult to explain.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: For all his ambition, McDonagh fails to understand one of cinema’s defining truths: that bleakness doesn’t automatically equal greatness.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Returning to the familiar territory of a wild and rocky outpost on the west coast of Ireland, Martin McDonagh's latest film tells a story so simple and yet so terrible that you may spend days wondering what you have just seen after the final credits roll.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Given its small scale and lyrical dialogue, the movie may bring to mind McDonagh’s early work as a playwright. It’s a triumph of the same kind of harsh minimalism that fueled his shows.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s latest is heart-wrenching in its simplicity, dark-humoured and unadorned in its sentiments. It’s a film equal to In Bruges -- perhaps even more effective in the way its relative restraint presents brutality as humdrum as a trip to the pub.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The film can be viciously funny, but that can also feel beside the point. Which is? Well... Male ego is in the mix, of course.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: One measure of the movie’s skill, and its generosity, is that it embraces the wisdom of both its protagonists.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The true genius of the screenplay, performances and direction lies in the way the stakes escalate, drawing others into the shared madness of the two men.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Inisherin may not be a real place, but its eccentric characters, rugged vistas and vivid local legends make it an attractive tourist destination all the same.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Gleeson and Farrell play their roles to perfection despite being drawn as two-dimensional pawns in McDonagh's game—two sides of the same broken coin, doubling down when the opportunity for growth presents itself because they're too entitled to listen.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: ...like Waking Ned Devine with a three-day beard.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: "The Banshees of Inisherin" is one of the year's most sincere and meaningful films.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: There’s power in the message conveyed by writer/director Martin McDonagh’s screenplay; it’s less a drama and more a rumination about the failings of humanity.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: …The Banshees of Inisherin is a straight-up masterpiece, and one that offers a striking moral for the fake news era and beyond…

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is a fascinating look at the deterioration of a friendship and depression through the backdrop of a coastal Irish island. Farrell and Gleeson deliver quietly powerful, emotional performances.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: An almost silent exploration of emotional fragility in the face of rejection and the desperation of living without living. [Full review]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Writer/director Martin McDonagh has fashioned a dark comedy/drama that the discerning moviegoer will find most intriguing --- and funny.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
