review: The film can be difficult to watch, but its unique premise will have moviegoers riveted.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh, Farrell, and Gleeson should continue to make movies together because something magical happens when they do. Backed by strong performances and a superbly written script, this is an outstanding piece of accomplished filmmaking.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Feels like a return to In Bruges with its quiet philosophising amongst loud banter, as well as using the same two stars.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is a rich, soulful journey, full of agony, dry Irish wit and big, haunting questions. If it’s answers you’re looking for, however, you’re not going to find them on Inisherin.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: With yet another hit of a film to add to his impressive collection, McDonagh is falling into that very category.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A movie that approaches big themes with deceptive simplicity. A work of absurdist genius.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s chaotic charm reinforces the dark hilarity amid The Banshees of Inisherin, with Farrell and Gleeson delivering a constant stream of laughs.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: As unapologetically warped a film about friendship as this is, it’s also filled with honest and raw humanity, And I would risk cutting off one of my fingers if you don’t laugh your head off

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The moral underpinning of {Farrell and Gleeson's] tale proves a bit too scant to reach the heights they and McDonagh achieved with In Bruges, but they’re a funny, heartbreaking pair worth spending a couple of hours with.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson play the roles of friends-turned-enemies that keep escalating their inexplicable feud to brilliant effect, both comedically and dramatically, along with solid supporting turns by Barry Keoghan and Kerry Condon.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: 'The Banshees of Inisherin' digs through the black soil of Irish history and finds gold, along with blood feuds and treachery.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin tells a bleak and often humorous tale of sad endings. The riveting devolvement of deeply personal relationships strikes a sobering tone. The hurt and loss that one feels often means freedom for another.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is an utterly remarkable blend of drama and black comedy that's unwavering in its perspectives on what it means to be kind.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A triumph. It's audacious, witty and wickedly funny. Underneath all of the pith and irreverence, there's a warm beating heart.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A profoundly riveting and moving portrait of the consequences of not valuing niceness.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A darkly comic masterpiece, The Banshees of Inisherin is a lot like the isle from which it is set; on the outside it is merciless and intimidating, but go a bit further and what you’ll find is humor and a surprising amount of warmth.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Often a great parable about the places pride can go before the fall — shot through with a chilling spectral fatalism and perfectly pragmatic pessimism. What keeps it from greatness is McDonagh's over-reliance on broad comedy from the island's denizens.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Beautifully written by McDonagh and brought to life by one of the finest ensemble casts of the year, it's delightfully funny and curiously subtle until the point McDonagh takes a turn down a swarthier path and never looks back.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: What animates “The Banshees of Inisherin” and saves it from stiffness is the clout of the performances.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The combination of an insightful black comedy script by... Martin McDonagh, with a winning combination of three lead actors and an excellent supporting cast, results in one of the funniest and most consistently entertaining films this year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A stone cold classic.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Ignited by career-best performances from Colin Farrell and Bredan Gleason,  this new classic from son of Ireland Martin McDonagh brims over with dark comic magic and jolts of bloody scary hell. Fasten your seatbelts for one of the best movies of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A stirring demonstration of the actor's art.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin feels like putting on a favorite sweater that happens to have just fallen in a mud puddle. It’s chilly and unsavory but you still get a sense of the warmth and comfort underneath. Quite simply one of the best films of the year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is tragicomedy at its finest, a specific slice of a combusting amity that just so happens to capture a wide swath of the human condition.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s another masterstroke from Ireland’s premiere filmmaker as it deftly balances on the razor’s edge between hilarity and heartbreak.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This is not a movie I will ever watch again or remember with any fondness but it is well done

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Set against the backdrop of the Irish Civil War in 1923, Banshees displays the nation’s (and Colm’s) ugly habit of cutting off their fingers to spite their hand.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: What means more in life, being kind or being remembered? That’s the question The Banshees of Inisherin asks in the heights of it’s perfectly crafted dramedy. Every piece of this movie works.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is a fucked-up kind of fun that'll leave you chuckling, heartsick, and a wee bit anxious. Don't miss it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: 'The Banshees of Inisherin' feels like an adaptation of some unwritten Shakespearean tragedy or Homerian epic. It’s a film that revels in its own riddles and demands multiple screenings to puzzle out what everything means.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Ferociously funny, dark, and offering the best performance of Colin Farrell’s career to date, The Banshees of Inisherin is Martin McDonagh at his most minimalist, yet most mature.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The impasse between two men, one who wants to be left alone and the other who can’t let go, is as gripping and meaningful as any tale of star-crossed lovers and it may be McDonagh’s magnum opus.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees is perhaps Mcdonagh's quietest & tamest movie. The beautiful shots of Ireland and the two lead performances are masterful. I don't see myself ever rewatching this one like I do his previous films but it's certainly the work of a master filmmaker.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Brilliant dark comedy.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This dark comedy about human loneliness and the need to be loved, featuring a strong performance by Colin Farrell, brings a whole new meaning to the adage "cutting off your nose to spite your face"

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s the kind of film that crawls into your soul and stays there.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh is one of today's great comedic writers, and he's found a band of actors who can bring his disturbing thoughts to life in a rather hard, jovial way.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Can be a Rorshach test for viewers if they relate more to Colm or Padaraic and take either or neither's side. Or, viewers can just enjoy the unfolding train wreck of two grown men spiraling out of control.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin delivers a measured, layered look at the deterioration of a lifelong friendship. Just be prepared to re-evaluate your friendships once you watch it

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees is very funny but calling it a comedy is underselling McDonagh’s deep—and ongoing—themes of cyclical violence and how difficult it is to break out of them.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin‘s pleasures are subtle and contemplative, much like Martin McDonagh’s other work. This is a film you get to take with you when you leave.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Some of “Banshees” is a little grisly — be warned — and things take a bad turn in the third act, but this is lovely work and not to be missed.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh’s new film, The Banshees of Inishirin, is as close as he’s come to equaling the success of In Bruges.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: With its mix of murder-ballad melancholy and bawdy, picaresque slapstick comedy, The Banshees of Inisherin is a contradictory sort of crowd-pleaser.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin [is] film that’s attentive to the range of ways that individuals cope with the nuances of life as part of a community, and affords McDonagh’s latest the shades of introspection that most of his other films can’t quite match.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A dark and bleak dramedy that is unafraid to tackle depression, despair, and worrying about the legacy you leave behind. The moral of the story: be a nice person.. even if it means no one will remember you when you're gone.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson expertly use their subtle expressions to portray despair, quiet rage, and perplexed longing all through repeated instances of giving and declining invitations for a pint.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A long-overdue reunion, The Banshees of Inisherin is a pitch-black allegorical comedy featuring everything that makes a Martin McDonagh film what it is.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Through this exaggerated, dark humour, we’re shown the true nature of the world and the humans who inhabit it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A texturally gloomy film and a testament to McDonagh as a director that it’s still entertaining despite its devastating portrait of a friendship torn asunder.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin mines its comedy from life’s darkest trenches. It also finds its most profound melancholy in the banal.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s a beautiful, yet desolate, film and I doubt you’ll see anything better this year.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is a quiet consideration of some very thorny issues by Martin McDonagh.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh re-teams with Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson for a hilarious and heartbreaking black comedy. Barry Keoghan shines in the riotously funny and achingly sad Irish dramedy, that is a continuation of the best of Irish literature.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s McDonagh’s quietest and most inward-looking film to date, settling for the agony of sheer absurdity than primal bombast.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Whatever you choose to call it, the film is often very funny.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson, reuniting from “In Bruges,” know each other’s rhythms by now and concatenate beautifully...

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh lyrically whips every incident in the film into a mordantly funny dark fable about men’s innate inability to work together for the betterment of society at large.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Banshees inverts cliché as much as it embraces it.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A masterful companion piece to In Bruges, with career-best work from Colin Farrell.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Give Martin McDonagh a topic like friendship to tackle, and he’s bound to warp it into something so subversive, so twisted, so extreme … that you’ll laugh your ass off for two full hours.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: he Banshees of Inisherin will make you want to call your friends and tell them you love them, and it will make you want to hold tight to your deepest bonds for as long as life will let you.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Good storytelling has magic, and when Martin McDonagh tells you a story, you know you’re in the hands of a real magician.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Without his trademark vulgarity and narrative absurdity, McDonagh’s challenged himself to draw humor and meaning from the mundane. And he does.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: At its best, The Banshees of Inisherin whispers and laments and amuses the way McDonagh's best stage writing does. And it offers the invaluable opportunity to see Farrell in his hangdog element

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin a film that is really worth watching and is also so unusual, once again impressively demonstrating the complexity of the author and director.  [Full review in Spanish]

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A startlingly intriguing group of island denizens bring McDonagh’s morbid tale to vibrant life, an aching portrait of the ravages of isolation and discontent.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin is a beautifully-shot and deftly-played comedy. It is at once masterful, surprisingly poignant, and profound.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Beyond all the quips and souring banter, there’s no shortage of the stuff in a break-up story that leaves a haunting impression.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Very good show all around.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Having scene partners of the acting caliber of Gleeson and Condon would raise anyone’s game, and here Farrell responds with a career-best performance that absolutely sings.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Another great feel-bad treat from Martin McDonagh, featuring one of Colin Farrell’s best performances yet as a guy trying (and failing) to deal with the fallout of a falling out.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A simple and diabolical tale of a friendship’s end shot through with bristling humor and sudden moments of startling violence.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Unpredictably counter-intuitive performances from a cast headed by Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson, plus McDonagh’s deliciously rhythmic comic dialogue, should give viewers a very good time – but may send them out shivering.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: If you’re usually immune to McDonagh’s blarney you’re unlikely to be any more bewitched by his Banshees, but with Gleeson and Farrell on fine form, it’s pleasant enough company for a couple of hours the next time your drinking pals snub you.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Another acerbic, dangerous, darkly amusing, and heartbreakingly sad character drama from a modern master of shifting tones.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: A testament to McDonagh's gift for dialogue and the infinitely watchable chemistry between Farrell and Gleeson...

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The writer-director’s superbly acted fourth feature is his most Irish work for the screen to date, and also one of his best.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell and Gleeson’s lovely, perfectly mismatched performances... both betray their own manner of gaping, aching vulnerability.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Its constant undercurrent of humor affords the story’s most pressing questions an appropriately ridiculous context, one that speaks to the absurdities of all existence.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: McDonagh uses comedy like a claw hammer, smashing open tricky subjects to expose the goo inside.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: As a study of male loneliness and swallowed anger it is weirdly compelling and often very funny.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Farrell brings extra layers of depth and mournfulness to the classic McDonagh pattern.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: It’s his quietest movie and, in many ways, his most touching, which is not to say that it won’t make you squirm in your seat as you wonder if it’s OK to laugh at what he’s throwing at you.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: The Banshees of Inisherin captures both the elemental resonance of folklore with the sophisticated weightiness of classic stage drama.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Invoking the spirit of John Hinde postcards ... McDonagh confirms that, for those not temperamentally opposed to the entire shtick, there is much life yet in his embrace of durable narrative traditions

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: This is an ode to petty grievances, bizarre stands that won’t be remembered, but might become a tall tale at a pub. Like the sparse land of its setting, Inisherin is a film that reveals multitudes through observation and reflection.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: “The Banshee of Inisherin” seems to be a mad meditation on the topsy-turvy nature of our unpredictable world, our unreasonable times, how civility has expired, and how there are no winners in war.

name: The Banshees of Inisherin
review: Martin McDonagh’s latest is a more soulful and straightforwardly sad film than we’ve seen from him before.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
Rating: PG-13 (Some Strong Language|Sequences of Intense Action)

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A movie-movie with an old-school movie star, this actioner is best seen in theatres, where the dazzling fighter-jet sequences will make you dizzy.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: All of these elements come together to form one of the biggest third acts in recent cinema.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: While other actors disappear behind their roles, Tom Cruise wants you to know it's him. This movie uses all of its technical marvel to bring us back to an adrenaline-filled formula blockbuster full of emotion. Made for the movies. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a little bloated at times and could have used a bit of trimming, especially in its third act, but there’s no denying the magnetic energy the film brings to the viewer.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "It’s a valid critical interpretation that Top Gun: Maverick is merely propaganda wrapped in a very pretty bow. But boy, that bow is really something."

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Its a sure-footed performance from an actor that never fails to hold the attention of its audience.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A big jingoistic cartoon. But it’s a fun jingoistic cartoon...

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: After years of uncertainty with the pandemic, Tom Cruise's Top Gun: Maverick has saved movie theaters, revitalizing their business with a great film.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: We want the thrill of suspense, to root for characters, to be in awe of cinematography, and to share the collective experience of unity in watching a film with strangers.This movie gives you that and more!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Stunning aerial action sequences aren't just random dogfighting but serve as narrative test runs to prep viewers for the climax. Granted, the nostalgia wouldn’t exist without Tony Scott, so it’s hard to give Kosinski credit for copying the flight pattern.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: As the movie star system gives way to the IP era, don’t ever forget one thing: Tom Cruise is still a major movie star.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Burnished 1980s blockbuster nostalgia as Tom Cruise and producer Jerry Bruckheimer prove they can still make ’em like they used to. Strap in for the thrillingly real aerial dog fights.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The zenith of modern “legacy sequels,” Top Gun: Maverick is in many ways traditional—from its “rah rah” militarism, to its 1980s individualism—but it’s also a metatextual lament for the dying light of movie stars.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Visually and emotionally satisfying in ways that you’d think would be the norm for big movies featuring families and explosions but very much aren’t.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: … an astonishing and glorious film that far surpassing its mediocre predecessor with a good story, amazing tech credits and some fab performances beginning with Cruise himself, who deserves to be in the Oscar conversation

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick will take your breath away!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: So, why did Top Gun: Maverick strike such a cord with audiences? It’s a film about feeling relevant. About a changing world. Parenthood. Friendship. It resonates.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It contains just as many formulaic narrative sops and expected character beats as the original, but the streamlining of the simple storyline provides a breeziness that befits and benefits the picture.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "Top Gun: Maverick" delivers on just about every level imaginable and then exceeds it: plus ultra.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ...a decent-enough sequel that ultimately falls right in line with its watchable yet far-from-flawless predecessor...

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: If a more cheesy sensibility is what you are looking for, then you'll likely enjoy the hell out of this film.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Like its predecessor, it thrives on military fetishism, a**hole energy, and the suspension of belief usually reserved for latter-day Liam Neeson fight scenes.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: One more piece of advice: See it in a theater. A big, loud, and crowded one. See it with the fans. That's the way these summer blockbuster blasts were designed to work.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise delivers a nuanced performance that gives Maverick multitudes. More than the character deserves. They find a way to make this guy likable and that is an achievement in itself...

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick represents the best of what blockbuster filmmaking can be, brilliantly blending spectacle with sentiment to exhilarating effect.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A good story made for young and no so young. It will bring to the beloved franchise a whole new herd of followers. A splurge of technology and action without equal. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: After Cruise and McQuarrie perfected the action thriller with Mission: Impossible—Fallout (2018), now they’re back (along with [director Joseph Kosinski and] some other screenwriters and story originators) to perfect the hero’s farewell.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It flies higher than the original with a few aerial sequences that demonstrate Cruise's skill at piloting anything, but I don't find the sense of adrenaline in the flight routines and the predictable missions in the danger zone. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ... A summer blockbuster of the old school, with rust-bucket F-14s duking it out with young pups in F-18s, all shot on celluloid rather than sketched in by computers, at the behest of a star who refuses to quit.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Maverick may make you cry at points, but it is a feel-good, crowd-pleaser through and through.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The screenplay impeccably balances the new with the nostalgic, drafting on the previous movie’s conflicts and amplifying its emotions.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It shines brightest in the final 30 minutes which features some of the best aerial fighter footage ever put on screen. See it in the theater. You won’t regret it.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Sights, sounds and speed act as a unifying force in an assault on our senses. When the engine roars, our knees tremble. When the jets dive, swoop and pirouette like they were in a musical number, the adrenaline rush trickles into the rest of the body.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Brings Maverick’s story full circle in a satisfying manner that adds depth and dimension to its predecessor, but still tells a story that’s all its own.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Forced ode to the original doesn't fully embrace the cheese

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A sequel that manages to soar higher than it's predecessor.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: One of the rare films where every discussion leaving the theater is about how much fun you just had, instead of an analysis of its quotients.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick repositions Tom Cruise as the world’s biggest movie star in his reprisal of a role that he invests with wisdom and experience without losing that hotshot confidence.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: When Maverick is called back to tutor the most elite young Top Gun graduates for an impossible mission, one can imagine Cruise — by starring in a sequel 36 years after the cult original — schooling the next generation about true-blue action cinema.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: There's so much great action, incredible stunts, big laughs, and emotional moments that really send the viewer on a journey, which is exactly why we go to the movies.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Kilmer’s inclusion in the blockbuster sequel shows that the franchise’s primary rivals are affected by something much stronger than g-forces these days: time.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick at first glance seems designed to go further and finally have Cruise embrace his role as elder statesman.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It helps that the filmmaking is pretty much impeccable, with director Joseph Kosinski providing the kind of clear, streamlined action sequences that make blockbuster spectacle feel fun instead of mandatory.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In Top Gun: Maverick, Cruise has his patented charm, energy, and credibility.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Gorgeous cinematography, insane flying action sequences, thrilling, emotionally moving, and a sequel that absolutely surpasses its predecessor. Well-paced, executed & has that re-watchability factor.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Along comes a film like Top Gun: Maverick (a film which the release was delayed a couple of times) and it reminds us of the good ole days in several ways. Thank you Joseph Kosinski (Oblivion, Spiderhead) and even bigger props to the ageless Tom Cruise.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: As much fun as it is when a familiar formula is well-executed, this movie is also an altar to America's obsession with youthfulness, its exaltation of white super-men, its worship of heavy artillery ... and (sigh) its objectification of women as trophies.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Maverick’s fidelity to the past goes deeper than dollar signs. This is a film where generational commitments matter and institutional continuity is valued.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The film is lovingly dedicated to the late Tony Scott, who directed “Top Gun.”  I’d like to think that he would give a thumbs up and a salute to “Top Gun: Maverick.”

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is not bloated fan service, and it hits you with the right amount of nostalgia. A thrilling summer blockbuster!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "A perfect popcorn movie and an improvement on the original."

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: An action movie that's this visibly wondrous and entertaining, knows it's walking in familiar footsteps but puts in a bold effort to make this return trip mean something is electrifying and, yes, breathtaking.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: As someone who typically hates sequels, this is by far one of the best ones ever made. It pays homage to the original and elevates everything!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This was a very entertaining two hours that I might have enjoyed more than the original.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "Top Gun: Maverick" pulls out all the stops to make this moviegoing experience an absolute spectacle.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Armed with a squadron of F-18s, compact digital cameras, and a wild disregard for Tom Cruise’s personal safety, Maverick’s aerial sequences are the most spectacular ever filmed.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: bears some residual traces of its predecessor, but it also shines in its own right, bringing to its title character a surprisingly effective sense of gravitas and emotional endurance

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Joe Kosinski matches his well-established architectural precision with suitably nostalgic but never pandering emotionality, while Cruise commands the screen in a performance that leverages his multimillion-dollar star wattage to brighten the entire film.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It's wild what a plot can do. Where Top Gun succeeded on vibes alone, Maverick understands that the reason for getting all these characters together needs enough substance to sustain our interest in them as people.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun Maverick is cinematic in every way. It’s a gift to traditional filmmaking and meant for the biggest screen possible. One of Tom Cruise's strongest films.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: An impressive action sequel that stays away from everything other than pure escapism. And that's great!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Joseph Kosinski and his team have umbraced the plot cliché thats put face to face past and present, turning it into a narrative engine that makes take off what we could describe as the perfect blockbuster.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a mature blockbuster and an improvement over its predecessor.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: For about two thirds of its runtime Top Gun Maverick feels like a rehash of the original film. But the action pieces in the final act along with Cruise's steady leadership turn it into a breed of blockbuster we don't crome across that often nowadays.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The Top Gun sequel delivers action and emotions driven by a whole lot of nostalgia.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Practically a beat-for-beat remake of the original with a non-existent screenplay that has so little interest in exploring the man of its title decades later that the film may as well be set in 1987.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The effects - second to Cruise - are the star of the show, but "Top Gun: Maverick" surprises in its quieter moments.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Somehow Cruise's foray back into the danger zone will be remembered more than the original, setting a new standard in the era of reboots.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Don't be fooled — it's the same glorified military recruitment video that the original was.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Despite my issues, Top Gun: Maverick accomplishes what it sets out to do: deliver an expertly crafted nostalgia machine that pays tribute to its predecessor while making some notable improvements.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cheesy at times and faulted, but absolutely exhilarating and emotionally moving. A marvelous "in theatre" movie experience.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The aerial footage is indeed the best you have ever seen up to this point. Even on a standard 2D screen, it feels like you're up there, hanging on for dear life.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun plays the phoenix game by rising from the ashes in glittery form.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise is here to save cinema. He's here to save America. And I'm here for it.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Mixing excellent visuals, a strong story, great performances with the right amount of nostalgia and spectacle, Top Gun: Maverick is one of the best cinematic experiences I’ve had in a long time.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: If this sounds like hokum, it is. But the storytelling too reminds you of the best version of old Hollywood, broad strokes rendered with watchmaker care.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The storyline is passable, acting is good, dialogue is fine, and there are some humorous moments.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Don't confuse this movie with wretched remakes like 'Firestarter' and 'Point Break,' because this one is as good as the original. It has the same strengths and the same weaknesses.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is stellar. Top Gun: Maverick feels like The Irishman for blockbusters, with the criticism going much more outward than inward. If you’d like to ask Tom Cruise about his opinion on the state of studio filmmaking, here’s your answer.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: If you love Top Gun, you'll love Maverick.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Absolutely thrilling. You truly feel like you're in the plane with Tom Cruise pulling Gs.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I'm almost embarrassed to admit how much I liked this... Everything I hated about [the original], I love about this one.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The film is not without its problems, but it’s a near-perfect master class in giving the people what they want.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Sure, the aerial action sequences are cool, but it’s the story, a star-studded cast, and that soundtrack...that makes Maverick the stuff movies should be.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: With some more to it than hard-driven action, with smart, crisp writing in the right irreverent tone, and with characters of more than a single dimension, this exhilarating legacy sequel sees off a much-vaunted 1980s original that doesn't even come close

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Maverick is truly one for the ages in its deliverance of a distilled summer blockbuster whose thrills are strong enough to inspire highs totally indistinguishable from narcotics. Beware, and welcome to the Danger Zone.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Compared to the original, this sequel is 70% less sweaty, 85% less sexy, and 90% more tween appropriate. Top Gun: Maverick is a tale of redemption both for Maverick and for the original film.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Perhaps the most admirable quality of Top Gun: Maverick is that it never pretends to be anything other than what its core audience wants it to be: a thoughtful, finely-crafted action film that will wow audiences with its sounds and images.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun’s appeal is built on US exceptionalism, on competitive machismo, on bread and butter heroics. The sequel offers it polished and unreconstructed.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Impressive as the practical effects are, they don’t quite make up for the film's atmospherically thin writing and an ensemble fully on autopilot.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Mission Accomplished

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It’s a triumph of blockbuster filmmaking, a legacy sequel done right, and one of the most exciting things you’ll find at the movies this summer.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The sequel is an adrenaline-charged ball of nostalgia that manages to be fan service while building off the original to create a superior film. It’s about as close to the perfect blockbuster as you can get.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The real star of Top Gun: Maverick is the dizzying aerial acrobatics, which are more than worth the price of admission for those not overly concerned about simplistic dialogue, far-fetched reconnections, and a silly plot.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise is going to save the movies, even if it kills him.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: “Top Gun: Maverick” is a better movie than its predecessor. The jet-propelled flying thrills and crisp special effects are infinitely superior. This is high-gloss “Hollywood” entertainment.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I hope you have the high-heart-rate alerts on your smartwatch shut off while you’re in the theater for Maverick, because you’re probably going to get a notification every ten or fifteen minutes.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It was corny. it was cheesy. It was emotional. It was exciting.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A testosterone-heavy entertainment payload...the film succeeds by sticking closely to the formula of its 1986 predecessor, bringing viewers a product that is beautifully polished in its design and blissfully unsophisticated in its worldview.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The only flaw is that it isn't 7 hours longer.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is such a perfect piece of formula filmmaking it’s impossible to dislike.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is the perfect American blockbuster. It plays like as much a legacy sequel to the 1986 film as to 40 years of Tom Cruise movies, with the best of what we’ve come to expect from Hollywood’s most consistent star accounted for.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise truly believes he can save movie theaters. If he keeps making movies like Top Gun: Maverick, that may not be absurd.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The spectacular aerial maneuvers of the third act are breathtaking.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A stand-alone classic-- the layered emotional elements added depth and texture to the familiar, beloved characters while paving the way for the next generation

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: With better acting, more emotion, and subtle humor that actually lands, Top Gun: Maverick is a huge improvement over the original film. But the constant need to fly the same flight pattern as the 1986 film is more of a restraint than a fond recollection.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Under the wildly sincere dedication of star Tom Cruise, Maverick trails a vibrant path in blockbuster cinema.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It is a movie movie in the best sense of those words. It has good acting, good storyline, good cinematography, etc. It may have been 36 years since the original; but a couple of generations have been waiting for this & they won't be disappointed.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: After the airless thrills of recent superhero films, Top Gun: Maverick is like a lungful of oxygen, but it has soul to go with its spectacle.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: All the visuals glisten, are well composed, perfectly lit and many are bigger than life due to cinematographer Claudio Miranda’s (Life of Pi) penchant for closeups.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This flawed yet irresistible exercise in big-screen nostalgia works hard to keep us entertained.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick makes up for the near four-decade wait with stunning aerial performances and one-liners so cheesy you have to love them.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: With virtually every shot awash in nostalgia, the movie brings such a glut of adrenaline that most fans won't notice how terrible the script is.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It has just the right amount of nostalgia, drama and nail biting action to make it worthy of theatrical viewing.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review:
To paraphrase Maverick: Don't think!

Just watch.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: With the element of surprise and wonderment missing the second time round, Top Gun: Maverick settles for a greatest hits approach with a few new tracks thrown in.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: What director Joseph Kosinski has done here is no easy feat. He's managed to take the good of the original film and elevate the story and special effects to new heights. "Top Gun: Maverick" is one of the best films of the year!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It has a gripping plot and is better than the original.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick proves the formula still works, if you have a bright enough star, one who refuses to accept new realities, and will die proving it.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: They played that nostalgia card really well...It still felt new and fresh, it felt like its own thing.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Surpasses the original...it moved me in ways I was not anticipating.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This sequel is a marvelous labor of love that doesn’t tread any new, unpredictable ground with its story.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I wouldn’t have thought that we needed another trip into the danger zone, but this film definitely took my breath away.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It's frankly better than we should have ever hoped for from any action movie summer tentpole in the misbegotten 2020s.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A quintessential summer blockbuster from the days of yore, it does nothing to reinvent the genre, but does prove it's still alive. Tom Cruise is problematic but a dang movie star. Knowledge of the original not required, but definitely recommended.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: To fans that fall into the nostalgia trap (knowingly or otherwise) or others who are here just for some truly spectacular aerial stunts (they are genuinely awesome), the storytelling shortcomings of Top Gun: Maverick probably won’t matter.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In matters of the soul, this [film] is Tom Cruise's Mad Max: Fury Road (2005). [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick absolutely lives up to its predecessor, Tony Scott’s streamlined blockbuster/machine from 1986.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise is lucky he’s still got pull as his supporting cast nearly outshines him in every scene they share.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: After the grand flying sequences and explosive finale, the only victory Maverick's won is the faith and love of the people in his life. And that's, all in all, enough.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A definitive, and enthralling piece of cinema that transcends into an experience.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It’s a fast-paced, heady bit of craziness, both on the ground and in the sky, and a worthy addition to the Top Gun name.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A good two-thirds of Top Gun: Maverick is very solid, if unremarkable, but what really gets it off the ground are its top-drawer flight sequences, staged thrillingly by director Joseph Kosinski.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Once again, Tom Cruise feels like a fish in the water – or like a bird in mid-flight, if the term fits. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A master class in tension and suspense; an exemplary action film that knows what people enjoyed from the first movie, and knows how to use the language of cinema to give audiences an experience that MUST be seen on the big screen. Full review in Spanish.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It’s the action that sells the popcorn, and this film really delivers on that front, especially when it’s time to put the impossible bombing raid into play.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The dialogue is sharper, the plot is more gripping, and the vastly improved aerial stunts really do take your breath away.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is the total package of what a blockbuster movie should be.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Spectacular spectacle, with chills and thrills running throughout the body whole. Crying on cue is just part of the ride.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Unlike its forerunner, which was firmly focused on restless youth, “Top Gun: Maverick” reminds us that life goes on after the final credits.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Old relics assemble! A superbly thrilling, witty and crowd-pleasing modern blockbuster, well worth the 36-year wait.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A vast improvement over the vapid original.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is better than the original, one of the best sequels I’ve ever seen and, quite simply, one of the best action movies ever.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: There will be enormous replay value in Top Gun: Maverick, a film one senses will rank among not just the best sequels or legacyquels, but perhaps one of the finest populist American pictures of the decade.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ...one of the rare sequels that improves upon every single flaw the original had, and more than exceeds expectations in the process.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A meta monument to the myth of Tom Cruise, the best action blockbuster since Mission Impossible Fallout.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Leaves behind any sticky realities of the modern era and attempts to capsulize the romanticism so characteristic of 80s blockbuster cinema ... The meat of Top Gun: Maverick is a juicy, adrenaline-pumping good time.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is the kind of film that will make you cheer in theaters, but it should also withstand the test of time, just as Top Gun has.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Under the thrill of genuine stuntwork and the pleasure of being able to relax into a story we already know, audiences won’t mind that the film’s sensations are only based on what used to get us off.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The tag-teamed script — where, I’m guessing, Cruise’s go-to screenwriter Christopher McQuarrie had a big influence — deepens Maverick’s emotional stakes, and those of the other pilots, in ways the first movie never could.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is exactly what audiences want when it comes to a theater movie

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Following up a movie so iconic to audiences with a sequel that is, in many ways, better than the original is no small feat.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: There’s a sharper movie trapped somewhere inside the thrill of the spectacle; one that actually engages with the supporting cast and one that explores how Maverick's unchanging nature may be something to critique and evaluate rather than blindly yield to.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: An eye-popping blockbuster that, for all its daft macho contrivances, still manages to take your breath away, dammit.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A somehow-superior sequel to a classic film without feeling indebted to calling back every moment, Top Gun: Maverick manages to be a profound addition to its predecessor while also being a tremendous film in its own right.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is better than its predecessor. From the rumble of the jet engines, to the amazing cockpit and fighter aircraft scenes, if you don’t see this film in an IMAX theater, you are doing yourself and the film a huge disservice

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: These are simple pleasures, yes, but in the moment they also feel like rarities. There might be no movie star better equipped to revitalize them than Cruise.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Credit Tom Cruise's convincing performance for evoking genuine emotional involvement and -at his insistence - there are no green screen or CGI aerial shots - resulting in a kinetic sequel that excels the original.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise's return to the danger zone will take your breath away. Family and friendship. Bravado and bond. Heroism and sacrifice. Tremendously thrilling with nostalgic poignancy, it's the ultimate love note to aviation and unifying, soaring blockbuster.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: With its melancholy regret and bittersweet nostalgia, this is far superior to the 1986 blockbuster. But as the sun goes down on American imperialism here, the last-gasp celebration of it unsettles.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is one of those rare breeds: a sequel that’s better than the original.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Call this one: "The Air Force Awakens" ...and then apologize for not recognizing that 'Top Gun' is technically about NAVY Fighter Pilots.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: At times, exceptional. [Full Review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This [dogfight] is so good that, Stockholm Syndrome-like, we willingly suspend disbelief at the sheer audacity of it in favor of lapping it up and wanting more. Which we get. And then some.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The first Academy Award winner of 2022 arrives with 'Top Gun: Maverick,' but it actually shows up after all is mostly said and done. That's when the inimitable Lady Gaga belts out 'Hold My Hand,' already a dead-mortal-lock Best Original Song ballad.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top-shelf popcorn entertainment buttered with genuine human drama and high-stakes action.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It illustrates Cruise's showmanly sense that maybe Americans desperately want to believe in themselves again. While the latest James Bond movies fail at heroism, Cruise's action films present a credible sense of valor

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "Top Gun: Maverick" is nostalgia for Reagan's America writ large across our collective imagination. The movie itself may not realize how much it speaks to a longing for more confident days.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: If you want to be treated to the aesthetic and the feel and the characterization they had in the first movie, you're absolutely getting this. Everything is there.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: While the new film is not as memorable, or of its moment, it’s a more coherent piece of character drawing, a more exhilarating spectacle, and, by virtue of not being made in the mid-1980s, altogether less daft.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick managing to exceed all expectations after the complicated journey it took to the big screen is a true testament to the power of simple, visceral movie magic.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: So while a lazy “Top Gun” sequel coasting on the fumes of nostalgia was ripe for the picking, everyone involved actually put forth the effort to deliver a spectacularly entertaining film.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: As a stand-alone blockbuster that’s just trying to suck viewers’ eyeballs out of their sockets with hellacious flight photography and thunderous sound, Maverick is just what every cineplex in the country has been crying out for.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Goes with popcorn like butter... I liked it in spite of myself.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Director Kosinski and company ratchet up genuine suspense in some sequences. We also get good acting, some decent banter, and plenty of speed.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review:
Tom Cruise returns to the air to do what he knows best: move us and make us vibrate in our seats.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Even as you see all the plot twists coming, Tom Cruise's charms and the spectacular aerial action still take your breath away.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The jet-fueled sequel to the 1986 flyboy classic has charisma to burn, soaring airplane indulgences and a narrative that honors the past while breaking the sound barrier as it shifts to the future.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a perfectly tolerable time-killer, and I enjoy popcorn as much as anyone, but I just hope these won’t be the only kinds of movies that bring audiences back to the theaters.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A big, brash and brawny movie jam packed full of the excitement and charisma fans have been waiting for.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: There was no doubt that the film made us swirly, giddy, tippy-toed...

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Not that what it offers is in anyway stuck in an era gone by - the film flies confidently and sturdily to deliver a crackling good mainstream movie experience.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The actor's daredevil persona is still intact, and he has just enough charm to keep the routine from getting old.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I’m happy to report it was worth the wait. Maverick can be my movie wingman any time.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Did I say the flight sequences are awesome? They are.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ... The fact that the script doesn't even cite the enemy country gives [you] an idea of how bland the story really is. So there are no problems with anyone for the release. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise continues to defy the odds, soaring above the laws of age and gravity. He feels the need for speed and delivers something to cheer about.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Kosinski’s dogfights are pristine, incredible feats of filmmaking, economical and orbiting around recognizable space, but given to occasional, inexplicable shocks of pure chaos.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Movie escapism at its most potent.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I haven't been this entertained in years! This film is a Perfect 10/10

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: During the biggest, boldest moments - and there are plenty of them - Maverick “takes it right into the Danger Zone,” and yes, this film will “take your breath away.”

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Earnest, emotional, and exhilarating, TOP GUN: MAVERICK is a master class in how to craft a legacy sequel.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise infuses the inevitable barrage of macho posturing and adrenaline-fueled set pieces with an underlying poignancy as he explores the emotional vulnerability of a title character coming to terms with his past.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It's nothing if not formulaic, and at times the script is cheesier than a croque monsieur. But the action scenes are splendid, and Cruise, at almost 60 but as willing as ever to whip his shirt off, looks predictably great.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "...131 minutes of fan service where the fan isn’t truly served until the last 30."

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is everything you want out of a sequel and so much more and feels familiar yet fresh, like coming back home after a long vacation.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is basically just escapist authoritarian porn for white dads. If it were a sports movie, the 60-year-old coach of the football team would be called out of retirement to quarterback the Super Bowl.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It's propulsive and spellbinding, even as you see every plot point coming at you as plainly as if it was on a radar screen.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: While it doesn’t skimp on the high-flying action sequences that made the first film a hit, it goes it one better by focusing on the obvious: Pete “Maverick” Mitchell is a lot older.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Like the most recent Mission: Impossible sequels, this is another eye-popping action film that serves as subtext for Tom Cruise’s race against mortality to prove his superhuman excellence – all for our own amusement.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It's a thrill ride like no other and zooms past the original with ease. I loved everything about this film and think you will too.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I might be overstating this, but Top Gun: Maverick is about as perfect a sequel as you can get.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: What Top Gun: Maverick asks, then, is this: 'What would Top Gun look like if it were, y’know, a good movie?'

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The sequel is still  rah-rah about American imperialism, but who cares? Thirty-six years after the original, Tom Cruise is having the time of his life, the in-flight thrills are off the charts and—hot damn!—you won’t find more blazing action anywhere.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick may not be the ideal sequel to Top Gun. However, given the events of the last few years, it may be the one we need.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It's not even the weekend yet, and "Top Gun: Maverick" is already taking off.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise was put on Earth to entertain by any means necessary, and he does so like no one else.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: 'Top Gun Maverick' is a one hell of a ride that shouldn't be missed. So hop on and buckle up fast!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Some of this movie is fun, but too much of it is overly slick, and a lot of it feels dated, far too close to the aesthetics of the original. Still, its incredible aerial photography is breathtaking throughout and probably worth the price of admission.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: What the new Top Gun movie does well to depict though is the TOPGUN stuff. Not only do [Joseph] Kosinski and Co. have a grip on the action and how it's put together, there's an undercurrent of tension at the root of everything on Top Gun: Maverick.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise soars while schooling a cocky squad in the action-packed, shamelessly sentimental "Top Gun: Maverick."

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It delivers the spectacle and thrills it promises, deftly mixing unapologetic nostalgia & stimulating action that satisfies fans of the original and wins new ones. Those crazy flying sequences gave me such an adrenaline rush, what a cinematic thrill ride!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is Tom Cruise in auteur-mode, for better or worse. Mostly for the better. Only someone of his intensity could make an action movie this intense, seemingly through sheer willpower.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick isn’t a great film, but it does entertain greatly as old fashioned fun.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: If you are a fan of the original, break out your checklist and tick off all the “homage” to that ’86 flick. There are many and the whole package is entertainment in spades.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I love Top Gun. Top Gun: Maverick is even better.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Works like popped corn. The challenge was to create a whole new atmosphere, while evoking the feeling of the beloved first film … an assignment almost as impossible as the story's flight mission … but dang it, they pulled it off with excitement to spare.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: [It] joins that small list of recent sequels made many years removed from their predecessors that are as good—if not better—than the originals...an experience that completely surpassed expectations, and even surprised me on a few different levels.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a warm hug of a fighter jet, Tom Cruise action movie nostalgia. Familiar and new, fun and captivating.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun and Tom Cruise are right on time with thrills, chills, nostalgia, a reunion that will make your heart melt and its just plain fantabulous!!  Tom Cruise is a mega movie star...period and the fighter jet sequences will leave you breathless

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The long-gestating sequel “Top Gun: Maverick” has finally arrived and, happily, these Navy pilots nearly reach mach 10.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Director Joseph Kosinski applies his mastery of practical and digital effects to craft aerial action sequences as beautiful as they are tense

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is not a dislikable movie, by any means... But it's also a little depressing, because of where it says movies are going, what it says about the lack of creativity making its way on screen.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick hits the mark, maybe because neither the filmmakers nor the actors are flying on auto-pilot.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: At its heart, it's really a story about how jets are cool and fast.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: "Maverick" satisfies by delivering exactly what it promises.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Arguably, the greatest achievement of the summer's biggest blockbuster is not the stunning action sequences, but the fact that Tom Cruise's star is brighter on landing than it was before take-off.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In the end, Maverick succeeds more often than it fails, proving absorbing enough for most of its length.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick... is a revivified mummy with a jet thruster strapped to its bandages, taking great pains to repeat all of the 1986 version's beats at maximum velocity. A mummy with a jet pack is, however, a fantastic thing.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Ultimately, it’s a good, old-fashioned blockbuster. Grab the popcorn. Sink down in your seat and immerse yourself.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: While there are soap opera elements, the screenplay is playful, laced with good humor, effectively builds tension and finds the emotional beats...Most memorable is a touching, affectionate nod to Val Kilmer as Admiral Thomas “Iceman” Kazansky.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Thankfully, the story is just as engrossing on the ground as it is in the air, and Cruise gets the chance to do some vulnerable acting when he’s on land.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The flight scenes are the major draw, I suppose, and the aerial encounters are dazzlingly choreographed even if the planes are so loud you can’t hear the pilots’ dialogue. That said, you don’t watch a film like this for the script.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The triumphalism powering those bone-rattling engines still comes through loudly and clearly enough to send you cross-eyed and set your cinema seat vibrating.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The movie we didn't know we needed. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is old-fashioned summer popcorn movie fun in all its high-octane glory. And Cruise is just the leading man for the mission.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Despite its suffocating adherence to nostalgia, there are many impressive elements to Top Gun: Maverick.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Deals with the trauma of having lost "Goose", his training partner and co-pilot, in a more human and real way... this sequel doesn't register as a commercial foil dictated by a film industry that only bets on pre-sold properties. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review:
Physical cinema, slightly vulgar, and very enjoyable…in theaters. 
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It is a thin, over-strenuous and sometimes very enjoyable movie. But it is also, and perhaps more significantly, an earnest statement of the thesis that movies can and should be great.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: One of the best legacy sequels we’ve ever gotten: a movie that knows how to move along and give you what you came for.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise’s star wattage remains undimmed, but while “Maverick” has been cannily manufactured...its familiar “Top Gun” mixture of jingoistic claptrap, macho posturing and formulaic excitement feels as mechanical as its military hardware.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I enjoyed it, and you might, too — if you don’t think, just watch.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The sheer will with which the movie strives to be a nostalgia machine for a world that never was, for the coke-dream of the 1980s that the original coughed up, is so relentless that hey, as long as you don't think about it it's fine

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: SFX are mostly practical (made in the sky, not in a garage) and the aerial stunts look more impressive than ever, but the biggest draw is seeing the determined star doing what he knows how to do best... [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I’ll just say it — it’s better than the original “Top Gun.”

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is how you make a heroic movie.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The film propels itself forward furiously, hitting Mach speeds higher than ever thought possible, but that doesn’t mean it doesn’t occasionally look over its shoulder at what it’s left behind.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Easily out maneuvers its predecessor — which isn’t saying much.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Like the original, even this one’s about fast bikes, dark aviators, supersonic planes and sweaty, muscular men with grease on their arms, a spanner in their palms, pushing the limits of male bravado.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a sequel that plays it safe with the story, but lets it rip in the blockbuster action sequences, giving the audience the expected need for speed.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: As a glossy, fast-moving fantasy this hits all the right notes, serving up cliches with a smile and fan service with a wink while still delivering plenty of thrills.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Almost everything about Top Gun: Maverick is ridiculous – except Tom Cruise’s commitment to delivering a proper big screen action movie experience.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: No wheels are reinvented (though one pair does get sheared off a plane’s landing gear by a barely cleared mountain), but the dialogue charms, the aerial sequences soar, and the two hours and 17 minutes of runtime speed by at (forgive me) Mach 10.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Name recognition and nostalgia may be what will initially draw audiences to Top Gun: Maverick, but they’ll leave loving it because of how it builds on the foundation and brings new ideas to the table.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: After a two-year delay, Top Gun: Maverick is well worth the wait. Entertaining and nostalgic as hell, the aerial fights are among the most exciting and exhilarating scenes experienced in the cinema this year. Strap in – it’s a hell of a ride.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It’s hard to picture another entry in the summer movie sweepstakes that can equal or exceed this one for pure, adrenalin-fueled entertainment. I had a great time watching the film and recommend seeing it as I did, on a giant IMAX screen

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: “Top Gun: Maverick” soars above the original every step of the way!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: There is no greater argument FOR the continued existence of movie theaters than "Top Gun: Maverick," the sort of theatrical experience that simply will never - EVER - be matched at home.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The action in TOP GUN: MAVERICK is so intense, at times I literally felt ill --- but in a good way. It’s a wild ride all the way through the film with just enough down time to prevent a serious case of hyperventilation.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review:
TOP GUN: MAVERICK is as exciting as any movie in recent 
memory. Edge-of-your-seat excitement is an overused cliché, but it fits perfectly here.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is ruthlessly proficient entertainment filmmaking, and any human plunked into a theater will be powerless against it.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a triumph, designed to capitalise on the love audiences have for the iconic original, but also with plenty for non-fans or complete newcomers to also enjoy.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: You don't have to have dad energy to embrace this movie. It's awesomely old fashioned and impressively modern at the same time. Fists will pump, eyes will mist.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: I loved Top Gun: Maverick. This sequel hasn’t lost that loving feeling. It’s the best of the best, making this return flight to the danger zone a rapturous aerial extravaganza that frankly took my breath away.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: [T]he spectacle on display is genuinely, well, spectacular.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A film you’ll be best served believing its near-impossible hype, Top Gun: Maverick is not only the type of sequel that surpasses its predecessor in every form imaginable, it’s the perfect encompassment of why cinema matters.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ... flies higher than the 1986 original. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is like a frat boy who finally grew up. This is how you make a sequel!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The film is about how a guy well past middle age can still kick ass, and this is a message that Cruise wants to deliver as loudly as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell. Message received. I just wish it had been in a better movie.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The airborne sequences are a marvel of technical achievement. Top Gun: Maverick markets on your nostalgia, but doesn't rely on it.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Maverick is more about soul finding than chest beating; while there’s some of the latter, it’s reserved mostly for the new young guns.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun is a legacy act, still popular, still influential and still able to blow the roof off when needed, and Maverick is the late career stadium tour that some -- not all -- legacy acts deserve.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is the rare action movie that delivers visual kicks without leaning on cartoonish digital crutches.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Frat boy swagger never soared as high or fast as it does in this attempt by Tom Cruise to outpace time itself.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The planes, the pilots, and their need for real speed is what makes a Top Gun movie special, and the filmmakers deliver in almost every possible way.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: All in all, I have to hand it to Cruise, director Joseph Kosinksi, and all the folks behind Top Gun: Maverick. They channeled ’80s nostalgia into a clever, exciting, and fun package that reminds us why we loved those cheesy movies to begin with.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The sequel to the iconic 1980s flyboy flick is, as they say, “go for takeoff.”

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ... If for Maverick: "it's not the plane, it's the pilot", in the case of Top Gun, it's not the movie, it's the actor. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is a militaristic epic so disassociated from actual life that it somehow becomes even more fanciful than the average animated family film.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Tom Cruise is the living manifestation of the Hollywood blockbuster — and he has made the ultimate legacy sequel his next mission.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: With military precision, Top Gun: Maverick is designed to please audiences and never challenge them.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise flourishes in exceedingly beautiful light. He’s Benjamin Button in a tailored motorcycle jacket. The light on everyone’s faces, especially in shots with multiple layers, is ravishing, particularly in lowest light.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is an expertly paced testament to the power of practical effects. Cruise’s tireless devotion to blockbuster filmmaking bleeds through the screen in every scene, a modern cinematic marvel.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Is there a lot of formula(s)? Yes, it is 80's cinema in all its glory. It's a movie without major audacity, conceived with sensitivity and nobility by people who know and love what they do. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A soaring movie if not a particularly self-aware one. But is that what you were expecting from a sequel to “Top Gun”?

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review:
The blockbuster you're going to want to see.
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The original was a mood piece. This is an actual movie, emphasizing remorse and regret over cockiness and easily outdoing its predecessor with action set-pieces that render indistinguishable the line between real derring-do and digital embellishment.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a full-throttle, action-packed nostalgia machine that delivers the supersonic thrills we all have been clamoring for.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: From manufactured rivalries to shirtless team building to the entrance of a surprise Top Gun instructor from last night at the bar, Maverick sells us back what we first bought back in 1986.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The sophomoric dialogue and story will never win an Oscar, but they were never meant to. What’s important is how deep an impression your fingernails end up leaving on the theatre-seat armrest.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It’s an action masterpiece led by a true master of his craft. Top Gun: Maverick takes cinema to new heights.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top stuff.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Jettison any doubts about the yawning gap between films: the sequel is a complete triumph, a high-octane fist-pumper that introduces weighty notes of regret.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: More than a nostalgia sequel or legacyquel; it is almost more than a movie. It is a manifesto and a monument, a defiant time capsule and a swaggering IMAX spectacle without precedent or peer.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Not only does Top Gun: Maverick execute that rare screen miracle of being a sequel superior to its predecessor in every way. It is also a blockbuster that will have the better of almost everything you see in 2022.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Like the hyper-competent aces at the story’s core, this is a movie that defines its lane early and sticks to it, with finesse, unfussy style and more than a few sneak attacks of emotion.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It definitely demands to be seen in the theater with the incredible sound design and immersive flight sequences. This is what you go to the movies for! You won't want to miss it!

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Phenomenal! The perfect summer blockbuster. The action is intense & the aerial sequences are breathtaking. Tom Cruise again adds to his legend in this sequel that's superior to the original in every possible way. [Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Absolutely everything is better...though one big reason is how well the late director Tony Scott's spirit is represented throughout, with Joseph Kosinski creating a perfect combination of nostalgia and modernity. Full review in Spanish

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Cruise displays a maturity as Maverick, not wanting to repeat the mistakes of his younger self. Cruise has not shed Maverick’s cockiness, but he has tempered it. (He) shows you moments in which you see the weight of Maverick’s past weigh him down. ...

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: The America of 'Top Gun' is the elusive greatness that we chase as a country. Perhaps it only ever existed on film. Whatever the case, it exists here.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick Cruises to the top with heart-stopping aerial acrobatics and a grounded storyline. It is off the charts adrenalin-charged and exhilarating.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Not only does Maverick nail it, but it soars above and beyond its predecessor. The emotion is surprisingly impactful, as we still feel the weight of the original’s events. Cruise and Teller are in top form, and the third act is an action-packed knockout.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is a sensational film that surpasses its predecessor in almost every way.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: “Top Gun: Maverick” nails the landing as one of the best summer blockbusters you’ll ever see. Popcorn movies just don’t get much better or more thrilling than this.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In true, rugged fashion as a legacy sequel aiming for the pinnacle of performance on and off camera, the movie exerts the very same pressure of gravity on us as we find ourselves glued to our seats with every flyby and bead of sweat.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: This is a Maverick movie through and through. Tom Cruise isn’t done with “Top Gun” yet, and he’s not letting go of big, emotional and deeply human blockbuster moviemaking without a fight. He’s indeed the hero that the movies need right now.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: An absolute crowd-pleaser. Nobody does blockbuster action better than Cruise and this raucous follow-up is presented with thought and extreme affection for the culturally iconic original.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Here’s the rare big studio movie where actors and stunt people perform on location while using as little CGI as possible; a movie where Cruise puts his hand on an F18, relishing its very tactile quality in a way that is deeply felt.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In a film jampacked with Hollywood’s rising stars, no one can match Cruise for charisma, magnetism, and depth of emotion. Quite simply, they don’t make them like him anymore.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A big, strutting, soaring, roaring, proudly pop-corny entertainment that begs to be seen on the big screen, like the blockbuster it's gonna be.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Believe the hype. Top Gun: Maverick is everything you could possibly want out of an epic summer blockbuster.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick proves to be a near-perfect legacyquel, with its adrenaline-laced dogfights grounded by a top-tier performance from Tom Cruise.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick is a sequel of a different breed.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It may not take your breath away, but it comes close.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: “Top Gun: Maverick” is a movie-star movie with great action pieces best seen on the biggest screen available. It’s a modern take on old-fashioned fun.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ...Top Gun: Maverick is one of the best pictures of the year.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: One of the best, and loudest, blockbusters that I have ever had the pleasure of witnessing.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Without wallowing in nostalgia, director Joseph Kosinski resurrects a 1980s-era relic, making the thirty-plus-year-old property relevant with thrilling aerobatic action and engaging drama. And Tom Cruise is terrific.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: A triumphant follow-up to one of the 1980s’ flashiest blockbusters.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In the age where big-budget Hollywood tentpoles favour more superhero movies these days, Top Gun: Maverick is a testament that old-school action filmmaking still prevails and you have to hand it to Tom Cruise for making this happen.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Watching Tom Cruise pick up his aviators and slip his patch-emblazoned jacket back on as Pete ‘Maverick’ Mitchell is as close as you can get to a transcendental experience at the cinema.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: …Top Gun: Maverick strikes a blow for the old-fashioned blockbuster, exceeding the range and grasp of the original, and giving a new generation a taste of the Boys Own heroism that made the first film a classic…

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review:
Offers something for everyone, without succumbing to the pitfalls of the genre. 
[Full review in Spanish]

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: In the sequel, nothing is left to chance. The camera orbits around him, his skills are unquestioned. Even Jennifer Connelly as the old flame Penny inevitably gives in with a love scene that has all the passion of a Christmas card.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: It may help to have hated the original, but I liked this one, even though it’s not so very different from the first.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: ... again playing a guy who's the best at everything, drama oozes from the same character with the on-screen realization his plot armor doesn't extend around everyone else he's responsible for, and movie stardom doesn't get any more meta than that.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Top Gun: Maverick soars higher than expected. It delivers thrills, fun and tender moments. A tremendous way to kick off summer blockbuster season.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
review: Prepare for more hyperbole because holy sh-t, I loved this film. It’s true, this is the best blockbuster action flick to come out of Hollywood in years.

name: Top Gun: Maverick
